item.title: Manager, Data Engineering at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used any ETL or data pipeline tools to process data? Do you love to build teams and manage talented engineers?
Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze user metrics and product usage? We are looking for a Manager of Data Engineer to manage a team while contributing ideas, innovation, solutions and code to one of the hottest startups out of NYC!

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager, Inventory Quality at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, big data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second and 30+ petabytes a day. The Inventory Quality team ensures that the ads we display are shown on genuine inventory to real people. Quantcast modeling scientists and engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality anti-fraud and brand safety products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for someone who has managed engineers and data scientists to manage the Inventory Quality team. As the Inventory Quality Manager you will lead Quantcast’s effort to continuously improve and refine our ability to stamp out fraud and meet our clients’ brand safety goals. As you expand the team you will drive the detection of ever changing fraudsters attempting to sell fake inventory.


Responsibilities




  • Manage a team of scientists and engineers to apply advanced data mining to detect and combat fraud




  • Work with several engineering and client facing teams to build comprehensive anti-fraud solutions




  • Maintain a robust brand safety product that ensures ads only appear on inventory with content desirable for each client




  • Recruit and retain excellent machine learning and software engineering talent

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Data) for a Rapidly Growing Startup at PaperG (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
PaperG is looking to hire an experienced Sr. Software Engineer who can help build our next generation data collection, analysis and visualization platform.


We need this platform to capture all of the data PaperG produces and a corresponding data visualization system to help us leverage this data. Needless to say, this platform needs to be running 24/7, scale with increasing load, fault tolerant and easy to monitor and manage.


Are you up to the challenge?

If so, and you enjoy a collaborative open office environment, flexible working hours, participating in hackathons, shipping early and often, and free team lunches, let's talk.

item.title: Software Engineer In Data at Dataminr (New York, NY)
item.description: At Dataminr, we are looking for dedicated software engineers to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Senior Engineer at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE, a Nokia company, is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com



The Team:



The RCP group designs and builds hardware and software for capturing, processing, and extracting information from street-level imagery, 3D Lidar data, aerial and satellite imagery, as well as dense GPS probe data from smartphones and vehicles. These rich datasets are used to power next-gen 3D consumer maps, navigation and assisted driving systems, and more. HERE Maps, a division of Nokia, provides detailed road and navigation data for nearly 100 countries, and can be found in four out of five vehicle in-dash navigation systems. Licensees of HERE’s platform include Microsoft, Yahoo, Amazon, and Baidu. 



The Position:



Within RCP, the Data Operations Team manages the software processing pipeline for transforming petabytes of raw data into useable information.  The team is also responsible for data quality control, measuring and analyzing pipeline performance and addressing data issues that may be identified.  We are seeking a Senior Engineer to help us build tools to enable, expedite and enhance Data Operations Team’s QA and analytical efforts.  Example work for this team will be building and maintaining tools to improve the efficiency and efficacy of terrestrial and satellite data QA review.

item.title: Lead Systems/DevOps Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Lead Systems/DevOps Engineer to head up a small Sysops/DevOps team. Our search is for a special kind of Sysops/Devops engineer -- one who codes to automate, is comfortable with cloud and physical infrastructure, and treats metal like a resource (e.g. hasn’t named a server after a greek god in at least 5 years).


We respond to over 100Kqps, manage a multi-petabyte compute cluster, heavily use and contribute to open source systems. and aggressively build, adopt, and deploy new technologies and capabilities.


This is a great opportunity to manage serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with a large and outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.

item.title: Senior or Principal Data Engineer at BandPage (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
BandPage is seeking a senior data engineer who is passionate about music and eager to disrupt the music industry in a positive way.   We are on a mission to empower new and established musicians to build their fan bases, increase their revenue, and make a living at their craft.  BandPage is already used by over half a million musicians, including nearly all of the most popular artists.  Meanwhile, BandPage is integrated with most of the popular consumer music services, including Spotify, Rdio, Rhapsody, XBox Music, Vevo, etc.  Join us and help build the “operating system” for the music industry.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Data Discovery and ETL - Utilize the appropriate frameworks and tools to perform the ETL layer for disparate data sources. Consider proven methods of ETL and propose abstractions of those methods to aid in solving the ETL problems associated with data ingestion.


Data Storage Optimization - Constantly strive to optimize the data storage layer to fit the current and future needs of the applications it supports. This includes being aware of issues and making recommendations about scalability prior to, or in advance, of development of of an algorithmic solution.


Advanced Algorithms - Actively apply your knowledge of advanced algorithms, machine learning, and data models to unique problems in the domain of music. Adapt existing principles of logical inference and computer science to new problems in the company’s vertical.


Team Player - Participate in knowledge sharing activities including giving talks on topics in your area of expertise, contributing to the internal knowledge base via wiki or other, participate in code reviews, and support fellow team members in algorithm development including whiteboard sessions.

item.title: Senior/Lead UI Engineer - Big Data Analytics at FourV Systems (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Are you a user interface engineer? with big, fast data experience? Are you looking to make an impact with a rapidly growing team of talented developers working on delivering a transformative product?


Are you highly motivated to make a real impact in the trajectory of our company? FourV Systems is looking for full-stack UI engineers for a transformative big data analytics platform. 


In the Big Data Analytics – Lead UI Engineer role, you will be responsible for participating in the design and development efforts of our big data user interfaces for the configuration and presentation of ETL interfaces, reporting, and visualization efforts.


This is a great opportunity to join early and influence the technology selection, design, and have ownership of the infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities



  • Generate software designs and determine levels of effort for new product features in cutting edge big data analytics

  • Develop software written in Javascript, including backbone.js, d3.js, and SVG rendering and other languages as needed

  • Work closely with QA and other software engineers on Agile teams to deliver quality features

  • Participate in architecture discussions to address long-term design objectives

item.title: Big Data Engineer with National Travel at CLARITY SOLUTION GROUP (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Note: For this position you will be required to travel throughout the country on a weekly basis.


DOES WORKING FOR AN ORGANIZATION WITH THESE BENEFITS, APPEAL TO YOU?



  • Working on complex transformation programs across many clients and many industries

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Competitive compensation which includes uncapped bonus potential based on individual contributions

  • Mentor program

  • Career development

  • Tremendous growth opportunities (company is growing at a rate of 35% or more annually)

  • Strong work/life balance

  • A smaller nimble organization that is easy to work with

  • Visibility to the leadership team on a daily basis

  • Be a part of an Elite Data & Analytics team


IF YOU ANSWERED YES TO THE ABOVE ITEMS, KEEP READING!


We are looking for individuals with the ability to drive the architectural decision making process, who are experienced with leading teams of developers, but who are also capable and enthusiastic about implementing every aspect of an architecture themselves.


OUR DATA ENGINEERS:



  • Are hands-on, self-directed engineers who enjoysworking in collaborative teams 

  • Are data transformation engineers


    • Design and develop highly scalable, end to end process to consume, integrate and analyze large volume, complex data from sources such as Hive, Flume and other APIs

    • Integrate datasets and flows using a variety of open source and best-in-class proprietary software


  • Work with business stakeholders and data SMEs to elicit requirements and develop real-time business metrics, analytical products and analytical insights

  • Profile and analyze complex and large datasets

  • Collaborate and validate implementation with other technical team members

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at DataRobot (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will provide engineering support to customer-facing data science activities.  You will be integral to helping solve unique customer integration and data science challenges.  Examples of potential projects might include developing custom prediction and data handling scripts, assisting and training customers to interact with the DataRobot API, and improving customer experience by recommending improvements to the UI, API, software, architecture, and other aspects of the platform.


This position requires the ability to rapidly develop robust, well-tested, scalable, production quality code in Python and R.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Platform team at Likelihood is responsible for building a massively scalable system that ingests billions of data points, executes experiments and makes predictions, all in real-time. We're seeking talented Java engineers with expertise in data structures, algorithms, and distributed storage and processing frameworks to tackle one of the most challenging problems in ecommerce today. 


To store, analyze and serve user information at scale requires ideas and solutions in every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, neutral language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, programming language design, networking, security, data compression, and machine learning, among others. Our engineers utilized advanced big data frameworks such as Hadoop and HBase, programming languages such as Java and Scala, and expertise in data structures, algorithms and software design, as well as extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux operating systems to engage in platform engineering activities.

item.title: Messaging Migration Engineer at bluesource (Grapevine, TX)
item.description:
The Messaging Migration Engineer develops migration tools and reporting systems for bluesource’s Data Migrations team.  The team takes data from a variety of source email and IM archiving systems, including those developed by Symantec, EMC, HP, Microsoft, and pushes it into an alternative platform that our customers want to move to. Target platforms may include Cloud systems like EV.Cloud and Office 365. Often these systems do not have public APIs, and will require out-of-the-box problem solving and innovation. In this position you will have a critical role in the future of the migration processes, and designing automated toolsets that will enable us to deliver the work for customers more rapidly and accurately, while supporting the expansion and success of a fast growing team.


General Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain a data migration and reporting toolset to migrate data between a variety of data archiving platforms.

  • Gather and document requirements from the Data Migrations Manager and Data Migrations Analysts to extend and improve the data migration toolset.

  • Assist the Data Migrations team with project tasks as required, and to dogfood the toolset.

  • Manage time efficiently, work with minimal supervision

  • Document tools and train analysts to use them

item.title: Data and Operational Engineer (Software) at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
At TGS, data and operational software developers form a core part of our business and are among our most valued resources. This role is mission critical, so we’re searching for an uncommonly reliable professional who enjoys writing programs, working with data, and providing support for large-scale production systems.


In addition to software development and data management, this position is likely to involve interaction with external resources such as data providers, brokers, dealers, and software vendors, as well as colleagues from the research and engineering teams.

item.title: Software Engineer - Big Data Java Developer at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Rubicon Project has engineered one of the largest real-time cloud and Big Data computing systems.  We are looking for great engineers to build high performance, high scale backend systems to take on trillions of transactions without breaking a sweat.


In this team, you will be working on Rubicon Project’s high performance real-time bidding platform. You will be working on big data solution using Java 8, Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Kafka and apply principles of Reactive Programming to build mission-critical systems at scale.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test (Python) at DataRobot (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description: This position’s responsibilities include designing and implementing automated tests and championing techniques to increase code testability and other ways to increase product quality.

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Backend Engineer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a motivated backend engineer to join our product team in Madrid, Spain.

You will be responsible for the building tools that process, analyze and monitor data -- the most important part of our product! Additionally you will:



  • Build tools that analyze data to make the quality checking process faster and more automated

  • Work with our team of international experts in web data extraction

  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis on existing data in our database

  • Use machine-learning techniques to find insights and data anomalies

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well


We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer- $90K at Crossover (Lahore, Pakistan) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer that has spent several years working with Big Data technologies? Have you created streaming analytics algorithms to process terabytes of real-time data and deployed Hadoop or Cassandra clusters over dozens of VMs? Have you been part of an organization driven by a DevOps culture, where the engineer has end to end responsibility for the product, from development to operating it in production? Are you willing to join a team of elite engineers working on a fast growing analytics business? Then this role is for you!



Job Description



The Software and DevOps engineer will help build the analytics platform for Bazaarvoice data that will power our client-facing reporting, product performance reporting, and financial reporting. You will also help us operationalize our Hadoop clusters, Kafka and Storm services, high volume event collectors, and build out improvements to our custom analytics job portal in support of Map/Reduce and Spark jobs. The Analytics Platform is used to aggregate data sets to build out known new product offerings related to analytics and media as well as a number of pilot initiatives based on this data. You will need to understand the business cases of the various products and build a common platform and set of services that help all of our products move fast and iterate quickly. You will help us pick and choose the right technologies for this platform.



Key Responsibilities



In your first 90 days you can expect the following:




  • An overview of our Big Data platform code base and development model




  • A tour of the products and technologies leveraging the Big Data Analytics Platform




  • 4 days of Cloudera training to provide a quick ramp up of the technologies involved




  • By the end of the 90 days, you will be able to complete basic enhancements to code supporting large-scale analytics using Map/Reduce as well as contribute to the operational maintenance of a high volume event collection pipeline.




Within the first year you will:




  • Own design, implementation, and support of major components of platform development. This includes working with the various stakeholders for the platform team to understand their requirements and delivery high leverage capabilities.



  • Have a complete grasp of the technology stack, and help guide where we go next.

item.title: Big Data Engineers at Betsson Group (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
Are you interested in working for the market leader in a fast-growing industry? Betsson Group is now looking for talented Big Data Engineers to join us in our Malta offices to build the next generation in data services.


Who are we?


Betsson Group offers online gaming products to customers and partners all over the world and we aim to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. We are a dynamic and creative company with over 1000 passionate employees and consultants of almost 40 different nationalities. Most of us work in the operational Head Office in Malta but we also have other offices around the world, for example in Stockholm, Kiev, Tallinn and Gibraltar. Betsson Group has its roots in Sweden and Betsson AB (Betsson Group’s holding company) is quoted on the Swedish Stock Exchange. The Mediterranean island of Malta offers a relaxed life-style, with more than 300 sunny days a year and the best diving experience in Europe.


Who are you?



  • You are an exceptional developer with an aptitude for new technologies who loves to push the boundaries to solve real business problems

  • You will have previous Big Data experience using the Hadoop ecosystem to solve large-scale problems.

  • You will have a good understanding of distributed systems and experience in using open source frameworks

  • You have agility to learn new technologies quickly.

  • You have the ability to develop and leverage key partnerships and communicate very effectively.

  • You display initiative, self-motivation, and effective time-management skills.


Description


Our Big Data development team is growing fast and we are looking for software engineers to help us use a variety of Big Data technologies to create exceptional personalised customer experiences and solve difficult business problems based on a robust, low latent platform of structured and semi-structured.

item.title: Data Infrastructure Engineer at Content Square (Paris, France)
item.description:
Content Square is one of the current fastest growing companies, deploying lots of analytics tools through a critical data pipeline. This infrastructure needs to remain strongly reliable and available, with minimum downtimes.


As a Data Infrastructure Enginneer you will



  • Design efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data.

  • Think about clever data models to serve product’s features, while minimizing costs.

  • Develop tools to help data-scientists to work with the available clusters.

  • Document your work, prove it works, make it work better!

item.title: Devops Engineer at Earnest Research (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Passion for data: Data is what drives this company. As a part of the group, you will be immersed in a fast-paced environment, with an infinite amount of opportunity to learn and grow. Within the engineering team, the candidate will be exposed to the technical challenges associated with big data and cloud distributed systems.


Responsibilities


• Manage our cloud infrastructure on AWS
• Implement and enforce security and privacy guidelines
• Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate ETL and Data Transformation processes
• Work closely with the Data Engineering and Data Analyst teams on enhancements to our platform
• Implement alerting tools and metrics to track system performance and availability
• Provide support to our existing processes and tools
• Contribute to the creation of system support documents such as run books
• Contribute in research and evaluation new technologies for use
• Help build out our team through hiring and evaluating candidates

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at HouseCanary (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We're seeking a passionate Senior DevOps Engineer to help manage the software release process for our world-class products, implement monitoring solutions, and manage our AWS infrastructure.


What you'll do:



  • Develop build and release management practices

  • Drive infrastructure strategy and operations

  • Lead operations service delivery and support

  • Implement systems monitoring solutions

  • Ensure application and infrastructure security

  • Work with a talented technology team building unmatched products

item.title: Distributed Systems Engineer (Spark/Scala) at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in tackling the problems of building large-scale, distributed- and stream-based processing systems.  As a Distributed Systems Engineer, you’ll work on:




  • Building fault-tolerant micro-services




  • Enhancing a low-latency decisioning engine responsible for complex predictive behaviour (at thousands of requests per second)




  • A streaming data pipeline supervising millions of daily events




Let’s talk if..




  • You have experience with delivering multithreaded and/or distributed JVM-based systems.  No experience with Scala?  Come learn!




  • You have experience with Spark and/or Spark Streaming or similar stream-based processing systems.  Experience with Hadoop-based pipelines, maybe a bit of Cascading or Scalding?  That works too, come give Spark a shot.



  • What you're building is as important to you as why you're building it.

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• You will be reponsible for continuing the development of data driven applications for one of our ventures. This includes a data warehouse (developed in-house, based on open-source technologies), a CRM system and integrations with other 3rd party systems

  • You will integrate, transform and index data from various data sources and develop meaningful data representations and visualisations

  • You will deal with the challenges of growing data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team

item.title: DevOps Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth by challenging them every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact.


Department overview:


The Credit and Data Analytics teams at OnDeck are responsible for the models and policies that drive our success in the industry. Through our data-driven approach, our models and tools sift through thousands of data points to (I) target businesses via marketing (ii) evaluate & quantify the financial health of our applicants (iii) enable prudent credit risk management and (iv) provide an industry leading customer experience The team combines model building experience with a strong focus on software engineering best practices to ensure our models can be deployed in production and impact the day to day functioning of our business.


In this role you will:



  • Work with a small, high impact data engineering team to develop a production quality data warehouse with complex, unstructured data in AWS

  • Make subsets of this data available to third party (internal) applications via a set of APIs. Ensure these APIs are production grade in terms of uptime and response time

  • Work with a team of really innovative data scientists as a partner in deploying a set of highly innovative machine learning based data products into a production environment

  • Develop monitoring, audit and logging tools to ensure business critical APIs are performing as expected

item.title: Software Engineer (ETL) at AnswerOn (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Utilizing your arsenal of skills and talents, you will solve unique problems in the management of client data, by designing, implementing, maintaining and executing ETL processes for the management of client data. You will also provide data support for predictive modeling and statistical analysis of client data. We will expect you to have an enthusiasm for working in small groups in a high-energy bootstrap environment. Right candidate will be trained on all these processes. 
 
Responsibilities:



  • In this position you will be trained and responsible to create, maintain and execute custom data management (ETL) processes using;

  • Business Objects Data Services (BODS) in order to support analytical modeling and statistical analysis of client data.

  • Store and manage client data using SQL Server.

  • Create and manage data warehouses to support analysis of client data.

  • Prepare analytical modeling output for delivery to clients using BODS.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for talented engineers who will have a big impact on our technical direction. You will join a company where risks and exploration are the norm. You will be part of a team that envisions, collaborates, designs, and develops highly scalable and highly available services to help writers around the world communicate more effectively.


As a Backend Engineer on the Grammarly Data Team, you will work on constructing the Grammarly analytical data pipeline using the coolest building blocks out there and effective creations of your own; build out our code metrics, log collection, and querying stack; and enable other teams building data pipelines for their services. Your ambition and skill will drive and impact our entire platform. If you want a big challenge, this is your next gig!


What You Will Accomplish



  • Build internal real-time analytical data acquire-attribute-aggregate pipeline using:


    • Spark & Spark Streaming, Reactive Streams

    • Cassandra

    • Kafka

    • Scala


  • Build a high-load, big-data, distributed, no-single-point-of-failure, horizontally-scalable, lambda-architecture app

  • Build extensible high-load APIs and client-side instrumentation tooling

  • Build querying and visualization layer on top of Looker, Tableau and custom web-app

  • Perform integration to loop the analytical insights back to Grammarly product

  • Relentlessly work to optimize performance and data processing

  • Help to improve our development cycle, including CI/CD, deployment, documentation, instrumentation, and monitoring processes

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Ticketing Data at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer that will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components that you’ll build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the data integration with our movie theater partners (APIs, data storage, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, admin tools for the content management team, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Backend Services Software Engineer at Bedrock Analytics Corporation (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
Bedrock Analytics is looking for exceptional engineers with strong Java, Scala, and/or Python skills and a well-rounded background in computer science. You should have a proven track record of delivering robust, high-availability services and understand the ins and outs of scalable data processing and analytics. You can envision the way a system works end-to-end and how the services that compose it work together, and you enjoy creating new and effective software. You are interested in the different ways data can be organized, analyzed, and visualized to make effective use of the insights it contains.


You like working in an Agile best-practices environment. You understand the importance of testable, modular, efficient code, so that's what you write. Ideally, you will have been building cloud-based systems with a similar DevOps stack to ours – AWS, Chef, etc.


A few of the fun problems we're working on:



  • Predictive Insights and Recommendations

  • Data-Driven Stories

  • Microservice-based Analytics

  • Machine-Learning-Augmented Data Processing

item.title: Help Desk/Junior Systems Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Junior-level Help Desk/Systems Engineer to help handle the management and growth of our cloud and internal computing and network infrastructure.  We're a technical group of people working in a relaxed environment with various demanding infrastructure needs.  There's almost no 24/7 component to this job but there are a lot of machines and systems to keep configured and happy and we have a very high standard of careful, detail-oriented, responsive professionalism.


Responsibilities:



  • Maintain computing and networking infrastructure.

  • Share support burden for mostly technical internal staff

  • Repair and recover from hardware or software failures

  • Devops and automation of internal and production infrastructure

  • System/network monitoring & troubleshooting

  • Participate in on-call rotation duties

item.title: Software Engineer and Data Geek at SocialCops (New Delhi, India)
item.description:
We are hiring across our Engineering teams for our office in New Delhi, India, 


Front End Engineer


Our Front End software engineers will responsible for building the features that decision makers will see and interact with to make massive decisions affecting millions of people. As a front end engineer you will be part of an agile team which is iterating on the product on a weekly basis. You will specialize in building responsive and elegant web UI.


We're looking for engineers with a keen eye for design. We use JS frameworks including D3.js, Backbone.js ReactJS & Leaflet apart from HTML5 and CSS. 


Back End Engineer


Our backend engineering team is the backbone of product development at SocialCops. We know that the best backend engineers understand that there are different ways to solve the same problem and each method has it’s own trade offs, thus we’re on the lookout for someone who can think, weigh each trade-off and make the better decision. You are expected to work well in a team, have a passion for performance and optimization and at the same time have great knowledge of building a scalable product. You will be directly responsible for developing and testing APIs. You own the product development at SocialCops and will be required to think on your feet to make quick tweaks to the product that will make the lives of our users incrementally better. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of best engineering practices.



We’re looking for people with a working knowledge of OAuth, Microservices architecture, Version Control Systems, how CDNs work, HTTP request lifecycle across various web frameworks, basic DevOps with experience/expertise in Python, node.js, MVC frameworks, Document, Key-Value, Columnar Stores, Amazon Web Services etc.


Data Engineer


Our data engineering team is the core of the work we do at SocialCops and you’ll be responsible for fuelling its growth. As a data engineer, you will be responsible for building a fast, scalable and reliable architecture for the purpose of gathering, organizing, storing and setting up batch or real-time processing pipelines on top of it thus providing clean and organized information to scientists who analyze it to solve problems. Your work will also involve natural language processing, turning semi-structured, human-readable content into highly structured machine-readable databases and thus make sense out of it. You will be building search algorithms that make our data searchable by data point, indexing millions of data sets in the process. The aim is to build the first search engine for ‘developing world’ data. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of databases and best engineering practices.


We are looking for people with a working knowledge of Distributed file systems, Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, API frameworks like express, hapi, with experience/expertise in Python, Pandas, Elasticsearch, NoSQL databases, node.js etc.


Android


Our Android engineers are building an application which works in the remotest and the most rugged parts of the world - on devices as cheap as USD 30. We build for the next billion - which means our average users can't speak english & have never used a mobile phone before. Just last month, the app was used to collect over 20 Million data points. Enough said =)

item.title: Senior Backend developer at Thinair (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description: We're looking for a senior backend developer to help design our product and to eventually lead our backend team.

item.title: Engineering Systems Data Engineer at ARM Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
The Engineering Systems Analytics group is responsible for ensuring that we have a solid understanding of both our engineering infrastructure, which we refer to as the engineering systems stack, and the engineering processes that run on top of it.


It strives to achieve this goal through a number of parallel activities:



  • By helping to refine our spark-based infrastructure that allows relevant data to be centrally collected, aggregated, and processed

  • By developing dashboards, reports and complex analysis and/or visualisations of the data that satisfy the business needs, both in terms of project reporting to help measure progress of the work, and in terms of infrastructure reporting to help understand the impact of this work on the estate

  • By working with engineering and IT functions to ensure sufficient relevant data is being captured to provide the best information in the above two categories


We are looking to augment the team with broad additional skills across the areas listed above.


You will be a software engineer with experience of Spark and R, or equivalents.


You will be equally at home working on the data processing pipeline, or performing an in depth analysis of the data it contains.


You will consider yourself a data scientist, keen to tackle the problems of extracting knowledge from data, and driven to understand the core ‘stories’ that data can tell, and to help drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements by providing the means to make data driven decisions.


This role be based from ARM's HQ in Cambridge, UK.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at Thinair (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description: We're looking for a senior front-end developer to help design our product and to eventually lead our front-end team.

item.title: Data Warehouse Engineer (junior/senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Big Data Architect/Engineer at OpenStax at Rice University (Houston, TX)
item.description:
The Big Data Architect/Engineer will work with the Machine Learning Research Scientist, contractors, and team developers to design and implement the second version of BigLearn, which provides personalization, recommendations, and performance prediction to students using OpenStax Tutor and CourseWare.


The Architect/Engineer will design big data solutions with heavy realtime usage in a secure manner, preserving privacy of student data.


The architect/engineer will design the data architecture and software components and application programming interfaces (APIs) to ingest learner interaction data, run an ever-expanding suite of cognitive science and machine learning algorithms on it in near-realtime and in batch processes, and return the recommendations and analytics produced by those algorithms to client learning platforms.


Apply to this job at Rice University using this link, and provide your application ID, cover letter, and resume here.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Brand at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second. The Brand team builds large scale pipelines that let us target online users across the web and mobile apps. Quantcast engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse targeting products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for people with strong engineering and big data experience to expand our Brand targeting capabilities. As a Senior Software Engineer you will design and build systems to identify the right users to target to drive clients’ brand goals. You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our Mapreduce cluster and global realtime bidding system.


Responsibilities




  • Develop software and techniques to target online users at a large scale




  • Lead software projects through the full technical life cycle, from design and development through deployment and support




  • Work with other engineering teams to coordinate brand targeting projects with other performance advertising projects




  • Work with product management and client services to gather project requirements and communicate project impacts

item.title: Software Engineer - Data Platform at Loggly. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Loggly is looking for a high-energy development engineer who is eager to design and deliver the innovative product sets that will drive the next phase of our growth.


Responsibilities:


Loggly‘s development team is responsible for designing and delivering the world’s most popular cloud-based log management solution. As a key engineer on this team, you will collaborate with engineers, product management, and the operations team to develop innovative features on top of our big data stack. You will have full lifecycle responsibilities for key product functionality, spanning design and development of features.


You will be expected to create robust, scalable, multi-threaded, and distributed systems that operate 24x7x365. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly innovative environment with new technologies as we continue to evolve our products and extend our leading market position. Our culture is fast-paced, performance-oriented, open and collegial, and lots of fun. This is a full-time position based in San Francisco, CA.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description: Responsible for architecting and building the interconnect to many SaaS data stores in the e-commerce marketplace using SOAP and REST based APIs.  Responsible for the primary design and frameworks used for transforming, storing, and extracting data from our centralized database hub for marketing purposes.  Assist in designing and building the Company’s own RESTful API supporting JSON and XML data exchange for integration with our front end UI. Code reviews, guidance to other engineers.

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Applecart (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Python Engineer


We are looking for an expert, creative, self-motivated, and problem-solving back-end software engineer to join our company as a Senior Developer and central member of our engineering team. This position will focus on building infrastructure and mechanisms for large-scale online data mining and data collection. A successful candidate should have significant experience with web crawler/spider construction, web etiquette, concurrency, and text-processing.


Responsibilities/Duties



  • Work individually and as a member of technical and non technical teams to scale and expand Applecart’s products and proprietary technology 

  • Collaborate with the Partners and the rest of the development team to conceive of, architect, and develop revolutionary, scalable data collection software that will be deployed nationally for maximum impact on behalf of major political campaigns and national advocacy movements.

  • Construct and manage Applecart’s data collection and data mining infrastructure 

  • Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 

    • Managing a sophisticated and large-scale data collection and processing infrastructure 

    • Constructing and adapting a robust AWS server infrastructure to process and run large data jobs (billions of records) 

    • Conducting advanced database design for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of data 

    • Work closely with a team of data scientists to incorporate robust machine learning algorithms into existing application codebase 

    • Parse and standardize large volumes of structured and unstructured data

    • Design and implement infrastructure to integrate new data sources into social graph engine

item.title: Data Scientist at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description & Responsibilities




  • Work with a motivated team in an innovative Spatial Analytics startup to build data Science, Analytics, and Machine Learning practice

  • You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers gain true scientifically driven insights.

  • You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets.

  • You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

  • You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas.

  • You will lead applied analytics and science initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions.. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

  • As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on science & mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.



Qualifications




  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field.

  • 4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact.

  • Expertise in machine learning, predictive analytics, statistical modeling, and data algorithms. Must have knowledge/experience in methodologies and algorithms including: Multivariate Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, Lifetime Analysis, Clustering, Mathematical Optimization, Random Forest/Ensemble Learning, Deep Learning Algorithms and Stochastic Processes.

  • Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability.

  • Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of applied math/statistics/computer science.

  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to describe the logic and implications of a complex model to all types of business partners.

  • High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude.

  • Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, and/or Weka.

  • Strong SQL and deep understanding of Data-at-rest and data-at-transit & other lifecycle points of data

  • Experience with distributed computing, databases and query languages like Hadoop/YARN, Spark, Cassandra/NoSql Databases, Graph Databases, Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing.

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Postgres, MySql

  • Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Java, Scala, GO, Python).

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Data Architect that loves mobile games? Join us! at Hothead Games (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Hothead Games is a 130-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for iOS and Android devices. Millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. Efficient and effective storage, transformation, analysis and archival are all top priorities. We are seeking an ambitious individual to take a lead role in planning and executing on all aspects of our data-related technologies.

Have extensive experience with multiple databases? Passionate about creating software architectures that are robust and scalable? Want to work on the bleeding edge of Big Data?  Then you need to join our world-leading mobile game studio and help us wrangle hundreds of terabytes of data into understandable, actionable information.

We expect the successful candidate will be an experienced software engineer/architect that will formulate and execute the vision for our proprietary Big Data platform. Are you up for it?


Responsibilities:



  • Define requirements, create technical designs and assist with the implementation of internally-developed analytics systems

  • Oversee the daily operation of analytics data processing, automating the process wherever possible

  • Educate internal stakeholders on best practices for analytics-related processes in the company

  • Assist data analysts, game designers and others with advanced queries, sophisticated A/B tests and other complex data problems

  • Advise game teams on databases and other data-related aspects of game client and server software

  • Perform load and stress tests and analyze performance of running production systems in order to optimize database use and remove bottlenecks

  • Perform tests to sanity check accuracy of internal and 3rd party data

  • Assist the Director of Technology with supervision of the work of programmers on the Analytics Team

item.title: Data Engineer - Python, PostgreSQL and Redis at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Analytics team and work on the huge data projects that are integral to Lyst’s day to day operations.


Data lies at the heart of everything we do here at Lyst, from understanding our users better to making mission critical decisions, we always look at the data first.


We record nearly 100 million rows of data a day just from user interactions. To support this volume, we have built our own analytics architecture, predominantly in Python and leveraging the convenience of many cloud services like AWS Redshift, Lambda, CloudFront, S3, etc.


With this sea of data growing everyday, you will work hand in hand with our analysts and data product managers to ensure that our analytics data pipeline is clean, efficient and scalable as the business and traffic increases. From building bespoke BI tools, ensuring analytics engineering requests are responded to in a quick manner to architecting new solutions. You will work on things such as:



  • Improving our analytics data architecture, ensuring scalability and resiliency

  • Streamline the anomaly detection process across all our data, and build tools and processes around it to speed up the required actions to solve any anomaly

  • Improving our internal BI tool, Looker, and tools surrounding it to ensure Analysts are able to provide amazing insight to the business.

  • Understanding the query requirements from our data analysts and optimising our database (table) design to make them faster and more efficient.

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.



WHAT WE USE


Python, JavaScript, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, Objective-C, Elasticsearch, Docker, Ember.js, RedShift, Pandas, IPython Notebook



As you can see we are really excited about the data we have here hopefully you will be too. We expect you to have already had some exposure to working in a commercial environment as an data Engineer. You will have the ability to not only work as a hands on member of the team but also the


We like to build things that solve problems, you will not be constrained by process - we work in small product teams that take a lean approach to building things. We believe that there is no silver bullet to fix the problems and challenges we face: instead we encourage consistent iteration to ensure we are always solving problems. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback and trust; all of our engineers take ownership of committing their own code and ensuring that everything is bug free and reliable.


If the above resonates and you would like to strongly influence the direction of our products and our culture, work with amazing people and hang out with Albert and Bruce, the office dogs. Artisan beers. Good Coffee. Great people.


If you would like to apply please do so right away, if you would like a bit more info feel free to get in touch with Tris on jobs@lyst.com.

item.title: Sql Programmer at Spatially (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Description



  • Work with Product, Engineering, & Data Scientists to create efficient Sql Queries to build/QA needed Data Sets, and validate/verify/troubleshoot data set integrity & validity

  • Build reusable models and queries that assist in building data set driven projects that provide insights to customers, in form of reports and data visualization

  • Ramp up into Geo-Spatial querying techniques

  • Ability to handle multiple requests project related queries, and help identify common patterns and modularize those into common data queries.


Qualifications



  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • BS computer science/related subject matter or equivalent experience

  • 2+ years experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • 2+ Years experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with both OLAP & OLTP workloads a strong plus

  • Experience with NoSql Technologies and Querying methods a Plus

  • Knowledge in One or More languages such-as Java, C#, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript a plus

  • Data Modeling experience a Plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Software Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
We are looking for talented Software Engineers with a deep interest in the analysis of data, highly scalable systems, cloud computing and open source technologies. Ideally you will have some experience with the following technologies or similar : Java, Javascript, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Python, AWS. As much as the previous is key, a strong mind and work ethic are the most important factors. At Logentries we value intellectual curiosity, a passion for technology, initiative, and a good sense of humor.


Logentries requires a Software Engineer to work on their core platform and satellite projects in Dublin, Ireland. We will provide you with a world-class mentoring program where you will learn from a team of seriously talented software developers. You might not have a Java or Javascript background, but if you’re a disciplined software engineer who is excited to learn and use new technologies and methods then Logentries Software Engineer role is for you.




Responsibilities





  • Delivering software to the Logentries production system/ getting things done

  • Follow the team’s agile practices to create world-class software





  • Interact with other engineering teams including Product, Support and Architecture

  • Collaborate with other sprinters to plan, deliver and report on your sprint

item.title: Principal Data Architect at Smartsheet (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Product Intelligence team is looking for a skilled data architect and principal engineer with prior experience designing data warehouse and business intelligence systems integrating transactional, analytical, and big data components. Together with the team, you will drive the data platform architecture to develop customer-facing product features and to meet the data needs of the organization. This is a highly visible senior role in a newly formed group where you will be instrumental in designing and building out the data platform, customer features and the team. The team comprises of data scientists and software engineers focused on enabling customers to perform actions and achieve insights currently not possible through Smartsheet's existing discrete features for tracking, sharing, managing, and automating work. Here are two short videos showing a Smartsheet overview and one of our innovative Product Intelligence features.



  • Smartsheet Overview Video

  • Graphical Exploration of Collaboration Across Your Organization


So if you like big data challenges and getting in on the ground floor of a new strategically important team within a fun and fast growing company, contact us. Responsibilities



  • Serve as technical lead and partner with members of the Product Intelligence team to design and implement a data platform that encompasses innovative intelligent product features and internal business intelligence

  • Develop and maintain technical vision and roadmaps based on the key performance indicators (KPIs)

  • Lead the development of capabilities in all facets from strategic to tactical implementation and from conception to post deployment

  • Help key users across the entire organization to understand and consume the data sets and platform for enhanced decision making and analytics

  • Advance the data architecture and platform and ensure adherence to key architectural tenets and best practices

  • Design and implement relational and dimensional models

  • Maintain master data models

  • Help build out the team and their practices and culture

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at TheLadders (New York, NY)
item.description:
Based in SoHo, TheLadders is an engineering-team-driven organization. We empower our software engineers to not just build great products, but to have a real say in the ‘how’ and ‘why’ the products are being built. We practice continuous integration, test-driven development, peer code reviews, pair programming and collaborative design studios. You’ll be on the cutting edge of current software development best practices and in the position to assist in the introduction of new ones.


TheLadders is looking for Senior Software Engineers, either Frontend, Backend or Full Stack, who want to mentor, code and help build a team. Work within a small, agile team of smart people while solving problems from beginning to end -- from product conceptualizations to engineering implementations. We use Scala, Java, Git, ElasticSearch, and Storm on the backend and Backbone, Javascript, Html and CSS for the front end.  We're proud of our engineers. Come be one of them!


 Responsibilities of the Senior Software Engineer:



  • First and foremost, developing software our users need

  • Mentoring junior and mid-level engineers and help drive the release of new updates

  • Collaborating with your team to brainstorm and create new products

  • Growing our engineering teams by interviewing, recruiting and hiring

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Hadoop, Big Data at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) technology organization is seeking a highly technical and passionate Principal Software Big Data Developer. The candidate will be responsible for leading and executing several of our strategic data initiatives for enabling the next generation customer analytical platform using big data technologies. This job also requires strong oral and written communication, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. The ideal candidate will be an energetic and resourceful team-player and leader who can effectively work with our globally distributed technology team. If you are looking for an opportunity to delve into the Big Data world with a leading technology organization, then this role is for you!


SIPD supports Fidelity's Managed Accounts business which delivers advisory solutions for Fidelity clients through the PWIS sales channels and online self-service channels such as Fidelity.com. 


This position is located full time in Durham, NC.


Responsibilities:



  • Work across technology teams to understand and define system and technical requirements for EDW and Big Data

  • Work and transition seamlessly between relational, data warehouse and big data platforms

  • Lead a team in the design/development of data ingestion and data transformation for EDW and big data applications

  • Lead the development of data pipelines using Hadoop, NoSQL, In-Memory and Distributed search platforms

  • Primary point of contact for development team to the project manager, lead systems analyst and QA lead

  • Design and deliver complex architectures for customers

  • Participates in requirements gathering and scope estimation meetings

  • Responsible for Technical Systems Design (TSD) document delivery and reviewing all project artifacts including requirements (SRA) and functional specifications (SDS)

  • Manage development for content pipeline and processing systems for real-time and predictive analytics

  • Capable of advanced performance tuning of hadoop jobs (hive, pig, map reduce, etc.)

  • Rapidly prototype and validate big data applications

  • Mentor software engineers in code design and optimization

  • Perform on-call support responsibilities with rotational schedule

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Summary: 


We are a team of agile, boundary-pushing problem-solvers who love to invent and improve. The VP of Engineering will lead a group of passionate, talented engineers (approximately 15 engineers with plans to grow rapidly) that are building a customer data query and analysis SaaS platform. Our core technology—a distributed, decentralized, bitmap index—is unrivaled and capable of performing complex queries over 200x faster than alternative solutions. You will report directly to our CEO and work very closely with our Chief Data Scientist to build an industry leading SaaS platform capable of delivering insights to our clients. 


What You Must Do To Be Successful In This Position:



  • Manage, coach, and mentor a rapidly growing team of 15+ front end, back end, and integrations engineers

  • Successfully scale our team, which is set to more than double over the next 9 months

  • Lead our Engineering recruiting charge by acting as an evangelist and improving the hiring processes

  • Be a cultural leader for our Engineering team

  • Work with our Chief Data Scientist to achieve groundbreaking R&D and architectural improvements

  • Oversee and execute multiple projects across the entire stack while maintaining stability, quality, and scalability

  • Work closely with our Product team to manage and prioritize requirements, balancing short-term and long-term needs effectively

  • Hone our agile development methodologies and team throughput

  • Drive technical performance improvements

  • Be the voice of Engineering and communicate to the entire company

  • Be a leader in the company and a voice for key executive level decisions on behalf of Engineering

  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and even commit code when necessary is a plus

item.title: Sales and Support Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a scrappy engineer to help our customers’ engineering teams understand, integrate with, deploy, debug, and troubleshoot our software and APIs.  You have been the problem solver of last resort, capable of diagnosing and resolving issues in production environments, and finding and implementing workarounds when necessary. You have described the implementation and behavior of software systems to people inside and outside of your organization, in-person, over the phone, and through IM and email. You’ve explained your systems to people of varying degrees of technical aptitude, ranging from “not technical at all,” to your coworker engineers who are working on the project every day.


This job is ideal for someone who likes to spend part of the day talking to people, part doing forensic work sifting through log files and telemetry data, part hacking together simple demos and documentation that helps customers understand complex software.

item.title: Front End Software Engineer at McLaren Applied Technologies (Woking, UK)
item.description:
Front end software engineers at McLaren Applied Technologies create innovative solutions using the latest open source technologies. We need smart engineers who are passionate about technology to join our team and help us provide timely insight into data for our customers. Your technical expertise will help us design, develop, test, deploy, and enhance software solutions that display and analyze data quickly and efficiently. You could be writing a web application with AngularJS or a desktop application with Electron.


Responsibilities:



  • Create efficient and reusable front-end solutions.

  • Develop small prototypes and spikes that reduce risk.

  • Actively contribute to agile ceremonies.

item.title: Software Engineer, Distributed Data at BuzzFeed (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company


BuzzFeed is the social news and entertainment company, providing the most shareable breaking news, original reporting, entertainment, and video across the social web to our global audience of more than 200M. BuzzFeed is also redefining online advertising with social, content-driven publishing technology.


BuzzFeed is headquartered in New York City, with additional offices in 16 cities in 10 countries across the world.


The Job


As a software engineer sitting with our Data Tribe, you’ll help build the next generation of data tools. The ideal candidate shares our belief that the right tools and data can empower our editors and producers to do amazing things they didn’t previously think possible. The overall mission of the team is helping the company learn how content works and performs no matter how it lives; you’ll be building flexible systems to support that. Because we produce content for a social web, you’ll build out integrations with external platforms to assist in data collection, build flexible systems to support all the different ways we can categorize/organize content, and develop and maintain tools for unifying and communicating data for audiences across the company.


You



  • have technical proficiency in Python or other high-level OO languages

  • have experience with external platforms APIs (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube)

  • are familiar with various DBs (mySQL, Redis, Mongo)

  • value reliability and simplicity over performance

  • value UX and craft elegant and intuitive interfaces

  • identify opportunities to automate and build tools to make your team’s lives easier


What you get in return



  • A competitive compensation package (including equity) and benefits that start on day one

  • A collaborative & close-knit team: our team is NYC-based and in the office because as great as technology is, there are few substitutes for in-person collaboration

  • Top of the line equipment and an office stocked with plentiful snacks, coffee, drinks and more

  • A company that takes its work seriously, while taking ourselves not-so-seriously

item.title: Big Data Engineer: real-time video sharing at Grabyo (London, UK)
item.description:
If you like working with emerging tech in a start-up environment, then you'll fit right in. We build an innovative platform to power real-time social video sharing for clients like BSkyB, ITV, Channel 5, Wimbledon, NHL, Formula-e and many more.


Responsibilities



  • Be social and have fun. Office culture is important to us. We work in small teams to create and develop new products and features continuously.

  • Data Engineer – you love big data and have an in depth knowledge of how to navigate around it.

  • Problem solving. Complex problems, smart solutions.

item.title: Front-End JavaScript Engineer @ high-growth DC startup FiscalNote at FiscalNote, Inc. (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Engineering at FiscalNote
Our team has a wealth of diverse life and career experiences that allow us to think outside of the box and ahead of the curve. And we laugh – all the time. You'll get the opportunity to work at an institution pushing the boundaries of open data transparency, while collaborating with some of the industry’s brightest engineers and data scientists to devise, nurture, and implement cutting-edge solutions to continuously evolving engineering obstacles.


About the Position
Willy Wonka said “We are the dreamers of dreams.” Well, FiscalNote front-end engineers are the architects that make our open data dreams come true. Wild ambition isn’t lacking at FiscalNote, and only the most talented can visualize open-data products that have never been built before. Our front-end engineers love what they do, and they are on a mission to continuously improve upon and build the most beautiful and useful user interfaces the open data world has ever seen.


About You
Creative. Ambitious. Communicative. Driven.  You yearn to exercise your abilities in a greater capacity than on a tiny feature of a much larger product. Lending your talents across our entire stack, you not only love sharing your savvy with the team, but also crave the opportunity to absorb any and all knowledge from our hyper-collaborative environment. Your appreciation (bordering on obsession) for clean code and attention to detail have helped you shine brightly at previous positions. You’re tickled by the idea of implementing inventive uses of older technologies, but even more revved at the idea of leveraging the most modern front-end tools, frameworks, and languages. Most of all, though, you live to engineer creative interfaces that take the user experience to a whole new level.


You Have
- 2+ years of industry experience programming in JavaScript
- Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3
- Expertise with jQuery
- Knowledge of algorithms, data structures and Object Oriented programming
- Knowledge of and experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks. Ember.js is highly recommended.
- Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, or related technical field (<i>Preferred</i>)
- Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or related design software (<i>Preferred</i>)
- UI/UX design experience (<i>Ideal</i>)


In becoming a FiscalNoter, you’ll enjoy a plethora of benefits that you would expect at both an established company and at a startup. More importantly, though, is the opportunity to develop software that impacts real decisions -- decisions that substantially affect governing in the US and abroad. You will hone your engineering skills among peers just as motivated and skilled as you are, and in the process, develop a tight-knit camaraderie that will transcend simple software development.

With this knowledge, Senior Data Scientists are involved in product and team leadership, helping oversee the development of Reveal to better meet both current and anticipated client needs.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for top-tier talent to design, implement, and operate large scale ML systems in a production environment. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems that span dynamic ad personalization, predictive modeling, recommendations, bid optimization and pacing - all operating on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.


Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modeling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers, and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie and Jerome Friedman.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning algorithms, systems, and supporting infrastructure

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data

  • Improve existing advertising products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations
