item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Query Processing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


You’ll be developing cutting-edge software for the best visual data analysis products available. Query processing is one of the most complex technical challenges in Tableau. You will compile, optimize and rewrite queries for all different types of data sources. In addition to traditional relational query optimization, you’ll work on optimizing federated queries across multiple data sources with diverse, often non-relational, data models. You will be expanding the analytical product capabilities and performance of the Tableau products through query optimization and through our custom in-memory columnar storage engine. You will be constantly challenged to leverage your creativity and your technical prowess to improve Tableau.

Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Extend and improve Tableau’s query pipeline that creates analytical queries enabling visualization of data.

  • Improve the performance and scalability of our in-memory data engine and extend it to support ever more diverse kinds of data.

  • Improve query performance through new algorithms, caching, concurrency, and scaling. These queries can operate on dozens of database platforms, enabling individual users and enterprises to rapidly federate and explore their data through insightful visualizations.

  • Create innovative algorithms to provide a better experience with live queries against an ever more diverse set of data sources. These may include API-based web data sources, cubes, graph data, relational and NoSQL systems such as Hadoop.

  • Leverage your creativity and technical prowess to extend our customer’s ability to see, understand, and “reach out and touch” their data; in whatever form that data it happens to be.

item.title: Data scientist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Data scientist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je beantwoordt met behulp van data-analyse vragen rond opsporing en bewijswaardering. Dit doe je bij het kennis- en expertisecentrum voor intelligente data-analyse (Kecida), onderdeel van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI).


Kecida zet intelligente data-analyse in voor het oplossen van forensische vraagstukken. Ook richten we ons op onderzoek en ontwikkeling in kunstmatige intelligentie en helpen we de openbare orde en veiligheidsector met het inzichtelijk maken van grote hoeveelheden data.


Als big data engineer pas je data-analyse toe, zoals machine learning, tekstanalyse en netwerkanalyse. Je weet data in het juiste formaat te krijgen, zodat je ze snel in kunt zetten. Vervolgens gebruik je statistiek om inzicht in data te krijgen en machine learning voor het benutten van deze inzichten. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met onderzoek en ontwikkeling op het gebied van data-analyse en data science. Tot slot werk je aan consultancyprojecten voor een diverse groep opdrachtgevers binnen de openbare orde en veiligheidsector, zoals projecten over fraudeopsporing.

item.title: Business Intelligence Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come work in a warm and relaxed environment among the red rocks of Southern Utah!  We are adding to our amazing IT team and have 2 openings for Business Intelligence Software Engineers. 


Position Summary: The Business Intelligence (BI) Software Engineer’s role is to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Business Intelligence Software Engineer is also responsible for ensuring high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.  The BI Software Engineer  will be responsible for setting the technical direction of BI projects within the framework of Enterprise Data Architecture.  The BI Software Engineer will also provide mentoring and guidance in best practices to other members of the Enterprise Data team.


Responsibilities:


Strategy and Planning (10%)



  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.


Acquisition and Deployment (10%)



  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. 

  • Evaluate and select database/data warehouse components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions.


Operational Leadership (30%) 



  • Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems. 

  • Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. 

  • Work with project managers to ensure that data entry, retrieval, change, and delete functions meet business requirements for project completion. 

  • Conduct job duties and responsibilities according to the organization’s business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology. 

  • Monitor alerts and troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary. 

  • Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant departments.

  • Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team.


Engineering (40%) 



  • Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. 

  • Develop the semantic layer, metadata, reports, and report definitions.  Develop graphs, dashboards, and portal interfaces.

  • Design databases, data models, data marts, and data warehouses. 

  • Analyze user requirements and, based upon findings, design functional solutions. 

  • Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.

  • Build specifications for BI front-end applications based upon user requirements. 

  • Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.  


Information Security (10%) 



  • Develop, test, and implement best practices within the BI ecosystem to ensure sensitive information is protected and only available to those with a need and the appropriate approved access to view the information.

item.title: Systems Security Engineer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are seeking a Security Systems Engineer to establish, lead and implement measures to protect the privacy of our customer data and intellectual property.


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools and is confident in embracing new technologies that come with cutting edge security.


If you are a security authority and hands on engineer excited to employ cutting edge techniques to manage and secure massive amounts of data in dynamic web environments we would like to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and implementing advanced security techniques in parallel and distributed systems environments

  • Mining security data, performing deep analysis to discover unrealized threats, in order to provide better transparency and more accurate metrics.

  • Developing new and innovative methods for automating security log analysis and event processing.

  • Implementing identity and key management infrastructure.

  • Implement HIPAA, SSAE16 compliance initiatives

  • Understand and review technical documents such as operating system and application system logs, code snippets, and information security best practice/regulatory guidelines.

  • Work collaboratively with developers as well as non-technical business units.

item.title: Open Source Software Engineer - Pivotal at Pivotal (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer- Security Platform Owner at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Security Intelligence team, part of Information Security at Amazon, owns the monitoring of and response to malicious activity on the Amazon network. We collect data from all parts of Amazon's massive, worldwide service-oriented architecture.



We are seeking Software Engineers to join a team in Information Security dedicated to enabling our organization to perform its most critical functions at Amazon’s scale. Our challenges are broad and deep -- we need to build flexible, secure, scalable, high-performance and robust software and services. We have all of the challenges you’d expect such as high scale, big data, and a need to never go down. In addition to these challenges we also have the security aspect. We protect customer data from adversaries that want it.



At Amazon, we obsess over our customers, and ensuring our customers’ trust is our first priority. To earn that trust in an environment as vast and varied as Amazon’s and an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated requires building a world-class security team to tackle never-before-seen challenges at dizzying scales. You will not just be using cutting-edge technologies here in Amazon; you will be inventing them.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. You have strong computer science credentials, are passionate about Internet technology, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality services. You know how to build and you dive deep into back-end services. You excel when working on complex and diverse systems. You can succinctly and accurately report your findings. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning and continuous improvement.


  • MINIMUM 8 years' Software Development experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala

  • Experienced in big data technologies and/or distributed computing systems

  • Self-directed, ability to multi-task, sharp analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Proven design skills and able to find creative scalable solutions to difficult problems

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, internet security fundamentals and designing for performance, scalability and availability




  • Masters in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills

  • Demonstration of project ownership including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

  • Experience with stream, batch and/or graph processing platform (e.g. Spark)

  • Experience with security technologies or products

  • Experience working in an agile environment

item.title: Java Engineer at Arria NLG (Surry Hills, Australia)
item.description: At Arria NLG, we develop software that uses bleeding-edge artificial intelligence technology to create natural language text that describes and explains diverse data sets. We’re looking for Software Engineers with commercial experience in developing Java applications to join us in building disruptive content creation applications, covering the full pipeline from data ingestion through data analytics and interpretation to the presentation of information in articulate natural language combined with cool graphics.

item.title: Tech Lead - Data Science Team (m/f) at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are not only excellent at their craft, but can also excite and lead fellow developers, and drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Tech Leads at TrustYou hold full responsibility for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to gather and prioritize requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and drive the implementation from specification to QA, leading a team of smart engineers.


Our data scientists are expected to have knowledge in machine learning and natural language processing, and, most importantly, know how to apply it to create precise and useful products.


Theoretical knowledge isn’t everything - good skills in visualization and communication are key for data scientists. The most interesting analysis may be useless if you can’t convince anyone of your results!


TrustYou lives and breathes the world wide web, and you should share our passion for it. It shouldn’t be a problem for you to slap together a REST server to feed data into a visualization written in JavaScript.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects

  • Manage and develop a team of data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree.

  • 6 years+ experience.

  • Knowledge of machine learning and/or natural language processing.

  • Experience with distributed systems.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases.

  • Excellent algorithms knowledge.

  • Fluent in English.


Preferred qualifications



  • Experience with Apache Hadoop, and other technologies from Hadoop ecosystem.

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Good HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge.

  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases.

  • 2 years+ experience in hands-on technical leadership and people management.


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Data Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

item.title: Lead Engineer at Pomello (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lead Engineer -- You will take the technical lead on Pomello. You have experience engineering enterprise applications, and are ready to build a product from the ground up without the bureaucracy of a large company. Initially, you will be a full-stack engineer with a lot of hands-on building. As the team grows, you will have the opportunity to build a team. You will influence every aspect of the product from ideation to execution. We value team members who are able to make strategic decisions quickly balancing development speed with risk. We are looking for consistent progress towards long-term goals, and the ability to get comfortable with rapidly changing priorities. As our first full-time software engineer, you will have the chance work with the founding team to build our platform from scratch and grow a product/engineering team.


CURRENT PROJECTS:
API Integrations with other HR saas companies to develop additional sources of data, and to facilitate broader distribution of our product.


Enhanced Analytics/Data Visualization--Make predictive analytics easily understandable and actionable.


Mid-term Product Roadmap--Brainstorm ideas and incorporate customer feedback into new features to test with existing and potential customers

item.title: iOS Engineer at VTS (New York, NY)
item.description:
https://twitter.com/BuildingVTS


http://building.vts.com/


https://www.vts.com/


As a VTS iOS engineer you’ll be working on all ends of our product, whether it be building out a new backend service to consume or polishing up a UITableView interface to match a mock. We’re always trying new technologies to fit the appropriate situation, and at VTS you'll definitely pick up a few skills you haven’t learned elsewhere.


We are looking for talented engineers who:


-Embrace solid software engineering and OO design practices


-Are passionate about writing clean, testable iOS code


-Are excited to work with & stay on top of the latest and greatest with Swift. We have embraced Swift fully since day one and the majority of our application is now written in it.


-Strong desire to learn and be a part of building the API’s (Ruby on Rails, Heroku, Sidekiq) the mobile apps consume


-Have a good sense for iOS UI/UX design


-Can take responsibility of & own their work through the entire development process


-Love collaborating in a team and occasionally pairing with other engineers

item.title: Software Engineer - Hotel Data Management at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
For our headquarters in Dusseldorf, Germany, we’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 700,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • Evaluate partners’ datasets for potential inclusion into the trivago hotel search.

  • Develop and optimize intelligent algorithms to determine matching of entities in 31 languages.

  • Leverage big data and machine learning techniques to improve our automated matching process.

  • Improve the overall quality of our hotel information by developing systems that reduce the risk of duplicate data. We encourage thinking outside the box!

  • Experiment with our cutting edge technologies to investigate and correct anomalies within the data.

  • Analyse and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of our current processes by taking them apart and rebuilding them in your own innovative way.

  • Become the technical interface for our content-related development teams and technical account managers and help them decipher all matching related issues.

item.title: Senior C++ Developer at Sisense (Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel)
item.description:
We are Sisense. We disrupt the Business Intelligence market. Our product allows business users to analyze humongous amounts of data without being experts and without help from IT. How? By building on a set of unique and cutting edge technologies, wrapped up in a killer product. We are looking for talented C/C++ engineer to be part of our core technology team. 


As an engineer in Sisense, you will be part of the team developing the core of our Big Data Analytics Columnar Database, ElastiCube.
ElastiCube is an award winning database with an advanced query execution engine.


You will develop and improve advanced features/technologies including:



  • Big Data transformation engine (TB scale).

  • Multidimensional queries (advanced analytics)

  • Cache-oblivious algorithms.

  • Superscalar decompression.

  • In-chip vectorization.

  • Parallel I/O.

item.title: NoSQL? Great! Come help expand our Big Data solution across our platform! at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
As an Elasticsearch Engineer at kCura, based in Chicago IL, you will leverage your knowledge in Elasticsearch to build Relativity Data Grid- a NoSQL data store that allows users to horizontally distribute large amounts of text and data. This is your opportunity to work on a next generation data store that will allow Relativity to handle massive amounts of data. If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our team and be part of a successful company experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field.



Responsibilities:




  • Design and implementation of APIs and services to expose the data and abstract the tools

  • Experience with relational databases

  • Experience building intensive data driven applications

  • Elasticsearch experience

  • Real time data processing utilizing Elasticsearch technologies

  • Familiarity building Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana logging system

  • Scaling distributed data systems

  • Optimizing distributed application systems to maximize performance

  • Configure/optimize Elasticsearch clusters

  • Design, build, and test systems for scalability and stability while processing petabytes of data

  • Integrate Elasticsearch tools into the Relativity architecture

  • Actively participating in our SCRUM process

  • Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems

  • May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer working on the Appian platform, your mission will be to ensure Appian is always fast, scalable and up to whatever tasks our customers configure it to do. You will be solving problems of scale and flexibility that most engineers never see, building a product capable of serving our customers in ways you never imagined. Your scope extends from the high-performance data layer to the cross-platform user interface. This position requires the mental agility to jump from the deep code-level view of Appian, to the designer’s view, to the end user’s view, and back again. Learn how to write software that runs software, and enhance Appian's cross-platform functional programming language.

You will design and develop systems that let our customers build amazing enterprise apps for mobile and the web without writing a line of code. The design decisions and judgement calls you make will impact millions of Appian users worldwide. You will be looked upon as an expert and advocate to fellow engineers on making design and reliability trade-offs in running large-scale services and engineering complex systems that fail gracefully and transparently to users.

As a successful candidate for this role you will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of software design and delivery which are uniquely Appian’s.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Sr. Systems Engineer is responsible for helping to develop and support a stable, available and scalable infrastructure that powers AXS.com and a suite of products that include Advantage and Data Platform (Hadoop). The scope of the position is from the system to the application service level. In the spirit of Dev-ops this position requires working closely with the internal development and big data teams. We are looking for System Engineers familiar with large scale, high traffic 24/7 production environments built in data centers and in the cloud. The ideal candidate is someone with a deep understanding of infrastructure, systems and services and how they’re built, deployed, managed and interact at scale. 


Essential Duties



  • Oversees provisioning and configuration of new systems in the cloud or at the data center

  • Work with various internal teams on issue resolution and systems management

  • First-line responsibility for isolating application-level configuration, performance and database problems

  • Performs analysis and tuning of system performance

  • Works closely with internal development and big data teams on stage and production management and deployment

  • Maintain and grow a production environment in a way that makes the system increasingly performant, stable and maintainable

  • Participates in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Responds to and resolves emergent service problems by debugging systems and services

  • Interfaces with development and operations teams to perform software and systems analysis, upgrades and new deployments

  • Management of system monitoring and performance monitoring frameworks, alerting, and security policies

  • Participate in on-call rotation

item.title: Linux Engineer; DevOps at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are Seeking a Dev Ops, Linux Engineer skilled with handling large production environments to expand, automate and maintain our Linux fleet. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance. 


If you have a passion for high performance computing you will be instrumental in building tools to manage a highly scalable, 24/7 available platform for data analysis. 



With a focus on scripting, process re-engineering and continuous integration; you blend the skills of an analyst with the technical chops of an engineer to architect solutions on issues that affect the entire company.


If you value the power of driving strategic vendor decisions and are confident in embracing new technologies to tackle our high volume, scalable problems we would like to speak with you! 


Responsibilities:



  • Scaling, managing and automating our Linux fleet as 1010data grows. 

  • Automate the management of cloud computing infrastructure

  • Build out HA/DR computing solutions

  • Ensure the overall health and performance of production environment

  • Proactively identify trends, determine root causes, and initiate appropriate action to resolve issues. 

  • Investigate and resolve hardware and software issues

  • Responsible for production systems sometimes after hours or weekends.

item.title: Analytics Platform Engineer at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft changes the way the world stays connected through data.  Our award winning engineering team develops integration solutions for fellow engineers around the globe and we’re looking to grow!  Our newest engineers will shape our world-class analytics platform, participate in architectural discussions, and choose development technologies.


MuleSoft has a growing portfolio of highly distributed and reliable connectivity products and our analytics engineers will build a platform which allows end users to analyze and share massive amounts of transactional data. This position also offers daily exposure to influencers within the API, Cloud and Integration markets.

Position details:


Our analytics software engineer will pioneer a big-data analytics platform which provides the back-bone for how we collect, analyze and share transactional data and metrics from tens of thousands of integration and API machines distributed in the cloud. This real-time analytics product will be used for cloud reporting and optimizing the behavior of our customer’s systems at runtime.  You’ll work on a customer facing solution which sits at the center of various distributed architecture stacks across the Fortune 500.The product spans the entire Anypoint platform and your end users will be our customer’s developers, analysts and the C-Suite.


The analytics function of our Anypoint platform is still in architectural phase.  You will participate in architectural discussions, shape the platform, choose technologies, and have a direct impact on the newest part of our product line.

item.title: Client Facing Python Developer at Continuum Analytics (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for accomplished scientists and engineers interested in a customer-facing software consultancy that could lead to full time placement with a customer at the conclusion of a project.  Many of these roles allow for involvement with our core technologies as needed by the customer.  The more experienced candidate will have a strong technical background with 4+ years Python and C/C++ development experience and 2+ years experience with NumPy or the equivalent.


Depending on your skills, you will work on one of our core products or technologies, including our next-generation data management products which will push Python and its vectorized enhancements such as NumPy into general use in big data analytics. For the right person(s) with strong technical and customer-facing skills but less prior exposure to Python, C/C++, NumPy, and related, we may offer concentrated training and mentoring to fully prepare you for this role. 


Bonus skills & experience: Distributed databases, parallel computation, KDB+, GPU, UI, Gemstone, OLAP/MDX, LLVM.

item.title: Technical Engineer (Customer Success) at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW



Logi Analytics enables enterprises to make better use of their data by delivering on the promise of analytics everywhere. By providing both a Web-based data discovery solution and a business information platform that can be embedded within applications, systems and processes, Logi Analytics helps its customers from the corner office to the factory floor to be more informed, make better decisions and improve corporate performance. With more than 1,200 customers worldwide, Logi Analytics meets the needs of organizations ranging from small businesses to Global 2000 enterprises. The company is headquartered in McLean, Virginia and has sales and support offices in the U.K. and Europe. Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



The Technical Engineer will assist existing customers in all aspects of the implementation, use and functional operation of Logi Analytics products. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of a wide range of technologies and serve as a contributing member of the team in technology discussions and operations. 



Responsibilities:



The range of the technical skills that are required to support the interaction between the Logi platform and client environments includes:



  • Web-based scripting technologies (JavaScript, CSS and/or HTML)

  • Common database systems (SQL Server, Oracle and/or MySQL)

  • SQL query writing

  • Basic networking skills, to include operating systems and OS security interactions

  • ETL processes and data modeling / data warehousing

  • Web Application technologies such as, DHTML and XML

  • Java and VB.NET programming language

  • Web server setup and configuration (IIS, Tomcat, Weblogic, etc.)

  • Data-driven web applications


The Technical Engineer will also:



  • Establish and maintain working relationships with internal teams, including professional services consultants, product management, engineers, and support staff

  • Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the entire Logi Analytics product line

  • Manage and drive competing requests across simultaneous client engagements

  • Provide clear and constructive product feedback to product management based on customer requirements

  • Help to document best practices in developing and deploying Logi Analytics solutions

item.title: Big Data Software Engineers needed at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for excellent software engineers from junior to senior who will be responsible for:



  • Working as part of a team to deliver key projects

  • Maintaining and improving our existing code base


Salary is in the region of £25 - £50k and we have a profit-share programme as well so we all benefit when the business does well.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at TAPTAP Networks S.L. (Madrid, Spain)
item.description: We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer for our Sonata Team. Main part of the work is dedicated to the backend development, but front-end experience would be highly  appreciated. Our backend stack is mostly powered by Java and Node.js. We make heavy use of MongoDB and Redis but also use MySQL and other database systems.

item.title: Front-end Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The front-end team at Likelihood is responsible for building an advanced, yet simple interface for our machine learning platform. With it, non-technical users at our customers are able to easily create experiments that power beautiful, data-driven website and mobile experiences. We seek talented JavaScript engineers with strong design sensibilities and a desire to create interfaces that are a pleasure to use. 


You'll be working from the ground-up with a small team to guide the architecture and implementation of our web applications. We'll want you to build upon your ideas about what other applications we can create that enable companies to provide personalized experiences for each of their individual customers.

item.title: Software Engineer Platform at Dataminr (New York, NY)
item.description: At Dataminr, we are looking for dedicated software engineers to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Hadoop System Engineer at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a Hadoop System Engineer to design, implement and maintain a large data solution for our health care project needs using Amazon’s cloud.


Responsibilities:



  • Work with project team to design Hadoop database to support large health care data sets

  • Develop capacity planning and analysis for Hadoop infrastructures/clusters

  • Implement solution using Amazon’s cloud environment

  • Provide metrics and data modelling support

  • Support an atmosphere of cross-functional teamwork within the organizations agile project lifecycle

  • Participates in product roadmap discussions and identify key areas for improvements in the product, and incorporate these goals into ongoing & future development initiatives

  • Recommends solutions by defining physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Software engineers play a vital role in the success of our business and form a core part of the organization. We tend to look for talented generalists who are capable of working in a variety of areas, some of which include large scale distributed systems, high-performance multi-threaded trading platforms, and data feed platforms. Successful candidates will have the flexibility and skills to contribute in one or more of the following domains:



  • Development and maintenance of large, complex software and hardware systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Development and design of monitoring tools, including user interfaces, to analyze data from all aspects of our existing system.

  • Parsing, processing, and analyzing large financial data sets.

item.title: Firmware Engineer at Parkifi (Denver, CO)
item.description:
Are you a hardware hacker looking to apply your skills in a tech startup?


Parkifi, a fast-growing tech startup founded in 2014, is looking for a Firmware Engineer to help develop the foundation for the company. Based in Denver, Parkifi is using cutting edge technology to solve and revolutionize the world’s parking challenges with data. Lots and lots of data.


We need someone with tireless hustle who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves problem solving.  If you understand MVP, and can make risk/reward trade offs in hardware and firmware, we would love to talk to you.

item.title: Sr Natural Language Processing Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The R&D ADSK Team at Bloomberg is looking for a seasoned senior software engineer to work on projects involving machine learning, natural language processing, and computation linguistics.

Our group develops sophisticated real-time systems that help create the best customer service experience possible. This includes the accurate routing of chat based questions to representatives based on their specialty and experience. We analyze chat conversations between representatives and clients in real-time to help assist the rep and create semi-automated systems to improve efficiency. You will have the opportunity to interface with the business to better understand the requirements and to drive the direction of the product.

We are seeking senior software engineers who can formulate a vision and work towards making it a reality. The ideal candidate would have background in mathematics and statistics as well as machine learning and natural language processing enabling them to contribute immediately to projects.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Core Systems at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description




  • Work as an integral member of highly motivated Product, Engineering, & Data Scientist teams to build plus manage scalable & Performance oriented software systems for an innovative Spatial Analytics Startup

  • Take part in establishing and driving best practices and engineering practices geared towards shipping products

  • Design, implement, and maintain software systems & infrastructure

  • Refactor and improve maintainability of the codebase.

  • Solve complex scalability, platform, and integration problems.

  • Learn new paradigms, languages, and libraries as you work.

  • Building, Managing, & Maintaining multiple application environments, including production

  • Manage systems and work in all aspects of the agile driven software development lifecycle



Qualifications




  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • Strong knowledge of OOP concepts, Functional & Reactive programming paradigms, design patterns, data structures & Algorithms

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • BS or MS computer science/related subject matter preferred or equivalent experience

  • 4+ years experience building & Shipping web scale and distributed systems

  • Strong knowledge in designing across all layers of complex software systems

  • 2+ Years experience with GO

  • 6+ Years building production systems and writing efficient code in multiple programing languages such as Java, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript, C++/C

  • 4+ Years experience with SOA/WOA based systems with strong understanding of HTTP, REST and like protocols, micro-services and system integration

  • Experience working in Polyglot code bases & systems

  • Knowledge of Scaling & distribution patterns

  • Experience & knowledge of concepts such-as Concurrency and Parallel paradigms, Asynchronous patterns, Threading & Processes, distributed components & systems

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • Experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with NoSql/Big Data Technologies and Querying methods including Hadoop/Mapreduce systems, Apache Stack, Column Family, Key-Value, Document, and Graph data systems

  • Good Data Modeling experience

  • Experience with Search systems such-as Solr/Elasticsearch a plus

  • Experience building on top of or integrating with Analytics & machine-learning platforms is a plus

  • Experience with Node, and Front-end technologies such-as React/Angular, HTML & CSS is a plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus



This position will be filled in either Seattle, WA or Miami, FL

item.title: JS Engineer, London office based at Monetate, Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
We're actively searching for Javascript Engineers to join our growing technical team in London office.This is a full time, permanent position, based in our London office. You will work with Monetate's delivery team side by side to use Javascript to build experiences for on page experiments for our many significant E-commerce clients. Your content will run on high-traffic web pages and test marketers ideas in real time.

We're looking for self-starters with a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms to tackle tough new challenges and to contribute to the growth of our business and our customers' success. Individual contributions are acknowledged during weekly company meetings and recognized throughout the company. If you're a problem-solver who is passionate about rich web applications, scaling Internet applications to billions of page views, and working with big data, then you're a perfect fit for our close-knit and agile team.



We offer full package of benefits, flexible hours, free lunches and monthly socials with the whole team.


Apply today!  


Please note: this is a London, UK office based position- local applicants only.

item.title: Senior Modeling Scientist, Brand and Inventory Quality at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second. The Brand and Inventory Quality teams build large scale pipelines that let us target online users across the web and mobile apps and ensure that the ads we display are shown on quality inventory to real people. Quantcast engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse targeting products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for people with strong analytic and big data experience to expand our brand targeting and inventory quality capabilities. As a Senior Scientist you will investigate and model a variety of problems to identify the right users to target on the right inventory. You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our Mapreduce cluster and global realtime bidding system.


Responsibilities




  • Develop models and techniques to target online users at a large scale




  • Lead analytic projects through the full technical life cycle, from design and development through deployment and support




  • Work with cross-functional engineering and science teams to coordinate brand targeting and inventory quality projects with other performance advertising goals 




  • Work with product management and client services to gather project requirements and communicate project impacts

item.title: Software Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Software Development Engineer to join our team. You’ll work on an agile team in the big data arena, building the infrastructure to support AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus and Hadoop experience an even bigger plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.


* Perform code reviews.


* Provide third-tier support for production systems.

item.title: Data Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for a Data Engineer that embodies our values to join our team revolutionizing healthcare.

item.title: Web Application / Software Engineer at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are comfortable getting out of their comfort zone, who never stop learning, who love responsibilities and want to drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Software Engineers at TrustYou work in a team with other smart engineers and are responsible for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to understand customer requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and help to drive the implementation from specification to QA.


Our web applications are built with a modern stack of technologies and tools. Our Engineers are expected to to build large, modular and fast cross-browser JavaScript applications.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects.

  • Team play together with other smart data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree

  • 2 years+ experience implementing beautiful and scalable web applications

  • Expert HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases

  • Good algorithms knowledge

  • Comfortable working in Linux

  • Fluent in English


Preferred qualifications



  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases

  • RequireJS or single page application frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, Ember.js)


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany; Cluj-Napoca, Romania


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Data Scientist at Aspen Technology (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Overview:



 “Enabling every process plant to achieve Operations Excellence” is the AspenTech vision. Founded more than 30 years ago by the best and brightest engineers at MIT, we continue to imagine and invent new ways to bring efficiency to the process industry. Today, AspenTech is thriving with our relentless focus on innovation, collaboration, and execution combined with world-class experts who speak more than 10 languages and work in 30 different offices worldwide. This is a place where people are fiercely passionate about technology, a balanced life style and a desire to make a difference in the process industry.



 Our software tackles the most complex  process manufacturing challenges, creating value and improving profitability for our customers.  The industries that drive our economies and touch our lives are optimized by aspenONE software every day.  The world’s leading oil & gas, chemical, engineering & construction, pharmaceutical, food, beverage, and consumer packaged goods companies all rely on AspenTech to run their business (Dow Chemical, ExxonMobil, BASF, Shell, etc.). With integrated aspenONE software, process manufacturers can optimize their engineering, manufacturing, and supply chains.  AspenTech customers are better able to achieve operational excellence —  increasing capacity and improving margins, reducing costs, becoming more energy efficient, while ensuring safety, and shrinking their carbon footprint.



If you want a shot at greatness, as a member of the data science team, you will develop and investigate hypotheses, structure experiments and build mathematical models to understand data patterns and relationships and prescribe actions and options. We are looking for a sharp, disciplined, and highly quantitative individual who has a passion for playing with data, in all its forms including data mining, mathematical modeling and expert systems. We are building a unique technology platform dedicated to the real-time discovery and manipulation of data; this is your chance to be a critical part of that data research team.






Responsibilities:




  • Experience and track record in contributing in core development activities in a data analytics project

  • As a data scientist, you will create the analytics platforms and algorithms in software including warehousing, data engineering and management, statistics and machine learning, advanced computing, probabilistic modeling and visualization. 

  • As a data scientist, you will build and verify mathematical models and automated machine learning tools to analyze and optimize all aspects of our system, providing actionable insights in real time.

  • Thorough knowledge of SDLC and the ability to adhere to software development standards to release products on time; this includes processes such as issue tracking, source code control, coding conventions.

  • Collaborate with data mining engineers and development teams on data selection,preprocessing and formatting for analysis. You will also have the opportunity to help implement product-related tools, features and/or designs; success is measured in monetizing, retention, product usage and adoption.  

  • Help the organization shape new product directions as well as implement product vision within the context of the next generation of product architecture, while keeping the data science/analytics in mind.

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at Datto EMEA (Reading, Regne Unit)
item.description:
Datto, Inc., is one of the fastest growing companies in Connecticut, specializing in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are a leader in our space. We are seeking a Senior PHP Developer for our top-flight development team based in our Green Park, Reading office. The development team at Datto is a highly collaborative organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill, and a passion for quality. Come write cutting edge Windows Backup solutions, and collaborate with program management and quality assurance staff on innovative projects.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop web products using PHP/Javascript/Bash.

  • Implement new features and maintain existing code base.

  • Give valuable input regarding the core architecture.

  • Follow coding standards and best practices.

item.title: Database Engineer - PostgreSQL at Amplify Technologies (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Amplify are looking for an experienced Database Engineer to ensure the data integrity of our rapidly evolving, open-source, Web-based marketing product.


Our ideal candidate is skilled in logical and physical database design for web-based transactional environments, the creation of SQL and stored procedures and expert in data quality and data cleansing processes.


This role will collaborate directly with the product manager and development team to identify and understand source data systems, as well as provide input for enhancements for standardization and consistency across the application. This position presents an opportunity to test and shape your professional potential - you’ll have significant impact on the products you develop and influence on the direction of the company. At Amplify your technical ability and creativity will be allowed to shine.


Our company culture is entrepreneurial and practical; our working style agile and collaborative. It’s an environment that demands a personality that can take initiative and lead and rewards a good team player. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty you’ll fit right in. Code Divas need not apply.

item.title: Software Engineer - Build To Scale at Reveal Mobile (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Reveal Mobile builds cutting-edge mobile analytics products, and we need talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. New hires work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products. We don’t hire using a checklist (5 years of that, 3 years of this, etc.). It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software. 


Your Responsibilities:



  • Build innovative, scalable application systems. Scalable is the keyword in that sentence. Our product touches millions of mobile devices every month.

  • Write maintainable code, working in a professional software engineering environment (source control, shortened release cycles, continuous integration and deployment, etc.).

  • Welcome change and complexity. We are on the leading, sometimes bleeding, edge of mobile development. That requires us to learn quickly and adapt fast. We are looking for folks to lead that charge, not just keep up with it.

item.title: Forensisch software engineer big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren Java-ontwikkelaar?



Binnen het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) werkt een team gedreven softwareontwikkelaars aan vooruitstrevende forensische software. Je draagt in hoge mate bij aan de doorontwikkeling van het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt. Bij dit R&D-project wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten.



Als forensisch software engineer big data ontwikkel je samen met een team van ongeveer 8 collega’s het platform Hansken verder om onder meer de performance, schaalbaarheid en functionaliteit te verbeteren. Aan het systeem worden hoge eisen aan de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid gesteld. Daarom ben je kritisch over het functioneren ervan, durf je vragen te stellen en sta je open voor feedback. Naast je werk aan het systeem denk je mee over het continu verbeteren van het ontwikkelproces, waarbij de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk geborgd wordt.

item.title: Web Developer - Full Stack at HERE a Nokia Company (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
Senior Web Developer/Tools Engineer



HERE Reality Lens Introduction:


Nokia HERE is a global leader in the mapping and location intelligence business. HERE Reality Lens utilizes advanced reality capture technologies to collect, process, and publish petabytes of street-level, aerial, and indoor spatial data to customers in over 72 countries around the world. These software and data services, the sixth largest on AWS, allow users to visualize high-resolution 3D panoramic and oblique imagery while interactively measuring, mapping, and modeling.


We use a lightweight agile process aimed at customer-driven milestones and give our engineers freedom in how they approach technical challenges. Engineering teams are supported with a highly automated continuous integration and deployment infrastructure.


Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer:


As Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer, you would help Reality Lens execute on our product vision, create great products, and make a great working environment. Your day will consist of tasks like researching, designing, implementing, and testing software. You should be a quick learner and communicate well. You're a team player who loves to both code and mentor others.


Ideal candidates will have developed and delivered scalable, robust API-driven services and data pipelines.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Canvas/WebGL and DOM-based solutions integrating 2D maps, 3D imagery and point clouds (aka “Smart Cities”).

  • Design and implement web-based tools for managing live operations and other shared platform services using a Node.js technology stack.

  • Integrate software with HERE platforms, processes, pipelines, and products.

  • Choose and implement analysis and design patterns and algorithms that enable systems or features to meet business and technical requirements.

  • Design data models for SQL and NoSQL databases and caches. (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).

item.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Services at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Our engineering culture is incredibly important to us.  We write great software, care deeply about code quality, and expect the people who join us to do the same. We're looking for innovative and detail-oriented engineers to help us create one of the most sophisticated SaaS cloud platforms in Canada.  


Engineering Responsibilities



  • Think in terms of 10x improvements

  • Write clean and elegant code

  • Create robust, speedy production components and develop prototypes quickly

  • Tell us what we need to be doing rather than expect to be told what to do

item.title: Discovery Software Engineer (m/f) at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Role


Rocket Internet’s discovery team is a fast-growing interdisciplinary team of engineers that design, build and maintain a real-time data platform that is at the heart of the search and recommendation experience of our e-commerce and marketplace ventures. We are looking for engineers who don’t like to be pigeon-holed into one role, but look beyond the platform’s current direction and are able to anticipate what needs to be in place in six months to support future platform development and growth. The day-to-day tasks of the infrastructure and relevance engineers on the team range from building a global infrastructure that handles millions of requests per second to development of powerful ranking algorithms based on statistical models derived from large data sets as much as intuition.

item.title: AWS Engineer at ActivTrak (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Dallas-based startup www.activtrak.com has an opening for a AWS DevOps Engineer. ActivTrak is used by 70,000 businesees worldwide.   We have a great product, clients, and are building a team to help take things to the next level.


As an AWS DevOps Engineer, you will spend your day responsible for the continuous operation and maintenance of the companies web service infrastructure %100 hosted on the Amazon AWS Cloud. 


Benefits



  • Highly competitive salary

  • Equity options after qualifying period and vesting schedule.

  • Annual training budget

  • High-end choice of personal computer

  • Flexible working hours

item.title: Database Administrator at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Database Admin/Engineer will be accountable for developing and maintaining the rapidly growing relational database infrastructure for the V12 Group's suite of cloud-based applications.


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop, and manage relational databases

  • Programming using SQL and SQL/RDBMS utilities

  • Work closely with Product Managers and Reporting Team for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure data integrity and overall system quality

  • Oversee database backup and recovery

  • Capacity monitoring and planning

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.
