item.title: Senior Engineering Manager - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for a seasoned hands-on data science manager to join a growing team of scientists and engineers in London, focused on performance targeting and optimization. 

This team is responsible for building the online advertising prediction and control systems that power Quantcast. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques, as well as serving as mentor, manager, and joint architect for the systems and processes built by the team.  Not a purely theoretical position, this team is responsible for shipping production code to meet the demands of the business and a solid background in software engineering is desired. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.

Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modelling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie, Jerome Friedman, and Michael Jordan.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Manage several projects, including prediction and control systems that are designed to efficiently drive sales and engagements for our clients

  • Lead, don’t follow. Drive innovation and contribute to intellectual property. Identify and propose new systems and techniques that bring business value. Everybody codes and participates.

  • Hire and manage a growing team of 5 - 10+ engineers of all seniority levels

  • Advise other data science teams and projects in London and globally

  • Ensure that the team is focused on commercially relevant projects, that the pace of innovation is rigorous, and that we meet stringent design, performance and robustness quality standards

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Software Engineer, Mobile at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. Our Software Engineers in Mobile Applications work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. You will build MoLabs products for either Android or iOS. If you are an Android Developer, you will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. If you are an iOS Developer, you will develop applications and SDKs primarily in Swift or Objective-C and using the iOS SDK.

item.title: Python Software Engineer at CodiLime Sp. z o.o. (Warszawa, Polska)
item.description:
CodiLime realizes projects for clients from all over the world, e.g. California, Japan, Israel, Malta and Scandinavia, rendering services to such companies as NTT, AT&T, Hitachi High Technologies, Juniper Networks, GigaSpaces, Mirantis.We work with cutting edge IT technologies in the following areas: Machine Learning & BigData, Cloud Computing, Software Defined Network. We code in Python, Java, Scala i C++, and use various tools, technologies and frameworks, including Celery, Hadoop, Spark, Flask, AngularJS. We work in accordance with Agile methodologies and Clean Code practices using tools such as JIRA, Jenkins or Gerrit.


Examples of projects under realization:


1. Together with our client’s team we take part in developing an open source system for management of complex cloud applications. Our task is to develop parts of the system responsible for monitoring virtual machines as well as processes taking place there and to produce an appropriate reaction of the system to the noticed problems. Additionally, we also work on integrating the system with other open source systems, such as Docker, SaltStack, JBoss, etc. Technologies: Python, Celery, Riemann, RabbitMQ, Cloud (OpenStack, AWS),Vagrant.


2. We create a system that predicts failures of medical devices. This is a two-phase project. At the first stage an IT system is designed for uploading measurement data from the devices, dividing calculations into a set of tasks, running them in parallel and presenting the results. The second phase includes time series (sensor data) analytics and estimating the risk of failure of given device. Technologies: Python, Celery, RabbitMQ, Azure.

item.title: Software Engineer at Revenue Analytics, Inc. (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Revenue Analytics has an immediate need to hire a Software Engineer for our Data Engineering Group.  We offer a competitive base salary, 15%-20% bonus incentive, full benefits, 401(k) + match and a defined career path. 


Revenue Analytics is looking for exceptional, motivated Software Engineers to design and develop large scale innovative solutions with sophisticated optimization models for Fortune 500 companies. Collaborate on cross-functional project teams assembled to address some of today’s most pressing business problems. Own project work streams while managing client expectations and strengthening client relationships. 


As a member of the Revenue Analytics Team, you will be part of a dynamic, growth organization dedicated to helping our clients optimize the price and availability of their products. 


 Responsibilities



  • Work with client and project team to write data and technology requirements in client facing documentation on software functionality.

  • Consult directly with clients and project teams to develop solutions to business problems through the design and development of software and database frameworks for forecasting and optimization solutions.

  • Through client interfacing and consulting, perform data transformation and analysis to assist clients in uncovering revenue opportunities.

  • Produce analysis and designs for the creation of analytical software solutions.

  • Work with clients to integrate our software solutions with their systems including providing full lifecycle application development support and consultancy.


Great Benefits


To attract top talent, we provide highly competitive salaries and benefits and offer substantial incentive compensation in the form of variable compensation and bonuses.



  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for our employees and their families

  • Life insurance, long and short term disability coverage

  • 401(k) plan with a generous match and you are vested immediately

  • Company issued cell phone and laptop

  • 3 weeks paid vacation, 6 national holidays, 5 days off for Winter Break, and paid sick time

item.title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

item.title: Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: Seeking Java Engineers to Make Healthcare Smarter at Audacious Inquiry (Catonsville, MD)
item.description:
Join Ai and become part of a team developing applications that are changing healthcare across the country.  Seriously!  Our engineers design and develop solutions that improve healthcare outcomes and enable healthcare professionals to do their jobs more efficiently and effectively.  If you are looking for a career with room for advancement and professional growth, in a fun and collaborative environment, that also makes a difference to your community, look no further.

JOB DUTIES

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer at Time Inc. (New York, NY)

item.title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
item.description:
System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services


Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. TechOps detects and solves the issues in a proactive manner. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. We are looking for system engineers that want to automate just about everything you can think of and build a development and deployment pipeline and set of tools that can effectively deliver our games and services. Our team is responsible for automating the entire stack of high performance, large scale, geographically dispersed resources throughout its life-cycle. We have an app stack that will challenge you and diversify your skills. Ideal candidates will have experience of AWS and/or other cloud tech. You will be building our infrastructure in AWS, EC2 or our own private hardware and software resources. You will work side by side with our engineering teams and architects to design and implement a scalable and robust cloud delivery infrastructure.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work closely with the engineering teams to design, deliver and manage our services with high uptime

  • Participate in failure, load and performance tests to ensure applications are production ready

  • Ensure security of the production infrastructure, systems and applications

  • Engage in the development of continuous integration strategy. Define, develop and maintain CI processes and systems

  • Automate, implement, administer, and maintain our databases, local and cloud-based servers including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades, and monitoring

item.title: Data Scientist at Feedzai (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for data scientists with as much skill as passion and large amounts of both! Come and help us disrupt the hot hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


You will be working in a cross-functional team where you will be able to tackle complex fraud detection problems and where your main responsibilities will be:



  • Work close with our product development team and with other R&D team members in thorny fraud detection problems.

  • Support your answers and findings with appropriate statistical techniques and methods.

  • Contribute to the team knowledge by keeping up with the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to our domains.

What we offer:

  • Independence to choose preferred tools and techniques to solve problems and minimize time-to-completion.

  • Become a member of an award-winning, amazing, driven, focused team which is disrupting the market.

item.title: MongoDB Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate MongoDB Engineer to join our team. As a MongoDB Engineer, you’ll be largely responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. This position includes production as well as development DBA tasks, as such it will require a commitment on your part as well as ours.


About the Team


Here at Rally we try to do things a little differently. Whether it's re-imagining how SaaS is implemented and scaled, blameless postmortems, pushing to production on your very first day, we don't subscribe to the mantra of "Because we've always done it that way".


We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We also believe in the right tool for the job, not language-as-religion.


About the Job


As a database and data store administrator, you will be part of a team of highly-skilled engineers that manage all production, test and ancillary data environments.  While there are a number of different systems, Rally is consolidating to MongoDB and Oracle as the primary data systems.  This position will be focused on MongoDB first, and Oracle second, and will be expected to cross-train the other DBAs on MongoDB best practices, management and implementation.  The position requires on-call availability to support our 24x7x365 SaaS operations.  


Responsibilities:




  • Monitoring and administering data systems security in AWS and colo environments.




  • Analyzing data stored in the databases and data stores and making recommendations relating to performance and efficiency of that data storage.




  • Helping application programmers to efficiently utilize the data assets by assisting in database schema design and recommending the best design for scalability and performance.




  • Proactively monitor systems for optimum performance and capacity constraints.




  • Establishing standards and best practices for database backup and recovery.




  • 2+ years of production Oracle DBA experience.




  • 3+ years of production MongoDB management experience.




  • Experience with Oracle RDBMS running on Linux.




  • Experience managing, implementing, monitoring and scaling MongoDB in AWS




  • Strong experience supporting mission critical data infrastructure




  • Some experience and knowledge of an Oracle 11g database for an OLTP application in areas such as best practices, scalability, performance, and reliability.




  • Experience with Oracle and/or MongoDB performance tuning.




  • Experience with Oracle standby databases. Active Data Guard experience a plus.




  • Skilled in scripting and automating repetitive administrative tasks.




  • Experience with backup, recovery, and DR best practices.




About You


You enjoy the challenges and opportunities that come from managing data stores in a large-scale SaaS application environment.  You have a love for automation, predictive analysis, capacity planning and thrive on continuous improvement. You have a strong customer-oriented attitude and collaborate frequently with development teams and the rest of Infrastructure Engineering to solve problems, make recommendations, and help Rally excel.  You’re active in the open source community, understand the power of community and openly share your expertise.  You have experience creating, running and scaling data stores and databases in high-availability environments.


You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Are detail oriented and understand the need for precision working with data infrastructure




  • Have worked extensively with MongoDB and ideally Oracle, or are willing to aggressively ramp up on which of those two you are least familiar with




  • Have strong database and data store administration skills and seek out opportunities to improve and automate everything




  • Enjoy fast-paced, CI/CD environments with lots of collaboration




  • Understand big data at scale




  • Have a passion for learning




  • Understand AWS and deploying data stores to cloud environments as well as Oracle on old skool bare metal




Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 10 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer! 


Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Full-stack web engineer for leading SaaS product at FreeAgent (Edinburgh, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for an full-stack software engineers to come and work on our flagship web-based product FreeAgent. We're a growing team of over 85 people, based in Edinburgh but with remote staff around the UK (7 engineers are fully remote).


We have a lot of happy customers (42,000+, NPS=75!), a lot of traffic (13 million+ page views/mo), and some lovely staff to work alongside, learn from and have fun with. We invest a lot of time in our platform (code health, scalability, security) as well as working on new features, which is nice.


Our engineers tend to be full stack, but we’re seeing people move towards more specialist work these days, such as front-end programming (we're doing a lot of React.js, primarily on our iOS app), our real-time accounting engine, data science. People play to their strengths really. Our stack is intentionally straightforward. It's sensible and sustainable. Javascript aside, we mainly write Ruby alongside MySQL, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Puppet. Prior Ruby knowledge is not a requirement!


Please note we are looking for UK-based full-time staff right now.

item.title: Sr. Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Pune, India)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Sr. Development Engineer to join our team. You’ll be responsible for the development of products and tools for the AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.


* Perform code reviews.


* Provide third-tier support for production systems.


* Work with development leadership and product management to evaluate new product and feature requests and recommend solutions.


* Provide mentorship to other developers.


* Stay current on state of the art technologies, and make recommendations for how these may be used to improve our systems.


* Play key role in recruiting and evaluating candidates for open positions.

item.title: Data Developer at Muzooka (Calgary, AB, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
In this role you will be responsible for modeling complex business problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role also requires working with development teams to integrate and prepare large, varied external datasets and sources and architecting specialized database and computing environments that aid in Muzooka's strategies. You will leverage developer skills to enhance and expand data sets to be utilized for product and data teams.


You will work closely with team stakeholders to turn data into critical information and knowledge into powerful insights unique to the platform’s value offering. You are a creative thinker and use data mining in innovative ways to solve problems with the information that is available.


You will need a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent written and communications skills to report back the findings in a clear, structured manner are required.    


You will work closely with the data team as well as designers and product managers to coordinate features on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:




  • Design specialized database for storage, retrieval and computation




  • Utilize various APIs to generate new data




  • Creating smart, periodic requests to external data sets to build out data pool




  • Implements enhancements and fixes to systems and data mechanisms as needed




  • Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithms




  • Works with Muzooka stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome




  • Collaborate with team to select the relevant sources of information.




  • Document results and methodologies in a way that can be easily understood by business stakeholders




  • Presents and depicts the rationale of their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Presents back results that contradict common belief, if needed.




  • Employs the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.




  • Create complex queries and structured data sets to be utilized for short term and long term strategies




  • Qualifies where information can be stored or what information, external to the organization, may be used in support of business objectives.




  • Collaborates with management to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies and that it meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the organization




  • Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.




  • Demonstrates the following scientist qualities: clarity, accuracy, precision, relevance, depth, breadth, logic, significance, and fairness.

item.title: Mid-level Developer at Maritime Planning Associates (Newport, RI)

Successful candidate must have the ability to work efficiently, independently and meet hard deadlines.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Overview: Datto is seeking an experienced software engineer with strong leadership and mentoring skills who desires “hands on” development as an ongoing part of their role. The role requires an engineer well-grounded in software-engineering fundamentals, experienced in Agile development, and able to make practical business tradeoffs to deliver maintainable, well-constructed and crazy-useful software for our end-users. About the Company: We are the fastest growing technology company in Connecticut, with an established development office in Boston (formerly Backupify). We specialize in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are the leader in our space. Our offerings include backups of cloud applications and this role is focused on continued development of those cloud-to-cloud backup products. Datto is trusted by thousands of organizations and millions of end-users to securely and reliably backup their business data. With over 100 petabytes of data under management and a fast-growing customer base, we continually challenge ourselves and our architecture to reach new levels of scalability. With our agile methodologies, small-team organization, fast-paced development and innovation-focused values we offer the benefits of a startup culture within a profitable company of 400+ employees. About the Role: Day to day work includes coding from the position of team lead, participating and leading design and code reviews, and actively mentoring more junior team members in both software-design and implementation. You’ll participate in architectural direction and have the opportunity to own and lead the design and implementation of new features and improvements. We’re continually re-evaluating our architectural needs, so an experienced engineer is needed to help make informed decisions about new technologies that can scale and how to transition legacy systems.

If you would like to be part of an Agile software development group working on challenging, cutting-edge applications for our customers, send us your resume!  In this position you’ll be able to create software utilizing technologies such as: Hadoop, Accumulo, Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, OpenNLP, OpenCV, jQuery, AngularJS, D3.js, AWS and many more.


Position Description

If you’re a passionate engineer who enjoys working with talented peers in a result-oriented environment, check out the project at http://lumify.io and contact us to join our team!

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)

Researching storage solutions, developing low-latency fault-tolerant architectures, and implementing state-of-the-art distributed query algorithms is our bread-and-butter. We also dabble in the dark arts of high-throughput data pipelines and streaming data processing.


We’re interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!

item.title: Data Processing Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your Mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer (junior/senior) (Berlin, Dublin) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment



WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals



ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.



WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Clutch Holdings LLC (Ambler, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Clutch is looking for an exceptional data scientist to synthesize and leverage our rich dataset of consumer and multi-channel transaction data to help our brands achieve their aggressive marketing goals.


This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals determined to change and innovate how data is used to influence customer outcomes. We are focused on the company’s product strategy, and work on high-impact projects, utilizing a mix of open source and in-house tools and techniques to deliver insights.


We’re a lean, flat, and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into our client brands' marketing strategies. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of industries like high-fashion retail, QSR, Automotive, Pharmaceutical, and many other verticals.


What you’ll be doing:


You will advocate, evangelize, and build data-fueled products that help our brands maximize their customer strategies. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.


You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.


As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader technical and business team(s), and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.

item.title: Partner and Software Engineer - High Frequency Trading Hedge Fund in Boston at Domeyard LP (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Domeyard is a hedge fund focused on high frequency trading. We are backed by the founders of one of the largest hedge funds in the world ($55 billion in AUM) and pioneers behind one of the largest public internet companies in Asia. 


We are a flat organization, in which the founders sit next to the interns, and traditional titles don't exist. Our flexible work hours, casual dress code, startup environment (open office with a gaming room, snack pantry, catered food) and generous employee perks (insurance, transportation, phone, health and dental coverage) ensure that you can commit fully to your intellectual interests. We welcome cultural diversity and are able to sponsor H1-B visas. 



Our vision is to set new thresholds for modern computing.
We take pride in possessing some of the fastest trading technologies in the world. Our software engineers build the latest technologies to manage petabytes of data and generate fast, data-driven insights. Every day is a learning exercise: you will explore the frontiers of computer science, in areas such as distributed systems, concurrency, operating systems, networks, computer architecture, data analysis and UI design. We develop and iterate quickly; you will have access to every line of code and can switch between many projects.

Apply to join us! (Takes ~5 min.) 
We are looking for people who share our passion for technology, add a fun-loving character to our team, and inspire each other's growth. We also seek potential candidates that we can help nurture, which is why no financial experience is expected. You will be joining as an early team member and influencing the firm's direction, and have the opportunity to lead a team of software engineers within a few years. Feel free to show us any work that demonstrates your interests, e.g. code samples, academic publications, GitHub projects.

item.title: Front End JavaScript Engineer for Connected Buildings Movement at Lucid (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
As part of the JavaScript engineering team you will work on our core platform, BuildingOS. You will write software that changes how people interact with commercial buildings, brings legacy building technology online, and enables the deployment of the next generation of building IoT devices. You will work closely with a world-class Product Design team to solve hard user interface problems, and you will contribute to the open source libraries and tools that we are using to solve those problems.


We are looking for an experienced engineer who writes simple, composable, and reusable UI code. You'll work on the new UI that we're building in React and Flux, and you'll help migrate our legacy Backbone and jQuery apps to the new framework. We love clear, elegant code, and we value tooling and testing that helps us to move fast and experiment with new ideas.


This position is full-time and based in our office in downtown Oakland, CA.


Responsibilities



  • Work with Product Designers to build analytics, data visualization, and mapping applications

  • Build efficient and reusable front-end components

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate and advocate for best practices for front-end engineering

item.title: Full-stack Software Developer at LiveStories (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)

LiveStories is looking for a senior software engineer interested in making a difference. 


Responsibilities:

item.title: Information Security Engineer at Gap Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Information Security Engineer works as a member of the Threat & Incident Management team (TIM team). The TIM team is part of Gap’s Information Security organization (InfoSec), working closely with infrastructure, application, and managed service provider teams to ensure the security posture of Gap’s global enterprise is maintained, including endpoint, network, server and border security.



The IT Security engineers serve as Subject Matter Experts (SME) for InfoSec’s portfolio of monitoring and logging tools, providing research, expert advice, and direction on configuration and management of the tools.



The Security Engineer has direct responsibility for working with all GapTech teams in delivering subject matter expertise for cybersecurity incident response and computer forensics services for suspected or confirmed cybersecurity breaches, emerging threats assessment, and supporting legal e-Discovery requests.


Responsibilities



  • Identify security issues and risks associated with security events reported by L1 or L2 InfoSec teams, or via alerts from various security tools, and develop remediation and/or risk mitigation plans

  • Leverage a wide range of security technologies including, but not limited to: SIEM/syslog, IDS/IPS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, identity and access management, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, LDAP, security incident response and Identity Management software

  • Participate in incident response and investigations of suspected information technology security misuse or compliance reviews as requested by Gap’s Security Council, InfoSec management, or as required when alerts are received from InfoSec threat monitoring tools and threat intelligence sources

  • Work with InfoSec product vendors and service providers, to evaluate potential security offerings, including product evaluations, pilots and proof of concept installations

  • Assist in responses to internal and external compliance audits, e-Discovery data collection, penetration tests and vulnerability assessments

  • Coordinate maintenance of security-related systems (Anti-Virus, Patching, Intrusion Detection, Logging, Anti-spam, etc.)

  • Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, industry standards, and ethical requirements related to information security and privacy

  • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards relative to the information security arena

  • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Senior Web Services Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

What does it take to bring up-to-the-minute news and video to 40+ million unique users per month? Bloomberg R&D's Web Shared Services team is responsible for doing that and more by engineering the world-class services infrastructure powering Bloomberg.com, News & Multimedia mobile apps, and other Bloomberg products.

Becoming the world's most influential news organization comes with unique challenges. Our team...
- Operates in a highly transparent ecosystem of advanced technical teams.
- Works in a close partnership with the industry's best product managers.
- Provides Web services which respond to more than a quarter of a billion requests daily.
- Presents product teams with a consistent API spanning numerous internal data sources and organizations.
- Integrates personalization tools to surface the most relevant information at the right time.
- Helps millions of users keep watch over their portfolios on the go.
- Keeps the world informed with smart push notifications and relevant alerts.

We focus specifically on...
- Performance and scalability of services and underlying data stores.
- Proactive, actionable monitoring and automated alerting.
- Service availability during deployments, maintenance and outages.
- Best practices in areas such as API design, data governance and component reusability.

item.title: Windows Client C++/C# Software Engineer at eFolder (Littleton, CO)
item.description: We are looking for a strong candidate with experience and deep knowledge of windows system development. The right candidate would have a vast level of knowledge and experience working in C++/C# building Windows services in a multi-threaded and safe manner. The candidate should be able to demonstrate a confident ability to not "code by coincidence". They should be comfortable with basic unit testing concepts and be able to program in a OOP paradigm. A strong understanding of design patterns, data structures, and systems architecture is a must.

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Synthace Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Synthace Ltd. are looking for a talented and experienced front end engineer to spearhead development of the AnthaOS user interface.


Antha is a high level language transforming biological engineering by turning laboratory protocols into executable code defining physical operations such as liquid handling alongside logical operations and data processing. AnthaOS defines the execution environment for Antha processes and defines a number of front-end components for users to manage jobs, track stocks and examine data in addition to custom interfaces for more specialised purposes.


Day-to-day, you’ll be working with a tight-knit, multidisciplinary development team on an exciting project with plenty of technical challenge to get your teeth into. Technically, you’ll be delivering a web-based front end in Google Polymer across both mobile and desktop platforms, handling backend communications via SocketIO and RESTful services. Personally, you will be as meticulous in your attention to detail as you are uncompromising in your commitment to maintaining first class development practices and making user experience the first priority, values you will actively encourage in others.

item.title: Awesome Senior Devops Engineer needed at Taxibeat Ltd (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for an awesome DevOps Engineer to join our highly skilled development team, to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  Taxibeat has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take full control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping us make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Datto® is the leading provider of comprehensive data backup, recovery and business continuity solutions with over five million end points protected and approximately 3,500 active revenue generating partners worldwide and growing. With its Total Data Protection Platform Datto’s mission is to protect business data everywhere it resides, whether on premise, in virtualized environments, in the cloud, and software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications including Salesforce, Google Apps, and more. Datto stores in its purpose built cloud over 140 petabytes of data worldwide for businesses ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses.


  Datto’s core technologies such as instant virtualization, Screenshot Backup Verification™, Inverse Chain Technology™, Backup Insights™, and end-to-end encryption are the cornerstones of its innovative solutions. Industry firsts also include 24/7/365 in-house tech support, white glove customer success support, and time-based cloud retention, that empowers its partners with predictable cloud billing. The Datto product line consists of the Datto SIRIS Family, Datto ALTO Family, Datto NAS and Datto Backupify.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is one of the leading startups in enabling automated web data extraction. We use advanced Artificial Intelligence, NLP, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning technologies to understand contents on websites and extract entities for our knowledge graph.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we are looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow! You will be part of the world-leading research and development team that creates our data extraction technologies like Magic.


What you'll do!



  • Research and development of algorithms to automatically extract data from web.

  • Prototyping, scaling, productising, and supporting the end-to-end pipeline of algorithms.

  • Collaborating with other members of the team to come up with innovative and disruptive technologies for understanding web and extracting relevant data.

  • Designing, implementing and testing new patentable algorithms in the field of AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP.


What we'd love to see!


Essential:



  • Extensive experience in working with Python.

  • Extensive experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Statistical Modelling, and NLP.

  • Bachelor, Master, or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Math, Stats.

  • Experience in working with scalable algorithms, data structures, big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop).

  • Experience with developing on Linux or Mac OS X.

  • Great communication and collaboration skills.

  • To have a great attitude, and be fun to work with.

  • To be proactive, excited by our product, and to be invested in pushing it forward


Desired:



  • Experience with Java, JavaScript, and C++.

  • Experience in data extraction, web crawling, and data indexing.

  • Experience of working with agile methodologies.

  • Open source contributions and projects (bonus point for working on web related projects).

  • Knowledge of full-stack development.

  • Experience working in startups.


What you’ll get!



  • Working for a company that has won loads of international start-up awards! We’ve been named as one of the coolest places to work (twice)! We love what we do, and who we do it with.

  • Great location - With offices in both London and San Francisco, we are in the heart of the technology scene in both the US and Europe.

  • Great people - We’ve assembled an incredibly diverse, talented and spirited team who genuinely enjoy coming to work everyday.

  • Challenges - The freedom to grow and define your own role so you can leave work everyday knowing you’ve made a difference.

  • Learning on the job - Investigating new technologies is always encouraged

  • Healthcare - You get full coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Paid lunches - We have catered lunch everyday and provide plenty of tasty snacks.

  • A share in the company - All employees own a part of the company.

  • Fun & Games - It’s not all work; we have movie nights, lunch activities, happy hours and a bi-annual offsite.

  • Gym membership - 50% off Virgin Active membership

  • Individual training & book budgets

  • Your choice of laptop - Mac or PC

item.title: Android Engineer at Ambassador (Detroit, MI)
item.description:
Ambassador is looking for talented Android engineers who are interested in solving complex problems and shipping beautiful products as part of an ambitious, world-class engineering team. Ambassador engineers demand quality and efficiency and love taking on responsibility and freedom to make large impacts.


WHAT YOU'LL DO



  • Design and build advanced apps and features from the ground up for the Android platform

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship extraordinary products

  • Practice disciplined software engineering (automated testing, code reviews, and clean, pragmatic code)

  • Rapidly iterate on product to incorporate user feedback and insights and improve performance

  • Be flexible, grow, and learn fast in a fun yet professional startup environment

item.title: Software Engineers (to work in Python/Django) at Fusionbox (Denver, CO)
item.description: At Fusionbox, the engineers work on tasks that span from server provisioning and system administration to server-side development to JavaScript fronted interface developing. We use git, Puppet, nginx, Postgres, memcache, Django, Backbone, AngularJS, Ember.js, and React--but we are always open to trying out new things. In addition to working on client projects, we have our own portfolio of open source projects that the engineers maintain.

item.title: Generalist Software Engineer (New Grad/Junior Role) at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: DSE Analytics Engineer at DataStax (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
DataStax delivers Apache Cassandra™ in a database platform purpose built for the performance and availability demands of IOT, web, and mobile applications, is looking for an engineer to help take DataStax Enterprise to the next level. In this role you will be working on integrating big data technologies such as Cassandra, Spark, Solr and Hadoop into our flagship product. Past experience with distributed enterprise software development is required.


Essential Job Functions:




  • Participate in and drive general product development for our DataStax Enterprise product




  • Implement new cutting edge features for our customers




  • Resolve hard customer issues



  • Integration work involving Cassandra, Spark, Solr, Hadoop and other relevant Big Data technologies


Job Requirements:




  • Strong Java background in systems or back-end software




  • Experience designing multi-threaded systems




  • Comfortable working with a distributed, larger development organization




  • Strong troubleshooting skills




  • Passionate about high performance large scale systems




  • Well organized and enjoys the freedom of working independently




  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience




The stuff that would be nice to have (but not a deal breaker)




  • 5+ years software development experience




  • Experience with scalable systems design and implementation




  • Familiarity with SQL and relational databases



  • Experience with any of Apache Cassandra, Spark, Solr, Hadoop, Hive, Pig

item.title: Informatics Support Engineer at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Informatics Support Engineer will be responsible for working with informatics author partners to support them in developing algorithms and insights on the Apervita platform. The ISE will train, coach, and provide support to informatics authors during their algorithm development and testing.


The primary language within the Apervita Author Editor will be Python, but the ISE will also be exposed to various data formats, ontologies, and other information related to the medical informatics used in the industry.


Additionally, the ISE will help create and maintain the public knowledgebase and documentation for the Apervita Author environment and will engage with the Development and QA teams in the improvement and testing of the platform.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Cloud Services System Engineer at MongoDB, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Join the fastest growing engineering team at MongoDB! We are looking for a systems engineer to join us in building the best database management system for the leading document database server. The MongoDB management service, Cloud Manager, is a cloud-based web application for deploying, monitoring, and backing up MongoDB deployments of any size and configuration.


Cloud Manager currently monitors tens of thousands of MongoDB nodes and backs up multiple petabytes of data. On a typical day, Cloud Manager processes over a billion metrics and replicates tens of billions of backup operations.


Tools we use include: MongoDB (of course!), AWS, CentOS, Chef, Nagios, Graphite, Load Balancers.


Responsibilities


You will design, implement, operate, and troubleshoot systems, services, and tools primarily in cloud-based environments. You will additionally participate in a weekly on-call rotation, and make occasional trips to our data centers.  Your responsibilities include resolving and escalating issues while advocating best practices to development teams.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

item.title: Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, you will specialize in developing back-end systems and APIs that support our front-end developers. You will play a key role in helping us design and deploy SaaS cloud-based products that are innovative and unique in our industry.


We are looking for a talented, experienced software engineer comfortable with modern libraries, build tools, workflow, and object-oriented design patterns. This role requires strong analytical skills, commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic, and cutting-edge coding skills. You should be rooted in object-oriented design and development and be comfortable with an Agile development approach.


Role Summary



  • Write server-side code for web-based, SaaS applications; develop prototypes quickly and create robust production SaaS services

  • Work closely with Building Energy domain experts to devise and develop product requirements, features, and algorithms

  • Work closely with Front-end engineers to develop and implement robust API services

  • Utilize object-orient design patterns in the implementation of reusable, performant, and secure components

  • Write subsystems that communicate in real time to external services using Web Services and/or APIs

  • Possess a strong understanding of relational (MySQL) database design concepts

  • Manage your own time and work well both independently and as part of a team

  • Translate agile software development stories into reusable units of functionality. Ability to estimate level of effort and prototype as necessary

item.title: Software Developer @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Do you love bringing data to life? We do, too. Our platform does statistical analysis on large datasets, and shows our users the results in beautiful, intuitive ways. We're focused on building the best threat detection application on the market. You'll work with a great team of engineers, data scientists, mathematicians, and product folks. We're good people, we love working together, and want you to feel the same way. If the above sounds like your kind of thing, we'd love to talk with you.


You're a RedOwl Developer if you can:



  1. Write exemplary code;

  2. Display an understanding of our system as a whole;

  3. Contribute to the quality of the platform while holding others to a high standard during code reviews, design meetings, and deliverables;

  4. Serve as a mentor to, and learn from, other RedOwl developers; 

  5. Contribute to the broader technical community via open source projects, writing, or presenting; and

  6. Identify and suggest new technologies that may make sense for our platform.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Connexta (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
Looking to create and contribute amazing open source software? As a Software Developer you will participate in Open Source Software Development working on the Distributed Data Framework (DDF https://github.com/codice/ddf). Using Scrum and applying Object Oriented concepts and design patterns, you will develop prioritized capability within a continuous integration development environment. Connexta is a software company with the software team as the core of the company.


DDF is open source and utilizes many other open source technologies and open standards. Besides continually building new capability into DDF, we work with customers that have distributed enterprises with many diverse data sources. Using DDF we make the data discoverable and accessible addressing aspects relating to search, geospatial, security, and metadata, among many others. Development is primarily in Java and JavaScript.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Treasure Data (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment, have excellent analytical skills, and a passion for scalable and stable engineering environments, we want to talk with you! Working closely with our engineering team, you will implement and scale our predominantly Ruby and Java-based architecture.


We love the fact that you are a little obsessive about maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our teams need to continue building our product. At Treasure Data, you will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, while working with a truly world-class engineering team, always employing state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Things you will do:




    • Manage PostgreSQL/MySQL databases and traditional k-v stores and clusters

    • Manage 100+ cloud servers using automation tools

    • Investigate of system errors and problems

    • Perform bottleneck analysis of the system for scaling

    • Setup monitoring systems and application metrics as well as supervise them for prediction/detection of failures

item.title: Senior Back-End Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Do you thirst to design, build, operate, debug, and optimize sophisticated distributed systems? Are you thrilled to creatively discover new ways to leverage 5 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning fast speeds? Do you love working collaboratively with intelligent, energetic, no-nonsense colleagues? Are you as nice as you are brilliant? Consider joining us.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 300+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas during Hackweeks (5 times per year!).

  • Contribute towards building a great company.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • 3+ years experience building scalabe and reliable products.

  • Comfort writing large-scale, high performance object-oriented code (bonus points for functional programming experience).

  • MapReduce or Java/C++ expertise or the brains and brawn to become an expert.

  • Good diagnostic and debugging sense, the ability to find a needle in a haystack or a bug in a program stack.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Sr Mobile Engineer at mappable (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
We seek an experienced Mobile Engineer for regular full-time, on-site position. Qualified candidates should understand the strengths and opportunities presented by native iOS and Android tablet platforms and will be prepared to help us create our flagship experience for those devices.

This is a full time, onsite, staff position. We will not respond to individuals or companies offering off-site or consulting services.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)
item.description: Appboy is looking for mobile engineers (iOS and Android) to help us expand and enhance our client SDKs. You’ll work with a team of committed developers on software that is running on hundreds of millions of devices around the world. Every member of our team is critical to success in an environment where interface design and usability are as essential as performance and footprint. Our ideal candidate is very interested in mobile development and has had some experience in coding (not necessarily in mobile).

item.title: Android Engineer at iCitizen (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
iCitizen, the leading civic engagement platform developed to revolutionize the way citizens identify and engage on issues they care about most, is seeking top talent with the right "will and skill" to join our team.


This business requires innovative thinking, balanced with a strong focus on quality and execution. Get ready to roll up your sleeves and solve some of the most complex big-data problems that will create efficiency in a large market and improve people's lives.


We are seeking a highly skilled Android engineer to develop our next generation of mobile apps. The ideal candidate will have a passion for clean code and the data driven design process. You'll work closely with the UI/UX team and product management to ensure our mobile apps are truly exceptional and delightful.

item.title: Frontend Web Engineer at Ambassador (Detroit, MI)
