item.title: Software Test Engineer at Masimo (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Job Summary


Seasoned Development Test Engineer with experience in Automation development and Testing.  This engineer will not only execute, report, and maintain existing automation test procedures but also participate in development of new automation testing systems and procedures.   


Duties & Responsibilities



  • The test engineer must be able to properly judge test outcomes to determine pass/fail status, clearly document findings in Test Reports and document bugs discovered during testing.

  • Analyze large amounts of data acquired during automation test using tools such as Mathcad and Matlab.

  • Will also execute manual test cases needing no automation.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Platform Engineer (Python) at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Platform Engineer at Apervita is responsible for the architecture and development of the back-end functions that drive the Apervita platform. Development is all in Python interacting with MongoDB as our data store to build a leading edge platform to revolutionize the healthcare industry in Clinical Decision Support and Quality of Care operations.


The Platform Engineer will design and build new reusable components and frameworks, optimize and refactor existing components, and design scalable and resilient solutions as the foundation for the platform. The Platform Engineer will also partner with the Front-End Engineering team to produce various features for our customers, enhance existing features, and ensure overall security, stability, and usability of the platform.


Apervita uses an Agile methodology and uses extensive unit testing and peer review as part of the development process.


The Apervita platform is a multi-tier application built on Python and MongoDB and extensively uses cloud computing principles.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Sr. .Net Software Engineer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.

Stability meets Agility.  CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career

CDK Global is looking for passionate, skilled software engineers to join a great team building a new product suite to change the car buying process for both dealers and consumers. Work on an advanced distributed system leveraging technologies such as AngularJS, .NET WebAPI, NServiceBus, RabbitMQ, RavenDB, and SQLFire. Our newly renovated workplace is a creative and collaborative environment supporting an agile methodology.  The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.  As a software engineer with CDK Global you will:



  • Performs a developer role in building enterprise software solutions encompassing: services and service layer, service integration to UI and data, UI components;

  • Delivers world class, high quality design and code using MS .NET including MVC, Entity framework. Uses agile methodologies including TDD, CI, Refactoring and Code Reviews;

  • Works with the Product Owners and other team members to complement and complete the development process.

item.title: Front-End Software Engineer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Software Engineer (Front-End) will be accountable for developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. The Developer/Engineer will be working on a next generation product.

Responsibilities

• Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality
• Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes
• All other duties as assigned

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Web at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Full stack engineers at Twilio are responsible for creating compelling web experiences for all Twilio product-lines, from SMS to IP Communications. The unified Account Portal we’re responsible for supports 500,000+ developers building communications apps on Twilio.


About the job: 


Full stack web developers own everything from the “first run” experience of customers just starting with Twilio to powerful debugging and monitoring tools critical to our largest customers operating at scale. Developers love Twilio because our “developer experience” makes it incredibly easy to build and scale on the most powerful communications API on the planet - full stack web engineering at Twilio is all about building that developer experience.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the backbone of our web framework to support all product lines across Twilio.

  • Own your production infrastructure end-to-end. You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.

  • Work directly with product management to define, architect, and build new customer-facing features. At Twilio, product roadmaps are a team sport.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.

  • Influence cross team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

item.title: QA Automation Engineer - Consultant at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a QA automation engineer, you’ll work with development teams to code, test, and deploy quality features for our customers and internal users. Every day you’ll use our extensive end-to-end test automation framework and hands-on testing to support exciting new projects. We also put a heavy emphasis in the QA team on test automation – everything from web automation (using Selenium) to REST API automation to data persistence & validity (in SQL, MongoDB, and Salesforce) to model testing.


When you’re testing a feature for the first time, are you dreaming on how you could automate the process? Are you always looking for a way to use technology to finish a job better and faster? This position will give you challenging opportunities to grow professionally as a QA automation engineer.


As a QA Automation Engineer at OnDeck, you will:



  • Work with development teams on end-to-end testing.

  • Proactively write test automation for new features and existing use cases.

  • Develop and maintain test documentation.

  • Monitor production issue backlog.

  • Work with QA team and development team to maintain and monitor execution of automation testing in development, QA, and staging environments.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
CreativeLive is looking for talented senior engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco or Seattle office. You will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

item.title: VP of Engineering at Crisis Text Line (New York, NY)
item.description:
Overview: Crisis Text Line is a data and tech driven not-for-profit. We've built our own online platform for engaging with people in crisis (think: suicide, self-harm, domestic violence, etc) over SMS using standard, open web technologies.


How we work:



  • Fail intelligently. We're always do our absolute best work, but we're ready to fail at any moment so we build with redundancy and fault-tolerance.

  • Pick the right tool. Technology is a means, not an end. We try to see where the bleeding edge is, but live in the realm of reality and practicality.

  • Hack this site. Seriously. We're the type of people who think hackthissite.org is one of the coolest places on the internet, so everything we build has an eye to keeping things safe.

  • Access control. Alice and Bob are our best friends, but we know that Alice and Bob are inherently untrustworthy. We write your code to make sure Alice and Bob can’t conspire against us or our users.

  • Speed. People expect a response to a text message in under 14 minutes. We’re shooting for no more than 5. That means the platform needs to run fast, and crisis counselors need to be able to use it efficiently and effectively.

  • Testing. Testing isn’t just clicking buttons. Testing means optimizing user experience and listening to your users rather than your gut. And of course, running automated tests too. You would never deploy untested code into production. Duh.

  • Cloud. We think scale. The cloud isn’t a solution, it’s an assumption.


Our team:



  • Custom, home-grown Symfony2 app for SMS-web interaction

  • Drupal 7 installation for managing remote volunteers

  • Slack chat bots because `@robot animate me <kittens>` is important

  • 1 CTO, 3 engineers, and we're hiring at least 3 more engineers in the coming months

item.title: Django Software Engineers at Fusionbox (Denver, CO)
item.description:
This position is specifically for a product-based project that requires a year-long commitment.  After the year is up you may choose to continue with that engagement or move on to one of our other exciting projects.


This project entails feature-driven product development in a service-oriented architecture.  You'll be building large systems that reach lots of users.


You'll spend your day in the Fusionbox office with others involved in the project, but you'll be collaborating with the client's development team remotely.

item.title: Full-Stack Engineer at Tech Soft 3D, Inc. (Berkeley, CA)
item.description: We are looking for full-stack engineers to join our team and help us unlock the power of 3D for the web, You will be working on cutting-edge Web Visualization Technology for the engineering market and solve challenging problems across the full client/server stack.

item.title: Software Engineer at KMKLabs (Kota Jakarta Pusat, Indonesia)

item.title: Java/Scala Software Engineer at Feedzai (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking outstanding Scala and Java software developers to integrate the development team of our SaaS product. High-scalability, fault-tolerance, low-latency, and efficient algorithms are keystones of the work you will be asked to perform on a daily basis. Experience in writing high-performance code (Java and/or Scala), concurrent and distributed algorithms is highly recommended. Experience with Akka, Hadoop, Relational & No-SQL databases (Cassandra, HBASE) and related technologies is also highly recommended.


Main Responsibilities:

  • Work on automated deployment as well as distributed logging and analytics so that we can be on top of things.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe availability, reliability and operability?  Does the opportunity to improve application deployments, infrastructure automation and monitoring solutions sound like your kind of challenge?  Can you balance system uptime and operational standards with organizational agility and speed?


Namely is looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

item.title: Python Engineer at Mirantis, Inc. (Pozna, Polska)
item.description:
If you’re an ambitious Python Software Engineer and thrive on working on tough, real-world problems, you want to work here. We are building a data center management product (FUEL) which can become the standard choice of a simple but powerful OpenStack deployment tool. We want you to bring ideas of how it should look and implement it. With the tool presently used to deploy OpenStack at the moment, we have an ambitious roadmap which includes live upgrades, network devices management, SDN devices integration and many more.

This is a permanent position in Mirantis' office in Poznan, Poland.

Ask us about great benefits, swag bags, compensation and more!

item.title: Database Developer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Database Developer will be accountable for developing and maintaining the relational databases of the V12 Group’s suite of SaaS applications.


Responsibilities


• Design, develop and manage relational databases.
• Programming using SQL and SQL/RDBMS utilities.
• Work closely with Product Managers and Reporting Team for understanding the functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure data integrity and overall system quality.
• Proactively monitor, troubleshoot and resolve database performance issues.
• Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.
• All other duties as assigned

item.title: Software Engineer at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
The Milliman predictive analytics group in Cambridge, MA is looking for software engineers to help bridge research and practice, towards changing the way the insurance industry does business. Yeah, we really do think we’re going to change the way this whole industry works. Although Milliman is primarily an Actuarial Science firm, that is not what we do. We’re a small team of motivated experts building a new product-oriented practice for tackling statistical problems in the insurance sector. We work with large, real-world datasets and advanced techniques spanning optimization, statistics, and machine learning. We are looking for exceptional and innovative individuals to help in building out tools/automation to support Milliman's Predictive Modeling Practice. This is a unique opportunity to take on a role that will allow end to end development and autonomy. You will be working closely with a strong team of researchers and engineers; your work will have immediate and tangible impact both internally, and within our clients’ operations. 


Responsibilities


Your primary function is to have your work support end-to-end work flow for high-volume customer data through the predictive modeling engines and back to the customer with full service BI/analytics using event-driven automation as well as designing and coding tools utilized in the extraction, refining, and data presentation arenas.



  • Implement, optimize, generalize and productionalize models and research emerging from the research team

  • Integrate predictive models into database-backed environments, real-time query APIs, and existing modeling pipelines

  • Think about high-level architecture, scalability, abstraction, modularity, and generalizability across clients and use-cases

  • Lead significant strategic projects focused on enhancements to core tooling and automation.

  • Design and develop custom exploratory tools for strange new data worlds.

  • Design and develop automation to harden the end-to-end data handling.

  • Help design and develop data analytics platforms for supporting customer access through interactive visualization

  • Design and develop tools for processing and correlating seemingly disjoint customer data

  • Design and develop tools for multiple database engines: both extraction and posting

  • Gently chastise the data-scientists for not writing better code - then show them how

item.title: Rails Developer at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Rails Web Developer / Software Engineer.  The candidate will be responsible for both minor and major functional enhancements to our UI.  Used by outside customers, our internal business team, and our developer team, the UI is our fastest and cleanest view into highly complex, multidimensional data.  As a core member of our UI team, the candidate will be the cornerstone of making our rich data accessible and visible, and by doing so will provide other groups in the company with the insights necessary to grow revenue.  With close to 200,000 streamed transactions per second and database tables with over a billion rows, we need a creative problem solver to provide windows of insight into our data.
 
We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt through out the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.

We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.

YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Building Ruby/Rails interfaces that make it easy to understand and control complex, multi-dimensional data

  • Creatively leveraging AJAX to pull from Redis and Hbase in order to provide real-time views of large datasets

  • Identifying reports that can be offloaded to helper applications for faster rendering

  • Helping with the schema design for NoSQL databases

  • Optimizing ORM queries to maintain good performance across large datasets

item.title: Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) at Bloomberg LP (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.


As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.


Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

item.title: Forensisch software engineer at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving


Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer met interesse in low-level datastructuren?


Je werkt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) aan onze data-analyseapplicaties en libraries.


Als forensisch software-engineer duik je diep in de low-level datastructuren en algoritmiek. Je gaat werken aan complexe applicaties die binnen en buiten het NFI worden gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering. Denk hierbij aan het reverse-engineeren van onbekende bestandsformaten of bestandssystemen, om zo forensische sporen zichtbaar te maken. Ook draag je bij aan de verbetering van het vakgebied software-engineering en denk je mee over een efficiënte inrichting van het ontwikkelproces. Hierbij zorg je dat de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk wordt geborgd.

item.title: Team Lead Software Engineer at TheLadders (New York, NY)
item.description:
Based in SoHo, TheLadders is an engineering-team-driven organization. We empower our software engineers to not just build great products, but to have a real say in the ‘how’ and ‘why’ the products are being built. We practice continuous integration, test-driven development, peer code reviews, pair programming and collaborative design studios. You’ll be on the cutting edge of current software development best practices and in the position to assist in the introduction of new ones.


At TheLadders, the Team Lead Software Engineer has not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy, and help develop your team to be amazing.


In this role you will:



  • Write high-quality, efficient, testable code in Java and other object-oriented languages

  • Collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry

  • Mentor other developers

  • Contribute to planning, design, implementation, testing, operations, and process improvement as the leader of a Scrum team.

  • Build something incredible!


Responsibilities of the Team Lead Software Engineer:



  • Manage a team of software engineers (backend, frontend, full stack), including task planning and code reviews.

  • Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.

  • Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.

  • Contribute technically to projects.

  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer to join the Intelligence Services team and revolutionize the CRM industry.  We are acquiring massive data points and applying cutting edge data science techniques to provide insights to our customers that will help facilitate a paradigm shift in how they interact with their CRM system.  You must be an exceptional developer with an entrepreneurial spirit and a get it done attitude to be successful in this role. There will many exciting and interesting challenges along the way including: exploring new technologies, tools, and knowledge in order to keep up with our ambition.  Communication and team work are a must. Let’s redefine CRM together.

  • Create services to analyze the volumes of acquired data by applying data science techniques and algorithms

item.title: Automation Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)

Come join a dynamic startup while learning the latest technology, Big Data, Cloud based platforms, and business analytics. item.title: Release Engineer at Zillow (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our current Zillow release processes and frameworks have supported a weekly Major Release schedule, frequent Hot Fixes, and oversight and management of IT network and infrastructure changes. We need a strong, experienced Release engineer to help build on our successes and help support our growing services and product offerings.  We look to increase release rates and provide more options for product teams and operations teams to get their changes and updates as quickly and as safely as possible, in support of Operational and Business needs. If you are highly motivated, a quick learner and desire to make big contributions, then we encourage you to apply.


What you’ll do:




  • Own and manage overall release plans




  • Be a key advocate and support for Change Management and Best Practices throughout the organization




  • Keep and maintain release stats and trend data




  • Be able to summarize and evaluate key site metrics and provide guidance and direction for release and follow-on stability




Requirements:




  • At least 3 years experience running release for a top-tier site and/or service




  • A technical degree preferred




  • At least 3 years experience with Unix/Linux system




  • Strong communication skills




  • Self-starter with solid analytical and problem solving skills.




  • Work in a fast paced, business critical areas

item.title: Python Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Python Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer to join the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team. Python developers are responsible for developing and maintaining highly scalable geospatial processing systems that will handle petabytes of data.


As a member of the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team you will use a wide variety of technologies, such as Python, FME, and AWS to solve problems and have the opportunity to explore and use emerging technologies.


We are looking for intelligent, innovative, and driven developers. We will consider applicants with limited experience in the technologies listed below, however you must have strong Python skills.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Use Linux and Windows system administration knowledge to set up and maintain working cloud distributed systems.




  • Use BASH, BATCH, Python, C, C++ and other specialty languages to develop and maintain backend systems for Trimble Data.




  • Use AWS to manage and grow our cloud strategy.




  • Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Back End Engineer at Skyscanner (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Skyscanner obtains data from multiple web scrapers, API feeds and external data sources to power its front end website, mobile applications and B2B partners. You will work in an energetic and intelligent team of developers to expand our world-class coverage of flight data and prices.


Our Backend Engineers are the backbone of our business. They build the engines that power Skyscanner and platforms that can cope with the millions of user visits every day.


As the primary technical point of contact for an important part of our system, the Partner Engineering team pride themselves on understanding and successfully delivering the business requirements of all departments.


What are some of the core responsibilities?



  • Ensuring that flight prices in Skyscanner products are accurate and up-to-date.

  • Creating seamless redirects to third party websites.

  • Assisting with the maintenance of existing scrapers and data sources

  • Increasing our global coverage of flight and price data, with focus on your local area.

  • Liaising with 3rd parties (travel agents and airlines) over new integrations and maintenance.

  • Working with test team to validate the quality of solutions.

  • Updating existing integrations to expose new data and support new product features.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Measure at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast seeks software engineering generalists that will work up and down the entire technology stack to build new features and products to drive the continued success of our Measure and Advertise businesses.

At Quantcast, these full-stack polyglots work in all aspects of agile application development, from DB schema design through Java business logic to advanced Javascript on the frontend. They also work with QC-specific, and other industry-leading, big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, QFS) – our products are driven by data after all and we process an average of 30PB every single day!

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role will want to work on our many open-ended problems and will have an opinion when it comes to selecting the right tool/technology for the job (and the ability to explain why!).

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast, you will have a major impact on how the world perceives and interacts with our products. We hope that you’ll bring your passion for application development to help us build truly world-class technology and products!

Example full-stack projects:

Advertising Reporting Infrastructure
Creating our client facing reporting infrastructure to provide campaign performance and analysis to internal and external clients

Online Measurement
Building new features for Quantcast Measure that will be viewed and used across the entire Web ecosystem

Mobile
Brand new mobile projects that range from prototyping to designing data schemas for both Android and iOS applications

Scaling Tools
Developing toolsets that support a number of core business operations at Quantcast

Brand Infrastructure
Building front end, data pipeline and server infrastructure to drive Quantcast targeting products for publishers

item.title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

item.title: Software Infrastructure Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop the core foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data-processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high-performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code which can react quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users, as well as our managers, are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through coding to deployment and maintenance.

More information on individual teams, technologies, and their products can be found below. You will have the ability to select the team you are interested in based on your preference or expertise.

Teams in Software Infrastructure:

Application Frameworks

UI Framework - We build and maintain an in-house real-time data-processing framework, which is used by over 3,000 developers to write high-quality, easy-to-use and efficient applications within the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for extending the core libraries to support more varied, complex and scalable solutions, and enhancing the toolkit for application developers, such as adding tools for performance analysis, debugging, introspection and optimization.

Rapid Infrastructure - We produce the next generation of tools for enhancing developer productivity and the infrastructure behind the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for creating software in C++ in both UNIX and Windows development environments. We work closely with other stakeholders to produce both the frameworks and tools used by all application developers to build and deploy their UI and applications.

Developer Experience

We are a team of technologists, engineers, evangelists and trainers charged with helping our developers deliver their best work. We are not afraid to make large investments to build our own tools when it will make us better able to outpace the competition. At the moment we work with Phabricator, Jenkins, DPKG, GitHub Enterprise, Coverity, Jira and anything that fills gaps and joins them together.

Market Data Distribution

API Technology - We are responsible for Bloomberg's data distribution infrastructure, which is the largest in the world, providing low-latency market-data and value added Bloomberg data via our open API (http://www.bloomberglabs.com/api/). We support scalable, distributed, high-performance software that provides mission-critical data delivery to all Bloomberg desktop customers and a large number of enterprise-level applications.

Market Data Systems - We build backend services and distribution infrastructure for Enterprise Solutions products such as, but not limited to, BPOD/B-PIPE (Bloomberg's consolidated real-time and reference data feed) and the rapidly expanding Event Driven Trading Feed (EDTF) business.

Systems Infrastructure

We build low-level UNIX infrastructure that is critical to Bloomberg's systems. Our areas of responsibility include: high volume, low latency realtime data distribution; enterprise wide software deployment systems; FIX connectivity; and PKI security services. As the rest of Bloomberg R&D fundamentally relies on our products, we have high standards for correctness, performance and scalability. We are a highly collaborative team who are passionate about building reliable systems to solve real world problems.

Ticker Plant

We develop real-time software for our high-profile system which sits at the core of the Bloomberg infrastructure. We process market data from around the world, driving the majority of downstream Bloomberg applications. We address the market demand for low-latency solutions by providing innovative software powered by the most comprehensive, timely and accurate financial data in the world. We work closely with multiple businesses and sales groups to design and develop our applications to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.

item.title: Data Architect at Blackbaud (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
Build a great career. Help the people that change the world.


Where else can you work alongside talented people, develop a rewarding career and create impactful tools for some of the world’s most successful and socially responsible nonprofits? It's not something you find every day. But we have it all: a growing, fast-paced software business, an environment where you can thrive professionally and the everyday reward of knowing that you’re part of a community that’s enabling meaningful change and we are immensely proud that our expertise is helping our 29,000+ customers accomplish their missions. They serve as a constant source of inspiration to us, and give purpose to our work.


Description:


We’ve got tons of data; you’ve got the skills make it useful. As a Data Architect on our Shared Services team, you will use your experience architecting, designing large-scale systems using Big Data technologies (e.g. BigTable, Hadoop, Cassandra) to help us design and build a highly reliable and highly scalable data platform to help us manage, analyze and productize vast amounts of non-profit data. The new platform will serve as the foundation both for a suite of new data services that enable our clients to deliver on their missions with increased efficiency and effectiveness, as well as for several existing data systems that we will be refactoring.


We work in small, close-knit agile teams. Our goal is to maintain an atmosphere that balances tough projects while still having fun. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:



  • Work in a progressive, team-oriented, growth-driven environment where innovation is king

  • Nurture, grow or change the direction of your career map – we see the value in exploratory andconventional goals

  • Solve challenging problems with like minds to make the solutions a reality


Responsibilities:



  • Lead architecture/design, technology selection and implementation of a data platform over Big Data technologies

  • Drive innovation by exploring, investigating, recommending, benchmarking and implementing data-centric technologies for the platform

  • Contribute to the technical design efforts - ensuring the system design meets scalability andperformance requirements

  • Provide technical mentorship for junior engineers on new technologies and development techniques

  • Be the technical architect for our data platform.


About Us:



  • Modern office space with private balcony, comfortable seating and gas grill

  • Beautiful views of the Berkeley Marina and Golden Gate Bridge

  • Easily accessible by BART (via the free Emery-Go-Round shuttle), Amtrak and public transit

  • LEED-certified building (LEED-EB:O&M Silver rating)

  • Stocked kitchen (fresh fruit, cereal, snacks, drinks)

  • Monthly company-sponsored lunches/happy hour

  • Conveniently-located cafe in building’s lobby; 3-minute walk to Emeryville Public Market, popular food trucks and the shops/theatres at Bay Street Plaza

  • Onsite Gym

item.title: Cloud Engineer- Python, Scala, Distributed Systems for Hot Open Source Company at Elastic (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Elastic is building out our Found Team focusing on Elasticsearch as a Service.  This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation. Note this role is remote Or can be at our offices in Mt View CA, Phoenix AZ, Berlin, London or Sydney


Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This  product would be built on technologies such as  OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elasticsearch clusters.


Job Duties and Requirements



  • This person will develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.

  • This person will be familiar with failures and complications related to a cloud offering.

  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Found Product and Engineering Team.

  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters.

item.title: Software Engineer Python/Django at OptimData (Paris, France)
item.description:
Entreprise


OptimData est un centre de R&D en fort développement fondé en 2015 par Laurent Couillard, ex DG d’Exalead, avec un actionnariat composé de Technia et Transcat, leaders internationaux reconnus dans la distribution de solutions IT d’entreprises. Son objectif est de développer, de maintenir et de distribuer des solutions logicielles en mode SaaS afin d’aider les industriels dans leur transformation digitale. OptimData se démarque par une approche innovante basée sur la valorisation des données internes et externes à l’entreprise.


Dans un premier temps, OptimData répond aux besoins non couverts dans le domaine du service après-vente dans les secteurs des biens d’équipement et machines spéciales au moyen de l’application ProductInUse.


L’équipe d’OptimData est composée d’ingénieurs R&D passionnés par les enjeux et problématiques modernes liés aux données: Big Data, Apprentissage automatique & Internet des objets.


Mission


ProductInUse est une application web basée sur une stack web moderne: ReactJs/API Rest Django/PostGreSql/Cassandra. Vous serez en charge du développement de l’API qui est un composant central dans l’architecture car il est “responsable” du modèle de données. Ce composant est basé sur le Django Rest Framework et la librairie d'analyse de données pandas.


Les objectifs du poste sont:



  • Mise à jour du modèle de données

  • Développement des nouvelles API

  • Contribution à l’amélioration de la partie devops (déploiement, monitoring …)


Étant donné la position centrale du poste, les interactions avec les équipe connectivité, data science, infrastructure & front seront nombreuses. L’équipe travaille en “sprint” hebdomadai


Environnement



  • Infra: Cloud IBM sur debian

  • Versionning: git/github

  • Devops: ansible

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Web Front End at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s business intelligence group is seeking an experienced front-end software developer to participate in the development of responsive user interface presenting users with real-time notifications and advanced data visualizations.



The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Implementing a production user interface based on wireframes and storyboards

  • Producing robust, intuitive and responsive data visualizations

  • Interfacing third-party services for reporting, notifications, and data visualization

  • Collaboration with product teams and UX designers


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Front-End Developer For Analytics Platform at Reveal Mobile (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Do you have a passion for making things easy to use for non-technical people? Does creating a streamlined and responsive user experiences sound like a day well spent?


Reveal Mobile builds cutting-edge mobile analytics products, and we need talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. New hires work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products. It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software.


As a front-end developer you will:


•      Develop functional and appealing web applications based on usability
•      Provide website maintenance and enhancements
•      Create quality mock-ups and prototypes
•      Assist back-end developers in coding and troubleshooting
•      Create cascading style sheets (CSS) that are consistent across all browsers and platforms
•      Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the product's interface
•      Consume REST services to build dynamic user interfaces

item.title: Sr. Engineer- UI at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with focus on UI to join our team.  You’ll work on an agile team in the SAAS arena, building the JavaScript infrastructure to support AudienceScience Gateway, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Experience in Objected Oriented JavaScript is required and Ampersand/Backbone experience a big plus.


Essential functions:



  • Design and implement pages for Buyer UI using HTML, CSS, jQuery/Backbone/Ampersand JavaScript frameworks, working closely with back-end Java developers to integrate with Spring MVC web application.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Lasso Data Systems Inc. (Richmond, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Position: DevOps Engineer


Day to Day


We work in a Kanban-Scrum hybrid environment. A typical day starts off with a daily developer update posted to Slack, the rest is spent on the software. Weekly, we have a team retrospective, and a meeting with business to discuss direction (not everyone need attend).


Work Environment


We take our software very seriously while fostering a relaxed, fun(ny), and supportive environment. Here is a list of things we like about Lasso:



  • Monday Lunch and Learns and free lunch on Thursdays

  • Excellent coffee, free pop, and fresh fruit

  • Gym and a napping couch

  • Our work stations (typically: four monitors, mechanical keyboards, and 32GB of RAM)

  • Run whatever OS, we really don’t care

  • No code in production without a review (GitHub pull-requests)

  • Work from home day once a week

  • Internal reading group because we care about training

  • The developers got to write this posting

item.title: Principal Engineer at First. (Durham, NC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About First.


First is a venture-funded startup at the intersection of predictive analytics and real estate tech. We identify when and why people will move, and build products to change the game for real estate professionals and consumers.


Our team is focused on shipping great products and driving innovation in a massive industry (2014 realtor commissions were >$69B). We believe in continuous improvement and sharing knowledge - whether through pair programming, speaking at meetups, and eventually open-sourcing parts of our system.


We’re moving fast and ready for a technical leader to join our CTO in building initial product offerings and automating our data platform.


Engineering


As one of our first engineers, you'll be a senior leader helping guide key architecture and technology decisions. You will reliably scale our data platform to support products and the needs of our data science team. This includes choosing and deploying our server and compute infrastructure (e.g., Ansible, Hadoop, Spark, etc) and building frameworks to support the development of our predictive models.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you wish to work on technologies like Java, Scala, Git, Linux, Bash, Splunk, AWS EC2?


If yes, keep reading…


We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala for our HERE Places team.



About the Team


The HERE Places API team is a part of the HERE Search and Places group. We work with an agile process and every team member gets the opportunity to analyse, develop and test software. The team supports the analysis of usage data, monitoring of production systems as well as supporting clients of the API.


The API layer is implemented in Scala and we are committed to test-driven development and pervasive automation of everyday tasks. 


We run extensive functional and performance test suites upon every commit. We also make extensive use of Java in the search backend as well as JavaScript for our playground and demo UIs.



Key Responsibilities



  • End-to-end delivery of new features of the HERE Places API  


         -Work with Product Management to analyse requirements


         -Plan and implement new features in cooperation with other teams


         -Ensure quality of software and documentation


         -Click the Release Button



  • Evolve the existing automated testing and deployment architecture as needed to fulfill new requirements

item.title: Software Engineer, Compute Infrastructure at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce.com hosts web services and applications written by thousands of internal developers and tens of thousands of customers to provide the largest business automation cloud on the planet.  The compute infrastructure that enables this innovation and value is evolving to fully embrace lights-out operations, single-click deploy to tens of thousands of nodes, and services that self-heal and self-optimize.


Salesforce is building out our compute infrastructure team to reinvigorate the way we deliver, deploy, operate, secure, monitor, and repair our data centers and the code that runs across them - at consumer web scale.  We are looking to add experienced distributed systems engineers who can step up and own big chunks of that vision.


What’s In It For You




  • Eat, sleep, and breathe services.  You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debt,




  • Have strong, heartfelt opinions on CAP theorem, can sketch out four different consistency models on a single napkin and defend each of them, and understand Paxos and Zookeeper at an implementation level.




  • Familiarity with crash-only and recovery-oriented software design.




  • Excited by building reliable, self-healing services on unreliable hardware.




  • Experience designing, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems that run across thousands of compute nodes in multiple datacenters.




  • Agilista capable of delivering thin slices of end-to-end functionality on a regular cadence

item.title: Front End Engineer at Spatially (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Description



  • Work as part of a motivated front end team to ship modern web applications for the geospatial market

  • Work with React, Node, and other modern front end frameworks

  • Work in a Microservices environment building web applications on top of orchestrated event driven services

  • Build Mock & Stub services & implementations to remove development blocks

  • Work with DevOps to assist in Deployment and management of applications

  • Troubleshoot & problem solve through the vertical stack of applications

  • Contribute to the front end architecture and improve code base

  • Own Validation, performance & scale aspects of code written



Qualifications



  • Loves Javascript, knows ES5 to ES6+

  • Strong desire to learn about the geospatial industry

  • NodeJS experience

  • Strong drive to keep learning new technologies

  • Ability to walk the stack, can code in multiple languages

  • Ownership of code base, love and feel proud of the code you write

  • Experience with single page applications (SPAs)

  • React, Angular, Ember or Knockout

  • NodeJS, Express

  • Async models, WebSockets and like technologies

  • Sketch, Adobe Photoshop/Fireworks experience

  • Gulp/Grunt, Bower, Webpack

  • Sass/Less knowledge

  • Experience with React, React Router is a plus

  • Knowledge of the Flux pattern and architecture is a plus

  • Experience with Redux is a plus

  • BS or MS computer science/related subject matter preferred or equivalent experience

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)
item.description:
We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.



You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, marketing, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications




  • New technology and design




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Working with big data





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Participate in building a microservice architecture which scales, routes around failure and lets us build complex systems out of small components as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Help us build our emerging JVM based stack (built on the Netflix open-source stack, mostly in Scala), which will power our next generation of services.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we’re working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • Exploring exciting relationships, patterns, answers in our enormous data sets




  • Developing high fidelity functional prototypes to validate growth initiatives




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

item.title: Computer Security Engineer / Analyst at Roka Security (Herndon, VA)
item.description:
Roka Security is a growing team of security, Linux, and network engineers, looking for the next member of our team. We work on incredible projects, including; securing complex networks, system and network performance tuning, physical server deployments at data centers around the world, disaster recovery, and working with customer teams to design highly scalable network architectures.


Our customers have the highest security and availability requirements. As a result, Roka Security strives to constantly improve our knowledge, technology and processes. There is always room for improvement, which is why we need you!


Security Engineers and Analysts


Roka Security is seeking Computer Security Engineers and Analysts of all experience levels (including management) to be part of our growing team.  We are looking for out of the box thinkers who will help expand our capabilities and deliver high value solutions to our customers.  The primary areas of focus for this position will be :



  • Incident Response support

  • Log Analysis

  • IDS / IPS - design, deployment, management, and analysis

  • Centralized logging systems - design, deployment, management and client usability

  • Vulnerability Assessments support

  • Penetration Testing support

  • Secure Networks - design, deployment, management, and analysis


Benefits



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Medical and Dental

  • Life Insurance

  • Paid Vacation

  • Relaxed, professional environment

  • Flexible Work Schedule

  • 401k with company matching and vested on 1st day

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Front-End Engineering focuses on the user experience of the Apervita platform, developing the user interface features and the overall feature framework. Front-end engineers use advanced JavaScript and CSS techniques to create the client-side experience for the Apervita platform. Front-end engineers collaborate with the UX team and Platform Engineers to ensure a robust and secure user experience. 


The Front-End Engineer will primarily use JavaScript, CSS, and HTML (specifically JavaScript MVC frameworks and Sass). Those with Python experience are encouraged to build end-to-end features, diving into the platform core and collaborating with Platform Engineers to build the best overall feature-rich experience.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Junior Test Automation QA Engineer with Java at aspect (Galway, Ireland)
item.description:
The Associate Engineer, QA is a team member for the development of tests for a specific product component. In this position, the Associate Engineer, QA works with more Principal and Higher level QA Engineers for direction and task assignments. Reviews test cases and plans with other QA members. May execute existing automated test scripts.



PRIMARY ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Tests software products through the use of systematic procedures to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products.

  • Modifies, and executes software test plans. 

  • Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software.

  • Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action.

  • Consults with development engineers in resolution of problems.  

  • Responsible for participating in the evolution and execution of procedures for ensuring the quality of new features and releases of software.

  • Isolates, reproduces and tracks bugs and verifies fixes.

  • Executes test plans for manual and/or automated tests.

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously, while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice what one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Require.js, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lighthweight Java8 backend running on DropWizzard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


Extensive experience with a modern MVC Javascript framework (Ember, Angular, Knockout) is a must for this position.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Internal Tools at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build tools for monitoring and tracking the performance of various aspects of our distributed platform.  This role will exercise your creativity and ability as an engineer to design and create tools to work against various big-data systems, such as Couchbase, Apache Kafka, and Vertica.  You will work as a full-stack engineer, developing in the database access layer, service layer, UI layer, and everything in between.

Candidate should be familiar with the different parts of the Java application stack as well as Python, but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings.  However, you should have a true passion for technology that is apparent in your work and/or personal projects. You will work in an agile, high-pace environment with other talented engineers to build mission-critical tools with high-visibility.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and build tools for the QA team to properly test and monitor their respective systems.

  • Work with different platform developers to expose any vulnerabilities in their respective systems.

  • Build SLA reporting tools for managers to determine the health of the overall system and uptime metrics.

  • Improve and maintain the different internal tools written in Java and Python.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and help them architect code intelligently).

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team.

item.title: Front End/UI Software Engineer at ObservePoint (Provo, UT)
item.description:
Come help us develop a scalable, distributed platform for ObservePoint's SaaS product!


ObservePoint's engineering team is an agile, value focused team.  We believe first and foremost in getting the right thing done for the right person.  The team is currently developing a state-of-the-art distributed, highly scalable quality management platform to bring unprecedented value to our customers.  To support us in our efforts, we're looking for talented, forward thinking engineers with a passion for delivering amazing products to happy customers.


As a front end/UI software engineer at ObservePoint, you will design, develop, and maintain a scalable SaaS application built on top of a service oriented architecture.  A successful candidate will work together with a talented UX expert, a team of other software engineers (including QA), and a product owner.


Some of the technologies we're using to build our platform are: 



  • AngularJS for the web application (this would be where the front end engineers will work most)

  • Scala and Play for the API

  • Scala and Akka for the backend micro services 

  • Cassandra and MySQL for database solutions

The Predictive Analytics Practice at Milliman is an aggressive startup operation within the larger Milliman business and is using the latest tools and technologies in big data, cloud operations, predictive analytics, BI, and scientific visualization. We are looking for highly motivated, startup loving people who want to be involved in building for the future with a bunch of like minded team members. item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Syntactx (New York, NY)

You will design and build high-scale applications that process large datasets and develop web applications for internal/external users. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, where we iterate quickly and work with cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.



Essential Duties:

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Platform at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who excels at understanding big systems and how different types of client and third-party integrations interact with said system. Your work will involve integrating the services provided by our backend with our web and mobile clients, but also across middleware layers internally, and with external services. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own many small and large parts of a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You will own a set of small to large integrations across different internal and external services. Scalability and reliability is a key factor. Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You work closely with consumers and producers of the data, be it mobile client teams, our backend team, or an external service provider. Coordination and planning improvements and new features across these constituents will be key.

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Software Engineer at imo.im (Palo Alto, CA)

We are currently seeking experienced software engineering generalists to work on our messaging platform. We are growing quickly and are looking for developers who have experience with highly-scalable distributed systems. We have 4 main teams here: Backend, Android, iOS, and Audio/Video.

Our ideal candidate has a strong background in data structures, algorithms, design, and coding. This is a great opportunity to be an early employee at a fast growing company.

item.title: Software Engineer- Backend at Brandcrumb (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We are looking for a smart and skilled Software Engineer to work on our backend systems. The successful


candidate will work with our team of scientists and engineers to design, develop, test and deploy large scale

problems
