prototypes to tackle them elegantly

item.title: Software Engineer, Product Testing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


In this position, you will be a member of a team of dedicated software engineers focused on testing a suite of next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration products. You will help define the strategy for testing interfaces in a cross-platform manner. You will leverage open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. In addition, you have a special fondness for things that are simple, elegant and effective.


Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Writing code to create, improve and maintain new and existing frameworks

  • Analyzing source code to understand areas of risk and complexity to provide optimal test coverage

  • Helping Drive a Test Culture across the entire company

  • Other duties as assigned


Within Product Testing, there are different technical groups:



  • Client:  Tableau designs products for people who use software, not necessarily for people who buy software – the Client team in Product Testing is all about ensuring these products we build provide a delightful experience for our customers.  We understand our customers and how they use our products.  We build robust automation systems with Java and Python that precisely mimic product scenarios and validate the look and accuracy of the resulting visualizations.  We also use our in-development products every day to visualize data in the same way our customers do.  Our team is focused on our desktop client application for Windows and Mac, our browser rendered visualizations on all browsers and all platforms (Windows, mac, mobile) and also our native mobile apps on the iPad and Android tablets.

  • Mobile: The shift towards mobile devices and the increasing need to see and understand your data, are two of the hottest trends in the industry today, and the Mobile team at Tableau is at the confluence of the two. The Tableau Mobile team has been tasked with a single mission: to make the mobile experience the most delightful way for our customers to stay on top of their data. We build next-generation apps for iOS and Android for consumers and enterprises alike, and ensure quality through a variety of modern, innovative techniques, including white-box automation, data-driven pair-wise testing, and instrumentation tools.

  • Platform: As a member of one of our platform teams you’ll work on Tableau’s secret sauce. We are about connecting, querying, integrating and preparing data from nearly 50 different data sources. We are about calculations and statistical analytics. We are about first class test frameworks and more. Ideal candidates will be skilled in one or more programming language, for example Python, C++, C# or Java. Working knowledge of one or more database technology like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop or Apache Spark is preferred. Our team verifies that Tableau’s platform is functionally correct, reliable, scalable and high performance for our Windows and Mac desktop as well as our server products. We employ modern testing methodologies to tame the permutation explosion beast and we have fun doing it.

  • Server: The Server Testing group at Tableau owns product quality for Corporate Enterprise Server and Cloud Hosted Services (Tableau Online and Tableau Public). We have a group of dedicated software engineers focused on quality covering overall end to end scenarios as well as functional, performance and scale-out testing of Frontend and Backend components. You will help define the strategy and for testing interfaces and implement tests in a cross-platform manner while leveraging open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. We work closely with our developers and do our daily develop in Java.

  • Performance: Tableau is a product where smart meets speed. This means you can use Tableau to make sense of your big data and be creative. The Performance Test Engineer at Tableau measures and verifies the latencies of Tableau functionalities using different data sizes and sources; they also measure the Page Load Time and throughputs of the Tableau servers.  Our Performance Test engineers use cutting edge testing strategies, frameworks and tools to hold the product to a very high performance bar. Candidates for this group need to be familiar with object oriented languages and feel comfortable to use industry standard performance test frameworks such as JMeter.


Who you are…



  • Experienced. 1-5+ years of experience testing and profiling large-scale C++ systems and highly scalable Java and/or Ruby server systems that back dynamic, highly interactive web experiences. Experience testing on Windows platforms, with experience testing on multiple platforms including Linux. Strong knowledge of database concepts is a plus.

  • Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable and that perform well. Excellent understanding of languages such as C++, Java, Ruby, and Python as well as programming experience with Javascript and css/html. Strong knowledge of development and test tools, in particular Selenium, junit and java tools.

  • Passionate about Quality. A love of testing, tuning and analysis through a rigorous scientific approach.

  • Self-Motivated. You do good work and the drive to deliver is just a part of you.

  • Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You assume the good intent in others, and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.

  • Customer Focused. You want to learn about customers, their challenges & scenarios and you find satisfaction in shipping quality products that delight customers.

  • You have high standards, and your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality no matter what.  You believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools & techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support.  You deliver better results through using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices.

  • Educated. Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Meraki’s customer base has grown by a factor of 2-3 every year since we started, leading to a current request rate of over 200 million page views per day, and the Meraki backend team keeps our cloud management infrastructure scaling in the face of that growth.


Examples of the systems we've built/worked on include:



  • A secure, resilient overlay network that allows our backend to deliver configurations and gather statistics from our devices despite Internet routing anomalies and middleboxes.

  • A highly concurrent daemon that gathers updated statistics from every Meraki wireless access point, switch, and firewall every 45 seconds.

  • A custom database, written from scratch in C++, that processes over 1 million writes/second and intelligently partitions statistics data on disk for fast retrieval and efficient in-memory caching.


The backend team uses a number of different programming languages and systems, deliberately choosing the right tools for each particular application. We write code in C++, Ruby, and Scala. We use Linux, PostgreSQL, Rails, Jetty, Click, nginx, and memcached. We contribute to several open source projects.

item.title: Senior Mobile Software Engineer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Nederland)
item.description:
As a mobile developer, you'll be responsible for creating and expanding our native and JavaScript SDKs and libraries for application and streaming analytics.


You will be working with algorithms on multiple platforms, including phones, tablets and other internet-connected devices, as well as upcoming hardware (Apple Watch, Google Glass, etc)


You should be experienced in mobile app development, coupled with in-depth knowledge of JavaScript and other web-technologies. Close collaboration with the local and American reporting team and QA engineers will also be an essential part of your work.


We're a close knit international team of experienced Engineers who are passionate about web and application analytics and finding innovative ways to provide analytics data on the latest technology to solve the needs of our clients.  We’re looking for like-minded developers who are keen to solve interesting problems.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Emerlyn Technology, LLC (Conway, NH)
item.description:
Develops quality assurance standards, publishes and implements test plans. Writes and maintains test automation. Defines and tracks quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and open defect counts. Must have a working knowledge of quality assurance methodologies.


Responsibilities
As a Quality Assurance Engineer you will be responsible for working with development and account support teams in developing test workflow, including functional, integration, regression, UAT, and performance/stress testing.
In addition:



  • Evaluate and recommend testing tools and environment.

  • Participate in installation and maintenance of testing tools and environment.

  • Analyze system requirements to develop and maintain test plans and data.

  • Document test plans and environments to be run by self and others.

  • Document, prioritize and monitor issues.

  • Streamline processes for efficiency.

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer, Ad Reporting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Advertising Reporting Team is responsible for building industry-leading reporting solutions for Quantcast’s advertising clients, providing rich insights into their advertising campaigns and audience.


We are looking for a senior/principal front-end engineer who has deep familiarity and experience with front-end technologies. He/she will be leading the development of brand new, innovative reporting features to deliver a rich and intuitive user experience for our large and rapidly growing advertising client base.


As a senior engineer, he/she will also set the technical direction and extend best practices within the team. We currently use Java, Play framework, JavaScript, AngularJS, d3, and are open to new technologies.


Responsibilities



  • Define, code, test, and deploy new features to our reporting suite with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.

  • Utilize latest HTML5, CSS, and JS techniques to produce highly-performant, informative, and beautiful user experiences for clients.

  • Work cross-functionally with UX, Product, and other Engineering teams. Contribute to the product definition, UI, and system design processes.

  • Evaluate feasibilities and effectively manage project scope and time.

  • Continually evaluate and instill best practices into the development process, including automated testing, code organization and style, and front-end application architecture.

item.title: Software Qualifty Assurance Engineer at iJET International (Annapolis, MD)
item.description:
Join a fast-growing Agile team of Software Developers and QA Engineers to build world-class, high-volume software-as-a-service product.


The Software Quality Assurance Engineer will work as part of an experienced software product team to test cases of our Software-as-a-Service product development or enhancement.

item.title: Left handed (or right handed) quick thinking, problem solving Software Engineer at Shareaholic Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Shareaholic is looking for amazing, problem solving, and hard working software engineers who WANT to work on a variety of problems and products. You must enjoy working on solving shared engineering problems and improving all of our products.  Our products deliver correctness, efficiency, and availability.  You will help make that happen. We measure and monitor everything, and have a culture of continuous reflection and improvement.  If you love delivering product driven software, we want to hear from you!

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Practichem (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
Practichem is growing and needs to add an experienced full stack Java developer. You'll create full stack web applications using Java, AngularJS, CoffeeScript, Less, Jade, NodeJS, and related technologies.


You'll control real world equipment directly from a single-page browser application. Recent tasks we completed:



  • Display of huge data sets on a multi-tabbed interface within the browser

  • Pattern recognition and identification within large data sets

  • Multi-instrument integration with a coordination site

  • Creation of simulated instruments into Docker containers for load testing


You'll integrate browser controlled Arista™ into a whole browser based lab concept. Along with a great team of software and hardware engineers, you'll be bringing amazing products to the world. 


What makes this position stand out?



  • Control real hardware using web applications you develop.

  • Work in the highly technical domain of scientific instruments.

  • Choose your daily OS. Many of us prefer Linux.

  • You get a great computer (Lenovo or Mac) with plenty of RAM and huge monitors.

  • Count on professional User Interaction designers on our team.

  • Create new software using the latest frameworks and tools.

  • At Practichem, we make our own real, physical stuff.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at LifeLink (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
LifeLink, a VC backed startup currently in stealth mode, connects patients and healthcare systems around the globe through an open, collaborative platform built on structured data.


LifeLink is the brainchild of successful entrepreneurs and early stage investors with expertise in healthcare and building ecosystem businesses.


Join a small, smart, fast, experienced, communicative and creative team. Apply your technical skills and creativity to change the world by revolutionizing the delivery of global healthcare!


About the position:


The Senior Software Engineer will



  • help build LifeLink’s global applications for patients and medical providers

  • help create effective agile processes and team culture

  • efficiently deliver customer value through high quality, reliable code


Specific responsibilities include:



  • Communicate constructively with team members to cooperatively build a product suite that delights customers.

  • Write extensible code with high automated test coverage.

  • Contribute to team decisions about system architecture and the selection of technical tools.

  • Build attractive and intuitive user experiences.

  • Build scalable, auditable, and reliable integrations with external partner and customer systems including electronic health record (EHR) systems.

  • Troubleshoot issues as they arise and resolve technical challenges. Understand business concerns and contribute to brainstorming pragmatic options to address them.

item.title: Development Data Team Lead at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• You will be creating and leading a medium sized, focused team, supporting the data needs of our UI Development team across a variety of clients

  • You have proven success in establishing and growing high performance teams focused on delivering high quality software on time and on budget

  • You have a solid understanding of web development and an in-depth understanding of API development and best practices

  • You fully believe in documentation and building exactly to spec

  • You understand how to build reusable components that have the flexibility to meet multiple clients’ needs


Web Development Culture


We pride ourselves in having a large community of developers who actively support each other through open dialogue and brain storming. We love to solve problems quickly and elegantly while keeping the codebase maintainable and lean. We value a collaborative environment where ideas are valued and exchanged not only through our technology, but together in person, using tools like 50-foot whiteboards, and lots of sticky notes to map out and create sites, apps and tools that help people understand complex information.


What you will do and learn



  • Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility APIs for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).

  • Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing APIs that deliver dynamic information from a variety of sources.

  • Use proprietary technologies and standard best practices to build and deliver high performance APIs.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
Sr. Software Engineer



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Founded in 2000, Logi Analytics provides businesses the fastest and easiest way to deliver business analytics, dashboards, and reports to a broad range of users, as well as to embed them into existing applications – all for a fraction of the cost of other solutions. Unlike traditional Business Intelligence platforms that are complex and costly, Logi Analytics’ agile technology allows organizations to rapidly develop, deploy, and adapt BI applications that serve any number of users on any platform all without extensive development or professional services. Logi Analytics is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with sales and support offices in the UK and Europe.  Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



This position will work closely with Development, QA, and Product Management to design and implement features and capabilities for Logi Analytics’ product line.



General:



Logi is looking for a technically proficient software engineer who has collaborated with a team to put enterprise software into production.  While this individual is capable of solving incredibly technical problems, he/she doesn’t need to solve every problem single-handedly, and actually enjoys bringing the best ideas together to design and implement the best possible solution.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



•           Design, develop and maintain a rich data-driven Java application containing HTML5, CSS and JavaScript, Angular, NodeJS components


•           Gain good understanding of our suite of software products.


•           Work within our development team to maintain and enhance the product.


•           Take ownership of product sub-systems.


•           Provide a positive influence that will improve our products for our customers.  Invent new ideas to build new features and products to help grow Logi Analytics.

item.title: Experienced Front-End Engineer at Geckoboard (London, UK)
item.description:
Geckoboard is a successful and growing 25-person B2B SaaS startup based in East London. Our elegant, real-time dashboards solve a difficult but valuable problem for thousands of paying subscribers, by taking the complexity out of connecting to their data and making that data simple for anyone to interpret at a glance. As a result, our customers unlock data they didn't know they had, connect people and join up projects, and make better decisions faster.


We are looking for a full-time senior front-end engineer who has built rich JavaScript clients. You’ll be opinionated, but contemplative. You won’t immediately reach for your favourite framework or library when approaching a problem. You'll be comfortable liaising with our product designer on design and implementation. You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.


Displaying complicated data to our customers so they can easily understand what’s going on and make actionable decisions is a big challenge. We're constantly tweaking and improving how we visualise data on Geckoboard, whether through adding more visualizations or updating what we have.


At Geckoboard you will:



  • Write clean, modular, test driven code

  • Implement visual design from prototypes

  • Test compatibility with various browsers

  • Pick the best library for the job

  • Care about web performance 


More than anything, we value candidates who are excited about picking up new skills and sharing what they’ve learned with the rest of the team - for example, none of us knew Go or React a short time ago, but now both are key parts of our stack. We love people with a keen attention to detail and the willingness to apply it in shaping all aspects of our product.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Mail Infrastructure at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network of 350,000 financial professionals. We are looking for exceptional Senior Software Engineers who are interested in designing and building the next generation of this unparalleled product.

Our system is built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available, large-scale distributed system includes a comprehensive storage and search infrastructure, real-time email transport and delivery pipeline, real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as a feature-rich and powerful user-interface optimized for our specialized customers.

The Mail team is looking for C/C++ experts who are interested in working on high-performance infrastructure. A developer in this role will work in a highly distributed, multi-threaded environment on problems including indexing and retrieval of mail and files for both core databases and Search, APIs to that data for internal clients, and ensuring stability and scalability of a system that has increased its traffic 20% year over year for the last five years.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Sr. Software Engineer - Palo Alto or Seattle


What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?


Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management.

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs.



(We are only able to consider candidates local to the U.S. at this time. Thank you for your interest!)

item.title: Lead/Senior Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure Engineering at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lets Go.

Lets go inspire 100 million people learn anything they can imagine. Lets go inspire 100,000 instructors to share their knowledge with the world. Lets go help 10,000 businesses to change the way their employees learn.

Learn. Empathize. Take Ownership. nnovate. Show Passion.

Get Stuff Done. Open Up.

ABOUT UDEMY

Udemy is an online marketplace where anyone in the world can take or teach a course on virtually anything, whenever and wherever they want. Our mission is to empower on-demand learning thats accessible to all by offering instruction in a way thats affordable, simple, and flexible, so individuals can fulfill their limitless potential on their own terms.

Our more than 7 million students can gain skills to launch a new career, advance in their current field, or try something new for their own personal development by choosing from more than 30,000 courses in 80+ languages. Our instructors are passionate experts who want to share their knowledge with a broad audience. Udemy also works with companies to help them develop more effective and engaging skills-based training for their employees.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and funded by Stripes Group, Norwest Venture Partners, Insight Venture Partners, Lightbank, MHS Capital, Learn Capital, and 500 Startups, among others. Udemy is headquartered in San Franciscos SOMA neighborhood and has offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey. Compensation includes full time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits (including healthcare, commuter benefits and an unlimited vacation policy).  

Job Description:

  • Build robust and scalable data infrastructure (both offline and real-time) to support needs from different teams around the company.

  • Manage the data infrastructure and do necessary capacity planning.

  • May get involved in various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities

  • May require mentoring  junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes

  • Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies (such as Spark) that may improve performance and elegance of our data infrastructure.

  • We practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

Technologies currently in use or will be in use:

  • Hadoop, Hive, Pig

  • AWS, Elastic MapReduce, Redshift, Kinesis, S3

  • Cassandra, HBase

  • Spark

  • Kafka, Storm

  • Python, Django (experience with Python/Django a big plus)

  • Github

  • MySQL, PostgreSQL

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known software technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Have contributed to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

Udemy in the News:

TechCrunch: Udemy Raises Another $65 Million To Help Anyone Learn Anything

Wall Street Journal: Udemy Raises $65 Million to Become Netflix for Education

Bloomberg: Why LinkedIn Is Tapping Into Online Education

Forbes: Closing The Skills Gap: How Udemy Is Helping Anyone Learn Anything

SFGate: Company culture, collaboration is focus at Udemy

item.title: Software Engineer - C#, VB.Net, ASP.Net, Sharepoint at King & Spalding LLP (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Responsible for working on complex software engagements and systems integration projects from a development standpoint. Serves as a lead on medium-sized projects dealing with data warehousing, data migration and architecting middleware to facilitate the exchange of data between enterprise applications. This person will help architect technical solutions and then handle the coding and implementation of the software engineering phase of the project. This person will work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Usability Designers and the rest of the Software Engineering group. They may be called upon periodically to meet with end users to assist in architecting solutions with the Analysts. This position works closely with Usability Designers and other Software Engineers to create web based application interfaces for various firm databases and products.

Qualifications:



  • Extensive knowledge and experience with a wide variety of Microsoft development tools and languages including C# and ASP.Net within the .NET Framework, SQL Server and Active Directory.

  • Extensive experience working with basic web scripting such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS and other interfacing technologies needed to support substantial web-based software applications.

  • Thorough understanding of software development processes and best practices.

  • Ability to handle high-stress situations and deal successfully with conflict.

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills (written and verbal) and the ability to relate technical information to a non-technical audience.

  • Excellent work ethics and the ability to work as a part of a team to accomplish assigned tasks and responsibilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple assignments and varying priorities.

  • Very organized, responsible, goal oriented with attention to detail.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Keen IO (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keen IO is seeking engineers to join our Platform team. We build and nurture an Analytics API that processes user data and queries around the clock, across diverse industries. Whether it’s gaming, e-commerce, advertising, publishing, or IoT, our platform aims to make Analytics so easy for developers that they can focus entirely on their product. Every day, every week, every month our challenge is to scale with a constantly growing data deluge and evolve along with our user’s needs.


About the Platform Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - servant leaders are elected from the team, by the team. Responsibilities normally held by a single manager are separated across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies both to the technology and the organizations of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.


About the Job


By centralizing a data pipeline for hundreds of companies, we operate at a scale that none of them have to worry about. Looking to the horizon, we need to look at every piece of our infrastructure with a critical eye. We need to stay ahead of the curve. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right bottlenecks at the right time. You’ll help make working on the platform easier and easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of distributed systems and teach others! Most importantly, you’ll collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

item.title: Lead Architect - Windows/C/Power Industry at LiveData Utilities, Inc. (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We have an exciting opportunity to join a spearheading smartgrid IT organization in a project team developing complex event processing products that manage large data streams responsible for monitoring and maintaining the grid.
LiveData Utilities designs solutions to improve grid uptimes, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction in the energy generation and distribution space. We are the vision leaders in Operations Technology Service Bus space.
LiveData is looking for a Windows C software engineer with complex event processing, web server development, and data exchange experience to develop our next generation OTSB product: an enterprise class software that is ingesting sensor data from numerous external data sources, processing & monitoring those data streams at the rate of tens of thousands of data points per second. Significant experience with real-time systems, asynchronous event processing, network or http processing, large data processing systems.



Key Responsibilities - what you do on a daily basis



  • Lead advocate for architectural, structural, and design decisions for the product

  • Design software application components using C in a Windows environment, Python, and other programming tools that fuel core business applications

  • Develop next generation complex event processing systems & components to replace and extend legacy systems 

  • Find bugs and eliminate them. Cleaning up old and broken code should rank high on your list of therapeutic activities.

  • Knowledge Share. We operate in a fast paced environment, and you will frequently pair with other team members. We want you to share your expertise, making everyone else better and facilitating continuous learning

  • Create reusable processes, components and tools that others can leverage to accelerate progress

  • Stay up to date on the latest technology trends and techniques – and be prepared to propose new ideas when there is strong business value.

item.title: BMW Group - Principal System Debug Engineer/Infotainment Head Unit Software(m/f) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
THE PRODUCT IS THE HEART. AND IT IS THE BRAIN.


SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR MODERN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY


Complex systems demand careful maintenance. Ideally from people whose good ideas and enthusiasm can truly shine in a supportive work environment. Because people like this make IT unique, smart and ready for the future. Without IT, the innovative power of the BMW Group would not exist.


We want this to strengthen even further, so our team is currently looking for a:


Principal System Debug Engineer - Infotainment Head Unit Software (m/f)


Job reference: 97998


BMW Car IT offers you the chance to take up a challenging role in automotive software development. Your role is to work with the performance & stability team for our next-generation Linux based automotive infotainment head unit system. Your key tasks and responsibilities will comprise:



  • Technical lead for stability specific problem solving.

  • System SW debugging.

  • Definition of methods to ensure product reliability.

  • Review changes in code and the environment to determine impacts on system performance & reliability.

  • Very close cooperation with architects, SW developers and test engineers.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Sr iOS Software Engineer at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Sr. Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Consumer Home Products.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development life-cycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. 


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new apps that interface with Consumer Robots, which are used by millions of people.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Expedite Financial (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


Our front end engineers build both consumer-facing and internal applications that transform a complicated and data-intensive domain into simple, intuitive, and delightful experiences. Our front end stack is composed of API-driven javascript apps built in React, AngularJS, and sass.  In this role you will collaborate with designers, product leads, and platform engineers to build beautiful and intuitive applications, comprised of reusable components with good performance and usability across browsers and mobile devices.



ABOUT YOU



  • You have deep knowledge of javascript, HTML, CSS, and browser behavior

  • You have experience with modern javascript frameworks (React or AngularJS preferred)

  • You have an interest in usability and design aesthetics

  • You are familiar with modern front-end tool chains – build tools, unit tests, linters, debuggers

  • You naturally build for structure, reusability, and sharing – you make other developers happier and more productive

item.title: Java/Scala Software Engineer at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for very high-tech engineers that have experience or have shown the ability to deal with hard software engineering problems - from an algorithmic and distributed systems perspective.


If your passion is building high-performant, scalable services, with elegant APIs and architectures you’ll fit right in! Join us in disrupting the hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


Responsibilities:



  • Design & implement our backend architecture, from the data layer, to service orchestration to our RESTful APIs

  • Build the libraries and frameworks we use to build high-performance, reliable distributed services

  • You’ll be hyper-technical - deep understanding and optimisation are in our blood

item.title: Software Engineer (Tower UI) at Ansible (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Ansible is looking for a Front-end Software Engineer to help design and build our Ansible Tower product.  The candidate will be responsible for working closely with various teams to ensure designs are not only possible, but have the required data from the provided REST APIs. Job leveling to be determined by years of relevant experience and skill set.
