item.title: Professional Services Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Professional Services Engineer Positions in San Diego, CA and Austin, TX


Our Services Team is responsible for delivering real-time process-transformation consulting expertise to our customers as well as ensuring the successful implementation of Hermosa solutions. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.


We’re looking for product developers with customer-facing experience who want more direct customer interaction and experience. It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have a Computer Science/Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.

item.title: Mobile & Front End UI Engineer / Inventor at Iodine (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Iodine is changing the way people find the right medical treatments. Our product is our voice, and we want you to shape it with us.


You work where design meets code. You know mobile UI patterns, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript like the back of your hand. You're passionate about experimentation, innovation, and playing around with the latest front-end technologies. You write clean, compatible, powerful user interfaces with speed. Bonus: You're passionate about understanding your audience, and dreaming up ways to build great technological futures for them.


As a mobile & front-end engineer, you’ll work closely with the rest of our design, engineering, product, and clinical team to turn ideas into tangible user experiences. You'll combine your keen design sense, stellar front-end chops, and the right technologies, to realize these ideas and validate them with users. Your wizardry will translate design concepts into living, breathing prototypes and finished products—all to help people make sense of health decisions.


You will co-own and shape the future of health & medical apps—both online, and in people’s pockets.


We are a JavaScript shop—you’ll be working in React Native, React.js and LESS, with designers who can code.


Responsibilities



  • Work with our product team to design and implement rapid prototypes, by whatever means necessary.

  • Write clean, compatible, automated-testable React JSX and LESS to realize our ideas as a cross-platform, responsive front-end.

  • Build our reusable UI framework to help us create rich applications to interact with our data—code, widgets, and all—and help us identify and document its emergent rules.

  • Serve as a mentor for engineers, designers, and other peers at Iodine.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at CrowdFlower (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


CrowdFlower is changing the way work gets done, and we want you to help us make it happen.


We’re building a platform that makes it easy for data scientists to enrich their data by distributing work to an on-demand workforce located around the world. In addition to being an integral player in the red hot data science, machine learning and big data fields, we also provide critically needed work and income to millions of micro-tasking workers around the world. Everything our engineers do has real and tangible impact, everyday.


We need smart, innovative people to help us build scalable, resilient and responsive systems, working with our exceptional team in San Francisco’s Mission District. You can look forward to working with a dynamic, growing company in a casual and fun environment with an opportunity to make an impact at all levels of the business.


Learn more about our engineering culture at http://www.crowdflower.com/careers/engineering.


The Job:


When we say Full Stack Engineer, we're looking for someone that is comfortable building custom UI/UX as well as defining API endpoints for the UI to communicate with. In terms of MVC, the position looks like: 5% M, 75% V, and 20% C. The primary tools you'll employ are Rails and jQuery. You like to work with different technologies and are passionate about constantly learning new things. You take pride in designing elegant, simple solutions to challenging problems, creating quality software components and promoting best practices for agile software development. You will help us ensure we continue to evolve and keep our edge as a world­-class development team. 


Responsibilities:



  • Distilling complex requirements into simple interfaces.

  • Defining the future of CrowdFlower's platform.

  • Building new products that use the core CrowdFlower platform.

  • Improve the interface that tens of thousands of CrowdFlower contributors and clients use everyday.

  • Take pride and ownership in your work and encourage others to do the same

  • Promote best practices for writing maintainable, well­-tested code


Must Haves:



  • 3+ yrs experience on at least one significant production-level web app in Rails.

  • Experience in multiple programming languages (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript).

  • A solid command of JavaScript. When something breaks, you either know exactly why it broke, or can find out easily.

  • The ability to design new interfaces - thinking up a creative solution and being able to implement it effectively.


Experience with these would be definite assets:



  • Client-side MVC - React and/or Backbone

  • Jasmine/TDD experience

  • An opinion about Web Components/ES6

  • Git skills and GitHub repos full of cool stuff you've hacked on

  • A great design aesthetic

  • PostgreSql, JQuery, Redis

  • AWS, Jira, Confluence.

item.title: Frontend Developer - Meteor / Javascript - FinTech Startup at Ldger Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're seeking front-end javascript developers to join our intimate NYC-based team to build our next generation platform for new exiting financial products.


We use - and love - Meteor as App platform, which gives us reactivity and “database everywhere” as well as a unified environment. 


You will help design and develop our financial service platform for AltFi products - allowing customers to model and execute exciting complex financial models. This includes analyzing and modeling financial data, data visualization and exporting results.


Our backend micro services are built in Node.js , integrating nicely with Meteor.

item.title: Full Stack Lead Developer at CNAG-CRG (El Prat de Llobregat, España)
item.description:
CNAG-CRG is looking for a full-stack developer to lead the design, development and  maintenance of the LIMS. He/she will be expected to develop the database backend and front-end using a mix of languages and  tools to process and display the data.


The developer will report to the Production Bioinformatics Manager and will work closely with other  software engineers at the CNAG and will interact with the laboratory, data analysts and researchers and tools to process and display the data.


Application procedure:
Interested candidates should submit a CV and a brief statement of experience and interests before September 30th 2015 to both an email address below, indicating the offer reference in the message subject: info@cnag.crg.eu and recruitment portal through the following link: http://www.crg.eu/content/jobs/cnag-jobs.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise, mobile and desktop, external and internal, user-driven and automated, and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. Although you will be focused on the back end system, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary as we are growing very quickly but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will be crucial to designing and implementing a scalable system from schema through software through operational tools. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our engineering culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.



This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Software Engineer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our team in San Mateo, CA. This role will work under direction and mentorship, helping build solutions to complex software engineering problems, which require frequent use of ingenuity and creativity. The Software Engineer will interface with technical leads and product managers while building new products as well as upgrades, and enhancements or fixes to existing products.

Please note we are considering local candidates only. 


Responsibilities:



  • Display a passion for software development.

  • Create code that is simple, extensible, testable and robust.

  • Collaborate with other team members to evolve our development processes.

  • Participate in technical group and design discussions.

item.title: Sr. Engineer (Dev Tools) at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with experience creating and deploying software tools to enhance the productivity of our entire Development team. As the Sr. SDE on our Dev Tools team, you’ll be responsible for leading the group in the delivery of tools and added features/functionality to help make life easier for your fellow Developers and DevOps teammates. You will already have proven ability to write code and automation scripts working with large scale internet technologies. Experience in a continuous deployment environment is a definite plus.



  • Work with development leadership to evaluate, propose and design new tools

  • Design, develop, and deploy development tool features from front-end to back-end

  • Collaborate with other project teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa

  • Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of development tools and systems to help scale the product

  • Create and adapt automated processes that improve the efficiency of our software development, delivery, and deployment

  • Provide mentorship to other Dev Tools engineers

  • Stay current on state of the art technologies.

item.title: Software Engineer at Click Therapeutics, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
About the Role:


We are looking for a Ruby on Rails engineer to be responsible for implementing both a user facing web application as well as APIs to support our mobile applications. In relation to the latter, this developer must be very confident in his/her ability to employ proper design patterns so that we may have a consistent, easily consumable API. Experience with designing and maintaining server infrastructure and configuration is a plus but not required. This is a highly visible, creative, and agile role within a rapidly growing pre-IPO company in a nascent and fast-growing space.  The role will be located in our trendy SoHo HQ and is a tremendous wealth-building/equity opportunity for the right individual. We also provide comprehensive, platinum-level healthcare and benefits.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
We're looking for somebody who's equally at home writing a script to replace EC2 instances, troubleshooting Linux TCP/IP latency, and building out a continuous-delivery pipeline for software in half a dozen different languages. Monitoring, capacity planning, and on-call emergency response also fall within the domain of this position.


You'll be working closely with a tight-knit team of software developers, project managers, and other platform engineers to guide the evolution of an ensemble of SaaS products supporting the Internet of Things. This means that in addition to the technical responsibilities already laid out, you'll need the confidence and passion to share ideas, deliberate, and execute decisively with other experienced engineers.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Viv Labs (San Jose, CA)
item.description:
Viv is a next-generation virtual personal assistant, brought to you by the team that developed Siri. In addition to being far more capable and intelligent, Viv will provide a truly open platform and marketplace that lets any developer extend Viv's capabilities for new domains and services.

We are looking for versatile, talented full-stack engineers who can create commercial-quality software with ease. As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will use our advanced AI tools to add new capabilities to Viv, teaching it about new domains and services.

You like working individually and in small teams and you are constantly learning from and teaching those around you and in online coding communities. You have a broad experience with server-side Javascript, integrating with third party web services, and are experienced at data and object modeling.


Benefits


Very competitive salary and equity packages. Other benefits include health, dental, vision, life/disability insurances, vacation/PTO, $100/month for phone or Internet service, access to the buildings gym & pool facilities, etc. Height-adjustable standing/sitting desks. Proven team, fun environment, huge upside, well-funded runway, cutting-edge AI technology. Work at home Thursdays for those with a longer commute.

item.title: Junior Software Engineer - C# at Intronis (Chelmsford, MA)
item.description:
This is an amazing opportunity for a Software Engineer to join a growing team of talented software developers at Intronis and make a major impact on the technical direction of our product. You will have the best of both worlds: join a software startup in the high-growth cloud market sector that has a real product, real customers and a rock solid financial picture and the opportunity to work on some cool technology at a company with a ton of growth potential.



We are seeking  talented, self-motivated software engineers who have experience with C#, .NET, Object Oriented design and implementation and Web Services.  Working closely with a team of analysts, developers, QA and other business resources you will be continuously improving and enhancing the primary interface for our growing customer base.  We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where you will have the opportunity to grow and refine your skills while rotating through research and development, mainline development and sustaining environments.

item.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer NYC at Curalate (New York, NY)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented senior software engineers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few great coders to join us.


Although experience with our existing technology stack is great, we're much more interested in hiring developers with exceptional problem solving skills, creative out-of-the-box thinking, and comfort evaluating and deploying new technologies.


For this position, we're looking for accomplished engineers with at least three years of experience at a high-functioning technology company; you should know exactly what it takes to ship high quality software on-time.  And while this is an IC role, we will lean on you to help mentor the more junior members of our team.


We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. Above all else, we're looking for others who are as excited above the potential in this space as we are, and who will be willing to join us in moving fast and breaking things as we execute against that vision.

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer at Canvas (New York, NY)
item.description:
Canvas is seeking a senior Front End Engineer with a deep passion for creating beautiful interfaces and interactions. Come help us build unique sites and applications for great brands like MTV, The High Line, Estee Lauder, Grand Central Terminal, and others. This role works closely with our creative team to conceptualize, design, and prototype interfaces; and with Back End Engineers to create high-performance, data-driven applications. Here are the qualities we're seeking for this position:



  • Tenacious: You enjoy the challenge of collaboratively planning a user experience across multiple platforms and taking advantage of the unique capabilities of each.

  • Focused: You're serious about the craft of your work. Details matter to you. You have a strong emphasis on modularity, reusability, and experience managing code in a team environment.

  • Creative: You're always on top of technology, UX and design trends. You find innovative and elegant technical solutions to complex problems.


We're looking for engineers who:



  • Get JavaScript. We're not just talking about being able to pull some jQuery off of Stack Overflow. We want someone who understands design patterns and works in a modular architecture. 

  • Are Planners. CSS is easily disorganized, and now with SASS in the mix, it's very easy to get lost. When you start working with designers, you are already thinking about how you're going to transform their designs into reusable, extensible code.

  • Keep on Pushing. We're not a 60-hour a week startup. We pride ourselves on work-life balance. And from that we want engineers who are working their hardest on developing their skills, and our company's collective abilities, every minute of every day.


This is a great opportunity to join our team and make a contribution at all levels of development, from prototyping through delivery. Be prepared to come in and present some code you’ve worked on, and tell us why it makes you proud. Also, we may ask you the worst movie you’ve seen twice. It’s just how we roll.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
The Senior Software Engineer will be accountable for leading a small team as well as developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. The Engineer will be working on a variety of applications and next generation products.

Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality

  • Mentor junior engineers in development methodologies and best practices

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Senior UI Engineer - Product Research at JUST EAT (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level UI Engineer in Product Research you will discover new and innovative ways to empower consumers to love their takeaway experience across our 15 countries.


As an Engineer in Product Research what will you be doing?:



  • Working in a small team that believes a few passionate people can have a big impact. Think of us as a lean startup disrupting from within.

  • We use many different technologies, designs and data to quickly bring ideas to life and we've got more ideas to try (although always want more) than we have time to build them.

  • We'll stay small and lean but we want to add a few key designers and engineers in our Bristol innovation hub to help us bring great new experiences to our millions of consumers faster than ever before.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Frontend Engineer at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.


The successful candidate will be responsible for the migration of our platform to an enterprise single page application. Your primary responsibility will be implementing a robust and responsive application that is dynamic and configurable. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be expected to design and implement new features and functionality in strict adherence with industry design patterns and best practices. You will be asked to work in the following areas:



  • Single page application

  • Front end technologies

  • RESTful API client

  • Asynchronous extensible UI components

  • Data visualization

  • User interface/experience

item.title: Sustainable Software Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're looking for Sustainable Software Engineer to build internal tools and features for the Appboy platform. In addition, this role will also require the candidate to be the technical escalation for our success team when needed. This role is a software engineering role, as this person will also be responsible for programming on the Appboy dashboard or backend, helping out the mobile team, and working on minor infrastructure projects. One day you may be building internal tools to help our success and support organizations with automating a workflow, and the next day building new features to be used by thousands of Appboy customers.


Sustainable Software Engineers may be required to split on-call responsibilities with other team members, though after-hours support is uncommon. Proficient Support Engineers have the opportunity to grow into full-time backend software engineers on the Appboy platform.


We are not interested in recent coding school graduates at this time, please do not apply if you recently graduated from schools such as General Assembly or App Academy.



Responsibilities:
-Become an expert in how our product works from a technical standpoint
-Be the technical point of contact for customer issues from Appboy’s customer success organization
-Add new features and fix customer-facing bugs
-Build or buy new support tools to help automate common tasks and challenges

item.title: SecOps Engineer at Truveris (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Security Operations Engineer’s responsibilities include managing security system deployment, configuration, monitoring and reporting. This position will have a lead role in performing vulnerability assessments, security testing, and working with operations and development teams on remediation and mitigation of findings. This position will have a primary role on the Engineering team focusing on security and with Disaster Recovery planning/implementation. The Security Operations Engineer provides
support for planning, designing, and implementing security controls which safeguard and monitor events for information systems, enterprise applications and data. The security engineer will work closely with the Development team to ensure that secure practices are followed throughout the entire SDLC.


Responsibilities:



  • Engineer, implement and monitor security measures for protection and detection of threats against computer systems, networks and information assets

  • Identify and define system security requirements

  • Design and develop security architecture and designs

  • Document and design standard operating procedures and protocols

  • Deploy, configure and maintain security infrastructure and devices

  • Develop solutions and tools to help mitigate security vulnerabilities and automate secure design practices.

  • Communicate with the Engineering team to disseminate knowledge about incidents and vulnerabilities

  • Document findings regarding future improvements and enhancements to overall system security and performance

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Senior Clojure Engineer, to build the future of education at Studyflow (Amsterdam, Netherlands) (allows remote)
item.description:
Studyflow is a driven team of individuals working together to rethink education in a digital age. We are an informal, passionate group that values creativity, hard work and a positive attitude. For us, our time at this company is an opportunity to better ourselves while helping the world.

Our mission is to build the most personal and motivating learning experience in the world. To fulfill this mission, we are looking for passionate Clojure engineers with the drive to contribute to something greater than themselves to join our top-notch Amsterdam based team.


A Challenge
As an engineer you will work on impactful and challenging problems. Every day we analyze the input of tens of thousands students, automatically classifying their practice data, using it to serving up personalized learning feeds in real-time using our Clojure and ReactJS based infrastructure.


For our architecture we use event-sourcing (http://martinfowler.com/eaaDev/EventSourcing.html) and CQRS. To do this, we built our own open-source event-sourcing toolkit for Clojure (https://github.com/rill-event-sourcing/rill). On occasion we host meetups like the Amsterdam Clojure meetup (http://www.meetup.com/The-Amsterdam-Clojure-Meetup-Group/events/222073611/) where we present our findings and progress.

item.title: Data Engineer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:

Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.

The Role:

We are looking for a Data Developer who can write clean well designed Python and PL/SQL in a timely and scalable way. You must have strong experience building and optimizing ETL processes in a heterogeneous environment (Oracle 11g, PostgresSQL).


We’d like you to:




  • Troubleshoot, test and maintain large-scale data warehousing systems and ETL processes to ensure strong optimization and functionality

  • Develop new features and tools as needed

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer- Building a new cutting edge platform!!!!! at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar, the world’s largest car-sharing company, is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.



We’re working to transform Zipcar from its ‘startup roots’ into ‘a world-class engineering organization’. The new platform we’re building is going to take Zipcar all over the world. We’re building a global platform to take car-sharing everywhere.


From an organizational standpoint, we’re going ‘deep into Agile’. We’ve launched a bunch of Agile teams and they are essentially self-directed. We’re pushing technical decision making and freedom to choose approaches down to the team level. We’re empowering engineers and teams to make decisions. Even our Leadership Team (including the President) does a ‘daily standup’.


The technology choices we’re standardizing on are:



  • Native Mobile applications on Android and iOS. Our goal is to launch new functionality on ‘mobile first’ wherever it makes sense.

  • Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Spark, Clojure, Haskel, machine learning, etc are going to be core to what we do.

  • All back-end services are going to be written in Ruby, Scala or Java. Mobile apps are all native.



Responsibilities:



  • Senior member of an agile team focused on delivering components of the next generation Zipcar technology platform.

  • Work to achieve engineering quality standards that our members will love and that you and your team will be proud of.

  • Responsible for the delivery a series of small, discrete applications leveraging Ruby, Java and/or Scala in a fast-paced, team-focused environment

  • Lead the development of applications leveraging traditional and non-traditional data stores, such as Hadoop, Cassandra and others.


Requirements:



  • The desire to work as part of an agile team

  • 5+ years of experience in Scala/Play, Java, or Ruby development for the web

  • Must have experience using non-traditional data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB.

  • The skill and desire to create well-tested software using current tools.

  • Experience with SOA, microservice and/or RESTful design patterns

  • Experience with applications having 100s to 1000s or more concurrent users.

  • Experience building web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • A solid understanding of Kanban, Scrum and other agile concepts

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, with at least one being JVM-based, such as Java, JRuby or Scala.

  • An understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

  • Experience in deploying applications using tools such as AWS, Docker, or Cloud Foundry

  • Experience using JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, Ember or Angular

  • Experience using data with predictive and other analytic approaches

  • Experience deploying and tuning large-scale applications built on top of the JVM

  • Exposure to mobile development on iOS or Android

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to join our machine learning team to help define our next-generation, optimization platform working closely with Data Scientists. 

We’re looking for highly-motivated individuals with the right skills to help us in developing systems that will have a direct influence on the success of the company. Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions. 

Join us as we pursue the goal of facilitating the merger of television and on-line media into a consistent experience accessible across any connected device including desktop, tablets, mobile devices and more.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed optimization service and data lake, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Work with Data Scientists to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Software Engineer- Search at Sonian, Inc. (Dedham, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Profile


This position is with the core platform team at Sonian. We have one of the largest installations of Elasticsearch in the world and we’re looking for somebody who can help us manage all our data.



What You’ll Do




    Help design and develop this platform and its component services, using technologies like Clojure, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Pedestal, and Datomic




    Spearhead new indexing designs and approaches for greater speed and efficiency of searches, lower cost, and greater ability to meet customer demand for new archive capabilities




    Contribute features and bug fixes to Elasticsearch and plugins, or to other software systems




    Work closely with developers who build the applications that turn our platform into powerful tools for users and partners, and with the support organization that keeps it humming



    Be on a team that values code quality, good communication tools, a carefully polished remote pairing experience, sound testing practices and diverse opportunities for mentoring

item.title: Software Engineer at Colony American Homes (Scottsdale, AZ)
item.description:
Job Summary


The primary purpose of this position is to developi and building web and mobile applications using some or all of the following technologies: JavaScript, Node.JS, Angular.JS, Python, PHP, Objective-C etc.


Essential Functions



  • Develop and direct software system testing and validation procedures, programming, and documentation

  • Write Code primarily using Javascript/NodeJS

  • Continuously design, develop and deploy backend services with focus on high availability, low latency and scalability

  • Measure and evaluate features and system metrics to continuously improve user experience and service performance

  • Work closely with Product Owners, Quality Assurance and other teams in an agile environment about software system design and maintenance.

  • Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.


Minimum Requirements



  • Bachelor's Degree

  • Experienced working in a Agile development environment

  • Proficient in Javascript or other programming languages.

  • Experienced in NodeJS and asynchronous programming

  • Experienced in Linux-Unix systems, particularly on AWS Extensive experience building applications with PostgresSQL

  • Skilled at processing and analyzing large data sets

  • Experience working with distributed and scalable systems and high-volume transaction applications

  • Good understanding of system design, data structures and algorithms

  • You’re literate in contemporary web API design such as REST, hypermedia, profiles, and relations.

  • Ability to write unit tests


Working Conditions



  • Office environment with no exposures.

  • Computer, keyboard, telephone, fax machine and copier

  • Occasional overtime.

item.title: Software Engineer (Javascript, ASP.NET, React and/or SQL) at Applied Statistics & Management Inc (Temecula, CA)
item.description: We are looking for an individual to build multi-tier enterprise software used by hundreds of healthcare organizations worldwide. Technologies include ASP.NET, nodejs, C#, Swift, SQL, Javascript, CSS and HTML. You will be working with small, focused teams in a creative and collaborative environment. You will also have the opportunity to work with healthcare specific data exchange technology (HL7, X12, etc.). All of our team members are customer facing, therefore we require a high level of professional acumen and excellent communication skills.

item.title: Lead Software Developer, Red Bull Data Services at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
As a global media company, Red Bull Media House produces, publishes, distributes and licenses high-quality programming. Millions of viewers around the globe experience our TV and video products through Red Bull TV, a global digital video service with a growing portfolio of applications on key platforms including Apple TV, Xbox, Chromecast, iOS, Android, Amazon Fire TV as well as select Smart TV devices.


The Lead engineer within the Red Bull TV data services group will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data collection, collation and analysis services to support the operation of the TV platform. The data will include video reporting, social streams, web content; click stream and application level elements. Outputs from this data will include recommendations, real time dashboards, quality of services insights, event reporting as well as several other business level reporting requirements.

item.title: Software Engineer at Soylent (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Software Engineer Position


Soylent’s engineers build software to help get Soylent into customers hands as quickly and easily as possible. You’ll be tasked with creating tools to help with many aspects of e-commerce companies that operate at our scale. Projects in our pipeline include creating a robust order management system, integrating various data sources from 3rd party services into our backend databases, improving our internal business intelligence reporting tools, implementing processes to make our operating teams more effective, growing our e-commerce management tooling, and more.


We try to be as language agnostic as possible, choosing to work with the best tools and languages for the job (Although we really like Python and JavaScript). Scaling to meet consumer demand for Soylent will require engineers with knowledge in diverse areas such as building out our internal dev-ops tools or working closely with UX designers and frontend engineers to create great software experiences.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop software with high level scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, etc.

  • Integrating with existing databases and APIs for payments and shipping

  • Building internal APIs for use by our frontend clients

  • Selecting frameworks, packages, and services 

  • Securing the data and privacy of all of our customers

  • Site analytics and usability testing

  • Working closely with UX designers, frontend developers, and 3rd parties

  • Building out our internal Postgres databases

  • Building devops and QA tools to increase internal development speed, reliability and efficiency

  • Ownership of projects that interest you

item.title: Sr Site Reliability Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Would you like to work on one of the world’s hottest advertising technology platforms? Do you revel in the challenge of managing web-scale services and their underlying infrastructure, including thousands of globally distributed servers? Do you enjoy combining your software engineering, networking, and systems administration experience and expertise to build highly available, reliable, secure, and performant services? Are you passionate about DevOps?


OpenX, a leading provider of digital and mobile advertising technology, seeks a Sr Site Reliability Engineer to join our Application Engineering team responsible for the operability and support of OpenX systems and services. OpenX serves hundreds of thousands of requests per second from thousands of servers across a worldwide datacenter footprint.


You will take a proactive approach to maintain and improve service uptime and you will scale our systems for continued rapid growth. You will take part in the design of our services and be an active participant in the software development lifecycle, partnering with software engineers and product to deliver a world-class service. Additionally, you will handle planned or unplanned maintenance events and will execute a consistent software release process.


You ideally have experience with large-scale management of thousands of physical servers. You have excellent communication skills that enable you to collaborate with varying disciplines, both technical and non-technical. You are a self-starter, able to self-manage with minimal supervision, and have demonstrated the ability to lead groups to the right decision.


Developing for and supporting our infrastructure presents many interesting technical challenges. We especially desire candidates with a passion for open-source software and an interest in the latest system architecture trends, for example: OpenStack, Docker, CoreOS, Dais, Flynn, or other container-based or PaaS solutions.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Syrinx Consulting Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Job Type: Contract or Contract-to-Hire


Over the past few years, the development and operations landscape has changed dramatically. The DevOps movement has shortened release cycles, increased automation, and created new tool chains to support an elastic, software-defined "modern infrastructure". These changes expand the threat surface for many organizations. Managing permissions for and distribution of critical secrets (e.g., SSH keys, SSL certificates, and API access tokens) is essential to protecting organizational and customer information. 



We are currently looking for Cloud Platform / DevOps Engineers to innovate upon the way our partners deploy, test, and develop their industry-leading software.



Our local partners include: a Cambridge based university, an educational technology firm, and an app analytics company.



These organizations are challenged to keep up with the demand of change requests to IT systems and services. The problem is the current workload, what is referred to as a “keeping the lights on” (KTLO) focus. This creates a backlog of projects that slows down innovation. We’re currently helping our customer with the Upskilling, Retooling, and Restructuring of their teams as they focus on a number of strategic initiatives that Advance Agility for DLCs and Administrative Units, Enable the IT Community, and Advance Business Process Excellence. Engineers within these organizations are solving problems in distributed computing, infrastructure automation, big data, and data visualization. Their rapid growth challenges them to continually evolve how they manage their infrastructure as they roll out new application services.



Here are some of the engineers we are currently looking for:



Cloud Platform - IaaS Engineer:


- Extensive experience with at least one of the following Cloud APIs : OpenStack, vCloud Air, vSphere, or AWS


- Strong Ruby or Python scripting experience


- Software-defined networking experience 



Cloud Platform - Automation Engineer:


- Extensive experience working with Puppet (modules, roles, profiles); ideally automating OS 


- Redhat Enterprise Linux v6 or greater administration, tuning, life-cycle management


- Strong Ruby or Python scripting experience



Cloud Platform - Operations


-Must have Linux Systems Admin. Puppet configuarion. Apache. SSL administrator


-VMware and VMsphere is a plus/ Comfort level with coding


-Systems Admin background is ideal. Must have great comm skills


Cloud Platforms - Identity & Access Management
-Looking for experience implementing the following authentication protocols (with preferred implementations in parentheses): Kerberos/GSSAPI (MIT, Heimdal, AD), SAML (Shibboleth), OAuth, OpenID
-Requires working knowledge of two or more programming languages: C or C++ and one or more of Python, Java, Perl, or PL/SQL
- Solid understanding of UNIX concepts and standard UNIX APIs


Cloud Platforms – Implementation
-Pilot testing for new on premise and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications.
-Working understanding of public cloud platforms, both infrastructure as a service (Amazon AWS) and platform as a service, i.e. Heroku, preferred.
-Experience supporting RESTful web APIs.
-Experience supporting SOAP-based APIs.
-Experience supporting SAML and OAuth2 authentication protocols.


Requirements



  • Manage our deployments, testing, and continuous integration infrastructure

  • Develop and maintain the infrastructure automation

  • 4+ years of experience running production web systems

  • Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux based systems

  • Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS or Azure

  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently

  • An understanding of OS and distributed systems concepts

  • Mastery of some of these software tools including git, Chef, Ruby, Ubuntu Linux, Amazon EC2, Munin, Monit, Jenkins, and MongoDB


You Might Be A Good Fit If You…



  • Have automated systems using Chef

  • Have automated web server and database deployments

  • Would rather automate than perform the same action manually many times

  • Are proficient in Ruby

  • Are proficient with GNU/Linux, particularly Ubuntu and CentOS

  • Are self directed and can identify areas for improvement in the infrastructure

  • Are obsessed with high-availability

  • Believe in DevOps

  • Understand how to tweak Linux for performance

  • Understand operating systems and storage technologies like LVM, RAID, and file systems

  • Are proficient in a virtualized cloud environment

  • Enjoy reading about DevOps practices

item.title: Software Engineer, Systems at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. You are a software engineer who can write server-side code for web-based applications, for both internal and external use. You are comfortable and enjoy working on the full development stack - both backend and frontend. You are also a well-rounded developer who knows how to create robust high-volume production applications, and can develop prototypes quickly. The work is challenging, creative, fast paced and intellectually stimulating.

item.title: Implementation Developer at Stevens Capital Management LP (Wayne, PA)
item.description:
Stevens Capital Management LP (“SCM”) is a registered investment adviser with more than sixty employees that manages a multi-billion dollar hedge fund that has been in business for 20+ years.


SCM specializes in the rigorous development and disciplined implementation of empirically based quantitative trading strategies. Our highly productive team works in a fast-paced collegial environment, utilizing extensive data sets, technology and the scientific method to devise and employ trading strategies throughout the world’s most liquid financial markets.


We’re looking for exceptional candidates for the following position:


Implementation Software Developer


We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our trading strategy implementation and performance analysis platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote, order and financial data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • Professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Perl, Bash or CSH is a plus.

  • Experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server and Oracle is a plus.

  • Experience with GUI design is a plus.

item.title: C++ Developer for Low Latency Trading at Arbillon Capital AG (Wollerau, Switzerland)
item.description: Arbillon Capital AG (www.arbillon.com) is looking to add a software engineer to its low latency algorithmic trading group. The candidate will focus on further development, maintenance and improving the real-time performance of the trading system across software, network and hardware components.

item.title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
item.description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

item.title: C# Software Developer at Volant Trading (New York, NY)
item.description: We are looking for a talented and motivated software engineer to join our development team. The candidate would focus mainly on the front end of our real time trading system in C# and may also work in C++ on the server side, which assembles and distributes data to the front end. This job is technically demanding due to the huge amount of data that needs to be processed in real time.

item.title: Sr. Quality Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are searching for a senior-level engineer to be a part of our overall quality assurance and software testing efforts.  You will be responsible for verifying different aspects of our ad platform, with a primary focus on automated test development.  This includes building test harnesses, as well as writing test scripts in Java.  You will work side-by-side with our development team in an Agile environment.

Candidates should have a passion for quality and an interest in testing on high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will be working with a Java application stack that leverages open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for test automation that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build and extend custom test harnesses to validate proper behavior of our Real-Time-Bidding engine

  • Develop automated scripts to simulate and validate 3rd party integrations

  • Work with application engineers to ensure monitors provide visibility and feedback on Key Performance parameters in production environment

  • Design creative approaches to solving technical challenges dealing with high volume, low latency data workflows

  • Be the gatekeeper for production releases and point person for investigating any related issues

  • Organize and conduct test planning meetings with engineers and product managers

  • Establishing performance benchmarks and automating the verification of this benchmark as part of the continuous delivery system

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Elevated Careers) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
As a founding member of our new Job Compatibility Engineering Team, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer. You will work our product to develop the next generation of matching technologies to power eHarmony’s new Job Compatibility product for job seekers and recruiters. Our mission is to provide candidate users with an entirely new way to find jobs that fit their skills at companies with which they are profoundly compatible, and recruiters to find talent that will truly thrive in their new positions. You will work on the technology that will bring this mission to life.


As the Senior Software Engineer you will:


Drive the development of an entirely new enterprise website



  • Work with internal and external resources to implement and integrate new and existing systems

  • Create modules to extract features and signals from diverse data collections

  • Process large data logs to detect patterns and insights

  • Build tools to improve the targeting and relevance of eHarmony’s job matching platform

  • Work with Machine Learning specialists, Product Management and QA Teams to deliver reliable, high-performance systems

item.title: Operations Engineer | DevOps at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


Wikimedia is seeking a DevOps engineer to work on the Analytics team to help maintain and build infrastructure used to measure Wikipedia’s reach and impact.  DevOps engineers work with software engineers, technical operations, product managers and researchers to ensure they have the Big Data tools they need to improve Wikipedia for hundred of millions of people around the world.


Description



  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting) on many aspects of Wikimedia’s analytics infrastructure

  • Assist in the research, design, and implementation of Wikimedia analytics infrastructure and services

  • Implement and utilize configuration management and deployment tools (specifically puppet, salt)

  • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams

  • Incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

  • Write and update internal documentation of systems and processes

item.title: Software Engineer/Senior Software Engineer at Pax Technology Inc (Jacksonville, FL)
item.description:
PAX Technology, Inc. is a global payment technology provider, ranked the top 3 in the world! We offer a competitive compensation package and a unique team environment where innovative new processes assist everyone's productivity. We are currently seeking several Software Engineers (entry level to senior level) for our Jacksonville office. This highly motivated individual will lead the testing of mission critical payment processing technology. Our development environment is agile, with a test driven development philosophy.


Applicants must meet the following profile:


- College Degree in Computer Science/CIS or equivalent.


- Fresh graduate in Computer Science/CIS is welcome; training will be provided.


- More experience in writing code will be considered as Senior Software Engineer 


- Good team worker and open communicator.


- Detail-oriented and patient.


Main duties and responsibilities:


- Working with tech support team and development team about quality issue of application


- Observing, testing, diagnosing and reporting faults in the software and hardware


Computer languages: C/C++, C#, Java, Javascript 



If you think you qualify and will thrive in a busy and fast growing firm, please send a cover letter, resume and include the position applied for in the subject line. Please also include your current and expected salary as well as date available to start. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.


Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Software Architect - 803 at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Have you delivered Software as a Service that truly scaled and experienced first-hand the challenges of rolling out new services? Would you like to do it again, working with “Big Data” and the “Internet of Things” to shape a new initiative within a true world class leader?


Cambridge Consultants is a fantastic place to work and is home to some of the most talented engineers and scientists active in connected devices and data analytics across a wide range of sectors.


Main purpose of the job


To be the lead software and technical architect for cloud based platforms that connect devices and deliver digital services, with particular focus on secure and scalable systems that deliver flexible Software as a Service business models.


Work within multi-disciplinary teams of highly talented people from around the globe that drive changes in technology to deliver novel solutions to the everyday needs of individuals and corporations alike.


About Digital Services


Digital Services is an exciting area within Cambridge Consultants; one that builds on the extensive range of work by the company in connected devices, data analytics and integrated systems across many sectors and with clients from around the world. Working closely with other groups in Cambridge Consultants we seek to deliver exciting new services in medical, consumer and industrial sectors as well as to drive forward the servitization of the company’s own IP.


We combine excellent technical and commercial skills with robust service design and evaluation methods and a broad base of industry experience to form a powerful development team. Our work ranges from undertaking complete service platform development and operations from concept, pilots and commercial launch, through to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, product offering and future strategy.


Specific responsibilities


Develop solutions for connected devices where scalable, flexible and secure software platforms, service availability and security of personal data are vital.


Technically guide multi-disciplinary project teams of Engineers, Consultants and Designers to realise your design.


To liaise with clients to understand their technical needs and use your strong technical expertise to prepare proposals which capture and structure these requirements clearly.


Apply your knowledge of the state-of-the-art software tools and techniques to ensure standards-compliant design that takes advantage of the latest thinking in database systems, open innovation and federated identity management.


Use your development experience to drive a robust and agile approach to software development, testing, documentation and deployment of live commercial services.

item.title: Software Engineer .Net at Canada's Motorcycle (Montréal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Canada's Motorcycle is looking for an experienced software developer to join our team. In this position, you will be responsible for building applications that will have a major impact on the operations of the company.


The applications you develop will automate processes across every department including:



  • order management (payment processing, fraud detection, purchasing)

  • warehouse management (logistics, pick & pack tools)

  • marketing (who knows what these guys really do...)

  • data management (we have LOTS of data)

  • reporting (are we making money??? ;)


You will work on everything from architecting the application, to creating the frontend and developing the backend (basically the full stack). 


So, if you enjoy working on a wide set of problems, having a big influence on the direction of the product you are building, working with a group of smart people (it's hard to be modest :), and are obsessed with writing clean/scalable/maintainable code, then we totally want you.

item.title: Systems Engineer & Devops at TAPTAP Networks S.L. (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
• AWS experienced System administrator will participate in the daily monitoring, management, troubleshooting and issue resolution, as assigned, including but not limited to: OS, network, hardware, access and security, application Servers and log management.

  • Act as subject matter expert on Amazon Web Services Platform (AWS) 

  • Will support Servers hosted by Amazon 

  • Provide cross training and/or knowledge transfer to colleagues as necessary, particularly on the AWS platform 

  • Continuously improve our visibility into our systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics and log analytics

  • Identify root causes on critical problems throughout the platform, and take necessary steps to resolve them

  • Create, and follow up on site incident reports with other members of the engineering team and see them through to resolution

  • Document processes and procedure in managing the infrastructure (JIRA, Confluence) making sure best practices are always followed where applicable

item.title: C# Software Engineer Contractors needed at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for excellent C# contractors!


Over the next six months we have a number of key deadlines to hit and are looking for contractors to work within our agile teams to help us build out new functionality and features, whilst maintaining our current production systems.


Our system will be cloud based (AWS) and will use SQL Server and non-relational databases to process, store, report and display large volumes of data.


We will require you to work within our Bristol office, functioning as a normal team member for a period of 3 to 6 months.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at R2integrated (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
POSITION SUMMARY


Work with engineering team to develop web based applications.  Document, track and provide updates on project status.  Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer sessions.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB



  • Provide progress updates to team lead/project manager

  • Create/maintain data integration efforts within a Java Content Repository (JCR)

  • Work with and extend existing components to implement client requirements.

  • Design/Develop custom components.

  • Assist with creation of interfaces to external data sources


OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Assist in training of new staff

  • Provide technical support for clients.
