item.title: Senior Web Developer at Manalto Inc (Reston, VA)
item.description:
We're looking for a brilliant, strong, creative and motivated engineer who will thrive in a start-up environment and can contribute, innovate and deliver a unique SaaS solution for Social Media. Successful candidates should enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and strive to succeed! This position will report directly to the Lead Engineer and will be located in Reston, VA.


Responsibilities 


Responsible for implementation and testing of our core product components
Work in a team-oriented environment to develop complex web-based applications
Think creatively and work independently and with others, as needed
Create technical design and document development work.
Participate in technical discussions.
Come up with innovative ways to improve the product and process.
Troubleshoot issues with application, technologies and infrastructure

item.title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: Software Engineer at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for software engineers who enjoy writing python to work on the huge technical challenges that come with building the world’s leading fashion commerce site.


As a software engineer you will ensure that the platform continues to over exceed shoppers expectations, helping us to constantly release new features and improve functionality. You will work in a product-led cross-discipline team on everything from helping to choose the best tools and frameworks to working with design and product exciting new features. You will have a huge chance to influence the way code, culture and product are built at Lyst.


At the heart of Lyst is a huge data aggregator that lists millions of fashion products from hundreds of retailers. On top of this we build systems that help people discover and follow their favourite fashion brands, ensuring that all of our users are inspired and happy throughout their shopping experience.


As a software engineer at Lyst some of the thing you will be working on:



  • Building real products that fix real world problems, predominantly in a Python based technology stack.

  • The huge challenges that come from working with a database with over 9 million products and a spider architecture performing 3.8 million updates a day.

  • Exposure to product specific teams fixing problems like; Shopping personalisation, Universal Checkout System, Marketing automation technology, PaaS, Our own Data Analytics platform, a new search function and personalisation etc

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Our universal checkout system that allows our users to find any item of clothing from any retailer on our platform, in stock, in their size and ready to buy.

  • Our internal and external REST API’s

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.

item.title: Senior Website Operations Engineer, Web Core at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Web Core team owns quantcast.com and keeps it running smoothly for the 1M+ visitors it gets every month.  We also develop and maintain the shared application infrastructure used by other teams within the organization to develop externally facing applications. Some of these tools include authentication, authorization, navigation panels, load balancing, A/B infrastructure, deployment services as well as supporting our Wordpress marketing site.

As a senior operations engineer, you will have an opportunity to drive architectural decisions and develop our A/B infrastructure, deployment systems, load-testing infrastructure, monitoring and performance. The team includes both operations and software engineers and you will be expected to code review and develop cross-functionally, expect to see Java, Python, Go and Javascript on a regular basis. Working in a team with several internal customers will give you the opportunity to have a major impact on the success of our large-scale web applications and their development.

As our ideal candidate for this role, you will have significant experience testing and maintaining mission-critical web applications. You will be adept at finding bottlenecks, analyzing performance, tuning alerts, identifying single points of failure and deploying software in a zero downtime manner. You will know how to achieve 5 nines and will be pushing the team to design to get there.

Our toolchain involves Java Play Framework applications, HAProxy, NGINX, Jenkins, Puppet, Consul.io, Terraform and Fabric. We are moving our infrastructure from physical hardware to EC2 over the coming months and intend to move toward a continuous deployment system as well.


Responsibilities



  • Deploy, monitor, and administer a high profile website and its underlying critical services

  • Develop innovative solutions to large-scale data transfer challenges

  • Improve the performance of our web applications and solve scaling issues

  • Develop automation and improvements to our deployment, monitoring, and testing processes

  • Serve on our on-call rotation with other engineers on the team

item.title: Software Engineer (learning golang!) at Permission Data (New York, NY)
item.description:
@Permission Data we are in the process of completely overhauling our tech stack. We've chosen Go as our primary implementation language, and are creating a scale-able microservice architecture.


Have you heard all about go but not had a chance to try it out? Have you played around with it on side projects but not been able to use it at your work?

This is your opportunity. We are a small team who is using go for our next generation platform and we are looking for interested, talented developers from mid to senior level.


Work will encompass the full stack. For the front end we are using aurelia.io. On the database side we use what is most appropriate for the service. Currently that means we have postgres, mysql, and redis, with cassandra soon to follow.

We are automating our pipeline with saltstack, DCOS, Marathon, and Drone.


The team is small (9 people), so you have the ability to make a big impact. We do a lunch and learn every other Wednesday, but are constantly pushing each other to learn more in our slack channels. 

We believe in a healthy work-life balance, and use agile practices to facilitate that.


We believe in contributing to open source.


We are unable to sponsor any visas at this time.

item.title: VP Software Development at CoheroHealth (New York, NY)
item.description: We are seeking an organized, hard-working individual to lead our software development team to build products across Android, iOS and our back end server.  You will help architect design of our software, lead an agile release process, drive product and feature prioritization, and oversee development.  You will manage our external team of software engineers to set the technical vision, guide code architecture, ensure quality of work and make sure deadlines are met.  The applicant must have strong technical abilities to be able to evaluate code, along with project management skills to develop and stick to development timelines.

item.title: Software Engineer at Hachi Labs (Bangalore, India)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Hachi!


WE:
- at http://gohachi.com - are solving the problem of how people find and reach out to each other - a google map for people and relationships.
- Use PHP, MySQL, Neo4j, Sphinx, AWS, Git
- Are seeing excellent user-traction
- Have 41M+ people on Hachi. And their Billion+ relationships.
- Featured by MIT Tech Review, Techcrunch, Business Insider, and others
- Recipient of California Excellence Award 2013 (for software), Nominee World Technology Award 2012 (presented in association w/ TIME, CNN, Fortune, Technology Review, Science & Kurzweil AI; co nominees - Instagram, Pinterest)
- Have tons of data-engineering and data-science problems for you to solve.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING TO DO -
- We have some technical debt that we accumulated - blame it on inexperience, hurry to keep up with user-growth, adding more features, etc. Now we want to fix things and put a rock solid platform for future growth.
- Oh, and we cannot stop scaling, so we need to re-architect things while meeting demand-growth.
- And we also need to add new features, to keep our competitive edge.


YOU:
- Cringe when you look at bad code and bad practices. But instead of complaining, you set things right, even educate others
- Are a really strong developer, with 4-6 years of experience (2-3 years of PHP experience highly preferred)
- Have experience with database / query tuning and performance.
- Polyglots get bonus points. Experience across different types of languages gets mega-bonus points. Open source contributors get a red-carpet welcome to the interview.
- Have experience working with a legacy system and then incrementally re-architecting things, adding tests, etc.
- Are disciplined about unit testing, continuous-integration and other good habits (honestly, we are not yet there and we'd like your help)
- Are a good communicator.
- Believe in data-driven decisions.


IF INTERESTED:
Check out the product and give us your critical analysis. Share your Github profile along with resume. Email at: careers@gohachi.com.

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Machine Learning at Workday (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
SYMAN is the agile data-engineering team within Workday. We build predictive analytics into Workday’s applications to help the world’s largest companies make strategic decisions about their people and finances. We are the former Identified team recently acquired by Workday.


This is an opportunity to contribute to the technology behind data normalization, search relevance, recommendation systems, and machine learning. And you’ll need to accomplish all this while achieving horizontal scalability and high availability.


We have retained our startup culture and are continuing to apply our agile principles within the larger organization. We don’t believe in QA for the kind of work we do, so the burden of quality falls on the developers. We practice scrum, pair programming, extensive automated testing, and continuous deployment. We expect that you have 3-5 years’ experience and a CS related degree.


Does this describe you working on a new generation data development team in a fast pace environment? If yes, please apply!

item.title: Write Code, Learn from the Best, Change the World! at Literacy Bridge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you want to learn and apply a broad range of technologies while helping the world’s poorest people avoid hunger and deadly diseases, then this unique opportunity may be for you. Through partnerships with organizations like UNICEF, Literacy Bridge uses technology to help people in some of the world’s most remote villages, often without electricity, learn to grow more food and stay healthy.  We do this today for 175,000 people; with your help, we will reach millions more.


You will be Literacy Bridge’s first full-time software engineer, working in a startup-like environment with the mentorship of volunteer senior engineers from places like Twitter, BMW, Zillow, Groupon, Tableau Software, and the Apache Software Foundation. You will work on a broad range of projects such as our:



  • Java-based audio content management system to allow people around the world to contribute local-language audio recordings of health and agriculture knowledge


  • Java-based usage statistics data gathering system integrated with visual data analysis and reporting


  • C-based firmware of our Talking Book audio computer, a battery-operated device with an innovative audio-based interface and the ability to conduct and track quizzes on knowledge retention


Note about working remotely: To work remotely, we would require an initial 3-6 months in Seattle, U.S., and ongoing semi-annual visits for one or two weeks.


You would also have the opportunity to travel to Ghana to meet with our users, partners, and local staff.

item.title: Senior .Net Software Engineer at Utilant, LLC (Buffalo, NY)
item.description: Development is our product.  The developers at Utilant like using the state of the art technology available here.  They are responsible for building, testing, debugging and troubleshooting software programs for database, applications, tools, networks to support business initiatives and customer needs.  Working in an Agile/Scrum environment, candidates will implement and maintain business applications using the skills listed.

item.title: Lead Application Developer (Java) at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
With ADP building a start up culture in Pasadena we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Labs is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


We are seeking diverse Java Engineering talent with different experiences, backgrounds, education, creative expertise, technical acumen, etc. that will offer new perspectives and challenge convention as we focus on the future of ADP for years to come.


The Lead Software Engineer will work in a team of Java engineers to create scalable and robust SmartCompliance backend applications and services. We are using the Java with Spring framework building RESTful webservices and other application services. This is the perfect time for an enthusiastic engineer to add your knowledge of API's, RESTful webservices and various technologies to the team so that we can deliver a superior user experience to ADP SmartCompliance users!


We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Join a team of talented software engineers, plan, execute and deliver top quality software deliverables on-time.

  • Act as a primary, dedicated technology interface owning the technical responsibility for architecture, analysis, design, development, and implementation of responsive user interface. 

  • Work closely with product to define and implement and improve user experience.

  • Overall, you will be responsible for day-to-day task management and sprint planning, working closely with product and stakeholders, participating in design sessions, leading and mentoring engineers to ensure that they follow best practices and guidelines, performing heads-down development, working on technical integrations with frontend UIs and other Backend APIs, and working with QA to assure top quality deliverables on-time.

item.title: Web Software Engineer - Equities Technology at BATS Chi-X Europe (London, UK)
item.description:
You will be a highly motivated developer who will build and maintain a broad range of web applications that perform a critical role in allowing our team to control, monitor and analyse our cutting-edge trading platform. Some of our web applications process millions of requests a day and are used by our members and the investing public for presenting high quality market data.


You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing these high-performance, scalable, data-driven web applications with professional browser-based interfaces using Javascript, CSS, SQL and Python.


You will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and thrive in an environment where you deliver quality code into production on a frequent basis. We are aggressive and agile. We care about code quality. We care about testing. We care about automation. We care about the user experience.

item.title: GO Software Engineer - Machine Learning Startup at Voleon Capital Management (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
You will architect and implement new production trading systems, machine learning infrastructure, data integration pipelines, and large-scale storage systems. The firm researches and deploys systematic trading strategies designed to generate attractive returns without being dependent on the performance of the overall market.


We seek candidates with a proven track record of writing correct, well-designed software, solving hard problems, and delivering complex projects on time. You should preferably have experience designing and implementing fault-tolerant distributed systems. Experience with building large-scale data infrastructure, stream processing systems, or latency-sensitive programs is a bonus.



The above job description is just a starting point in terms of possible duties and seniority. We can be very flexible for the right person.

item.title: Software Engineer at Prometheus Research (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
• Plan, document, build and test Facebook’s React (Javascript Toolkit) enhanced components for our template-driven web application



  • Work with business process analysts to refine user requirements and translate them into a technical plan

  • Engage directly with clients onsite, on customization projects using open-source RexDB framework



  • Participate in design discussions about overall functionality and architecture

  • Report on progress to relevant stakeholders; keep JIRA issue tracker accurate with progress



  • Assist with delivery of semi-custom applications to customers, which may involve developing prototype functionality not yet available in the main product stack

item.title: iOS Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Swift and/or Objective-C developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch. Your primary focus will be the development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services, although some projects may require you to handle all technical aspects, including leveraging BaaS solutions such as Parse. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform.

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Apptio (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Position:


Help us create our market-defining SaaS enterprise applications! In this role, you will be responsible for designing and delivering a variety of exciting and challenging user-facing functionality. For example, our work includes interactive modeling, business intelligence and creating an extensible applications framework. The right candidate will be a solid JavaScript developer, collaborate exceptionally, have a knack for delivering appealing UI and demand a high-performance environment.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, cross-functional, agile environment.

  • Team with product management to define desired capabilities.

  • Design and deliver those capabilities with state-of-the art rich interfaces in JavaScript.

  • Contribute procedures, tools and practices to optimize team productivity.

  • Analyze problems from internal and external customers, debug and provide fixes.

  • Deliver initial quality, design for automated test-ability, and write unit tests.

  • Essential Qualifications and Experience:

  • Passion, energy and the desire to work very hard to deliver cool software.

  • Object-oriented software engineering with Java and JavaScript.

  • Complex object (data) models and business rules.

  • Large scale, data-driven web business applications, preferably SaaS.

  • Rich user interfaces with web 2.0 technology such as BI, graphical manipulation or complex tabular UIs.

  • Collaborative work style; effective communication; cross-functional teamwork.

  • Able to work with product management, field staff and customers to clarify requirements.

  • Experience delivering commercial software; familiarity with common roles and responsibilities, product and release life cycle, source code and change management, etc.

  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be a part of a small, geographically distributed, cross-functional DevOps team that is massively scaling icflix Solutions cutting edge streaming platform infrastructure. This team is committed to delivering the highest systems uptime and operations transparency. The global team provides a matrix approach to 24x7 infrastructure engineering and support services.


Do you crave the adrenaline rush of supporting the production infrastructure that powers MENA’s first online streaming platforms offering thousands of hours of Arabic, Hollywood, Bollywood content to over 400 million people?  Are you a fanatic when it comes to quashing operational inefficiencies in web infrastructure?  Do you get a kick out of automating routine tasks with a few lines of code? Do you exemplify the ethic of, “If you have to do something more than once, automate it”?

item.title: C / C++ Software Engineer at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!


Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and government.  

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk, and ensure compliance.


Tenable is looking for a highly motivated C/C++ Software Engineer to join the Development team for the Log Correlation Engine (LCE) product. The Log Correlation Engine processes, classifies, stores, and correlates log data for customers to identify and eliminate network threats. 


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Plan, design, implement, and test features and improvements to the core of the Log Correlation Engine.

  • Collaborate with the technical lead, Research, and QA teams to produce coherent and comprehensive software solutions.

  • Work with log data, vulnerability data, and security logs to improve and expand existing capabilities.

  • Develop innovative object-oriented, reusable, and stable code, and deliver solutions on schedule in an Agile environment.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Business Enablement team, you will help design, develop, and maintain the processes and tools that enable Code42 to achieve its objectives and better serve our users, both internal and external. You will make a difference throughout the company by making others more efficient and providing new capabilities. You will help other developers design effective solutions and lend the benefits of your experience to new challenges. You will provide insight into application architecture and help evaluate 3rd party solutions for business needs. You will integrate, innovate, and have a good time while doing so. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



  • Designing and implementing software solutions for assigned projects, both independently and with teammates.

  • Writing unit and integration tests.

  • Testing, debugging, and troubleshooting data and software issues.

  • Documenting code and design, and reviewing code and design docs from others.

  • Estimating tasks and providing status updates when needed

  • Synthesizing requirements into cohesive designs while identifying gaps and contradictions.

  • Identifying improvements in our current systems and processes.

  • Collaborating with teammates and end users to deliver the right solution.

  • Participating in design discussions and code reviews.

  • Getting to know our systems and processes.

  • Helping to mentor and guide more junior developers.

item.title: Engineering Manager - Billing & Payments Infrastructure at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio is seeking an Engineering Manager for our Billing & Payments Infrastructure team. This is a leadership role, reporting to the Sr. Engineering Manager of Billing & User Data, focused on nurturing and expanding a team of engineers, providing people management, and driving projects to successful, on-time delivery through our agile process.


About the job:


Twilio is a company built by developers for developers. You must not only have the professional expertise to understand your team’s engineering and business challenges, but also the technical acumen to build great software.


Responsibilities:



  • Partner with the Technical Lead to make long-term architectural decisions about Twilio's micro-transaction platform.

  • Take personal responsibility as the delivery manager and set clear expectations for Finance and R&D billing integrations.

  • Work directly with Technical Lead and Product Manager to track velocity and plan sprints for the engineering team.

  • Manage & grow a world-class team of engineers that think about the customer experience.

  • Own quarterly deliverables with highly-visible and effective communications with Senior Management in R&D and Finance departments.

  • Manage your direct reports in an empathetic, high-touch way, including weekly/bi-weekly 1:1s. Coach and unblock them on a daily basis. Encourage and teach them to drive to complete key objectives. Assist in their longer term career and skills development. Excite them with new challenges and opportunities.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - (Full Stack .NET and AngularJS) at comScore, Inc. (Reston, VA)
item.description:
The comScore Survey Tech team is looking for a full stack Senior .NET Software Engineer who is familiar with all layers in software development. You will design and build high-scale applications that process large datasets and develop web applications for internal/external users. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, where we iterate quickly and work with cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.



Essential Duties:



  • Participate in the requirements gathering, design and development of new systems to be incorporated into and improve the existing processing environment

  • Design and build scalable, high availability web services and portals

  • Work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

  • Manage multiple assignments and balance workload according to priorities

  • Collaborate and mentor team members to identify and implement project solutions



comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a global leader in digital measurement and analytics, delivering insights on web, mobile and TV consumer behavior that enable clients to maximize the value of their digital investments.



Through its Audience Analytics, Advertising Analytics, and Enterprise Analytics product suites, comScore provides its clients with a variety of on-demand software, real-time analytics and custom solutions to succeed in a multi-platform world. The proprietary comScore Census Network™ (CCN) leverages a world-class technology infrastructure to capture trillions of digital interactions a month and power big data analytics on a global scale for its more than 2,000 clients, which include leading companies such as AOL, Baidu, BBC, Best Buy, Carat, Deutsche Bank, ESPN, France Telecom, Financial Times, Fox, LinkedIn, Microsoft, MediaCorp, Nestle, Starcom, Terra Networks, Universal McCann, Verizon, ViaMichelin and Yahoo!.



We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Software Engineer II at Mishimoto Automotive (New Castle, DE)
item.description:
The Software Engineer is responsible for overseeing all database activity, project coordination, and report development. They are responsible for planning, processing and performing all jobs in an efficient manner with no assistance from the supervisor. They will be working closely with senior management to carry out strategic goals.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Analyzes, coordinates and supervises the development and implementation of third party software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.

  • Creates reports from data stored in SQL Databases, as requested by Management.

  • Responsible for analysis of current programs including performance, diagnosis and troubleshooting of problem programs, and designing solutions to problematic programming. In addition, carries out enhancements and additional system requests to current programs.

  • Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.

  • Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.

  • Maintains current systems by ensuring that all software and hardware is up to date, as well as backs-up all systems to ensure that data is never lost.

  • Responsible for communicating with manufacturer's technical support staff regarding programming needs and performance.

  • Documents code consistently throughout the development process by listing a description of the program, special instructions, and any changes made in database tables on procedural, modular and database level.

  • Researches and recommends software tools to management.

  • Protects operations by keeping information confidential.

item.title: Software Engineer - Medical Mobile Apps at InSpark Technologies Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We seek a mobile engineer with a love of Android and iOS mobile development. Yours will be a pivotal role at the company with a high degree of influence over architectural and design decisions as well as responsibility for delivering high-quality, production-ready code within our regulatory and quality framework.


As a foundational member of the engineering team you will be primarily responsible for developing:


1.     The front-end for our iOS, Android and web applications for patients and their health care providers;


2.     On-device database management and local capture of user health information from connected medical devices and wearables.


3.     In conjunction with other developers, data transfer mechanisms to back-end systems for capturing, storing and managing all related health information.


You will be expected to verify your code through a variety of methods and work closely with other members of the team to perform system testing and validation studies.


As a lean start-up, our work environment emphasizes collaboration over supervision: We all know what we need to achieve and expect employees to work towards that end, individually and as a team. This role therefore has a high degree of individual responsibility attached to it. You will be expected to be self-motivated and have the confidence to share and pursue your ideas for how to achieve high-quality results in an efficient manner with limited direct supervision.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Python) at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you the missing link between our IT Operations and Trading departments? Do you get excited about designing, developing and implementing improvements to our monitoring systems? If that sounds like you, then you might be our new DevOps Engineer.


What you will do
As a DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining software to monitor our complex trading architecture. You will work in a fast-paced environment where your actions have a direct impact on our P&L and thus on the success of Optiver. You will be working with highly skilled and engaged colleagues in an informal and dynamic setting. On top of that you will be in direct contact with our traders and technical stakeholders.


As a DevOps Engineer you will:



  • Create, develop and maintain software to monitor our complex trading architecture;

  • Join in projects to design and implement new parts of the monitoring system;

  • Deploy and support our monitoring systems and dashboards;

  • Automate the process of getting data from different sources to compare with baselines and automatically act on breaches;

  • Help users (traders and trading application engineers) gain insight in the performance of our trading systems;

  • Pro-actively think of new ways to measure our performance, by interacting with the users of the system, being trading application engineers and traders;

  • Constantly be on top of your game to increase the team- and system performance;

  • Be challenged to handle our complex and large data sets.

item.title: Senior Java/Scala Engineer (BigData) - Realtime Stream Processing at Equalum (Petah Tikva, Israel)
item.description:
This is one of the most challenging position in the BigData market. You'll be architecting and developing our platform from scratch, with a chance to work with all the cutting edge technologies for BigData, like Apache Spark, Kafka, Storm, Hadoop, All popular NoSQL/Relational databases and more.


The platform is designed to support extreme volumes of data processing in near-realtime latency, there's a serious emphasis on performance here.


Developing is mostly in Java and some Scala.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer (node.js) at HopSkipDrive (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Technology


HopSkipDrive is securely seated right in the middle of the rapidly growing Sharing Economy market.  We leverage aspects of Geographic Information Services (GIS), Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Machine Learning, Microservices, and Cloud Architectures, solving the current technical challenges of the day.


Responsibilities



  • Reports to VP of Engineering

  • Resolve defects and develop features on our services, web or mobile products

  • Develop unit tests

  • Develop functional tests against consumer products

  • Write test plans for new and existing features

  • Perform regression testing with the team

  • Participate in sprint planning, daily scrum, retrospectives and brainstorming with the team

  • Participate in developing a startup culture that focuses on quality, safety, and fun

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Craneware (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Craneware is creating a new dynamic platform for its suite of healthcare applications. The new platform will run in the cloud and provide a very rich application environment. We are aiming to be on the cutting edge of web applications. Use of novel techniques to handle large data sets as well as utilising the latest in UI design to bring our applications to our users through a number of different devices including mobile. As part of the development team, you will be responsible for creating this platform as well as building a set of rich applications within it.


We develop our solutions within a SCRUM process. We use C# to build micro services, HTML5, CSS, AngularJS and JavaScript to provide a rich UI. The platform is based on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform utilising their scalable architecture for SQL as well as the new DocumentDB JSON database.


If you have any skills in these technologies and want to join a team of dedicated passionate developers then this is for you.

item.title: Front End Engineer at HopSkipDrive (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Technology


HopSkipDrive is securely seated right in the middle of the rapidly growing Sharing Economy market.  We leverage aspects of Geographic Information Services (GIS), Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Machine Learning, Microservices, and Cloud Architectures, solving the current technical challenges of the day.


Responsibilities



  • Reports to VP of Engineering

  • Resolve defects and develop features on our services, web or mobile products

  • Develop unit tests

  • Develop functional tests against consumer products

  • Write test plans for new and existing features

  • Perform regression testing with the team

  • Participate in sprint planning, daily scrum, retrospectives and brainstorming with the team

  • Participate in developing a startup culture that focuses on quality, safety, and fun

item.title: Senior Cloud Development Engineer (RESTful web services, Azure, Amazon AWS) at AppSense (Halton, UK)
item.description:
The successful candidate will have proven development experience of commercial Internet facing web sites using JavaScript/HTML5/CSS.


You will know how to build a site from scratch, apply best practices for providing multi-lingual support, incorporate theme / skin support, obey good design standards (i.e. making use of templates to prevent duplicate work, diligently make use of style-sheets and so on) and work to current accepted web standards. You will also have experience of website/application setup and deployment.

item.title: Senior Security Engineer (San Francisco or Washington D.C.) at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Rally Health (rallyhealth.com) is a startup that's revolutionizing the face of healthcare. We're looking for an experienced Security Engineer who will have the opportunity to help establish the Rally Engineering Application Security Team from the ground up. Come help build Rally Health's reputation as a leader in information security in the health technology space.


What you’ll be doing:




    • Set the technical direction of the Rally application security team

    • Evangelize security across the engineering team and beyond

    • Teach complex security concerns to engineering and operations

    • Develop and execute application security policies and procedures

    • Mentor junior team members

    • Proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve vulnerabilities

    • Participate in incident response and management



Ensure application is compliant with HIPAA as well as with security best practices

item.title: Principal & Sr Software Engineer, iOS Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Principal Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control an ecosystem of Robots in the home.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (iOS) that control real time systems.


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by millions of people.



  • Develop new apps for IoT products that are used by millions of people.

  • This position will help to mentor and grow other engineers.

  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt, Germany)
item.description:
Crytek is looking for an experience Senior Software Engineer to support our Web / Publishing team.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for working on the design, development and ongoing support for game, application and tools technologies used by Cytek’s games-as-a-service (GaaS).


The successful candidate will be an experienced engineer in developing game technologies and have an interest in distributed systems, multiplayer games, databases, tools development and game client technologies.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop, support and iterate on the integration of company products.

  • Creating a reliable and high performance online service which stands for quality.

  • Work directly with Crytek studios to resolve technical issues.

  • Participate in the scoping and sizing of tasks.

  • Work towards the goal of shared common technologies where applicable.

  • Ensure appropriate, accurate and up-to-date technical documentation.

  • Debug, reproduce and triage bugs to create solutions.

  • Take ownership for building and maintaining platform tools.

  • Contribute to making self-publishing a success.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at a Rapidly Growing Startup! at PaperG (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
A PaperG Full Stack Engineer works as a key member of the engineering team, helping push our products to new heights. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will have a wide span of opportunities to tackle different technical problems across the technology spectrum. You are empowered to make technical decisions, and will own large projects from inception to completion. We have a smart team that is always striving to learn and innovate. If you like doing the same, we would love to have you on our team.

RESPONSIBILITIES: You will have many opportunities to 'choose your own adventure' inside the company. Engineers in this role tackle a number of projects from implementing a machine-learning algorithm for predicting and eliminating ad fraud to writing a highly scalable tracking system with billions of data points. Regardless of your project, here are some responsibilities common to all your projects:



  • Write high quality code for a product seen by millions everyday 

  • Work with product team to develop innovative, highly usable features

  • Make architectural decisions to deal with scaling and high availability

item.title: Senior Mobile Engineer - iOS at DraftKings Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description: DraftKings is seeking a Senior iOS Software Engineer to join our world-class engineering team building the next generation iOS apps. As a Senior iOS Software Engineer you will work through the full project lifecycle to design, develop, test, implement and support our iOS apps applications using Objective-C, Cocoa, Xcode and the iOS SDK. Design and implement new features, create UI, debugging and data modeling. Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions. Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle. Additionally, any experience working with large-scale server-side systems using object-oriented languages is a plus.  We are constantly optimizing and improving in an iterative fashion to deliver the highest-quality experience to our users.  In your role as an iOS Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on highly impactful projects. Working in small teams or independently, you will have the autonomy to take projects from concept to production engaging cross-functionally with stake holders.  We are looking for team players who are able to tackle problems under tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions.

item.title: iOS Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable iOS Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Swift/Objective-C experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.


Our projects usually range from one to six months. In a year, you could easily work on six different projects. Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer at Adept Technology, Inc. (Pleasanton, CA)
item.description:
1. Implement embedded software for our robot controllers (eV+ language and servo code) 2. Specify, design, and implement functionality and behaviors of embedded robotic subsystems 3. Design, implement and maintain drivers for controller peripherals (serial ports, USB, I2C, Ethernet, FireWire, SD Card, Force Sensor) 4. Support existing products 5. Write Unit Tests for implemented features 6. Participate in product architecture design


A successful candidate will be expected to contribute positively to the development efforts in the embedded software team, implement key features in eV+ and have the ability to solve problems through solid debugging techniques. He/she will report to the manager of the embedded software group and must be capable of working with a distributed and international software team, with electrical engineers and technicians and other teams. He/she will also work with Applications Engineers.



EDUCATION: At least 4 years of experience in embedded software development BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering.

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Product at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description: At AlchemyAPI, we are looking for talented software engineers to join our fast growing team. As a product engineer, you will be exposed to a variety of challenging problems and work closely with our R&D engineers to transform ideas into customer ready APIs.

item.title: Back-End or Full Stack Software Engineer at Orchestrated (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
Orchestrated is seeking a Back­ End or Full Stack Software Engineer responsible for the implementation, operation, and ongoing development of new applications and systems. Under the guidance of the engineering product lead, engineers design, implement and test robust code and maintain deployed applications.


Location options: 



  • NSW Sydney, Pyrmont 

  • NSW Central Coast, Erina (Occasional travel to Sydney may be required)

item.title: Software Engineer at Synergyse (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Synergyse creates highly interactive and measurable cloud training, adoption and productivity tools. We started by teaching everyone how to use Google Apps proficiently and it worked really well. We are working on hard problems in big data, HTML5, media delivery and real time technology. Our backend technology and web runs on the Google App Engine. Our frontend uses the Chrome Extension, jQuery, Google Closure. We use some of the latest technologies across the board!


Synergyse is based in Toronto and we managed to be profitable within a couple of months of starting it. Our clients tend to be in the enterprise and education world, but our technology is consumer facing and fun. It’s the best of both worlds. We are seeking a highly talented Software Engineer who's able to take on and deliver important parts of the software to users.


Why you should join us



  • Ability to define product and engineering as one of our first hires

  • Work with a highly motivated and talented founding team

  • Be a part of a business that has a good business model, good revenue stream, and makes flagship technology

  • Flexible and casual work environment with opportunity to work remotely

  • Competitive compensation ($100k-$150k), equity and full benefits

item.title: QA Engineer at Adbrain (London, UK)
item.description:
ABOUT YOU



  • You have a deep understanding of the difference between programming and software engineering.

  • Agile principles and a balanced appreciation of the lean mindset - with a view to iterate and test rapidly where possible and sensible, and design and implement to ship a version of a solution sooner rather than later. (We aim to follow the spirit of the law, and not its letter.)

  • You care about Software, appreciating pragmatism, accountability, and quality of the software as a measure of company success rather than an abstract principle.

  • You have strong opinions, loosely held. You know how to argue your point passionately, but are the first to change your mind if proven wrong.


ABOUT THE ROLE



  • Work with product owners and developers to create specifications for new software

  • Plan the testing of new products and features

  • Help developers create test-friendly components

  • Write automated tests using C# and SpecFlow, and Selenium for some products

  • Perform exploratory testing

  • Investigate, log, and track issues

  • Contribute to the development of quality assurance across the company

item.title: Technical Lead for the next great mobile-first platform at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. As a Technical Lead, you will lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You have deep expertise in building performant, scalable systems in C++, Java, Go or Python. Your design intuition should lean towards elegance and simplicity, and you should have experience with highly-scaled serving systems.

item.title: Cloud Operations Engineer at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
Role and Responsibilities


The Cloud Operations Engineer will be responsible for running, maintaining and operating our cloud hardware and services; using the software deployed by our development team.  In this role, you will work on a range of in-house projects.  This job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies.  If you are looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it. 


You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects.  Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment. 


Qualifications Requirements



  • Proven experience with processes related to Linux in a cloud environment

  • Solid understanding of programming with Python, Bash, Perl or other languages

  • Solid understanding of CEPH, OpenStack, and SaltStack

  • Good working knowledge with writing scripts in any language

  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deadlines and priorities

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly in documenting and teaching operational cloud processes

  • Ability to work on critical and abstract tasks with minimal supervision

  • Comfortable using and learning new technologies and products.    


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  • Apache

  • CEPH

  • OpenStack

  • Networking experience

  • Python

  • Nagios

  • System Administration

  • Rabbit MQ experience or equivalent distributed message queue

  • Amazon Web Services


Education



  • B.S. Degree:  Information Systems or related field and/or 5+ years' experience as a Systems Administrator.


Additional Notes


This is a FT, long-term position reporting to the Engineering Director. Hours of work will be primarily 8:30am to 5:00pm during the week, but able to be on call 24/7. 


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

item.title: Software Engineer (C++), Traffic Team at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you want to work on projects with an amazing scale and develop solutions for millions of users? Keep reading!!




HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities creates location-based services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Traffic team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in C++ backend development. The Traffic team offers a unique chance of developing innovative features for visualizing traffic conditions used on automotive products, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


Our Offerings



  • To join our highly motivated team in Berlin

  • To work with evolving and challenging technologies

  • To work together with specialists in an international team

  • To invent next-generation mobile services for users world-wide

item.title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Benchmarking team at Amazon (Cape Town, South Africa)
item.description:
Are you the sort of person who enjoys building software in the cloud? Can you automate processes so that they run continuously without manual intervention? Do you get excited by the performance aspects of complex architectures and like diving deep to find answers to hard performance questions? Do you want to make an impact on millions of developers and IT professionals? If so, we would like to talk to you.



The Amazon Web Services Benchmarking team is seeking a mid- to senior-level Software Development Engineer to join us in beautiful Cape Town. Our team focuses on understanding and improving the performance and usability of AWS and ultimately the end-to-end customer experience.



Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Designing and implementing cloud-based software solutions to automatically execute performance benchmarks

  • Analysing performance metrics and reporting to business stakeholders

  • Exploring and building new ways to make performance data accessible to internal users

  • Working closely with product teams and owners to understand the performance aspects of their services

  • Identifying performance and usability issues of cloud services and driving improvements




  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years software development experience

  • Fluency in one or more mainstream programming languages

  • Working knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, Oracle, or SQL Server)

  • Great communication skills, attention to detail, and sharp analytical abilities




  • Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • Experience developing distributed systems

  • Experience with developing and deploying applications on Amazon Web Services or other providers

  • Experience with industry-standard performance tests

  • Experience analyzing large data sets to identify trends and outliers

item.title: DevOps Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is a young start-up of just over 30 people, looking to shake-up the world of data. From our homebase in London, we’re working hard to give people a totally new way to access the web.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we’re looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow!



You will be responsible for the overall health and well-being of our mission critical infrastructure. Things that may affect this include:



  • Increases and spike in load due to increase in query numbers, or increases in query complexity.

  • Ever-increasing numbers of pages that are crawled and structured by us for our enterprise data products.

  • Malicious attacks on our infrastructure, or AWS outages.

  • Suitability for architecture and components for scale, e.g. MySQL vs HBase.

  • Ability for systems to survive single or multiple points of failure.

  • Awareness of problems before, or as, they arise by monitoring and alerting of key metrics.

  • Bugs in our software or third party software that manifest as operational issues



Responsibilities would include:



  • Designing and improving distributed self-healing fault-tolerant distributed systems

  • Architecting and implementing changes to better respond to dynamic or projected increases in load or scale, changes of desired latency, or other changing parameters; including designing models, evaluating and choosing new components.

  • Automation and optimization of processes to build, test and roll out system updates, and to advance software through development, testing, staging and production.

  • Designing and implementing safeguards against malicious attacks on our infrastructure.

  • Designing and implementing monitoring, metrics and logging to identify any issues or performance improvements within systems, analysing information and presenting findings along with recommendations; including garbage collection, heap usage, log file analysis, latency, response times, load balancer statistics, database statistics, etc.

  • Blogging about our engineering, as well as communication of operational issues.

  • Emergency out-of-hours operational support

item.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer at Genomics England (London, UK)
item.description: This role is for a senior dev ops engineer, with considerable experience of automating Linux systems. The main responsibilities, of the post holder, will be to aid Genomics England in automating its infrastructure delivery through the use of Salt Stack and other relating tools.

item.title: Software Engineer, Generalist at Connectifier, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
item.description:
Build the next generation employment platforms, and help great companies find great people.


Connectifier is changing the way recruiting is done today. Our engineering team from Google, Microsoft Research, Berkeley National Lab, Carnegie Mellon, and Stanford is building large scale data analysis software that processes professional profiles from all around the web. By analyzing code repos, blogs, and social profiles we're helping recruiters and hiring managers connect more efficiently with the candidates best for their openings.


We are deployed at 25% of the Fortune-100, and our revenue is growing extremely fast. At Connectifier you'll get to work with top growing companies and fantastic brand names and deliver a best in class product.


Example projects


Build a predictive AI model of employee success based on a dataset of millions of people


Build infrastructure for running distributed, restartable tasks on a cluster of machines


Requirements


Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or commensurate work experience


Software engineering work or internship experience


Preferred experience


Application of algorithmic knowledge and intuition to solve complex problems


Experience building software with a statically-typed backend language (Java preferred. C, C++, Scala, etc. are all sufficient)


Knowledge of machine learning, aritifcial intelligence, big data and web technologies are a plus


How to apply and what to expect


Click the apply button below.


Be prepared to answer technical questions and write code to solve very challenging problems during the initial phone interview, a 5 hour on-site (or video chat) interview and on-site coding project.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:



    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef. 
    Hadoop, MapReduce.
    Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

item.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

Senior Scala Software Engineer

We’re hiring a core team that will build a new product technology platform from the ground up. The new platform will be a vital part of the company’s transformation and its reimagined product offering. From technology selection and architecture to team structure and processes, the core team will take on the challenge of building a new Micro Service Architecture that will power Weight Watchers over the coming years.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning, Performance Targeting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Performance Targeting & Optimization team’s mission is to help our customers understand their audience better and to deliver relevant advertising across all mediums on the Internet. The team builds and operates realtime prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of machine learned models, and to use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second.


We are looking for top-tier senior talent to lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large scale ML systems in a production environment. The successful applicant will have industry experience applying techniques like classification, clustering and control optimization to solve big data problems. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems to run advertising campaigns at a global scale. You’ll also introduce new products aimed at providing a complete targeting solution for our advertisers.


The team also works closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning systems and supporting infrastructure.

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data.

  • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers.

  • Interface with Product & Business Operations teams to translate business requirements into robust and scalable solutions.

item.title: Data Scientist at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


We are looking for a Data Scientist with a machine learning background who is excited about the thought of working with big data to solve a complex, challenging problem. You must be able to architect and build a scalable system to process, analyze and validate models in real time.


You need to be entrepreneurial, have a desire to be part of a small team of highly motivated, mission-driven people, and have the appropriate experience to have significant input into all parts of the product and company.  You have to be a hands-on coder who enjoys not just implementing algorithms, but designing them from scratch.


Everything we do is hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Zillow (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our Marketing Product Team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us reach out and expand our audience of Zillow fans. You’ll work with our Marketing group on a wide variety of projects with high visibility, right on the front page of Zillow.com. Your work will be seen and used by millions. You’ll have a lot of latitude to run with your ideas to make Zillow.com the best place anywhere for our users to make their home-ownership dreams come true.


What you’ll do:



  • Delight our users with the features you’ll ship.

  • Write performance-minded, highly-readable code using OO best practices

  • Take ownership of product features

  • Be involved at all stages of application development, from UI design to final testing

  • Invent elegant solutions to hard problems

  • Collaborate closely with UI designers, Program Managers, Developers and Testers

  • Have fun!


What you’ll need:



  • BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Minimum of 5 years of software application, systems and web development experience

  • A proven track record of high productivity in application, architecture, design, coding, troubleshooting and debugging with a bias toward action

  • Experience designing and implementing high performance services and APIs

  • Experience implementing RESTful web services

  • Strong experience with Java or Python

  • Technical expertise in Ajax (Javascript, XML, CSS and HTML)

  • Ability to carry out tasks with limited need for supervision

  • The ability to work in a fast, agile and nimble environment with frequent change

  • Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills


You’ll have an edge if you have experience with:



  • Big data and No-SQL databases.

  • Customer targeting products such as segmentation and personalization

  • Spring framework

  • Tapestry, Mustache-Templates or YUI.

  • Developing on a Linux or other Unix OS platform

  • Relational databases, especially Microsoft SQL Server

  • Distributed systems design and development

  • Git

item.title: Software Engineer - Java - Alpharetta / Atlanta at Intelligrated Software (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Intelligrated software intelligence helps retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers build smarter distribution and fulfillment operations for fast, accurate fulfillment that delivers increased productivity, efficiency and customer satisfaction. At the heart of "software intelligence that delivers" is Intelligrated’s focus on innovation, excellent project execution and a company-wide commitment to deliver on promises.

item.title: Full Stack Product Engineer at Pusher (London, UK)
item.description:
Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our product team to solve more problems for developers around the world. You will be part of a new team in Engineering who will be improving on the features of our current product and developing new ones to go alongside it. You will own the technology that surrounds the core message bus and makes things easy for our customers to integrate, understand and use Pusher.


By building applications and using our APIs, you will help us solve more problems for web developers who use our product. You will influence how our APIs are designed, and work with our platform engineers to bring them to life. You will also take ownership of several of our server libraries, and develop them further.

item.title: Software Engineer - Java - Grand Rapids at Intelligrated Software (Grand Rapids, MI)
item.description:
Intelligrated software intelligence helps retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers build smarter distribution and fulfillment operations for fast, accurate fulfillment that delivers increased productivity, efficiency and customer satisfaction. At the heart of "software intelligence that delivers" is Intelligrated’s focus on innovation, excellent project execution and a company-wide commitment to deliver on promises.


Our Software Engineer  creates software solutions by analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining Java based components and interfaces.  They also:
