item.title: Front-End Engineer at Flexport (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Flexport is looking for talented front-end engineers to join our team here in San Francisco. This is a high impact and high ownership opportunity for self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficient industry of global trade.


What You'll Do



  • Create tools that make it easier for companies of all sizes to participate in global trade

  • Help build intuitive, highly efficient and performant interfaces to automate the repetitive parts of logistics


Our Stack


In the frontend, we serve a few isomorphic single-page apps using React for the views, organize the data flow with Flux architecture, and test our application with Jest. We use a hybrid version of Bootstrap styles mixed with hand-built Sass components as our CSS library and are moving away from Bootstrap as we continue building our apps. We follow OOCSS methodology and use Hologram for documentation.


On the backend, we're a Rails shop riding on AWS and Postgres RDS. Using Rspec we believe in just enough testing to provide full coverage without introducing a lot of change friction. Our architecture is light-weight and modular in nature adhering to the fat models, skinny controllers ideology.


Our Process


Flexport engineering is a close-knit team where everyone reviews each other’s Github pull requests. We are expected to learn from our peers and help others learn. Code is released almost everyday or whenever business requires. Our continuous releases are integrated with Travis and Github.

item.title: Systems Engineer at Brandcrumb (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description: We are looking for a proactive, talented, visionary Systems Engineer that will work together with our developers to improve the deployment, availability, and performance of our cloud-based infrastructure and bring it to the next level. The successful candidate will play a key role in deploying and maintaining a rapidly growing network of servers and services that handle high loads with low latency.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (Seattle, WA)
item.description:

item.title: Software Engineer, Android / iOS at TheAmazeApp UG (Köln, Deutschland)
item.description: You will help us to build and extend the Android or iOS version of our product. This means you will work closely with the UX team and our Android / iOS engineers as well as the backend team. It is your responsibility to implement the AMAZE UX/UI guidelines with respect to the overall Android or iOS look and feel. It will be your task to both implement a state of the art UI as well as a stable and reliable communication layer with our REST backend.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at Taxibeat Ltd (, )
item.description:
Are you a Full Stack Engineer who has excellent problem solving skills and loves technical challenges? If yes, then jump into our Taxibeat team and build with us an amazing product with international reach!


Our Full Stack and API team has recently been working on some great features along with a revamped version of our older legacy APIs providing security mechanisms (OAuth2, scope-based access control) that allow us to open specific parts of our API to third-party developers and/or service integrators. Thus, we’re ready to deploy a number of very cool new services to expand our footprint in the market.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (New York, NY)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.

Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: VP of Software Engineer, Data at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The ideal candidate will have experience in deploying, designing, and implementing big-data solutions using a diverse set of technologies and solutions. This leader will head a team that builds the powerful data discovery and analytical capabilities that provide the insight that drives strategic decisions for the enterprise, our customers, and optimizes business performance. The position will support each business unit with their data discovery and analytics. The ideal candidate will possess the thought-leadership skills to drive our big-data agenda and the interpersonal and networking skills to develop critical relationships across the organization.

item.title: Data Visualization Application Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Are you excited by the potential to develop web, mobile, and tablet apps that thousands of people will use to tell their own stories? Do you love incorporating data visualization and geospatial concepts into what you do? We’re seeking a talented and ambitious developer to perform creative, groundbreaking work on a small, highly collaborative team of creative and motivated professionals.



Story Maps are open-source apps that combine interactive maps with multimedia content and innovative user experiences to tell informative and inspiring geography-based stories.



Responsibilities:



  • Develop and prototype responsive web applications and UI modules in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS

  • Conceptualize and prototype innovative ways to combine maps, charts, timelines, and info-graphics into user-friendly storytelling applications

  • Work closely with software developers, product engineers, UX/UI designers, and story tellers in a highly interactive and creative environment

  • Solve technical challenges efficiently and effectively

  • Identify and leverage the latest technology and methodology

  • Document functionalities, processes, and best practices to support the growing community of story map authors

item.title: PHP Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a PHP Developer motivated about developing web solutions ranging from managing back-end services to handling interchange of data between the server and front-end. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will work both on projects requiring you to directly handle UI and on projects in which a co-worker will handle most of the UI.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Integrate user-facing elements developed by front-end developers.

  • Handle server/front-end data interchange and work on front-end as needed.

  • Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules.

  • Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges.

  • Ensure high performance and optimize speed in the back-end.

  • Integrate data storage solutions, including work with databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Senior Big Data Architect at Warner Music Group (New York, NY)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment looking to join the Big Data solutions team at Warner Music Group. 


Are you a passionate Big Data Architect looking for a new challenge? You get excited defining and leading engineering efforts for product vision, requirements and execution of customer driven innovation. You have a passion for coaching and mentoring teams. You take action on creative solutions and ideas. You thrive in a team environment, knowing that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You look at problems from different angles and seek out fresh perspectives. Warner Music Group wants to speak with you about how we can transform the music industry together!!!


Your Role and Responsibilities:



  • A self-starter who is a technology as well as a people person. Should be able to work in different abstractions from the lowest i.e. code and to the highest i.e. architecting and designing systems. Also be able to work with different teams and people to understand and facilitate the deliverables in a timely fashion.

  • Design and build scalable infrastructure and platform to collect and process very large amounts of data (structured and unstructured), including streaming real-time data.

  • Architect the data pipeline to meet the needs of a technology centric company.

  • Hands-on development as well as mentoring of a team of Data Platform Engineers.

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand, document and prioritize key technology decisions, processes and business needs for data and intelligence. This will require an extensive technical background and experience with working on big data in a highly distributed environment.

  • Work with business analysts and business stakeholders to help define technology needs for the logging, processing, storage and presentation of data in a manner that delivers business value.

  • Liaise with other development and reporting teams through the implementation process of new reporting systems.

  • Create, define and deliver new processes that will enable better development efficiencies.

  • Own a road map to automate and key reports in a consistent and scalable fashion.

item.title: SaaSOps Engineer - $50k at Crossover (Cebu City, Philippines) (allows remote)
item.description:
SaaS Ops Engineer - $50k


Are you equally skilled at Elastic Load Balancing and balancing numerous projects across multiple products? Do you enjoy Cloudformation and forming the industry standard? Are you unafraid to take risks and scale ElasticBeanstalk with Jack’s chutzpah? Do you manage people with as much expertise as you manage traffic on Route 53? Are your presentations impeccable? Do you know the trending topics in technology and business processes like the back of your hand? You may be the wizard we’re looking for to transform our Saas optimizations.


Are you what we’re looking for:


Our ideal SaaS Ops Engineer is a highly motivated individual with a broad technical footprint. You get to optimizing SAAS infrastructure, become an expert on the latest SAAS technologies, and invent industry best practises along the way. You will be a principal contributor within our Engineering team, and will own the implementation, support and evolution of our SaaS environments, designing and building a highly scalable, unprecedented, globally deployed infrastructure.


If you are you a strong communicator and razor-sharp analyst and a creative strategist whose solutions that push the envelope, read on to apply!



As a DevFactory SaaSOps Engineer, you will:




  • Architect experience within large environments especially within core technology offerings.




  • Perform a wide variety of technical and administrative duties in overall systems design, development, and delivery.




  • Work in conjunction with IT, Engineering, and business groups to understand functionality, scalability, performance, security, and integration requirements from the database perspective.




  • Develop and maintain an in depth understanding of the application/system/database architecture and the general application functionality used to maintain data integrity.




  • Participate in SaaS infrastructure deployments.




  • Be a cross functional, contributing member of our Change Control Board (CCB) and Production Change Teams (PCT) to deploy changes to production and other environments.




  • Recommend solutions on system/database to meet the technical and business needs for SaaS applications.




  • Oversee data fixes for business issues or to address application issues.



  • Be accountable for proper backup and disaster recovery procedures.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Nederland)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


We like to organize ourselves in small, focused, autonomous teams (4 or 5 developers and a product owner). You will have a say in architecture, planning, and how new product features are designed. During the trimester planning, you’ll also have the opportunity to bring your ideas to the table and take part in planning new features and initiatives.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be responsible for the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products and for extending and maintaining our SOA. We are looking for people who love clean code, work in a test-driven manner, would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Java/Big Data at Criteo (Grenoble, France)
item.description:
CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its R&D Center in Grenoble (South-East from France). Your main missions will be to :


- Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


- Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


- Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


- High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


- Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Lead Engineer, Metrics Aggregation Pipeline at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
At New Relic, we build amazing tools that provide deep insight into web apps and services. We make sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates performance-monitoring data into a single, powerful interface.


We’re looking for an extraordinary engineer to play a key role in designing and implementing the backend server systems that power the New Relic platform. In this role, you’ll work with a wickedly smart team to create the next generation of our data pipeline that receives, aggregates, stores and queries more bytes per second than Twitter.

item.title: Cloud Architect m/f at Cloudreach GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):



  • Consulting with our German customers helping build and architect new solutions, data center migrations and scaling their adoption of cloud technologies

  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, a Big Data project, or building a scalable mobile backend

  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything

  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!

item.title: C/C++ Software Engineer at Intel Corporation (Shannon, Ireland)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer / Technical Lead, you will work with Intel Shannon DCG/NPG Software development team to deliver leading edge enterprise and communications platforms that will enable tomorrow’s Data Centre infrastructure and accelerate cloud computing adoption from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices.


You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects working on cutting edge hardware. You will enjoy a world class work environment and you will be empowered to full fill your greatest ambitions.

item.title: Engineering Manager, Business Applications at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic Engineering Manager, Business Applications San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR
Are you the ace engineering manager who will run part of our fast-growing Business Applications engineering team? You really do need to be an ace for this. Our engineers are particularly smart, creative, hard-working, and capable collaborators. They need leadership, not supervision. Management at NR leads by example. Managers here help engineers ship great features by providing resources, eliminating blockers, and keeping folks informed. If you're a command-and-control person, this is not the right place for you.   


If you've been a software engineer yourself, and you love helping other engineers excel and manage projects working with engineers and business users, we might be the perfect place.   Management here is serious business. We have the best management-mentoring program in any start-up -- perhaps the best, period. It is hard work. Your job as an engineering manager is to pave the way for engineers to do great things and lead projects across organizations. That could mean sitting in meetings so that engineers don't have to; it could mean working with other leaders to keep focus and without repeated changes helping engineers to stay focus and deliver; it could mean coaching an engineer all night through their first big conference presentation. It means whatever it takes to help our engineers ship great features, constantly level up--and have fun doing it! (Of course, you'll have fun too.)  


Tell us about your management philosophy in your cover letter and give examples of your risk-reward thinking with releases. And, of course, we want to hear why you might be particularly interested in New Relic.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at HERE a Nokia Company (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sr. Engineer – Java


The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!


The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:



With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to an engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Messaging at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of the messaging team at Twilio, you will enhance and scale the SMS and MMS platform that touches millions of people every day. To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform in Scala and Java and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, and data integrity. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.  


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Release, monitor, and maintain features in a responsible, reliable way as part of our integrated DevOps practices.

item.title: Principal UI Engineer at Attivio, Inc (Newton, MA)
item.description:
Job Description


If you are passionate about creating impactful and intuitive UIs, consider yourself a trend-setter and creator of innovative solutions, have strong requirements gathering, design, coding and troubleshooting skills, and are relentless in your pursuit of developing well-architected software and delivering high-quality work, you will find the Principal GUI Engineer role in the Engineering Group satisfying and challenging.  You will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting Attivio's new end-user, developer, and administrator GUI initiatives for Enterprise Search and Big Data markets.

Responsibilities also include –
•    Designing and developing the user experience for GUI initiatives, including creating and developing wireframes, storyboards and use cases.  
•    Creating and preparing recommendations on feature sets and technical infrastructure for assigned projects and new system modules.
•    Consulting with partners, customers, and end users to receive feedback regarding the design and maintenance of Attivio's technology and GUIs.
•    Researching and finding opportunities to take advantage of existing platforms and communities to improve user experience through GUIs.
•    Implementing GUI projects using Agile methodologies.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for Senior Python Engineers to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. Python is the primary language of our tech stack, and we’re looking to add more python expertise to our team. You’ll work with the rest of the engineering team to set direction in building applications and data pipelines in python. We value moving fast, but we do so with a pragmatic approach that will allow us to sustain velocity over time.


Healthcare experience not required.

item.title: Senior System Engineer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
comScore Inc. is looking for a highly motivated all-round (DEVOPS) Engineer to join the Digital Analytix Operations team. The perfect candidate excels in bash scripting, Linux operating systems, automating standard procedures etc. You are familiar with technologies as data collection, Ruby, Perl, Nagios monitoring, MySQL, DNS or SSL certificates.


            Some interesting facts:



  • We're at 1500+ servers, and growing

  • More than 12.000 calculation cores

  • over 2.5 billion page views a day

  • over 4PB of Network attached high performance storage

  • 4 Datacenters (2 in EU en 2 in US)


 Duties and responsibilities:



  • Perform day-to-day application administration and system administration duties on Linux servers across comScore's business-critical Digital Analytix platform

  • Maintain all the DAx  (Digital Analytix) platforms

  • Respond to and resolve incident tickets and monitoring alerts

  • Automate common procedures used to resolve Incidents and monitoring alerts

  • Standardize and document common procedures that can’t be easily automated for hand-off to other resources or teams for execution

  • Participate in 24x7 on call schedule of production systems

  • Work on interesting projects with the latest technologies and hardware

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth through being challenged every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact. Oh and having fun – Whether it’s a game of Ping-Pong, team get-togethers or weekly happy hours in the office.


Department summary:


Technology at OnDeck is a mix of building cutting edge systems to provide a world-class user experience to our customers and partners, aggregate mountains of data to make real-time lending decisions, and of course move lots of money every day.  We have an emphasis on scalability, reliability and accuracy.


As a Software Engineer, you will: 



  • You will investigate, prototype, build and transition tools, frameworks, and products to other internal teams

  • Participate with Technology management in the development of technology products and services.

  • Build a team of diverse professionals to drive ideas from concept to implementation.

  • Speak and author papers to showcase the company as a technology innovation leader in the commercial lending space.

  • Transition successful implementations to engineering for full support and build out.

  • Drive organizational change around key innovation products.

  • Provide insight, feedback and assistance to other technology teams as needed.

item.title: Lead Android Engineer at iCitizen (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
iCitizen, the leading civic engagement platform developed to revolutionize the way citizens identify and engage on issues they care about most, is seeking top talent with the right "will and skill" to join our team.


This business requires innovative thinking, balanced with a strong focus on quality and execution. Get ready to roll up your sleeves and solve some of the most complex big-data problems that will create efficiency in a large market and improve people's lives.


We are seeking a highly skilled Lead Android engineer to develop our next generation of mobile apps. The ideal candidate will have a passion for clean code and the data driven design process. You'll work closely with the UI/UX team and product management to ensure our mobile apps are truly exceptional and delightful. We are looking for a proactive thought leader who is willing to challenge themselves and others, is ready to learn and embrace new ways of thinking, and has an innate sense of curiosity.

a10:author.a10:name: Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC

item.title: Python/Django Engineer at Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC (Columbus, OH) (allows remote)
item.description:
A computer expert and electronic discovery firm is looking for an experienced Python and Django engineer to focus on an application that is currently being used to process evidence in legal proceeding across the United States. This candidate will work collaboratively to lead development of a web frontend for this existing data center application. Successful candidates are passionate about the art of problem solving through programming and will understand how to balance the tradeoffs of code that is simple, clever, secure, and of high quality.


The job is a contract position for a period of three to six months. Opportunities for full-time employment exist at the end of the contract period. Our offices are located in Columbus, OH but telecommuting may be possible for the right candidate.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Gateway at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon is seeking an experienced C++ engineer to redesign the gateway enterprise application. The focus of this role is on building a public communication layer between enterprise servers and web, mobile and third party clients.


The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge object oriented C++ application for video, networking, communication and storage

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements

  • Ingestion, processing and handling of large, remote, real-time telemetry and video data sets

  • Collaboration with other product teams to define, design and implement new features


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Electrical Engineer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
As an Electrical Engineer, you are a key participant in the design of Sensoria’s groundbreaking product offering, successfully engaging with an experienced multi-disciplinary team and global partners. You are responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. 


In this role, your responsibilities include:



  • Contribute in hardware development of consumer products from concept through prototyping, short run and manufacturing.

  • Perform hands-on system bring-up and validation.

  • Create detailed test plans.

  • Implement automated testing infrastructure.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Autonomous Driving at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Senior Java Software Engineer



The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!



The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:
With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to a engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Senior Mobile Engineer - Android at DraftKings Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description: DraftKings is seeking a Senior Android Software Engineer to join our world-class engineering team building the next generation Android apps. As a Senior Android Software Engineer you will work through the full project lifecycle to design, develop, test, implement and support our Android apps applications using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Java and the Android Studio. Design and implement new features, create UI, debugging and data modeling. Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions. Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle. Additionally, any experience working with large-scale server-side systems using object-oriented languages is a plus.  We are constantly optimizing and improving in an iterative fashion to deliver the highest-quality experience to our users.  In your role as an Android Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on highly impactful projects. Working in small teams or independently, you will have the autonomy to take projects from concept to production engaging cross-functionally with stake holders.  We are looking for team players who are able to tackle problems under tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions.

item.title: Android Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable Android Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Java experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.


Our projects usually range from one to six months. In a year, you could easily work on six different projects. Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

item.title: Systems Engineer at WB Games San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Warner Bros. Games Inc. seeks a System Engineer for the WBG San Francisco Platform department. As a System Engineer at WB Games San Francisco, you play a central role that ensures our core technologies are of the highest standards and are easily reused across all of our titles and platforms.

This position requires close collaboration with all the Studio Technical Director as well as the game teams to define and implement the systems, features and tools that will be shared across our titles. You will also be a leader in establishing best practices, workflows and identifying problem areas / opportunities for improvement in the codebase.


Responsibilities include:



  • System / Feature / Tool design & implementation / Library & Service integration.

  • Establishing / refining standards & best practices.

  • Performance optimization.

  • Assess middleware and 3rd party solutions.

  • Documentation.

item.title: QA Engineer at Spoon.net (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Spoon makes groundbreaking virtualization software that allows businesses, developers, and consumers to stream applications over the web, distribute server workloads and create automated test environments. Imagine simply installing a small plugin and being able to instantly run Firefox, Skype, Chrome, Spotify, or any other application without downloading it.


Founded in 2006, Spoon.net is a profitable, rapidly growing company with a multi-million dollar revenue base. We are seeking quality assurance engineers to join our virtual machine engine, server infrastructure, developer products, and web development teams.


QA engineers design and execute test plans, develop automated test and monitoring systems, assist analysis of customer technical issues, and work closely with product designers and developers to maximize product quality, performance, and reliability.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Create, execute, and maintain comprehensive test plans. Product areas include: virtualization engine, data storage and analysis, desktop client, web site (client and server), server infrastructure, and development tools

  • Design and create automated test suites to verify the performance and functionality of software products and services

  • Build and test virtualized applications and analyze virtual machine errors

  • Quickly learn new languages and technologies appropriate to a range of problem domains

  • Work closely with developers to maximize product quality and maintain accurate defect tracking records

  • Work effectively with development team members, product management, contract staff, and customer engineers to solve extremely challenging technical and design problems

item.title: Software Engineer Team Lead - Hadoop at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid international growth we are now creating an exciting new position for a skilled developer and expert on systems level to lead, inspire and grow our Hadoop development team. In this role you’ll have the overview of our big data architecture and implement your own ideas to strategically drive our Hadoop cluster to the next level. We want someone not only to use but to build a complex Hadoop cluster and data pipeline infrastructure. If you are passionate about using technology in creative ways and enjoy playing with big data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • As an expert in your field, you will design, implement and maintain data integration and data warehouse based solutions using Hadoop.

  • Translate business requirements into technical implementations based on systems‘ capabilities.

  • Ensure the solutions being defined are reusable and follow standard design patterns and architecture principles of Hadoop.

  • Coach and mentor a growing team in an Apache Hadoop environment. On this note you will support the recruitment process of further team members and liaise with HR to devise innovative approaches to finding the next Hadoop prodigy.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to other Software Development, Operations, Product and Business Intelligence teams to define deliverables and plans.

  • We promote thinking outside the box so we encourage you to initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test - Data.com at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce is transforming the data industry with its Data.com cloud by bringing together the rich set of business contacts and company profiles. With this high quality data, professionals from sales, marketing, service, recruiting, etc, can use it and be more productive and effective in their business. Data.com includes over 30 million accurate community sourced business contacts and over 200 million accurate company profiles from Dun & Bradstreet. The combination of contact and account data along with social insight is exactly what businesses need to succeed in today’s mobile, social and open world. 


You will be working with world-class talented technical team and in the fast-paced, innovative environment to deliver a high traffic, high performance enterprise application & platform. As a fast growing company, our goal is to build an organization of smart and ambitious people, committed to our mission of building a billion dollar data business.

 Responsibilities:



  •  Create test plans and test case using test case management system

  •  Plan, design and enhance automation test framework

  •  Perform both manual and automation tests

  •  Automation test cases

  •  Validate code changes against existing test suites

  •  Investigate test and production failures, perform root-cause analysis and

  •  Create detailed, high-quality error reports

  •  Participate in product and feature design with developers

  •  Support product deployments to production environment

item.title: Senior Tools & Automation Engineer at NetSuite (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Tools and Automation Engineer who has low tolerance for repetitive, manual work and has a passion for building state of the art automation and orchestrating tools. You will have a chance to work on infrastructure and system provisioning, applications deployment, log analytics, etc.


Responsibilities:


Primarily responsible for designing/implementing/supporting operational tools that improve efficiencies through process automation, integrations, and metrics collection.  The tools built will provide Business Intelligence to the company, enhance departmental efficiencies, and promote higher ROI on client renewals and retention


Travel: (optional)


1-25%

item.title: Senior Engineer (Java) at Hytrust Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
HyTrust is seeking Software Engineers to join the continued expansion of CloudControl into AWS, Azure, KVM and OpenStack. The ideal candidate will combine expertise in server management, virtualization and security with drive and leadership to build a killer product.


Our product suite provides control and visibility for virtualized infrastructures as well as encryption and key management capabilities for cloud-hosted virtual machines and data.


What you will do:



  • Create – Conceive and design scalable software.

  • Code - Deliver robust and optimized software, that stands the test.

  • Respond - Understand customer needs and deliver real solutions with long term thinking.

  • Collaborate - Be a part of a super-charged team!

item.title: Software Engineer 1 - Java - Alpharetta at Intelligrated Software (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Intelligrated software intelligence helps retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers build smarter distribution and fulfillment operations for fast, accurate fulfillment that delivers increased productivity, efficiency and customer satisfaction. At the heart of "software intelligence that delivers" is Intelligrated’s focus on innovation, excellent project execution and a company-wide commitment to deliver on promises.


Our Software Engineer 1 creates software solutions by analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining Java based components and interfaces.  They also:



  • Participate in the development and preparation of JAVA design specifications

  • Work with the R&D team leadership or implementation team leadership to meet delivery deadlines as well as maintain/support of existing applications

  • Provide implementation support 

  • Work closely with Project Leaders to resolve any issues

  • Follow testing life cycle procedures

  • Document modifications and changes to program

  • Recommend improved policies and procedures

  • Propose software configuration/modification to adapt to business change requirements

  • Recognize and propose core software improvements

item.title: Software Engineer - Java - Emeryville at Intelligrated Software (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
Intelligrated software intelligence helps retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers build smarter distribution and fulfillment operations for fast, accurate fulfillment that delivers increased productivity, efficiency and customer satisfaction. At the heart of "software intelligence that delivers" is Intelligrated’s focus on innovation, excellent project execution and a company-wide commitment to deliver on promises.


Our Software Engineer  creates software solutions by analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining Java based components and interfaces.  They also:
