item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Transactional at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components you build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the transactional data flow that powers our movie ticketing service (reliability, security, traceability, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Software Engineer at Gamma 2 Robotics at Gamma 2 Robotics (Denver, CO)
item.description:
The software engineer will participate as a valuable member of the engineering team at Gamma 2
Robotics, Incorporated. This position will be responsible for designing, programming, testing, and
installing robotic systems. This will include a variety of tasks related to developing the control
systems, sensors and drive systems for mobile robots.


The ideal candidate will have the ability to develop and implement standard engineering practices,
as well as provide detailed documentation upon project completion.


They will be familiar with Agile programming practices such as team coding, unit testing, and use
cases. They will be fluent with Java. Experience with C, C++, and embedded systems is a plus. A BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering is desired.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description: The engineering team at OpenX is looking for Python experts to build and maintain high-performance distributed systems. This is a Lead Software Engineer role with emphasis on Python/Django.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer (Backend) at Mirantis, Inc. (Pozna, Polska) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you’re an ambitious Python Software Engineer and thrive on working on tough, real-world problems, you want to work here. We are building a data center management product (FUEL) which can become the standard choice of a simple but powerful OpenStack deployment tool. We want you to bring ideas of how it should look and implement it. With the tool presently used to deploy OpenStack at the moment, we have an ambitious roadmap which includes live upgrades, network devices management, SDN devices integration and many more.


We can give you:



  • Top-tier development laptop or powerstation

  • Freedom of your working schedule (there are some meetings, which you can always attend remotely)

  • Best salary around here

  • Education budget. Our company grows constantly, why don't you grow too?

  • Participation in a breakthrough within cloud computing. We are shaping the future!

  • Number of benefits, most of which you will love.

  • Last but not least, a bunch of smart and bright people to work with.

item.title: Android Senior Software Engineer at Netflix (Los Gatos, CA)
item.description:
Netflix is the leading video streaming service globally and the Netflix Android app is one of the most widely used and highly rated mobile applications. We work hard to constantly improve the performance, features, and quality of the app as we expand our coverage to 150+ countries in 2016.


Our Android innovation team is currently leading development of new products and features for all mobile clients at Netflix. Examples of current and upcoming projects include:



  • redesign of the app for phones to provide easier and more personalized browsing of content

  • improved, more informative second-screen experience for Chromecast

  • dedicated experience for kids on tablets


Each client team also controls the code for its endpoint, which allows for the ideal amount of customization and control in transferring data across the wire. We make an effort to be flexible and up-to-date with our tools and processes, and are always working to reduce developer friction.


We'd love for you to join our team of senior engineers and take on this unique opportunity to delight millions of users each day!

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (Boston, MA)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: Software Engineer at ALTA Language Services (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer: Mid and Senior Level Positions Available

The engineering team at ALTA is a small group empowered to make decisions, think independently, and embrace the newest coding and technology paradigms. We write internal business applications as well as customer facing sites that are the core of all operations. We strive to push new features into the language services market and hunt for business opportunities to explore with our tech.

item.title: Creative developer (frontend, personalization, profit) at Scarab Research (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
We need your help in putting a friendly face on our stone-cold machine learning technologies!


Join us in designing and building the next generation of personalized user interfaces. Innovate on how we present personalized content to end-users and how clients interact with a complex machine learning system.


Why Scarab Research?


Scarab is part of the fresh and upcoming technology startup scene and community of Budapest. We can offer you the ideal combination: a startup with traction and a stable financial background.


High impact, high growth – our recommendations reach millions of visitors every day. Our user-base is expanding rapidly internationally.


Great team – work with a small, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers (ex-Google, ex-Toshiba R&D).


Lean startup – we apply agile principles both in business and in software development.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Middleware) at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile Software Engineer with a strong understanding of object oriented programming and SaaS systems.  In this role, you will transform terabytes of real-time data into practical and action-able information for our customers as well as our technicians.  That data comes from our tens of thousands of customers with solar electric systems, energy meters, and grid connected batteries.  We have a lot data and even more on the way - you will be crunching, transforming, graphing, caching, and archiving a growing stream of information.


Your work will accelerate the adoption of clean energy, and improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of users.  You will get to work with a small, fast-paced, and dedicated software team to design and develop cutting edge products.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CrowdTwist (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Us and the Role:


CrowdTwist is seeking a Senior Software Engineer for our growing team based in New York City.  In this role, you will work directly with all areas of our platform while adding new features and new products to the CrowdTwist platform. You will be involved in many different projects as we continue to grow and enhance our platform.  Your work will be in front of millions of people and will directly influence the loyalty program offerings for many of our clients, such as Pepsi, Nestlé, Lancome, Ubisoft and Zumiez.


We are a venture-backed NYC based company that provides the most comprehensive omni-channel loyalty & analytics solutions for industry leading brands. We're relaxed, experienced, hard driving and are changing our industry.


Your work will span many areas of the CrowdTwist platform, including but not limited to:



  • The consumer-facing loyalty program experience

  • Our RESTful APIs

  • Our scalable microservices architecture

  • Our client-facing content management applications

  • Integrations with social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Foursquare, etc) and vendors (PoS, ESP, CRM, Bazaarvoice, OrderGroove, etc)

  • Our data-driven, client-customizable JavaScript SDK


This role is for an engineer who loves to roll up their sleeves, dive in, and tackle any problem with speed and precision.  You will be utilizing your experience with object-oriented software design and implementation, data modeling, and building high-performance, highly scalable web and data processing applications.  We operate in an agile manner, so you must thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy shipping product.


In this role, you will work with a broad backend tech stack, including but not limited to:



  • PHP

  • Java

  • Oracle

  • Redis

  • MongoDB

  • RabbitMQ

  • Docker

  • Amazon Web Services (EC2, VPC, ELB, S3, RedShift, CloudFront etc.)

  • Various third-party services (Twilio, SendGrid, EdgeCast, etc.)

item.title: Software Engineer at Raise.com (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Job Description:


Raise is looking for its next generation of technical leaders.  As part of a cross-functional agile team, you strive to build user-focused solutions with technical superiority.  You balance usability needs with the functional and performance requirements befitting our global marketplace.  You share the knowledge gained through your career through mentoring, code reviews, and frequent pairing sessions.


As part of a small, fast growing team, there is immense growth potential both from an engineering as well as a business standpoint. If you're a smart, hardworking problem solver who enjoys working with autonomy, but understands how to take complete ownership of a project while meeting deadlines, this is the perfect role for you.


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Questrade Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We’re revolutionizing financial services for everyone’s benefit. Think of us as an IT company revolutionizing financial services, not a financial company with an IT department. Join a dynamic front end development team and build our trading platforms and applications from the ground up. 


The Senior Software Engineer will see through the full software development life cycle at Questrade; from requirement-gathering, design and development, to implementation of both small and large-scale projects. You will collaborate with our user interface team, our back-end engineers, and other front-end engineers to design and develop functionally rich, robust, and user-friendly web and mobile applications, as defined by business requirements.


Need more details? Keep reading...


• Design, develop, and implement client-facing, internal web and mobile applications


• Design new application features and functionality, writing APIs, and ensuring scalability


• Propose and sometimes decide on technologies used to support and evaluate a multi-tier environment


• Participate in the project architecture exercise and take ownership of ongoing project data architecture


• Provide support and enhancements to existing production applications


• Define both functional and technical requirements to facilitate design, development, testing and implementation


• Interact with Questrade’s user-interface team, enterprise architects, back-end engineers and front-end engineers as needed in order to elicit, define, analyze and document requirements for new applications


• Define and implement best practices, standards and procedures, including quality and delivery methodologies


• Ensure the quality and reliability of code from intermediate developers


• Assist and support your team members on multiple projects and support the team lead in making technical decisions


• Ensure compliance with the documented software processes and procedures throughout the life cycle of software products

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Test at Kyruus, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a passionate engineer to raise the bar on accelerating delivery and improving quality at Kyruus.  As a software engineer in the test organization, your responsibilities will be to create frameworks, tools, and applications that will drive the engineering organization to understand the current level of quality of our products, and identify where to invest in the creation of more tests. Simply put, your job is to enable product development by helping developers help themselves.


Sample Responsibilities:



  • Build metrics to track and assess the quality of our releases

  • Create tools that will continue to allow the engineering team to scale while quickly delivering high quality software

  • Assess product quality through management and aggregation of information from test automation frameworks

  • Present quality metrics to enhance our overall process, advise the engineering leadership team on resource allocation and improvement strategies

  • Take the lead on organizing the mechanics of our test processes

item.title: Linux Operations Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Responsibilities



  • Make sure our infrastructure stays up and running 24/7.

  • Repair nodes as they fail and deploy new hardware as we scale our infrastructure.

  • Perform task related to deploying new software, managing DNS, maintaining OS security patches, etc.

  • We have an existing infrastructure that you will be managing for the next 90 days as we transition to our new stack.  

  • Deploy new systems and scale our infrastructure as we expand our capacity for more content and customers.


Ideal Candidate


We are looking for people outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


Culturally, we’re a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you’re generally available for communication and are productive.


The plan is to transfer all operations management to you, including being on call for outages, and knowing our operations tasks including bringing up new machines, dealing with failures, etc.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: Logistics and Operations Software Engineer at Good Eggs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
What we’re building:


The Good Eggs operations and logistics team builds the platform that empowers our entire supply chain, from the tools that help our producers know what and when to make products, to the software and hardware that manages the flow of food through our warehouse and delivery network. Our systems go beyond the screen, and include mobile and hardware platforms that help our associates deliver food faster than anyone else in the industry.


How you can help:


We're looking for engineers who are interested in a multidisciplinary engineering environment, and who are excited by building high-scale software that interfaces with equipment and displays on the floor. As an engineer on our team, you'll be responsible for the architecture, design, development, and testing of new tools and equipment we are developing to streamline the process.


How we work:


We run a mature Agile engineering process complete with test-driven development, pair programming and continuous deployment of features throughout the day. Our core platform is built on Node.js, MongoDB, AngularJS, and CoffeeScript. We're in the process of expanding into new domains, including iOS application development and software that runs on embedded devices in our hub (IoT). Don't worry if you haven't done it all: we are happy to train the right person to work in this environment.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Sorenson Media (Draper, UT)
item.description:
We are looking for a team player.  We are not looking for a rock star or ninja.  We succeed as a team.  We are looking for a self-driven, world-class software engineer seeking excellence to contribute to the design and development of a varied and sophisticated application—the glue in a system to ingest, process, store, and deliver large amounts of data.


Our team is a high-functioning, agile team strictly adhering to the scrum process. We are self-organized and peer-based. We prioritize technical debt, technical improvements, and bugs—not just features. We highly value testing. We work on concise stories with unambiguous acceptance criteria.  Our executives understand the impact of mid-sprint interruptions and allow us to focus on producing world-class technical solutions.


You will be collaborating closely with data engineers and video engineers to ensure that the system satisfies requirements and is robust and scalable.  You will have significant influence in deciding which technologies are chosen throughout the system.  We are confident you will find satisfaction working with our team to bring innovative technologies to fruition.

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at mParticle (Boca Raton, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for supporting our growing application infrastructure. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining strict production SLAs of a custom distributed application running on AWS cloud infrastructure, monitoring, alerting, incident management, SOP, capacity planning, change management, security, and overall platform stability and improvement.
 
The ideal candidate will have a deep technical understanding of Linux operating systems and at least an intermediate understanding of Windows operating systems, strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), advanced scripting skills, experience with variety of monitoring solutions, deep understanding of network communications and excellent troubleshooting skills.


Finally, we are seeking someone who wants to be a major contributor in a small, dynamic work environment, loves a challenge, and has a strong balance of technical and people skills.
 
The Cloud Systems Engineer will be responsible for:



  • Maintain, monitor, and improve the performance and availability of the 24x7 production environment including networks, servers, databases, etc.

  • Participate in on-call rotation and provide hands-on support during emergencies, outages, and service transitions.

  • Define and monitor compliance to production environment SLAs.

  • Participate in creating long-term and short term strategies for scaling the production environment.

  • Adhere to a comprehensive incident management program including problem management.

  • Generate KPIs for service availability, uptime, and adherence to SOPs, and SLAs.

item.title: Sr. Network & Systems Engineer at Rewards Network (Miami, FL)
item.description:
The Senior Network and Systems Engineer position is responsible for ongoing assessment and maintenance of all Rewards Network’s Information Technology infrastructure, systems, and security. This position will be required to work independently and within teams to assist with operations management, problem management, and project management. Additionally, the Senior Network and Systems Engineer will be accountable for equipment evaluation, systems design, and compliance requirements. The person in this role will be responsible for contributing and achieving department and company goals.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Designs, implements, and maintains network infrastructure and system operations independently and as member of the Network and Systems Engineering Team.

  • Acts as escalation point to the Application Support Team and the Reward’s Network’s Support Center facilitating their efforts to resolve incidents and execute problem management.

  • Exhibits solid communication skills both verbally and written between team, department, organization and external entities.

  • Monitors Network & Security operations including infrastructure and systems “Alerts” and log entries resolving and/or escalating issues in a timely manner.

  • Adheres to Change Management and Quality Assurance requirements during configurations changes, vendor patch deployments, upgrades, and project execution.

  • Ensures there is a collaborative process of development and maintenance in place for all policies, procedures and standards as they apply to network, systems, and security infrastructure.

  • Familiar with implementations of process and security frameworks like ITIL v3 and ISO 2700x, and familiar with compliance initiatives like PCI DSS and SOC II & III.

  • Recommends and contributes to system and network opportunities for increased systems uptime, expanded operational performance and reduction of ongoing costs.

  • Develops, implements and manages project plans to facilitate implementation and operational rollout of network infrastructure and security solutions.

  • Leads by example, demonstrating best practices for trouble shooting issues, cross training within the team, and provides constructive feedback to peers to improve the strength of the team.

  • Provides 24x7x365 days a year support for all of Rewards Network’s Network Infrastructure, users, and outside departments on a rotating On-Call Schedule.

  • Capacity planning and performance analysis of infrastructure.

  • Develops projects to improve performance, efficiency, experience, capacity, etc. of environment

item.title: Enterprise Automation Engineer at Connolly iHealth Technologies (Atlanta, GA) (allows remote)
item.description: The Enterprise Automation Engineer is responsible for working across the organization looking for every possible opportunity for automating repetitive manual tasks. While this person typically works with the development team their focus isn’t limited to just traditional DevOps areas. Once identified they then bring together a combination of technologies or code designed to completely or partially replace the manual work. The Enterprise Automation Engineer is a very specialized type of developer and are held to the same high standards as all of our other developers. The Enterprise Automaton Engineer should have a passion for technology and working with technical people to help accelerate them. This role will spend time working independently and as part of a team and will focus on specific deadlines in an Agile development process as defined by the management team.

item.title: Sr. Network Engineer at Augmedix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and scale of the production & corporate network. At Augmedix, we use cutting-edge technology to give nimble business owners a competitive advantage in their customer interactions. We work on a broad range of business initiatives and objectives by leveraging a wide set of technologies and tools. Our network topology is designed using OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP routing protocols. Our customer’s infrastructure operates Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, Cisco wireless concentrators and ISR platform devices. We continue to introduce Cisco Meraki AP’s to our smaller customers and are currently working on a WAN Optimization project.

item.title: Lead / Sr. C# Full Stack Engineer (C# / MVC / SQL Server) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) has an immediate opportunity for highly skilled Lead Software Engineers to work on our flagship product Rave. Rave is used everyday by pharma companies, biotech and clinical research organizations the world over. Medidata's Rave is part of a platform that provides our customers with the most advanced tools for planning, executing and managing their clinical trials. Result? 7 of the top 10 grossing drugs in 2013 were developed on our Medidata platform. 


We are continually building and improving our SOA cloud-based clinical trial solutions to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. Working at Medidata will allow you to impact society in a positive way.


The engineers who best fit at Medidata are those that make good decisions, communicate well, and are eager to make an impact. We are curious, flexible, passionate, honest and selfless. We enjoy freedom and responsibility and can get things done. We are not afraid to fail and have the confidence to remain calm in stressful situations. We can survive on our own but prefer working as part of the team of equally talented peers. We are self-improving and disciplined and enjoy learning and sharing what we've learned. We are missionaries, not mercenaries.


What's in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA), commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We provide top of the line computers (PC or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.


We help our developers be more efficient by providing them with a license for Visual Studio Premium with MSDN, a ReSharper license, and a PluralSight subscription.


Every engineer gets an opportunity to work on a personal-interest project for two weeks every six months. We send people to conferences to learn, get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.

item.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Avalon Healthcare Solutions (Tampa, FL)
item.description:
Avalon’s Software Engineers supports projects through the use of software development tools under limited supervision using prescribed methodologies. Software Engineers work collaboratively with other technical and business resources. You will analyze, design, develop, document and support various custom applications, portals, data exchanges, services and integration with other applications and systems to support the evolving needs of the company.


Job Requirements



  • Develops complex, modular and reusable application code which utilizes SQL data sources.  Able to performance tune applications.  Develops multiple, modular objects and the messaging interface between objects to create a complex software package.  Reuses objects and can create object inventories.

  • Can create a detail design document through the assessment of business requirements.  Can work in a team to assess alternatives to different designs and choose best solution to fit business needs.

  • Demonstrates an ability to read, interpret, create and maintain complex Conceptual, Logical and Physical models to include context diagrams, data flow diagrams, process flow diagrams, data dictionaries and logical flow charts, under limited supervision.

  • Able to develop unit test plans which include regression testing and the packaging of tests into consecutive steps based on logical dependencies to ensure quality delivery. Assists in the development of functional test plans used to verify that a specific system functions according to actual requirements and established guidelines.

  • Able to perform moderate to complex application administration & support. Ability to triage and resolve application and integration issues. Document and track product defects.  Demonstrates the ability to develop and implement solutions for the causes identified.

  • Able to evaluate, recommend and exploit evolving technologies in the design and implementation of application infrastructure for scalability, reliability, availability and serviceability and identify the trade-offs and risks associated with each.

  • Adheres to and contributes to definition of good database design practices.  Conceptual understanding of referential integrity, locking and transaction processing.  Understands impact of data modeling decisions on system performance and resource usage.  Able to do complex queries and updates of tables. 

  • Software Developers will contribute to, and follow the defined Avalon Agile SDLC / Change Management process for developing, testing, maintaining and deploying code.  Contributes to and follows established coding standards.  Able to perform code reviews and assess the work of other team members to ensure quality delivery and compliance with procedures.

  • Has an understanding of the strategic alignment of IT solutions with business objectives.  Demonstrates a working knowledge of specific components of health plan operations and associated technical dependencies.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Nimble Collective (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Do you love animation? Do you want to use your coding super powers to change the animation world? Then this is an opportunity of a lifetime.


The animation landscape is ripe for disruption and we want you to be the catalyst. We have the technology to change everything about creating. But we need talented, prolific and endlessly creative engineers to join us in blazing this new trail! Come with us on our journey to enable millions of creators to manifest their visions for billions of eyeballs!


Nimble Collective seeks a motivated deadline driven, flexible and positive individual focused on developing our backend service-based architecture. You will be instrumental in designing the services that control the flow of data in an animation pipeline, working closely with our pipeline and frontend engineers. Understanding of Computer Generated Imagery process is a bonus.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a mobile engineer, you will be working on both platforms in addition to working in the API layer.


You must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer - Site Development at Cimpress (Vistaprint's Parent Company) (Lexington, MA)
item.description:
The R&D Team (code name: Columbus) was named to “conquer the blue ocean” by disrupting and opening up a new market for Cimpress and Vistaprint.  Specifically, this relatively small team has started building an entirely new technology stack hosted in the cloud that leverages Vistaprint’s deep domain knowledge in the field of mass customization and e-commerce to enable many new types of products to be purchased and customized online. 


A large part of this work is focused on creating new, more intuitive user experiences for customizing products virtually over the web, disrupting how customers purchase many of these products currently.  While much of this is green field development, it requires exceptional engineers that will routinely have a huge impact on the business.  Engineers are expected to have solid experience in back-end and middle tier development in addition to expert level knowledge of client side development, technologies and best practices.  Particular focus will be on delivering truly innovative user interfaces that let people seamlessly select, design, and preview customized products online.  You will work with multiple technologies and programming languages.  Our engineers develop across our entire technology stack, from the database and back-end APIs up through the presentation layer.  We’re currently working on a number of interesting projects that will have strategic impact for the business:



  • Substantial improvements to our product visualization capabilities including accurately depicting particular types of decoration on non-flat, irregularly shaped products.  These improvements will be leveraged in highly configurable ways such that they can be easily extended to partner organizations.

  • Catalog and product organization and find-ability improvements including algorithms that leverage deep product data to easily find similar or related products amongst very large product populations

  • We have a number of other challenging projects in our queue that have the opportunity to vastly improve our customer experience, e.g. in-line text, dynamic design portability and re-colorization and merchant tools to support integration with locally specific brands or customer sets. 


As a Lead Software Engineer on the Columbus development team you will be joining an experienced, highly driven development team.  You will work within green field development areas that create new business opportunities for a large and fast growing company.  Particular focus will be on delivering scalable solutions that automate what are often manual processes within other businesses.  You will work with multiple technologies and programming languages.  Our engineers develop across our entire technology stack, from the database and back-end APIs up through the presentation layer. 


Requirements:



  • At least 5 years of industry experience using Object Oriented programming languages (C#, Java, C++).

  • Web development experience.

  • Experience with javascript

  • Strong written and oral communication skills.

  • BS/MS in Computer Science, MIS, CIS, or equivalent.

item.title: Senior Back End Engineer at White House Custom Colour (Eagan, MN)
item.description:
You are passionate about solving problems. You think big picture and excel at making all the pieces fit together; from server infrastructure to adding new endpoints to a RESTful API. You strive to make an impact in a team setting and aren't afraid to express your opinions and ideas. 


What You Will Do


This is a back end engineer position responsible for developing and maintaining server-side components and infrastructure that supports web and mobile apps. You will be responsible for architecting, developing, and shipping code for new and existing products. You will be working with a group of like-minded people who share your passion for technology.


Responsibilities

  • Architect and develop APIs for both internal and external use

  • Work with established APIs to integrate into projects

  • Work closely with other engineers and management

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at OpenGov (Redwood City, CA)

item.title: Front End Engineer at BrightGauge Software, Inc. (Coral Gables, FL)
item.description:
BrightGauge Software is looking for an incredible Front End Web Developer to join our growing team.  You know the type: an HTML, CSS, JavaScript engineer who loves building beautifully detailed web applications and all the magical interactions that happen in the browser.  


As you’ll read and learn about BrightGauge, our product works with tons of data, is used all over the world, and we’re incredibly passionate about beautiful interactions.  So as a front end engineer joining our growing product team, you’ll make a direct impact on thousands of people’s everyday work lives.  We want you excited about that, about shipping awesome code, and bringing designs to life.  More specifically you'll enjoy

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for a hands-on DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for writing code and building systems to improve the performance and operational efficiency of our distributed NLP and growth systems. item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) at U.S. House of Representatives (Washington, DC)

Vacancy Announcement Number: CLK-007-15


Closing Date: August 14, 2015


Proposed Starting Date: Immediate


The Office of the Clerk for U.S. House of Representatives is seeking a dynamic and innovative Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) to join a development team that is dedicated to building and enhancing systems critical to legislative operations, used by Members of Congress, Committees, other internal agencies and the public. item.title: DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (Coventry, UK)

Call yourself ambitious? Wait until you meet our team. We’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around and this is your chance to get in the mix.

Someone who’ll go all-out to keep delivering, enhancing and supporting our game-changing business applications, relentlessly looking for ways to make improvements to platform stability and increase the pace of change. item.title: Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer (.net/Ruby)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives!

Who We Are:


This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:


Software Engineers at CareerBuilder solve interesting business problems that span the range of deriving intelligence from big data, engaging job seekers on mobile devices, to building applications in the cloud.


Helping developers integrate their code with others through release management, automated testing and deployment one minute, and then showing no mercy in a vigorous game of table tennis the next –the life of a CareerBuilder Software Engineer is never dull! Bring your ideas, your skills, your object-oriented background and your quick-draw and come join our team. Pursue next-generation technologies and tools to help support the platform that is matching job opportunities with employment seekers around the globe. You’ll be given plenty of independence and autonomy with which to work, and you’ll be able to spend 10% of your time just learning new tools and languages. If you have a passion for solving complex problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment, CareerBuilder has a place for you. If you have the passion for developing cutting-edge solutions to business problems and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!


As a Software Engineer, you will come up with new and innovative platform development ideas for ALM. Best of all, we participate in the open source community, which allows for plenty of flexibility and room for innovation as you experiment and tinker alongside some of the best Software Engineers in the business.

Here are some of the toys you’ll get to play with:


* REST 
* Visual Studio
* Distributed Computing 
* TFS and Github
* .NET 4.5 
* Saucelabs
* Automated Testing 
* SOA
* MVC 
* Linux
* Chef
* RubyRails

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Body Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
Body Labs is looking for a highly-skilled and driven Front-End Engineer to help us design and build great products that provide amazing experiences, with an emphasis on web application development. We need someone who has the experience and skill to make the right design and development choices, and write awesome code. You’ll be part of our internal product/engineering team, requiring teamwork, focus, and drive.

We want to work with someone who is energized and motivated, who thrives in a fast-paced, high growth environment, and who enjoys working closely with a small team. You will have to understand Body Labs’ high level goals and be able to connect your daily activities with the company’s long-term aspirations.

  • Develop internal tools and architectural code standards

  • Debug and optimize existing and new code

  • Work independently and as a team, participating in code reviews and weekly product meetings

  • Write awesome code that you can be proud of!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web Services at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)

At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web services for Exosite products.
