item.title: Sr. Rails/Javascript Application Engineer - Internal Tools at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
We are looking for talented web developers who are excited to work with Rails and emergent Javascript frameworks to build great products for our internal tools.


At New Relic, we define the space for Application Performance Monitoring with compelling web experiences for visualizing and analyzing data to help small, medium, and enterprise customers make their business better. As a software engineer on the internal tooling team, you’ll be working on the tools that help New Relic to analyze and make better our own business. The best part is that your users are your co-workers, so not only do you get access directly to your users, you get feedback faster, and you get to see the glory that is your hard work making others’ lives and jobs easier/better.


We’re hiring at all experience levels, and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your perfect job, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.


As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.


Some of the things we work on:



  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first

item.title: Lead/Senior Full Stack Developer at Scarlet (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Scarlet:


Scarlet is a new kind of a voice based information service that delivers personalized content at the right time.  We believe that there is a tremendous opportunity to create an effective and human solution to deal with the ever growing stream of information pouring out of our devices. 


 While exploring new opportunities for voice interfaces, we are first creating a consumer mobile application that helps people better start their day.  We are a small but fast growing early stage startup that is funded by the Samsung Accelerator.


Position Description:


Scarlet is looking for a founding engineer who can take a lead role in solving complex engineering problems to deliver highly relevant information to users in a natural, helpful and charming way.  Ideal candidates are individuals who are strong individual contributors, but also enjoy mentoring and working with other engineers. 


You will be our founding engineer to build and lead a high performing team that explores new applications of natural language processing, intelligent content aggregation, and voice-driven user interfaces.  Deep experience with agile product development, a love for human centered design, expertise in JavaScript development with focus on Node.js, and a passion to solve hard problems with creative solutions are all required to thrive in our fast-paced startup environment.



You will:




  • Build and deploy a scalable backend to support end user experience

  • Advance our web based tools and enhance our ability to deliver unique and personalized end user experiences

  • Integrate new sources of data into the system

  • Design and implement machine-based solutions to select and present data for end users

  • Analyze system performance and identify areas for improvement

  • Play a key role in building a top notch engineering team around you

  • Work closely with product, design and client teams to define, iterate and implement new features

item.title: Developer at Typeform (El Prat de Llobregat, Spain)
item.description:
Typeform did to web forms what Tesla has done to cars: completely reimagined online forms from the ground up. Typeform is growing at a tremendous pace because of its heavy emphasis on amazing UX, strong product/market fit, and future products that will blow you away. This is a ground-floor opportunity for you to be a part of something fun, exciting, and supremely rewarding.


As an engineer at Typeform, you should have a solid understanding of software architecture and design patterns. You should be able to knowledgeably talk about OOP/DDD/SOLID and it would be great if you have a strong desire to innovate, learn about new technologies and be ready to take a part in the building of the product.


We're currently hiring for:



  • Front End: As a front-end engineer at Typeform, you would be responsible for creating and innovating on every corner of the front-end platform at Typeform.



  • Back End: As a back-end engineer, you will need to be able to build and design large scale applications for our platform to support millions of form responses and provide realtime data analysis.



  • API Integration: The API integration team is focussed on seamlessly integrating the Typeform platform with other 3rd party services such as Salesforce, Wordpress, Google spreadsheet and Mailchimp.

  • Full-Stack: We have need of full stack developers in a number of areas of our business to work simultaneously on the front and back end.


Benefits



  • Flexible working hours

  • Half day Fridays

  • Amazing office space (including terrace and BBQ)

  • 24 days of holiday (you can take your birthday off)

  • Private health insurance

  • Nice equipment

  • Yoga classes

  • Free team lunches

  • Fresh organic fruit

  • Wear your slippers within the office

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Scala / Functional Language Developer) at Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
item.description:
This role is also available in Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta with appropriate cost of living adjustments.


Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. is a fully-funded and well-connected start-up providing cutting edge software development and hardware solutions for the next era in information technology.  


The company is looking to bring together an international team of world-class developers to deliver a highly confidential, critical IT service for a long-term, major government contract in Southeast Asia. This project will ultimately provide a high-profile system to be used by millions of users in the specified country.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be building a large scale, data intensive Web application using the latest technologies in an Agile environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:



  • Application design, engineering and development

  • Follow Agile practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming etc.

  • Own a set of stories and manage their end-to-end implementation

  • Work with distributed team to deliver end-to-end solution

  • Present and conduct demo for users, stakeholders, and technology groups as and when required

  • Using industry best practices to deliver quality deliverables


What We Offer



  • World-class software development facilities

  • Startup environment with minimal bureaucracy

  • Learning opportunities to acquire the latest and most advanced development skills (we invest heavily in our employee training and development)

  • Agile work culture, focused on innovation, team work, and open collaboration

  • Flexibility of job location (Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta)

  • Greenfield development with opportunity to be involved in full Dev lifecycle

  • Health/relocation benefits available

item.title: Passionate Java Software Engineer at Capgemini (Machelen, België)
item.description:
Capgemini is looking for Java Software Engineers with experience in developing business-critical applications.


You will support our customers in analyzing, designing, implementing and testing Java solutions in national and international organizations.


In collaboration with your Project Manager, you will be responsible for the quality of the solution you develop.


As a Java consultant, you will manage the scope and quality of your own development activity on challenging missions.


Activities



  • Perform developments according to specifications


  • Be accountable for timely and qualitative delivery


  • Commit to deliver developments according to agreed planning and budget


  • Analyze and solve issues in collaboration with the team leader


  • Participate to the release/project launches


  • Identify and report risks related to his tasks and propose mitigation actions


  • Share insights and experience with colleagues



We offer



  • A unique environment for your personal development


  • A career where high performance is rewarded and where freedom, industrialization, innovation and trust are in the spotlight


  • Joining an international organization that enables you to grow within your domain of expertise and share knowledge of experts worldwide


  • Wide range of training and development opportunities


  • A competitive salary package

item.title: Senior Developer at COzero (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
COzero is searching for talented senior developers in Sydney looking to change the way businesses use energy.


Our product ranges cover traditional electricity retail, energy monitoring, energy efficiency programs, energy audits, creation and trading of environmental certificates and support for commercial solar installations.


The Senior Developer's role is to ensure the continual delivery of the EnergyLink platform such that its milestones are met to support internal and external users of the platform. The role also entails support for the CTO, across other business services as required.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Football Radar (London, UK)
item.description: At Football Radar, we analyse and predict football matches. As a backend engineer you’ll have the chance to help build and maintain all the software that makes that possible – everything from modern web applications to statistical models, real time data platforms to cloud infrastructure. Our backend engineers are involved in everything the company does and deal with all kinds of different challenges. A lot of our code is in Scala, which we are using increasingly, but we still have lots of PHP code, and a few odds and ends in other languages. You don’t need to know Scala for this role, however: we’ll help you learn it if you don’t know it, and many of our engineers had no real Scala experience before they started. We are just looking for great programmers who are passionate about their work. If you like a challenge, and want to work with really smart people, we would like to hear from you.

item.title: Software Engineer All Levels at Workday (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Join our team and experience Workday!


It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.


Software Engineer


What if you can own the platform that powers business-critical transactions for Workday’s global customers? We want passionate developers who love technology, upward mobility and want to make an impact.


Our Technology Services organization is growing fast and we are looking for Software Engineers to join our team.


What a Software Engineer for our Technology Services team does at Workday:



  • Architecture, designing, development and ownership of critical platform services. These modules are the building blocks that help make our software great.

  • Innovation and solving problems are always on our mind; our engineers are constantly evolving our systems and are motivated to rapidly deliver features to production.

  • Collaboration is the key to success. Our small teams allow our Engineers to come up with quick and exciting solutions.


Can you answer YES to some of these questions?



  • Is Java your core development language?

  • Have you worked with any of the following: Scala, Akka, Spray, Spark, NoSQL data stores (for example, Riak, Cassandra, or MongoDB), XML processing or Web Services (SOAP / REST)?

  • Have you worked on large-scale, distributed, and highly concurrent systems?

  • Do you have knowledge of methodologies, technologies and architectures employed by consumer internet applications?

  • Apply and see if you have what it takes to be part of the revolution of cloud based, user-friendly enterprise software systems of tomorrow!

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):




  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend




  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything




  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign On solution




  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!




What do we look for?




  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject




  • You’re super motivated and have at least a year’s working experience. We can find a great role for you with 1 year or with 10+ years experience




  • Scripting skills - ideally Python or Ruby, but talk to us if you love to hack in any language. We look for people who automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn’t update each one manually right?




  • You’ll probably prefer a command line to a GUI




  • Solid knowledge of Linux (or perhaps Windows) Systems Administration/Engineering




What are our cloudy perks?




  • A top spec laptop. You want a Macbook, not a ThinkPad right?




  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture where we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the Clouds - this year’s project is building a Quadcopter on our 3D printer




  • Plenty of holidays - increasing with every year of happy cloudy service. You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake




  • Great career development opportunities with an assigned mentor




  • Centrally-located offices - where the cool kids hang out




  • Good food and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday




  • If you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus




  • The chance to work on side tech projects to build something cool, unrelated to your day to day work




  • Overseas work opportunities - if you want them




  • Working with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere else

item.title: Software Engineer at MaxPlay (Austin, TX)
item.description:
MaxPlay has an opening for a Software Engineer experienced with SaaS to help build the next generation of tools that helps the Interactive Entertainment industry create compelling content. The ideal candidate is passionate and highly skilled, who can help guide the capabilities of our product to show unique, cutting edge value through extensive use of data mining, modern machine learning, and optimization techniques. If you enjoy solving complex business problems, all on a blank slate, this is the job for you. By helping shape this core feature of our product, your skills and leadership will help accelerate the growth of our venture backed company.


 The ideal candidate is passionate and highly skilled, with a hunger to build a groundbreaking content creation pipeline for designers and artists. The Software Engineer will be responsible for developing software to optimize workflows and minimize iteration times of development teams. This role will also work closely with the UI/UX team to develop these tools.

item.title: Senior Linux Systems Engineer at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Senior Linux Systems Engineer to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

As a member of the Information Technology department at Synthetic Genomics, you will work as part of a team of systems administrators and DevOps engineers to implement and support our SaaS application and Distributed Job Queue.  Candidate should be familiar with deployment pipeline tools such as Jenkins, Puppet, and Ansible, have solid systems engineering / operation experience and be able to contribute to all phases of project development cycle including definition, architecture, design, scoping, planning, implementation and testing.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s is leading the charge in retail digital innovation. We’re building centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry from where we’re crafting world-class apps and services. Call yourself ambitious? Wait until you meet our team. We’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around and this is your chance to get in the mix.


We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer with a real bug for automation. Someone who’ll go all-out to keep delivering, enhancing and supporting our game-changing business applications, relentlessly looking for ways to make improvements to platform stability and increase the pace of change. And, all the while, making sure our service level is protected and our business value increases.


As a DevOps Engineer you’ll:


• Build widely distributed systems from scratch and improve existing ones
• Deliver and create infrastructure as code
• Code and containers packaging
• Enjoy real collaboration with teams as you design and implement CI/CD pipelines
• Automate wherever possible, always knowing where the ‘too far’ mark falls
• Inspire amazing performance and best practice
• Get everyone in the business in the DevOps mind-frame
• Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota as needed

item.title: Senior Security Engineer at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
A Senior Information Security Engineer at Code42 helps to build and maintain infrastructure and products that are of the highest security standard. In this role, you will collaborate with people from throughout Code42 to enhance and maintain the level of security that Code42 and it's customers need.Code 42 is seeking a Senior Information Security Engineer to help maintain our high standard of security in a rapidly growing cloud infrastructure. Continuous vigilance of threats to us and our customers, as well as the ability to quickly assess the implications of cutting edge technology, will be your focus. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



  • Review, analyze, and respond to security incidents

  • Design, build, and maintain security infrastructure

  • Conduct security assessments using automated tools and manual penetration testing techniques 

  • Define security requirements for Code42 technical infrastructure and product software

  • PerformAssist with incident handling and forensic analysis

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Software Engineer -- Personalization at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for dynamic, passionate and effective Software Engineers to join our team. Our product is the wildly successful travel website www.tripadvisor.com. Our website and mobile apps provide our users with a rich user experience to research, collaborate, and contribute. We have big data with over 150 million reviews, opinions, photos, and videos reaching over 260 million unique visitors each month.


We are seeking developers for our Personalization team, which is responsible for understanding, analyzing and delivering knowledge based on the activities of the millions of users of our site.


Can you operate in a highly-iterative agile development environment, delivering significant new functionality every week?Can you interact with a wide variety of peers across the organization to get to a single result? Are you, above all else, passionate about what you do and who you do it for?

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at NFL (Culver City, CA)
item.description:
The National Football League is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help make our applications amazing & incredible to use! We recently released our first Open Source project, launched a new iOS app & our team is thriving with start-up methodologies.


What’s it like to be an NFL Senior Software Engineer?



  • You have a voice at the table to innovate our software development

  • You own the custom mobile-centric software application products you build for our fans

  • You create replay-worthy experiences for our fans

  • You build products for our use of video, social & live data applications

  • You champion a legacy suite of online applications unlike any other

  • You feel the engagement of your work used by over 60 million of our fans


We’re growing our team with permanent, onsite talent & competitive compensation packages that include full healthcare benefits, bonus, pension, 401K, employee discounts, reimbursements as well as NFL Media Culture Committee perks (see our company page for more details).


Our NFL campus on Los Angeles’ west side houses the offices as well as studios for NFL Digital Media & NFL Network.

To apply, please send us your latest resume & links to your work!

item.title: Senior Go Backend Engineer @ Wearable Intelligence at Wearable Intelligence, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: We’re looking for passionate software engineers with experience developing complex backend services. Do you like the idea of a highly-available, micro-service oriented, well-defined architecture? Know REST and SOAP inside and out? You would play a major role in designing and implementing backend services that interact with many different types of devices, and support thousands of concurrent users. The ideal candidate is well-versed in more than one language and framework, and has experience building backend services composed of lots of moving parts (microservices) that interface via APIs and SDKs.

item.title: Android Engineer at LiveSafe (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
We are looking for a mid-level Android engineer to join our mobile engineering team. We develop both Andorid and iOS native moble applications used by over 100,000 people across the world. We are constantly looking to improve our platform and branch out onto new devices (Android Wear, IoT) to deliver added value for our users.


The kind of engineer we are looking for will likely identify as a:



  • Polyglot that gets a special satisfaction from picking up a new language, framework, or tool

  • Problem solver that does not relent until digging and discovering an issue’s root cause

  • Collaborator that thrives in a social, transparent, and “got your back” team environment

  • Person who cares deeply that their work realizes positive outcomes for our world

  • Someone that stays on the bleeding edge of technology to help enhance user experience even with new OS releases


You probably also have:



  • Strong opinions on what makes certain languages/tools/frameworks good, bad, or ugly

  • Sufficient experience with your favorite language/tool/framework to describe its faults and shortcomings

  • A pet software design principle that drives you nuts when not used

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


As a Senior Software Engineer – Android Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Defense & Security Products.


In this role, you will collaborate with other mobile and robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (Java/Android) that control real time systems.


What you will do


In this role, you operate as a member of an elite and growing team of robot developers delivering the next generation of iRobot products.


 As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by the military, state & local, and industrial markets; these are the robots that save lifes and keep people out of harms way.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, Android based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

  • Proactively write software documentation.

  • Maintain and identify areas for improvement in established software.

item.title: Software Engineer - Network Function Virtualization Orchestration at Casa Systems, Inc. (Andover, MA)
item.description:
Casa Systems, Inc. seeks to hire another talented Software Engineer to join its SDN/NFV group based in Andover, MA.


The Software Engineer will impact the organization by focusing on Network Function Virtualization (NFV) Orchestration development in accordance with software development practices, procedures and quality standards established by the company. 


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 



  • Participate in requirements development and analysis activities.

  • Design and build the orchestration layer for Casa VMs.

  • Review and test software components for adherence to design requirements.

  • Will be responsible for providing full system and software life-cycle support.

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Do you live to solve problems, technical and otherwise?  Do you take responsibility where others fear to tread? Are you passionate, fast and detail-oriented in your work?  Can you communicate as readily with executives as with developers?  Do you want to manage people while staying technically hands-on?


If your answers to these questions are “yes”, great!  The Rubicon Project is growing, and we need development managers who are thorough and agile, capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done.  In the Data Pipeline team you will work on real-world problems working on big data sets where accuracy and speed are paramount, take responsibility for your systems end-to-end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts customers around the world.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Be an end-to-end owner of software services spanning technology boundaries

  • Translate business requirements into technical designs and project plans

  • Write production-ready code and unit tests that meet both system and business requirements

  • Respond to feature requests, bug reports, performance issues and ad-hoc questions

  • Work collaboratively with multiple teams to deliver quality software

  • Support operation of services in production

  • Line manager of other developers

item.title: Principal UI Developer at ADP (Roseland, NJ) (allows remote)
item.description:
The Principal Application Developer is responsible for developing the ADP Reporting product for ADP's external clients. The ADP Reporting team is focused on building a cutting edge reporting product with a simple mission -- make it beautiful, performant, simple and useful. The product will include a simple drag and drop interface, report preview, a library of categorized fields/reports and will extend to the manager persona. The reporting solution will be tightly integrated with the Analytics solution to enhance the user reporting experience while also providing insightful information combining transactions data with predictive analytics, benchmarks and mash-up data so users can make intelligent business decisions.


We are seeking candidates with a desire to get involved with a product through its infancy and help contribute to its success. The right candidate will not only have strong technical skills but also possess the leadership skills needed to mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) while meeting their own deliverables. We seek someone who is continually looking to grow, technically, as our architecture stack continues to evolve to meet the changing demands of our clients and growing user base.



Principal Application Developers work with product managers analysts, architects and engineers to plan, design, develop, test and implement information technology solutions consistent with the business objective.


Principal Application Developers at ADP are expected to be results-oriented, have knowledge of new and legacy technologies, have knowledge of the relevant platforms and environments, and be familiar with business process, functions and data within their domain to provide innovative, insightful, and secure solutions.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web UI Applications at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web-based front end applications for Exosite products.  At Exosite we love building highly responsive, engaging user experiences for this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play.


As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the applications you are building.  Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web-based client side application code and user interfaces within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web-based user interfaces.  You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders.  You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs.


You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders.  You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality.


You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development.  You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

item.title: Software Engineer, Recommender Systems (Junior, Senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


As a software engineer you will focus on developing Zalando’s in-house recommender system into a state of the art microservice. Your main task will be to position this technology as a “software as a service” component which can be fully leveraged within the Zalando platform. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Java developers and expert data scientists. 


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You have at least 2 years of experience, working as a Java Software Developer

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You know the most common design patterns and you know in which context to apply them

  • You have a solid background in applied machine learning and you can implement algorithms in a parallel fashion

  • You love to optimize processes and code, and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving data-driven products at scale, which are real-time oriented

  • You are familiar with the Map-Reduce paradigm and the main aspects of functional programming

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus 


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommendation and personalization engine in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds 


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world’s best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment 


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Lyudmila Barabash at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.


As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.


Some of the things we work on:



  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Search at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
AlchemyAPI, an IBM company, is used by customers across dozens of countries, including some of the largest companies in the world. We're solving real-world problems affecting billion-dollar industries. Come help us build amazing technology and do it at scale.


We are looking for a talented search engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in building a scalable data analytics and search platform that powers our next generation of products. Successful candidates will have an extensive background in Lucene-based distributed search systems such as ElasticSearch (preferred) or Solr with a solid understanding of Lucene internals.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX (based in Kirkland, WA) is seeking a DevOps Engineer within our development team to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  INRIX has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take better control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping to make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure, scale and monitor their applications in data centers and in cloud

  • Actively participate in high level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations

  • Help solve business needs with technology by evaluating different technology options and vendor products

  • System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains - will be expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot customer facing issues

  • Takes ownership of end-to-end solutions provided by teams across the organization

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at MediaRadar (New York, NY)
item.description:
You are a passionate software engineer looking to help lead a strong development team. Youre a proud problem solver with a strong technical gut feel with hunches more often right than wrong about where problems lie. A constant learner, youre a continuous contributor to the team IQ level. Youve got the ability to take on and lead individual assignments and complete them soup to nuts. As much as you love the elegance and power of good architecture, your number one focus is delivering software to do the job and you pride yourself on doing that well.


What youll be doing:


Our Lead Software Engineer will be responsible for the following software feature activities:


  • Shared responsibility in the Design and Architecture of a feature

  • Ensure that the proper plumbing is in place for the given feature

  • Analyze complexity

  • Implementation (i.e coding) of the feature in a mostly vertical fashion (i.e UI, Business Layer, Database Access and Schema Design, External Interfaces)

  • Fully understands and follows the companys Software Development Processes (i.e SCRUM)

  • Ensures quality of implementation and support the feature during testing/bug fixing phase

  • Authors required documentation (in code or WIKI)

  • Keeps all assigned cases up to date and updates statuses as required

  • Perform code reviews

  • Mentor and assist other developers

Lead Software Engineers:


  • Tackle hard engineering problems with many unknowns, fail fast, find how to get the job done

  • Are self-sufficient and expected to tackle an entire feature. Ability to overcome difficulties with little or no help is required

  • Must be able to identify any gaps in application platform, propose and implement solutions

  • Are key contributors to feature scoping and development estimates. Their projections have a high (90%+) degree of accuracy. They rarely, if ever, miss the due date

  • Are proactive about developer testing. They frequently utilize unit tests to ensure long term health of their code

  • Are able to code across all levels with ease. Their code is well structured and displays best practices in software development

  • Have drastically less bugs in their code. They are quick to fix issues that come up

  • Ensure overall quality of the software (quality of code, performance, security, extensibility, etc.)

  • Use engineering know-how and common sense to assess impact of their work on the platform

  • Are able to interface and communicate effectively with people in other departments

The Ideal candidate is:


  • Motivated, works extra without being asked

  • Technically strong, has deep understanding of current and future technology

  • Must be a great team member

  • Passionate about the team, project and work

  • Hardworking and fully dedicated to the success of the project

  • Obtains 100% trust and confidence of manager

  • Pushing innovation and emerging technologies forward


Whats in it for you:

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.



Benefits


Check out what it's like to work with our awesome team here: http://muse.cm/1Mt0NCg

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.


To apply:

If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of a collaborative, creative environment, please APPLY NOW.

item.title: Software Engineers at Overpass (Newark, NJ)
item.description: Our available positions include Full Stack, Front-end and Backend developer roles. As a developer you will be part of our core development team. You will take part in building a complex platform from the ground up.

item.title: Lead Front-End Software Developer at CCI Systems, Inc. (Iron Mountain, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
CCI Systems, Inc. is seeking a Lead Front End Software Developer with hands-on front end web application design and development experience. The successful candidate will be part of a team that encourages remove work, has a flexible schedule and well defined and prioritized work for the team in an agile Ruby on Rails/AngularJS development environment. The job includes working closely with a small specialized team of: Developers, Business Analysts, and Production Support.


This can be a remote position


 Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Design and develop core applications for our business (SaaS).

  • Work with other talented engineers to solve real world business and technical problems.

  • Architect, build, test, document, and ship code.

  • Design, implement, build, and utilize RESTful APIs.

  • Use test-driven development techniques to ensure that your code works.

  • Respond to and resolve questions and issues logged by users of a live system.

  • Collaboratively design and build new features.

  • Develop functional prototypes that highlight new design concepts.

  • Seek out new technologies to better solve problems.

  • Practice agile development methods (scrum, XP).

item.title: JAVA Developer Building Baseball Analytics Applications at LBi Software (Woodbury, NY)
item.description:
LBi Software is looking for candidates with experience in full stack Java-based web application development.


We are seeking a Software Engineer to work as part of a team to design and develop custom enterprise web applications. Candidates must be self-starters and able to follow written and verbal direction working with a technical team leader. They must be able to produce well-documented and efficient code and possess the communication skills necessary to explain complex technical information. A four-year degree in Computer Science or equivalent is required. The position requires strong knowledge of software architecture, development, data modeling, database design, unit testing, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and QA processes.

item.title: Software Engineer at ADP Innovation Lab (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking talented Software Developers with diverse backgrounds, creative expertise, and technical acumen who will offer new perspectives and challenge conventions.


RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Deliver highly automated, intelligent, and predictive solutions for our client offerings

  • Responsible for building out the Core frameworks of the Meta Data Driven Platform being developed in house, including building out the Source Control Management piece that will allow application developers to have their own isolated development environment

  • Deliver innovative solutions to drive next generation user experiences, designs, and technologies

  • Responsible for ensuring the successful transition to a Service Oriented Architecture framework with the help of containers

    • Spearhead POC’s on the latest technologies and help ADP choose the right tool for the right job

item.title: Java Programmer at RavenPack (Marbella, Spain)
item.description:
Position immediately available for an experienced software professional. You will work within an international team of developers skilled in Java, SQL, Python and Common Lisp.


The ideal candidate will have excellent skills as a software engineer and professional experience delivering backend applications developed and deployed on Linux.  You should be fluent in current Java technologies and tools.  Experience in the following technologies and procedures is a plus:



  • Continuous integration and test driven development practices

  • Project management and build automation tools: Maven, Sonatype Nexus and Jenkins

  • Knowledge and experience with J2EE frameworks

  • SQL and JPA

item.title: Algorithm and Software Developers for Computational Biochemistry at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. 


Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. 


Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/CS


D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Full Stack (Python) Developer at Hearst Corporation (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re creating a game-changing modern content technology stack - built from the ground up to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell these amazing stories. We’re using modern web technologies to do this, like Python, PHP and memcached. We’re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe passionately in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems. We are working with Big Data scientists to build a modern information pipeline for building intelligent and optimized media applications.

We’re hiring talented and passionate Software Engineers to solve problems as we build out our new platform. The ideal candidate has extensive experience working with distributed, service oriented architecture (SOA) systems, writing clean object-oriented code, building and working with RESTful APIs and has worked in cloud based environments like AWS.

item.title: Java / Python Integration Developer - Multiple roles at different levels at BAE Systems Applied Intelligence (Guildford, UK)
item.description:
You will join a vibrant and experienced team of software engineers. You will focus on the implementation/integration of cutting edge technologies with the aim of improving end user experience and information exchange capabilities within a heterogeneous data landscape.


Working within a dedicated team, you will be responsible for integration and configuration of technical solutions with support from some of the best innovators in the business as well as maintaining up-to-date technical design documents and test plans. You will be instrumental in helping to maintain the technical superiority of the Managed Security Service as well as contributing towards the technological and business goals of the Cyber Security business unit.


You will work across a diverse range of tools, technologies and infrastructure which includes Hadoop (HortonWorks), ElasticSearch, Accumulo, HP ArcSight, CA Service Desk, LifeRay and CA Site Minder in terms of configuration and integration to achieve greater automation and efficiency.


You will be driven by getting the best out of tools and technology and wish to improve integration and interoperability between toolsets favouring configuration and integration over new product development. You will have a sound knowledge of software engineering practices and the development lifecycle.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Opportunity:



  • Working with one of our capital markets clients on a large scale, complex, highly visible project to understand their product vision and requirements.

  • Providing technical consulting to clients while recommending technologies and solution options that provide critical business operations such as processing multi-billion dollar transactions quickly and error free.

  • Working with cross functional teams to build, engineer, architect and design an electronic trading and risk management solutions

  • Using your Java background in development to work collaboratively with capital markets Traders and IT professionals to brainstorm use cases and problem solve issues.


  WHY INFUSION: 



  • You’ll build your portfolio by working alongside various capital markets leaders on a variety of large, complex, multi-million dollar projects.

  • We’re about transformation. You’ll be challenged to come up with creative solutions working on new technologies.

  • We invest in you. We host programming contest, hackathons and fun training sessions to keep you on top of your game.

  • You’re supported. Whether it’s a training, mentorship, breakfast basket, pizza, spa services, or Infusion’s monthly social events, Infusion takes care of you. 

  • Career progression is real. You will move up if you have the drive.

  • Our Infusion Air program gives you the opportunity to work on projects out of our global offices in North America and Europe.

item.title: Senior full stack developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for full stack engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please forward your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV at SUPERNAP (Las Vegas, NV)
item.description:
Join SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
Switch, the developer of SUPERNAP data centers, is the revolutionary technology solutions company led by inventor and solutionist Rob Roy. As Founder and CEO he holds 218 patents and patents pending that have produced an essential and future-forward transformation in data center architecture, engineering, technology and operations. His vision also resulted in the creation of the SUPERNAP CORE Cooperative. It is the world’s only $3 trillion independent purchasing and collaboration ecosystem, guided by the company’s unique operating ideology called Truth in Technology.

Designed by Rob Roy, the Switch award-winning Tier IV Gold SUPERNAP data centers are certified as the highest-ranking colocation data centers in the world and are maintained by the highest-rated mission critical operations teams. With more on-net, independent cloud providers than any other physical cloud gateway, SUPERNAP connects thousands of clients and providers from within the facility. SUPERNAP is the recognized world leader in colocation design, development and mission critical operations.

SUPERNAP, with clients ranging from sophisticated startups to Fortune 100 powerhouses, enables unparalleled mission critical solutions that make a difference in innovation, ROI and communities as a whole.

Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV

The purpose of this position is to design, architect, develop and test new web-based software applications and address issues with production systems, while also providing technical research, support and training as necessary. The ideal candidate will have a hard time placing a title on their skill set because besides being a Perl rockstar, they are also revered as a Linux Engineer, have a very respectable amount of network knowledge, and are just as good at "putting out fires" as they are with developing new code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for architecting, developing, and testing new web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Improve, fix, and test production web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Utilize MySQL and DBI for data storage and retrieval within Perl applications.

  • Make technical recommendations based upon the current production applications and future applications.

  • Discuss and clearly articulate complex technical topics with technical and non-technical staff, and occasionally customers.

  • Eager to interact with other teams and departments, as well as customer facing and commercial teams.

  • Perform other duties and special projects as needed and directed.



    • Required Job Skills:



  • Expert Perl programming experience.

  • Experience with relational databases and SQL.

  • Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  • Systems/software development experience in a Linux and/or *nix environment.

  • Advanced Perl Scripting, threading, forking and object oriented concepts experience.

  • Source control (GIT, SVN, CVS, etc.) experience.

  • Knowledge of PC LOAD LETTER.

  • Good sense of humor.



    • Computer Equipment and Software:



  • Comprehensive technical knowledge of software, servers, workstations, and the internet in general is expected.



    • Education and Experience:



  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical schooling and/or work experience.

  • 5-10 years experience (additional certifications preferred).




    • Physical Demands:
    The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, use hands, operate a computer, and have specific vision abilities to include close and distance vision, and ability to adjust focus working with computer and business equipment.

    The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
    ____________________________________________________


    A STRICT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION AND DRUG TEST WILL BE REQUIRED OF ALL CANDIDATES IN ALL DEPARTMENTS.

    Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

    Benefits include a group health, dental and vision plan, long term disability and life insurance, 401(k) Plan, FSA, paid vacations and paid holidays.

    Apply online click here

    SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
    7135 South Decatur Blvd.
    Las Vegas, NV 89118



    SUPERNAP is an equal opportunity employer.

    Principals only please. Temporary or permanent placement recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Python at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a talented and enthusiastic software engineer who wants to make a difference within a successful, growing company. StorageCraft is looking for a Software Engineer to work on a range of in-house projects. The job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies; you will be able to work using multiple software languages and operating systems and help shape the complete design from the ground up. If you are an enthusiastic coder that is looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it.


DUTIES
You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects. There is always a wide variety of problems that need to be solved so you will be expected to learn and adapt quickly, providing the best solution for each problem. Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment.


Minimum Qualifications:



  •  3-5+ years of experience of writing good quality code in C++, C#, Java or similar

  •  Proven experience of writing scripts in Python, batch, Perl and other languages

  •  Solid understanding of coding concepts including object orientated design

  •  Proven experience of both Windows and Linux

  •  Knowledge of various development methodologies including Agile

  •  Knowledge of building and compiling products developed in multiple languages

  •  Knowledge of application deployment technology and installers, including the MSI model and related technology (e.g. Installshield, WiX, NSIS etc.).

  •  Willing and able to learn quickly and work within a team


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  •  Django 

  •  Virtualization technology 

  •  Experience with complex application build systems and installers

  •  Windows and Linux command line options and utilities

  •  Experience with any test automation frameworks and methodologies

  •  Backup technology, including block-level backups and the VSS framework

  •  SQL database experience

  •  SQL Alchemy

  •  Linux development experience


Education:
Associates or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience preferred.


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/DisabilityThis

item.title: Information Security Engineer Ethical Hacker at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


The Information Security Engineer (Application Security) will join a team of other Information Security professionals reporting directly to the Global Manager - Application Security. The position will have primary responsibility for managing security architecture reviews, vulnerability assessments and penetration testing. The Information Security Engineer will be part of a team providing state-of-the-art technical expertise and support to clients, IT management and staff in risk assessment and the implementation of appropriate data security procedures and products.


You Will:



  • Collaborate with the Information Security staff in the evaluation of risks and threats, development, implementation, communication, operation, monitoring and maintenance of the IT security policies and procedures which promote a secure and uninterrupted operation of all IT systems

  • Identify emerging vulnerabilities, evaluates associated risks and threats and provides countermeasures where necessary

  • Monitor developments within application security and ensure internal policies, procedures, tools and awareness programs reflect current security methods such as those published by OWASP, WASC, etc.

  • Serve as a point of contact with business clients and consult with infrastructure and software development teams to design proper security architecture

  • Act as security liaisons with software developers globally

  • Conduct security architecture reviews for new development (web, digital, mobile) and modifications to existing ones

  • Conduct internal and oversee external penetration tests

  • Design and implement Secure SDLC program (policies, methodologies and tools) across the company globally

  • Execute formalized Information Security programs and processes, such as vulnerability management, event monitoring, data loss prevention, and incident response

  • Evaluate, implement and support information security related technology

  • Respond to information security alerts and analyze events for appropriate action

  • Conduct security awareness training for software developers

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.
