item.title: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile software engineer to develop technologies that enable wide scale deployment of renewable energy generation.   You will be part of a fast-paced and dedicated engineering team that develops embedded software and hardware systems for solar monitoring, energy storage and energy efficiency applications. Most of the software you develop will be in Python on embedded Linux platforms.  The ideal candidate will be an excellent programmer, have some experience with remote data acquisition and control, and be adept at rapidly learning and implementing new technologies.  Your work will affect every single one of our customers that have chosen clean, low cost energy.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


As a DevOps engineer you will be taking part in the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products. We are looking for people who get things done and would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.


Responsibilities


You will support, develop and enhance highly scalable and highly available infrastructure for all our projects in Google Cloud. You will find a balance between creating awesome things that create an immediate impact and making sure that they're secure and maintainable in the long run. You will have an opportunity to be involved with product development as a software engineer and be able to develop your programming skills to the next level.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at IceMobile Agency B.V. (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Because of our bold ambitions we are looking for an DevOps Engineer to help us change the food retail industry globally with innovative digital solutions. The DevOps Engineer delivers customer solutions together with the development teams.






The technical architecture serves as the starting point for mapping IceMobile’s product onto a customer’s technical environment. This includes standard product functionality as well as required bespoke components.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Chatham Financial (Kennett Square, PA)
item.description:
This position is part of our models team, which is responsible for developing robust and scalable services to enable cutting-edge financial applications. Our models are implemented in a micro service architecture designed to support a variety of internal and external user applications. We are looking for developers who are interested in both software engineering and computation, with skills and experience including:



  • Object-oriented design patterns; languages including C#, C++ or Java; web frameworks like Microsoft MVC and angular.js; and relational and NoSQL databases.

  • Quantitative and modeling skills with an ability to learn techniques in numerical optimization, data mining, simulation, or model calibration.

  • Comfort with full stack software development, including computationally intense back-end development and service design, data storage and access models, enterprise level messaging patterns, and modern web development frameworks.

  • Proclivity towards refactoring and continuously improving OO code through agile development methods.

  • Testing skills including use of inversion of control, mocks, and stubs in unit testing and BDD testing frameworks like specflow and cucumber.


Additionally engineers on the models team work directly with operational teams, other software engineering and design teams, and our quant team comprised of Mathematics and Physics Ph.D.’s. Members of this team gain knowledge of our business and the mathematical models used in modern finance, and have the ability to deliver robust and scalable software meeting the needs of a variety of business users. The team has a strong core of existing developers who can help new members gain this knowledge.


Although not required, a typical successful candidate may have been involved in



  • Mathematical/quantitative competitions.

  • Open source development projects.

  • Advanced degrees in mathematics, computer science, engineering, or sciences.

  • R&D experience at the collegiate or professional level.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving but currently includes .Net, ServiceStack, RabbitMQ, SQL-Server, ASP .Net MVC, angular.js, Memcached, Redis, various Amazon web services, unmanaged C code, Nvidia Cuda, and Python. We also use developer tools like Team City, Subversion, Specflow, Graylog, and Visual Studio. We have specialized design, database administration, devops, and IT infrastructure teams to allow software engineers to focus on software engineering.


Finally, we work in a rapidly-changing, high-performance environment that relies on excellent communication and collaboration, so we look for people that are energized by being part of great teams, and looking to challenge themselves to learn new technologies and apply them to our technology stack. Most new employees say that Chatham is both the most challenging and most rewarding place at which they have ever worked. If this applies to you, we’d be interested to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

item.title: JavaScript UI Developer at LogRhythm (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
LogRhythm is a software company focused on security intelligence analytics. We are looking to add a JavaScript UI Developer to our team to support ongoing development of our dashboard which allows our customers deep visibility across their entire IT environment. If you dig networks being violated you should stop reading right now. Or find your moral compass and keep reading. 



  • The application consists of an AngularJS web user interface (UI) and is powered by JavaScript (Node.js) and Java in the middle tier. The stack includes: Node.js, AngularJS, D3.js.

  • Our UI has an impressive amount of polish. Building a portal to client data to help them track down ever-changing threats is critical work. We take UX serious so a complicated task like protecting your network is made easy and engaging.

  • Our browser support matrix includes “evergreen browsers” (IE10+, Chrome, Firefox, mobile). We have given our web team the latitude to utilize the modern technologies needed in order to scale.


Within this domain we are the fastest growing private company in the world and we are headquartered in Boulder. This is one of the true success stories within the Boulder/Denver tech community. You’ll get a chance to join a local company that’s gone from startup to an established company who's out innovating the largest security companies in the world.

item.title: Back-End Developer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience.


The Software Engineer (Back-End) will be accountable for developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. You will be working on a next generation product.

Location: Red Bank, NJ


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Front End Engineer - Consultant at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
Technology at OnDeck is a mix of building cutting edge systems to provide a world-class user experience to our customers and partners, aggregate mountains of data to make real-time lending decisions, and of course move lots of money every day.  We have an emphasis on scalability, reliability and accuracy.


What we're building:



  • "OnDeck as a Service" - direct business web and mobile applications.

  • Merchant loan origination and account API, used by the web applications and the sales CRM platform. 

  • User tracking and feature testing infrastructure, as well as internationalizing our web offerings.

  • We have exciting plans to build out mobile experience, SMS notifications, and voice-based account information system.

item.title: Sr. Cloud Engineer (DevTools) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
What we do: 

The DevTools group within Medidata is responsible for the following:



  • Building and maintaining deployment and infrastructure automation tools

  • Handling the ongoing operations of our production systems.

  • Configure and build monitoring and logging tools to monitor our applications and servers.

  • Working with engineering teams to improve their use of our cloud resources.

  • Ensuring that our applications and services are horizontally scalable, highly available and are deployable with our existing tools.

item.title: Newsroom Developer (Front-end Interactive) at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
The Financial Times technology department is hiring a developer to join Interactive News, a joint Technology & Editorial team, working in the newsroom.


We are a cross-functional team of data- visual- and coder-journalists. We work with other reporters and editors from across the FT to develop engaging forms of digital journalism. This includes data visualisation, infographics, maps, multimedia long form articles, microsites, news apps, video graphics and experimentation with audio. We also create tools for the newsroom.


Much of our code is public on Github. Take a look:



  • github.com/financial-times

  • github.com/ft-interactive

item.title: Senior Network Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg's R&D Network Design & Information Security (NDIS) group is responsible for the design, architecture, development and security of Bloomberg's internal and client-facing global networks, security, and cloud infrastructures. The Core Network WAN Engineering team is the part of the NDIS Core Networks group that is focused on the architecture, development and escalated support of the global WAN infrastructure.


Bloomberg's private WAN is a sophisticated carrier-grade multi-vendor network that leverages technologies such as MPLS, MPBGP, LDP, RSVP, MVPN, etc. The private WAN currently connects 14,000+ customer sites via 100+ global POP sites using 20,000+ CE network devices and 800+ core network devices.


The Core Network WAN Engineering team is seeking a dynamic, talented and experienced network engineer who thrives on being "in the trenches". The successful candidate must possess extensive programming experience in network automation, provisioning & performance management. The candidate is also expected to possess expert networking knowledge, experience, creativity and capability to work in a complex and fast paced network technology environment. The candidate will work closely with network operation groups to provide technical assistance and guidance. The candidate will also work directly with vendors to drive feature enhancements that are necessary to meet business needs. Ability to drive relevant strategic solutions in a complex environment is highly desirable.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Automation at Rapid7 (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Rapid7 is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to join the engineering team in our offices in El Segundo, CA. This team is focused on expanding Rapid7’s existing products and creating new product lines. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of shipping enterprise-class software to a large installed customer base.


Candidates must be able to quickly ramp up, learn our product suite and immediately set to transforming product stories into a functional test suite developed in Cucumber, specifically identifying key high risk quality targets. Prior experience in the security, networking and/or data analytics space is a plus. Candidates must have the ability to quickly grasp Rapid7’s current product designs, become proficient with Rapid7’s products, and become knowledgeable in company tools and technologies. This is an extremely hands-on, technical role. 


Using our current suite of framework tools, along with introducing appropriate new solutions to creatively build a world class verification automation framework, we expect out-of-the-box thinking from candidates as with all engineers. This SDET is a key member of the core Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable test toolset approach for assigned product coverage, as well as contributing to the improvement of our release framework. The ideal candidate has a solid track record of day-to-day test automation framework development in Ruby or similar and contributing on verification strategy and risk mitigation improvements.


The Software Engineer is a key member of the CORE Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable tools and test framework to help maintain and ensure stability and quality of our product.


We are an agile company with weekly(!) product releases. Great environment and attitude. As part of a scrum team you will be interacting with PM/Support/Customers to help us build the right things for our customers.


Responsibilities:



  • Enable the team to meet release based and SLA-bound release requirements

  • Test Extend and improve upon existing framework automation

  • Design, develop and refine Cucumber automation classes and code strategy for the automation framework

  • Analyze epics being developed and create succinct tools coverage as well as identify the areas for regression coverage

  • Develop reusable automated regression verification frameworks to improve test framework scope

  • Work to document, analyze and investigate issues found during test execution and present findings to help provide solutions

  • Work with all key groups to insure functional and non-functional requirements are tracked and converted into test components for continuous automation coverage

  • Drive towards delivery of those commitments throughout the iteration and raise risks early

  • Identify the risks and appropriate testing to validate coverage, and develop test plans and test cases

  • Be open to learning new technologies and new problem domains.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
What does this role entail? You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a full-stack engineer, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member.


You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Software Engineer (.NET/MVC) - 2+ Years Experience at Advanced Enterprise Technologies, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
The ideal candidate would possess a thorough understanding of the .Net Framework and related technologies. Advanced Enterprise Technologies, Inc. develops ASP.net web pages, Mobile PC applications, and web services, using Microsoft C# within the MVC application framework. The primary databases are Microsoft SQL servers.


We offer a stimulating environment for software developers who can analyze, develop, deliver and support high quality business software. The ideal candidate will have strong abilities to design and develop complete systems that integrate with the existing software library. Software testing, database design, project management, documentation and user training are all routine expectations of the development team. We combine parts of the RUP methodology along with Agile which stresses smaller deliveries, but maintain an understanding of the full scope of the business needs.


Candidates should expect to spend at least two weeks in the office to acclimate with our product.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Preact (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: Our Infrastructure team is responsible for maintaining and improving custom automation tools to configure servers and interface with AWS.  You will setup monitoring and alerting to ensure stability and continuity of our various services and machines.  You will plan and manage to ensure our infrastructure and operational needs are met as the company expands and our product continues to grow. You will communicate and plan with the Engineering, Science, Product and Customer Success teams.  You will take part in our 24/7 on-call rotation.  You will test and choose new technologies best suited for upcoming product features.

item.title: BAMx Software Engineer at BAMx (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


At BAMx, we use a variety of open source technologies such as Python, Flask, Angular, MySQL, Redshift, Redis, Eleasticsearch, Celery, and Docker.


We’re looking for someone with serious JavaScript chops to help us build out our AngularJS web application, our third-party integrations, and a Chrome browser extension.


If you can work onsite in NYC, love solving problems and want to work with a small, talented, dedicated team then please get in touch.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer at Antsquare Technologies Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Antsquare is seeking an experienced and self-driven iOS developer to help build our existing iOS app. You will be working on a small team solving problems that directly make a business impact to our customers. Daily tasks can and will include implementing new features and designs, optimizing the app for buttery smooth performance, and building tools to streamline our development process . Not to mention mentoring and learning from the current engineering team members & having a little fun as well!


Our current iOS app is built on top of some amazing open source projects and we would love to see any contributions back to the iOS community.

item.title: Software Engineer - Growing Startup at OrderMyGear.com (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Come join us at OrderMyGear (OMG!) and play a pivotal role in a rapidly changing industry. You will be part of a small but growing development team, making a direct impact on the development process and culture.


We’re building our platform with tools like Docker, Go, PHP, Node, Backbone, React and other exciting technologies (we always pick the right tool for the job).


IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:



  • Work closely with all teams to understand needs, distill requests down, come up with a plan, get buy-in, and implement.

  • Build and maintain internal tools that enable our business to make data-driven decisions.

  • Collaborate closely with the team to set the technical direction of our platform.

  • Be proactive in solving problems and comfortable in moving quickly.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Development, aGalaxy at A10 Networks (San Jose, CA)
item.description: As a member of web development software engineering group, you will develop software for a Management system to manage Application Delivery and Security devices in the local network and in Private/Public Clouds

item.title: Technical Operations Engineer- 3rd Shift at Spot Trading LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Are you a talented IT professional? Do you see yourself working with cutting-edge technology in a low latent environment? Are you passionate about solving complex problems that others give up on? Can you picture yourself supporting traders and automated trading systems? Can you query a database on the fly and produce data a trader can act on immediately?


Time, speed, and expertise are critical in our industry! We need an overnight IT Analyst who can facilitate quick resolutions to any trading or technology-related incident or request. As a member of Spot’s team, you will be constantly challenged!



  • Reconcile positions

  • Process Corporate Actions

  • Walk the datacenter to ensure all devices are operating correctly.  Troubleshoot those that indicate something is wrong

  • Trigger, monitor, and troubleshoot the initialization of the Production applications

  • Perform various IT Infrastructure checks

  • Monitor and troubleshoot the initialization of the Staging applications

  • Work with third party vendors to resolve issues

  • IT projects and tasks as assigned

item.title: Senior back end developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for back end engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please send us your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Systems Architect at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Systems Architect. The Systems Architect will collaborate with the Architecture Team and software designers to engineer a secure, scalable, and extensible application infrastructure for Wiland Products. This individual guides the software design process to ensure the project objectives and requirements are met with an effective solution compatible with the existing architecture. This Architect performs a variety of technical activities for assigned projects and maintenance requests as dictated by business priorities. The primary responsibilities of the Systems Architect include:




  1. Collaborate with Architects, Design Leads, Software Development Directors, and DBAs on high-level design, data modeling, and process flows as defined by the Wiland development methodology.

  2. Review detail designs (process flows, process specifications, pseudo-code) for assigned development projects.

  3. Assist in writing and publishing the Development Standards and Best Practices for use by the software development teams.

  4. Ensure adherence to established software development standards and guidelines.

  5. Evaluate and recommend tools and technologies for development of enterprise software.

item.title: Software Engineer, Firmware at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The firmware team (wireless and switching & appliance) develops the software that runs on our networking gear. We focus on simplicity over bell and whistles, and leverage data from thousands of networks around the world to continuously improve the performance and stability of our products.


Because our devices are managed from the cloud, customers are able to deploy firmware upgrades to their networks with just a few clicks. This means that we can develop new features, iterate on existing features, and fix bugs far more quickly than most of our competitors.


Example projects and tasks for the firmware team include:



  • Implementing a scalable, distributed wireless roaming feature to seamlessly hand off client connections between access points in large campus deployments.

  • Developing fast and accurate deep packet inspection features so network administrators can see what applications are being used on their network and use that to inform decisions about network policies.

  • Implementing controlled delay queuing to help counteract "buffer bloat".

  • Analyzing data collected from thousands of networks to improve channel selection, airtime fairness, and bit-rate selection for wireless clients.

  • Implementing dynamic routing protocols such as OSPF with enough flexibility to support our customers' use cases while keeping the configuration interface easy to understand.

  • Implementing VRRP-based high-availability features so our appliances and switches can be deployed in redundant pairs.

  • Virtualizing our security appliance firmware, and then building out a testbed of thousands of virtual appliances (each with simulated clients behind them) for scale testing our products.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Computer Vision Startup NYC (Series B) at Curalate (New York, NY)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented DevOps engineers to join our team.  Our technical team is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few good DevOps engineers to build and scale our infrastructure to make it all possible.


Responsibilities:


You'll be expected to dive into our stack and toolkit, and start shipping code on day one. We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute ideas as well as code. Specific responsibilities include:



  • Continuously monitor and improve our infrastructure for performance, stability, scalability, and security

  • Develop and improve the build and deployment pipeline

  • Plan service capacity

  • Develop and test disaster recovery scenarios

  • Assist with infrastructure planning and implementation

  • Implement security best practices, from OS-level patches to organizational methods

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Sauce Labs Inc (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Sauce Labs provides the world's largest automation cloud for testing web and native/hybrid mobile applications. Founded by the original creator of Selenium, Sauce Labs helps companies accelerate software development cycles, improve application quality and deploy with confidence across 500+ browser / OS platforms. Join us in making the world a better place for continuous integration and software development. We’re building a next generation infrastructure as a service platform.


We’re looking for Senior Systems Engineer to join our Ops Team. This role will be responsible for the successful operations and scaling of the infrastructure and software that powers Sauce Labs and launches over 10 million VMs a month.


Responsibilities:




  • Write tools and scripts to provide automation and self service solutions for ourselves and other teams




  • Design new systems to support production services




  • Install, configure and debug hardware and systems in our data center;




  • Creatively solve scale challenges regarding a rapidly expanding cloud environment;




  • Work with real hardware - high density Cisco UCS B-series blades and C-series rack-mount servers, Nexus networking (10Gb+ core network), storage (NAS and SAN), Mac-in-a-datacenter, custom appliances for mobile devices, load balancers, and beyond;




  • Help improve monitoring and identify key performance metrics;




  • Proactive R&D - discovering and implementing new tools, emerging technology, etc.;




  • Disaster recovery design, implementation, and maintenance;




  • Create NOC runbooks, procedures, documentation, and diagrams of the environments you manage;




  • Troubleshooting and resolution of server/network issues;




  • Help maintain hardware in Sauce’s colocation facilities;




  • Help build out new data centers around the globe;




  • Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation.




Here are a couple of examples of the kind of projects you might work on:




  • Optimize hardware and configuration for improving hypervisor performance.




  • Automating and migrating a system configuration to our UCS platform for faster production scaling.




  • Building and optimizing a logstash cluster for our development team to monitor and analyze production system usage.




We have a lot of big projects and decisions that need to be made, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Sound like fun? Here’s what we’re looking for:


Our Ideal Candidate:




  • 3+ years recent experience working as a Linux administrator/engineer at scale (hundreds of systems) and designing/deploying ‘highly available’ solutions;






  • 2+ years of recent professional experience designing, developing, and operating Configuration Management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, Salt (preferred), or Ansible (preferred) at scale;




  • Solid experience in Linux tuning, profiling, and monitoring;




  • Strong skills in at least one language: Python (preferred), Ruby, Bash.




Bonus points for:




  • Experience deploying/managing KVM-Qemu and LXC




  • Solid understanding of cloud/networking/distributed computing environment concepts; including TCP/ IP connections, firewalls, VLANs, etc.




  • Experience and understanding of contemporary metrics, monitors, and logging solutions especially statsD, Graphite, ELK, Splunk, Nagios, etc.




  • Provisioning and automation with Cisco Unified Computing System Manager




  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, able to work individually, as well as within a team, and across teams;




  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written across all user levels;




  • Deployment automation in physical and virtual environments (PXE, Cobbler, MAAS (preferred));




  • Working knowledge of load balancing technologies (hard/soft);




  • Proven experience collaborating in a cross functional team environment;




  • Familiarity with software engineering practices, including n-tier architecture, configuration management, development methodologies (e.g. agile, waterfall, spiral, prototyping), etc.




Notes:



  • This role can be based in either South Bay or in San Francisco. Some travel to South Bay or SF is required.

  • Relocation available.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Devops Engineer at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
DevOps Engineers at Rally Health work incredibly close with our engineering and product teams to help design, implement, and scale our predominantly Scala and MongoDB based architecture. We are obsessively focused on maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our product teams need in order to succeed.


If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment on top of: AWS, MongoDB, CDN, ELB; deployed and managed environment using Chef; and have excellent analytical skills, and a taste for good engineering. WE WANT YOU!  


You will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment at Rally Health. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with an outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Responsibilities: 





  • Build and maintain a highly fault tolerant infrastructure on public cloud

  • Build and document cutting-edge automation tools to improve capacity and velocity for software engineers and production operations

  • Collaborate with our development team to implement and evolve solutions for a wide array of challenging projects

  • Improve provisioning, automation, configuration, integration, deployment and release processes

  • Mentor, train and develop team members for career progression and learning

  • Participate in 7x24 on-call rotation

item.title: Systems Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
About the Job
Become a member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest indie game development platform in the world with more than 17 million unique active users. We are ranked #1 among kids entertainment sites in the U.S. for the number of daily visitors, total minutes, total page views, total visits, and average length of visits by ComScore. Each month we have more than 4.4 million active users and more than 70 million hours of engagement. Our users have created more than 15 million games and have played 2 billion hours since 2008.

As a Data Center Ops Engineer, your duties will include, but are not limited to:



  • Maintain a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Triage, troubleshoot, and solve production issues caused by failures in hardware, configuration, networking, vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolve complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritize and multitask daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Design, deploy and configure servers and complex firewall environments

  • Assist in implementing disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborate with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Collect, document and help manage vendor-related services

  • Manage systems and develop contingency plans

  • Participate in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits:



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Zymeworks Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to help improve our software infrastructure. We pride ourselves on developing useful and robust software, and would like to have a world-class development environment for our team including automated builds, continuous integration, monitoring and fault tolerance.


 As Senior DevOps Engineer, your responsibilities would include:



  • Interfacing between Software Development and Systems Administration teams 

  • Facilitating the transition of our platform from our own in-house cluster to the cloud

  • Creating and managing standardized software development environments for the Software Development team

  • Developing automated systems for deployment, monitoring and fault tolerance

  • Helping improve software deployment, monitoring and development processes taking into account systems requirements

  • Working with the systems team to provide the necessary services for the software development team

  • Laying the foundation for a strong DevOps team, and establishing a common language between developers and system team members.

  • Envisioning long term goals for our infrastructure along with the Software and Systems team leads.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Area 1 Security (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
The role: 


We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. This role involves building out systems that support the biggest and most targeted companies in the world, enabling the whole engineering org to iterate at top speed in an open, decentralized environment. Systems management and automation is the name of the game here - in development, testing, staging and production. If you love working on software products that have an impact and want some serious experience under exponential growth conditions, this is it. 



We also realize there's a lot to accomplish in this position, and we're open to people who want to work full time remotely as long as they're able to travel to our office in Redwood City as needed. 



Here’s more about what you’ll accomplish at Area 1: 


* You'll act as an "engineer for the engineers," helping others understand the architectures and platforms underlying the solution. 


* You'll have free reign to make improvements wherever you find inefficiencies. 


* You’ll debug complicated failures and be able to grok complex systems from their roadmaps all the way down to their syscalls. 


* You’ll build and lead a DevOps team as we scale.

item.title: Software Developer (All Levels) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is on a path of unprecedented growth. The development team is aggressively driving innovation, design, implementation and deployment of large scale distributed applications and web services. Our core mission is to solve complex problems around big data and analytics. To develop and modify software to drive (pun intended!) the accuracy of predicting traffic flow and deliver the most valuable and accurate results to our customers!

The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset. Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience.

What you’re looking for:



  • A cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers

  • Practical experience in working in a fast paced “start-up like” environment with high performing teams

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers are focused on delivering complex data and services that must be delivered with extremely low latency

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged (required) to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development, not one of many

  • Design, implement, and deploy large scale distributed applications and web services

  • Solve complex problems to develop software to drive the most valuable and accurate results to our customers


What we’re looking for:



  • Senior, Mid-Level, and Junior Software Developers -- experience with software development, architecture and deign, enjoys creating exciting products through hands-on coding

  • Experience in designing, implementing and deploying large-scale distributed applications and web services

  • Experience maintaining and extending applications and services through their lifetime

  • Experience in developing in Java on enterprise platforms (C# equivalent experience accepted)

  • Solid understand of graph algorithms

  • Demonstrated strong technical judgment in conjunction with passionate customer-focus

  • Be collaborative, have a strong work ethic, be reliable and a self-starter

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or related discipline


 What’s so exciting about our platform?

We’re working on a cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers.  You’ll be joining a team focused on delivering engineering solutions to support complex services that must be delivered with extremely low latency.  You will have a strategic role driving decisions that will shape INRIX's capabilities and the future technical direction of our products.
Ideal Candidates have:



  • Strong experience in open source stacks and some experience in MSFT stack

  • Working knowledge in probability, statistics and analytics,  GIS/LBS concepts highly desired

  • Experience delivering and operating SaaS product offerings in an iterative, agile software lifecycle in AWS or Azure

  • Experience in Big Data architectures, NoSQL DB’s, Hadoop/HDFS/map/reduce, real time streaming analytics, visualization, or other technologies in the Big Data Analytics stack


Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Software Engineer at Fulgent Therapeutics, LLC (Temple City, CA)
item.description:
Fulgent Diagnostics is a rapidly growing CLIA-certified & CAP-accredited diagnostics laboratory. We offer comprehensive next generation genetic testing and great customer service for a wide spectrum of genetic disorders for diagnosis, genetic counseling, and prenatal testing. We are seeking a full-time Node.js/Web developer to join our fast growing bioinformatics team.



Short Description: 



"Full-time Node.js/UI Web Developer. Technologies: SQL, NodeJS, JQuery with knowledge in transaction processing. Minimum 2-years working experience. BA/BS in Computer Science.



Full Description:



Full-time Node.js/UI Web Developer



You'll be building web applications to enable our customers and enable our team members. You'll be thanked by both of them for improving our workflow, our turn-around-times, and for making their lives easier. You'll be building custom interfaces, work queues, weekly reports, dashboards, and integrating with several in-bound/out-bound interfaces. Above that, you'll be learning about bioinformatics and aiding in the diagnostic process of improving the lives of the customers we serve.



Must haves:



  • Exceptional ability with node.js, jQuery, Javascript

  • Exceptional ability with CSS, HTML5

  • Exceptional ability with SQL, PL/SQL

  • Exceptional ability with User Interface Design

  • Experience building PDF Documents

  • Experience building Reports and Dashboards

  • Experience with GIT Source Control

  • Experience with Windows and Linux

  • Experience with Transaction Processing

  • Experience manipulating data in JSON, XML, CSV, XLSX

  • Deep understanding of Web Security and User Authentication

  • Understanding of Browser Limitations

  • Understanding of Locus of Control

  • Strong communication skills

  • Works well in teams and also works well alone

  • Minimum 2 years working experience

  • Minimum BA or BS in Computer Science or equivalent 


Nice to have:



  • Experience with C/C++/Java/Scala

  • Experience with python, bash, regular expression


Must be willing to take a remote programming test as part of the application process. No independent contractors and no free-lancers.

item.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer at Ivenix (Amesbury, MA)
item.description:
About You


You want to put your fingerprint on something that will help bring medical care to the state of the art. You consider software craftsmanship an absolute necessity for a highly productive team. You use system-based thinking and thrive as a member of an agile, cross functional team. You know how to manage multiple tasks concurrently and correctly prioritize them. You are able to collaborate across hardware and software engineering aspects of system development to achieve great results. You also have the experience and knowledge we are looking for:



  • You are skilled in the development of embedded software on bare-metal chipsets

  • You have a deep understanding of the Linux operating system and have written drivers to control hardware

  • You have a strong understanding of the unique software development challenges associated with a  resource-limited, battery-operated, network accessible embedded device

  • You have 8+ years of embedded software engineering experience along with a degree in math, electrical engineering, or computer science

  • Experience with Agile Software Development practices is a plus

  • Experience in the medical device industry is a plus


The Position



  • Design and implement medical applications running on an ARM Cortex A9, STM32 and MSP430 chipset

  • Design and develop software that interfaces with hardware devices

  • Read electronic schematic designs, component data sheets, and derive requirements for embedded software

  • Review and engage in the development of software specifications compliant with our established quality system and design controls

item.title: Sr. Full-Stack Engineer at Crunchyroll (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Crunchyroll is looking for world-class backend engineers to work on our suite of internal APIs. Example services include media and video, user account management, eCommerce, digital publishing, payments social media, and more. The ideal candidate is a full-stack LAMP engineer. Qualified candidates are highly technical and have a knack for building production-quality services for millions of users. They are professional software engineers with strong technical design principles, not hackers. They think before they code, they adhere to principles of software abstraction in API design, and they are cognizant of capabilities as well as limitations in what they build. They are not married to a specific language or implementation, but see the merits in using the right tool for the job.


Responsibilities



  • Work with other engineers and technical product managers to implement and maintain features for our internal platform

  • Improve the reliability of our services via robust testing infrastructure

  • Improve the scalability of our services through proper planning and changes to architecture

  • Improve the availability of our services through better monitoring, performance reporting, error reporting

  • Improve the server response times of our APIs by profiling and identifying bottlenecks and eliminating them

  • Improve the security of our systems

  • Work with devops and sys admin to deploy new technologies

item.title: Android Developer at PicMonkey (Seattle, WA)

item.title: Software Engineer, Python - really strong team, big scale (30+ servers) at Growbots (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description:
Growbots Inc. – a Warsaw startup made with enthusiasm. We’re a part of 500 Startups – one of the best accelerators in the US. At Growbots we’re building A.I. for sales with the ultimate goal of automating the entire sales development process. You will be part of great Team, working with other nice, experienced programmers who are ready to help. We expect that you will bring also great value to our company - experience, skills, proactivity.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at SOLS (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mobile app is a core component of our platform.  Today, it enables our providers to prescribe SOLS.  Tomorrow, it will enable anyone, anywhere to order SOLS for themselves and their friends.  It will also be the connection to our Smart SOLS to help our users monitor their daily walking habits and improvements.  We are looking for engineers who want to help us build an app that our customers will love to use.  Success in this role requires a combination of initiative, technical capability, and passion to deliver.  We are looking for people who can demonstrate the following skills, talents, and experiences:

  • Comfort and experience working beyond Objective-C.  Our stack includes python, PHP, and C++, so its important that you are willing to get your hands dirty with other components when needed to get your job done.

  • An appreciation for agile, testing, and shipping products frequently

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java, Large-Scale Distributed Systems) at Jasper (Santa Clara, CA)

Jasper is a fast-growing pre-IPO company headquartered in Santa Clara, CA. We are the pioneer and global leader in cloud-based platforms for the Internet of Things (IoT). item.title: Sr Application Security Engineer at NetSuite (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Summary:
As a senior security engineer you will focus on finding and fixing vulnerabilities, promoting good security practices, and designing security frameworks for use by NetSuite developers. The ideal candidate loves both building and breaking software. This is a job where details matter, and there are a lot of details, including all of web security, mobile security, cloud security and software security. You must be able to tell the difference between a big problem, a minor weakness, and a false positive. You must help developers understand security concepts and security practices. You need to be friendly but uncompromising when it comes to getting security right.


Responsibilities:
• Identify, reproduce, and report security issues
• Do security reviews for feature design/implementations
• Design and implement Security APIs

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f) - Rendering & Cloud Computing at Dassault Systemes 3DExcite GmbH (München, Deutschland)

Show all in: Munich - Germany, Research & Software Development, Permanent


 Job Responsibilities


Verify & validate next generation 3D rendering & distributed rendering technology on API level

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Blue Coat / Perspecsys (Mississauga, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Are you an outstanding Java Developer looking for an exciting company where you can contribute to today's hottest information technology? We are currently looking for developers for projects to build out our core platform for protecting sensitive corporate data in the cloud. You will be working with some of the world’s leading cloud solutions, and inventing the next generation of cloud security.


Our elite engineering team has immediate openings for experienced or junior software engineers with expertise in enterprise server software and web application development along with the capability to excel. We are looking for creative, out-of-the-box developers eager to tackle difficult problems. If you love working on leading-edge projects, from design to coding to implementation, have a wide range of technical skills, and have the right aptitude and mindset to become one of the best, then we need to talk. Come be part of the excitement - apply now!

item.title: Web Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)

We are looking for Web Engineers to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. item.title: QA Engineer (Automated and Performance) at mywedding.com (Castle Rock, CO)
item.description:
With music playing in the background, friendly people greeting you at the door, and breathtaking views of the mountains, mywedding.com feels like a home away from home. 



At mywedding.com we provide engaged couples with wedding planning inspiration, useful planning tools, exceptional content from a diverse set of partners and access to the best local, national and international venues and businesses.



In November 2014 mywedding.com joined the Meredith family (NYSE:MDP), the leading media and marketing company serving American women. As a result of this acquisition and our anticipated growth we are looking for exceptional sales associates to join our team. 

About The Job:

EARN, LEARN and LAUGH at mywedding! Our QA Engineers work in a fast-paced culture, surrounded by talented, motivated and intellectual colleagues.   



They play a strategic role in verifying the quality of web software in a LAMP environment to deliver and support industry-leading wedding planning applications. This position will emphasize test automation and performance testing of the application and will require the successful candidate to have software development and scripting skills:  In this role you will:



  • Responsible for delivering high quality scripts, applications, and tools to support core QA function:

    • Automating tests for core application features and functionality

    • Automating regression, edge case, failure case, and break-and-destroy tests

    • Performance, load, and endurance testing

    • Delivers high quality, well commented, and unit tested code they are proud to have peer reviewed



  • Works with business owners to understand, define, and implement tests that meet product requirements

  • Conducts manual testing as required to ensure product delivery goals are met

  • Writing and executing test plans and matrices

  • Writes clear, complete, and concise defects

  • Troubleshoots and researches root cause

  • Understands and contributes to ensuring the security of the application and user data

  • Thrives in Agile, Scrum, and Kanban environments

  • Off-hour and weekend work may be required as business needs dictate

  • Perform related work as required

  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon makes shopping more convenient for millions of customers and Dash Button and Dash Replenishment Service (DRS) are bringing this to a new level, revolutionizing the future of e-commerce. Reordering favorite consumables is easy with the simple press of Dash Button. With DRS, we will enable connected devices to fully automate replenishment, reordering needed consumables when they start to run low.



Our team is responsible for the backend web services, mobile app experience, and developer facing SDK & experiences that power the Dash Button & DRS. We are looking for talented Software Development Engineers to develop new & innovative experiences. This is an opportunity to work with a broad set of technologies and develop & deploy exciting new experiences to customers on a regular cadence.


  • Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science or related field

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in areas such as data structures and algorithms

  • Strong object-oriented design and coding skills in at least one modern programming language such as Java, C++, or C#

  • Experience building scalable systems/applications in a complex, distributed environment

  • Self-directed and capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Excellent leadership, problem solving and analytical skills

  • Experience playing a lead role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Javascript and AngularJS at RealMassive (Austin, TX)
item.description:
RealMassive is looking for an über-talented & energetic front end web developer to help build and deploy our game-changing marketing platform. Creativity, personality, tats & piercings encouraged.


About You...


You are an experienced software engineer who is passionate about building quality software that delights customers and meets our organizational needs. You are a leader: others hold you in high regard and look up to you as a specialist in software development. When you promulgate opinions on software, others listen. For years, you worked diligently to establish a rock solid foundation in computer science. You continuously learn new technologies and stay apprised of current trends. When you create, it’s fast, clean, and elegant. Junior engineers are constantly learning from you and your work. You are on a path of continuous improvement. You can deliver under pressure and on strict timelines. You’re comfortable leading a team in agile practices and getting the most out of them. You can manage and code on multiple projects. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong will to jump in, produce, and lead. You’ve worked hard to get where you are, and you’re not done yet. Your next steps are Technical Director or VP of Engineering.


This senior level role reports directly to the CTO and includes coding and leadership.


Requirements



  • Expert foundation on the principles of computer science. A degree in computer science or related field; Masters or PhD preferred.

  • Expert in Javascript, AngularJS, and other front end frameworks and technologies.

  • Experience all across the stack.

  • 2+ years managing multiple projects.

  • 2+ years experience managing scrum teams.


Benefits



  • Competitive compensation (salary and stock options)

  • Medical & dental insurance

  • Relocation assistance available

  • Work with a close-knit, passionate team providing key innovations to an industry controlling an $15 trillion asset base.

If you think you would be a good candidate, e-mail us a resume and cover letter to jobs@realmassive.com. No recruiters please.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Solar Performance Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a talented developer to develop software tools in Python to evaluate photovoltaic system performance. You will work with a team of analysts who are experts in how solar systems function, and need your help to implement smart software algorithms that identify underperforming systems. You will develop both the underlying analysis engine, and the user interface and data visualization tools used by our teams responsible for servicing underperforming photovoltaic systems.


The ideal candidate would have proven results in developing user interfaces and middleware for data analysis. You seek out the simplest solution, but don’t shy away from more complicated algorithms and mathematics when appropriate. You like leading the full software development cycle, from requirements gathering and architecture, through coding, testing, and deployment, and you enjoy working on small teams, where you can make a big individual impact.

item.title: Front end engineer at Gridium (Menlo Park, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Gridium is looking for a front-end web developer to help us build the next generation of energy management and operational tools for big buildings.


At Gridium we take in data -- lots of data -- and turn it into insights that help property managers save electricity and money. Our users are busy so we provide them with intuitive tools and beautiful visualizations that help them get the information they need as quickly as possible.


We also work with utilities to design programs that scale to hundreds of thousands of businesses. Our software results in demonstrated savings, which means cleaner air and a more reliable grid.


We are a small, focused team who believes everyone deserves to use great software. Gridium is a highly collaborative work environment where you will have significant ownership from your first day on the job.


We are also a distributed team, so you should be comfortable and excited about working remotely. Of course, face time is important, so once a quarter we pick a city and meet up for several days of highly productive and highly fun planning and doing (and eating and socializing).


Please note: distributed team means no central office. We would love to talk to you, but only if you are comfortable working remotely!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)

As an Android developer you will be a key member of our growing mobile engineering team, developing industry-leading mobile applications and SDKs. The ideal candidate is a quick learner who is not afraid of digging deep into new technical challenges, loves to work with Kanban in small teams, and has experience shipping one or more Android apps that are currently available on Google Play Store.
