What we offer...


At HERE, we strive to deliver memorable moments and unforgettable experiences for our employees. You'll have the opportunity to work with highly respected industry professionals from around the world, and learn from their experiences every day. In return, we will prepare you for future opportunities to progress within the business and drive your own career; acquiring new skills and expertise along the way.

item.title: Scientific Software Lead, Proteomics at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics team (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. Members of this group have a chance to participate in groundbreaking biomedical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated scientific software lead with an excellent understanding of proteomics, genomics, and research data, as well as experience in software engineering principles, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.


This candidate will work closely with scientists and software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenges from proteomics enabled drug discovery research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment. The candidate will be expected to work as a team member and/or leading a team to deliver solutions to support NIBR’s biology and proteomics research.



Responsibilities:



  • Actively work with scientists in disease areas to communicate with scientists effectively and understand their needs

  • Define proper informatics solution(s) to address the scientific needs

  • Work with internal and/or external software teams to design proper solutions to meet scientists’ needs

  • Serve as a key expert analyst to guide the engineering team to design proper data standards, data models and analysis tools to serve NIBR-wide informatics needs

  • Work effectively with different Informatics and IT groups globally to ensure that solutions are effectively and efficiently implemented

item.title: Sr. Scientific Software Lead (IS Beta) at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide them with the best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. The members in this group have a chance to participate in the groundbreaking medical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

The NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated Senior Scientific Software Lead with an excellent understanding of genomics, research data, and lab workflows, as well as experience in software engineering and informatics, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.

The successful candidate will work closely with scientists and talented software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenge arising from genomic drug discovery research. The ideal candidate should be a highly motivated team player with a strong understanding of genomics, as well as data management and analysis needs associated with target discovery and screening research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment and be capable of leading a technical team to deliver solutions to support NIBR drug discovery biology research.

Major Accountabilities / Key Performance Indicators



  • Gather user requirements and perform needs assessments to guide development and selection of software systems.

  • Support scientific research with software systems which capture experimental design, enable data analysis and interpretation, and provide for regular communication on genomics projects.

  • Design and/or supervise development and testing of software systems to meet or exceed project objectives.

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing team of developers by establishing high technical standards and demonstrating, by way of example, technical excellence in all stages of software development.

  • Manage and motivate high-performing teams of developers by setting clear expectations and delivering effective feedback.

  • Use software version control system, automated build tools, ticket tracking software, architecture documentation, and release engineering processes.

  • Develop and optimize techniques and methods to improve software development processes including test driven development, agile methodology, and pair programming.

  • Work closely with cross-functional groups (engineers and researchers, management, business analysts, and internal customers), in a highly matrixed organization to build constructive and effective relationships throughout the whole organization.

item.title: Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
You


Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.


Our Tech


At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.


We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.


We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.  


Our Culture


We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture, stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013”  


Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers.  We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate.  So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people.  After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.


If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not.  You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.


We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).


Our Company


Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health.


Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA).


Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo.


But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.


Our Products


At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease.  We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch) and fitness (GigaOm).  More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.  


Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012.  It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member.  How, you ask?  Great question!  It has:


* A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;


* The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;


* Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.


* A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use


* Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users


Our Benefits


If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay).  Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.  


We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting).  We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).


Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

item.title: Software Developers at Boeing Defence Australia (Brisbane, Australia)
item.description:
BDA's Internal Research and Development Department has been established by the business to drive innovation and next generation technology and prototyping, whilst producing a strong return on investment to the company.


The Phantom Works International division of Boeing Defence, Space & Security (BDS) is responsible for executing Internal Research and Development (IRAD) projects on behalf of BDS in Australia


The IRAD Department is currently recruiting staff for two key projects: a project involving algorithm development for distributed, multi-domain and multi-data type fusion, and a multi-platform integration technology demonstration and evaluation live virtual and constructive environment project.


The software engineer will be part of one of a number of small project teams within the IRAD department, where you will help drive innovation and next generation technology development and prototyping, with a strong focus on commercial outcomes and results delivery.


Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer f/m at Smaato Inc. (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Systems Engineering Team at Smaato operates a highly available, globally distributed, latency bound web service hosted exclusively on Amazon Web Services. Our environment relies heavily on Ubuntu LTS in EC2, as well as many other AWS services. We are actively expanding to include new technologies and new operational capacity through automation and monitoring. We are also looking into all that new and hip container stuff.


Key Responsibilities:
You are an experienced Linux Systems Engineer, comfortable with working in terminal, and editing in vi. You lust for automating infrastructure tasks, and are willing to take on a slew of challenges to help build something new and enable us to meet new challenges.
You dream of running large clusters of systems efficiently, and quickly resolving problems as they appear. Your desire for a monitored and properly metricked platform borders on obsessional. You have used BSD and four different flavors of Linux, and found them all just not quite perfect enough. You see the potential in quickly adjusting infrastructure around the needs of the moment, and prediction around upcoming requirements.

item.title: Software Engineer at Trade IT (New York, NY)
item.description:
TradeIt engineering team exhibits high energy, deep technical skills and a drive to get things done. Jobs are broadly defined and interact with Product Design, Product Management, Business Development and Marketing.


The Front-End team works deep within javascript to create a highly dynamic environment. If reading the jQuery release logs and listening to or arguing with Douglass Crockford is your idea of a fun afternoon, then we’re looking for you to come help us push the boundaries of what browsers can do.



Our Mobile team strives to find the smoothest and most efficient implementations of pairing backend data (mainly JSON) with a turly unique interface. We don’t pick sides, so if you’ve signed more Apple NDA’s for developer previews than you can count or if someone says Halo and you think of the Paranoid team before the XBOX game, we’re looking for your skills.



The Back-End team works with GRAILS, Java, MySql, Redis and all things based on OO principals. Configuring and  building scalable, high-performance, back-end applications in groovy to interface with a dynamic web and mobile front-end is part of the day to day. If you believe that a problem well put is half solved, we’ve got a comfy place for you to write elegant solutions.



We're looking for great developers on each of our product teams: mobile applications, back-end infrastructure, and front-end web applications. One-to-one fit or a one-to-many, we're interested in both seasoned veterans and recent graduates and all flavors in-between.

item.title: DevOps Engineer / FinTech Startup at IEX (New York, NY)
item.description:
IEX is looking for what we are calling our next System Reliability Engineer – you may also know this role as DevOps, WebOps, SystemsOps, and so on. The right person for the job will be an insatiably curious tinkerer with technical chops, who may or may not have done this type of role before. Bonus points if you take an interest in the stock market, though a willingness to learn all about the inner workings of the market is a must. In this role, you’ll be constantly optimizing and automating our processes and systems, in an effort to improve reliability, scalability, and maintainability. Plus, you’ll take on real-time responsibilities, such as monitoring, incident management, and recovery.


Coding and scripting is part of our daily life (we like python, bash, awk, sed and we are currently exploring Go). You’ll be exposed to how the technology interacts with the business side, and will gain a deep understanding of application logic and business data work-flows which is essential during the recovery process when an incident occurs. Experience with any layer in our stack (Linux, Java, C++) is highly beneficial particularly around the areas of performance and capacity. Experience in an agile environment is a plus, and a willingness to tackle the challenge of innovating within a regulated environment is key.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Responsible for monitoring the health of our systems

  • Participate in the engineering process as we design, build, and manage our systems.

  • Build tools to monitor and automate processes.

  • Be a core contributor in our change management and the post mortem processes

  • Troubleshoot issues across the whole stack - hardware, software, applications and network.

  • Document current and future configuration processes and policies.

  • Translates customer needs and projected product utilization to operational reliability targets.

  • Write systems reliability plan and report progress on attaining reliability targets to team and senior management.

  • Guides other functions (e.g., development, market operations, business development, subscribers, etc.) on reliability techniques, application and system functionality.

  • Educates and mentors team/company on operational best practices

item.title: Systems Software Principal Engineer (C++, Polyglot) at Grier Forensics (Owings Mills, MD)
item.description:
Using C++ and other languages, you'll develop the next generation of security technology. We’ve used C++ to:



  • Accelerate device level forensics by more than 10x over existing technology

  • Implement new network protocols enabling collaborative defense against distributed attacks

  • Detect patterns of insider data theft in real-time through file system analytics


C++ is our language of choice for low level systems software. We write modern C++ (STL, RAII, and Boost). But, given our addiction to innovation and our position on its leading edge, our platforms and tools are always evolving. Therefore, a good fit requires that you thrive on learning new domains and tackling new challenges. Deep talent, problem solving, and a commitment to quality are more important than proficiency in any single language.


Our work straddles the fence between engineering and research. Like research, we’re inventing things that have never been done before. We thrive on discovery and are comfortable with risk. And our domain is never static. Yet, like engineering, we haven’t succeeded until we’ve produced well-built systems that people actually use.


We write code to be read. We’re looking for someone who cares deeply about clear, clean, well factored code. We emphasize architecture: the right architecture leads to a robust, simple, flexible implementation. Our project management is strong but hands off: you’ll be given clear goals and the support you need. From there it’s your job to deliver: you’ll be expected to solve problems independently and get the job done.


If this is the type of challenge you thrive on, we’d love to speak with you further. We’re located in Central Maryland, just outside of Baltimore and about a half hour from the beautiful Chesapeake Bay. Most of the time, you’ll be able to work remotely.


We offer competitive salary and benefits, including health, dental, and vision; 4 weeks paid vacation and holidays; opportunities to perform research, speak, and publish; unlimited technical books at our expense and whatever tools you need.


Grier Forensics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Lead Test Automation Engineer - Distributed Systems at Sentient Technologies (San Francisco, CA)

Sentient Technologies has built the world’s largest and most powerful intelligent system on the planet. We use massively distributed artificial intelligence to solve the world’s most complex problems. So, if you’re looking to work on something bigger than another mobile or social app, please read on.


We're looking for an experienced Lead Test Automation Engineer to join the Distributed Computing team. The Sentient Platform makes effective use of a million cores (outside of data centers), to solve problems in several domains that would be impossible to approach on other platforms. The next version of the platform is orders of magnitude bigger.


You’ll be leading the design and development of comprehensive test infrastructure and end-to-end tests for our platform.

Boulder, Colorado, United States | Information and Technology

Benefits

item.title: DevOps Engineer on our massively scalable messaging platform at Pusher (London, UK)

Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our engineering team so we can solve more problems for developers around the world, and part of that mission means continually improving the way we deploy and maintain our platform.


Some of the things you will be doing:



  • Increasing automation and reducing deployment time on our platform, while still maintaining Pusher's reputation for maximum reliability.

  • Being part of our on-call rota, while building tools and infrastructure that mean you are never called.

* Design, develop, deploy and manage highly available and scalable systems

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



· You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

· Solving problems at scale excites you.

· You don’t implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

· You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

· You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they’re a core part of writing great software.

· You don’t throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

· You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

· Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

· Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

· Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

· Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

· Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

· Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

· Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

· Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

· Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



· Experience of working in a DevOps team.

· Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.



aws-sdesdm-ea

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Becton, Dickinson and Company (Durham, NC)

Our mission is to advance healthcare by improving self-care tools and strengthening the relationship with clinicians and caregivers. Our team is building disruptive solutions using smart medical devices and mobile applications to support and engage chronic disease sufferers, such as diabetics. We are building a platform to include mobile applications for patients and caregivers, a clinician portal, and real-time analytics. Ultimately, our goal is to support BD’s mission to help all people live healthy lives by building world-class integrated solutions for the chronically ill.


About You:


This position primarily focuses on creating the back-end software needed to support our chronic care platform. You should have experience in building mobile and/or web based applications with a focus on the back-end and a passion for improving the state of healthcare.



The Senior Software Engineer position will play a critical role in the full life cycle of our chronic care solution - from design and development through ongoing maintenance.


Responsibilities:

This means a leaner specification process and an excellent end product that's been built with the type of feedback you can only get by trying out aspects of each feature as they're developed. You’ll iterate quickly with an emphasis on clean and reusable code.


We’re building a new product that’s transforming the way businesses save money on energy. We don't care if you've never tried Python, Django or React. Are you the type who wishes that user interfaces had kept up with the developments in modern graphics hardware, and that the cool UIs in movies were available to people in real life?

We are continually improving our platform and are also building flagship applications in-house that leverage and showcase our technology.  We are looking for software engineers who thrive on continually pushing the envelope, and we think we offer one of the best opportunities in the industry to truly apply your skills.

item.title: // CriteoSeniorDeveloper.cs - Senior Software Engineer in Paris, France at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
using System;


using System.Linq;


namespace CriteoQuestions


{


    class Program


    {


        static readonly uint THRESHOLD = 5;


        static uint Question(string text)


        {


            Console.WriteLine(text + " [y/N]");


            string answer = Console.ReadLine();


            return answer != null && answer.Equals("y") ? 1U : 0U;


        }


        static void Main()


        {


            string[] questionTexts =


                {


                    "Looking for a new challenge?",


                    "Want to work in the heart of Paris?",


                    "Do you enjoy solving hard problems efficiently and creatively?",


                    "Would you like to work where Big Data is more than a buzz word?",


                    "Want to work on a product at true web scale with 30B HTTP requests and 2.5B unique banners displayed per day?",


                    "Would you like to know more?"


                };


            uint score = questionTexts.Aggregate<string, uint>(0, (current, text) => current + Question(text));


            Console.WriteLine(score > THRESHOLD


                                  ? @"Contact a.dia@criteo.com today"


                                  : @"That’s a shame, you can learn more at http://labs.criteo.com/ maybe we can change your mind?");


            Console.ReadLine();


        }


    }


}

item.title: Javascript Engineer to help disrupt software security at Codiscope (Boston, MA)
item.description:
There’s incredible excitement and urgency around developing secure software.  But today’s security tools are unwieldy and expensive to implement, fit poorly in modern agile development processes, and often simply pile up bugs of questionable value.  We’re disrupting software security by replacing assessment tools with development tools that build security into software as it’s developed. We scale secure development in today’s app focused, DevOps centric, continuous deployment world.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help our users understand the impact that our products are having in their organization. You will transform mountains of data into actionable insight. You will tackle challenges to deliver blazing fast performance, scale through a microservices architecture, and drive new data storage solutions like NoSQL. You will play a prominent role in our small but strongly backed company and you’ll help accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:



  • Redesigning and transitioning our legacy J2EE application stack towards a MEAN stack

  • Helping move our product to a SaaS model addressing features such as multi-tenancy, streaming

  • Manage for performance and flexibility in distributed architectures

  • Being a strong communicator with ability to coordinate and follow-up aggressively

  • Conducting technical evaluations of new JS frameworks and plugins

  • Conducting code reviews

  • Mentor and develop junior engineers

item.title: Java Software Engineer with a passion for modern tooling at Bol.com (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Over 5 million Dutch and Belgian customers have already discovered that bol.com is a great place to shop. Because we offer over 9(!) million products. Because our products are easy to find on any device. And because every visit is an inspiring, ‘strictly personal’ shopping experience. With 15 to 20 million page views per day, bol.com is a textbook example of a state of the art big data environment. This environment is developed and maintained by 30+ Scrum teams. From desktop to mobile, and from product catalogue to CRM systems; our Scrum teams create the bol.com landscape and make it future-proof. Do you combine a passion for modern tooling with a drive to be at the cutting edge of the big data revolution? Prove to bol.com that you’re a forward-thinking Software Engineer!


As a Software Engineer you develop, test and implement innovative Java based solutions for our retail platform and back-end processes. How can we port web-based solutions to mobile? How can we integrate the catalogues of external vendors (bol.com Plaza) into the ‘regular’ bol.com catalogue? What tools will enable us to automate the test process? You analyze these questions – often in tandem with business units – and come up with answers that go beyond functional requirements to address performance, scalability (think HBase) and security. You provide proactive go-live support, including organizational embedding (tests, user support, demonstrations). Additionally, you develop tools that further optimize the development process itself, helping us to realize our ambition of making continuous integration a corporate standard. You adhere to best practices, including specification by example, and are regularly asked to share your ideas with the entire organization.


Your role in bullet points



  • Develop, test, and implement Java based solutions

  • Deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Provide go-live support, including organizational embedding

  • Develop first-in-class tools, e.g. to automate testing

  • Ambassador of innovative ideas in software development

item.title: Senior Java Back-End Software Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:
- Design and implement the next generation architecture of VMware's virtualization products
- Be part of a software development team working in collaboration with management, quality assurance, user experience and technical publications teams
- You will define/analyze the product requirements, write/read functional and design specifications, write/support the code
- You will perform code reviews to the rest of the team members and will receive code reviews of your code as well
- You will have to adhere to VMware internal processes during the whole development cycle – idea, patent, requirements, specifications, designs, implementation, bug fixing, QA, support, etc.

Required:
- Experience with product development or strong willingness to switch from outsourcing to product development
- General programming knowledge - object oriented principles, data structures, algorithms, design patterns, memory management, etc.
- Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process
- Willingness to innovate, learn and share knowledge, invent and patent new algorithms and technologies
- Professional programming experience in Java and related technologies
- Experience with distributed systems
- Experience with enterprise architectures – remote method invocations, extensive XML usage, stateless designs, load balancing, SSL security, etc.
- Experience with web services (REST, SOAP, WSDL etc.)
- Experience with multi-tiered architectures (Service-Application-Presentation)
- Experience in developing UI application in Java and Flex is a big plus
- Willingness to develop both front and back end applications
- Willingness to use different programming languages to address the specific product needs (Python, Batch Scripting, etc.)
- Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
- Willingness to work without close supervision and with proactive goal-oriented attitude
- Willing to practice into other roles like code review, pair programming, QE automation
- Excellent communication skills and fluent English (speaking/reading/writing)

Desired:
- Hands-on experience in utilizing Spring Framework
- Experience with Python
- Experience working in an agile environment is a plus

VMware offers:
- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, team buildings and celebrations All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Senior Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic
Senior Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer
San Francisco, CA


New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our team builds prototypes to validate new ideas, which have a direct impact on the future of our products. 


The right person for this job delights in building solutions, has a talent for executing quickly, and has “agile” in their DNA. You can confidently build any type of software component and if you don’t know something, you’ll learn and adapt very quickly. You probably have 5+ years of software development experience with a couple of those years working in Java, JavaScript, or Python. And you undoubtedly have open source contributions with a GitHub repository, personal project page, or blog.


Your ideal environment is motivated by rapid prototyping concepts and you have a demonstrated record of using creativity and innovation to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solution to complex problems.


This is an opportunity to innovate and have an impact on our future product line. It is a high-visibility role in an environment where the Founder/CEO actively participates in the creation and development of our product suite.


To complement the existing skill set of our team, you have passion and expertise in one (or both) of the following areas:



  • User Experience / Front-End Development

  • Data / Statistics


Skills and experience needed for the job:



  • Real tech fluency - Significant experience with multiple backend language(s) such as Java, Ruby, Python, or Node.js

  • Has consistent track record of building working prototypes

  • Worked in a highly interactive, team-oriented environment

  • Broad understanding of SaaS and technology trends


We’re hiring at all experience levels, and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your perfect job, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply. 


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000+ customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications.


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech-rich urban center of San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, stock options, and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you.



#LI-CV1



Apply Here
PI91800506

item.title: Senior Ruby / Rails Engineer (Washington, DC) at LivingSocial (Washington, DC)
item.description:
You know LivingSocial as the marketplace to buy and share the best things to do in your city and beyond. And while we're bringing excitement and value to our merchants and consumers, we're also committed to creating a world-class environment for our employees. Our talented LivingSocialites bring an all-hands-on-deck approach to our work, taking pride in being collaborative, creative, and flexible. If you’re passionate about working as part of a team to drive value to businesses of all sizes, you may have just found your new home.


LivingSocial is revolutionizing local eCommerce. With millions of consumers and tens of thousands of merchants using our web and mobile tools, we're constantly improving our suite of products. Using data to drive decisions, our engineers are solving hard problems at the heart of our business. We’re looking for hungry, creative, and pragmatic engineers to help us continue innovating - you can learn more about our team on our tech blog and our public github repository.


We are looking for a Senior Ruby / Rails Engineer to join the Consumer Engineering team. 

Your responsibilities: 



  • Build intuitive, responsive experiences our millions of customers will enjoy engaging with every day

  • Help customers find what they’re looking for, and discover new things across our varied suite of offers

  • Find new ways for our customers to engage with us through sharing, personalization, etc. 

  • Personalize our content to provide the most value to our customers  

  • Optimize placement of promotions to deliver measurable ROI to merchants  

  • Work with our shared services teams to implement and integrate with our backend platform


Desired skills, experience & qualifications:



  • 5+ years of web development experience; preference given to candidates who have experience with large applications of some scale 

  • Exceptional competency in object-oriented programming 

  • Experience developing in a web framework, with Ruby on Rails background a plus 

  • Solid foundation/knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

  • Experience working across the software stack (Ruby on Rails, JavaScript/CoffeeScript, MySQL, Redis) 

  • Excited about deploying to production multiple times a day

  • Comfort collaborating daily with your team (could be a distributed team) and other groups

  • You can take smart risks and champion new ideas


Compensation:



  • Competitive base salary and bonus plan 

  • We’ve got you covered with health, dental, and vision offerings and a fantastic 401(k) matching contribution that vests immediately

  • Generous paid time off program

  • Some of our offices offer commuter benefits, all of our offices offer snacks...lots of snacks

  • Opportunity to work with committed, talented people with a great sense of humor




LivingSocial appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. It is the policy of LivingSocial to provide equal opportunity for employment to all qualified employees and applicants, regardless of race, religion, religious affiliation, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, or veteran status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, placement, training, transfer, promotion, termination, pay, and other forms of compensation and benefits. The company will comply with its legal obligation to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer


About the Job


Become a critical member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest platform in the world for emerging and independent game developers. We aren’t just building a publisher tool, but rather a technology platform providing developers with the tools they need to create their own world class games, bringing User Generated Content to the gaming space. With our user base consistently growing, we remain the #1 ranked kids entertainment site in the U.S. by ComScore. Each month we have more than 5 million active users and over 80 million total hours of engagement with peak concurrent users approaching over 200K.


You, being a talented engineer with the ability to take a big problem and break it down into smaller pieces to find the best possible solution, will work closely and collaboratively with our 5-person Ops Team on our internal development tools and automation pipelines. You will build out and significantly automate several parts of our continuous integration and test automation systems, design and build tools used internally by the engineering team, and help implement best in class configuration management and provisioning systems. You are a jack of all trades who loves having an impact on your team and product by:



  • Maintaining a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Developing automation to automatically detect and recover production issues in all layers from hardware, configuration, networking, and vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolving complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritizing and multitasking daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Designing, deploying and configuring extremely complex computing environments characteristic of large-scale gaming systems

  • Leading in the execution of disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborating with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Managing systems and developing contingency plans

  • Participating in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits: 



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!

item.title: Senior Mobile SDK Engineer (iOS and Android) at Kahuna (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Kahuna is the trusted leader for successful marketers and product managers to delight their customers in the mobile era.  We are looking for senior software engineers to help architect the next generation of mobile SDKs for the Kahuna engagement platform.  The SDK is embedded in our customer’s applications on hundreds of millions of devices.  These applications are sending billions of end-user events a month which allows our customers to understand and communicate to end-users with personalized content at the right time and on the right device.


As a mobile SDK engineer you will be directly responsible for delivering high quality SDKs to our customers that their application developers will love and will allow them to easily drive end-user engagement with their brand.  You will have the opportunity to keep up with the latest trends in mobile and wearable technologies, application development and the nuances of operating systems and runtime environments.  


This is a ground floor opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies, big data processing and real-time communication with connected devices.  You will work in a fun environment with some of the best engineers in SIlicon Valley.  You will also gain invaluable experience from being a developer evangelist and providing thought leadership on building intelligent mobile applications of the future.

item.title: Software Engineer (Backend) at PlayLab Ltd. (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
We are a mobile games company based in Bangkok, Thailand.  We do everything in-house. That means we don't outsource any of our work. We focus on casual games for both IOS, Android and other platforms. 



 The role


As a software engineer on our backend team your prime responsibility is to create and support features needed in our games as well as working together with systems engineers on the team to ensure reliability and scalability of the platform.


You will get to work on technologies such as Ruby (mostly RoR), eventmachine, MySQL, Redis and Cassandra. We are however not set on these technologies and they will most likely change in the future, you will be part of figuring out which technology to bring in next.


What you would be doing:



  • Collaborate with system engineers to improve current features and bring new into production.

  • Making sure our backend is of great quality.

  • Get hands-on experience with building a scalable backend for millions of users.

  • Build a nice platform for our game developers to built great games on top of

  • Investigate and implement new technologies to improve our service.


About the backend team:


Our culture is fairly startup-y, with a flat hierarchy and lots of freedom to work on what you think is important. We try to hire smart people, and trust them to do smart things. We track player progress, store game state, handle in-app purchases, and process large amounts of analytics data, amongst other things. 


Our engineering culture also like in the startup world - we test heavily, move fast, automate everything. We do regular code reviews, and weekly tech talks to share skills.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Software Engineer in Test role is critical in Sprout Social’s success as it is responsible for accelerating delivery, increasing quality and tackling some of our most difficult problems.  SETs create scalable and efficient test automation, verify performance against real-world scenarios and data, and create specialized testing tools for use throughout the diverse Sprout stack.  This role works closely with every part of the Sprout Engineering team, giving exposure to a broad set of technologies, people and challenges.


The Sprout Social software that is used by more than 15,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on Sprout to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media.


If Java is your bread and butter, you have a passion for testing, and you are a stickler for quality software, we’d love to talk with you.


Responsibilities



  • Design, implement, and maintain test automation systems for continuous integration

  • Work with manual testers to evaluate test cases for inclusion in automated regression tests

  • Work with manual testers on automation tests of newly developed features

  • Develop toolsets to augment QA and developer testing

  • Assist in performance and scalability testing

  • Collaborate with product engineering when specialized testing tools are needed

  • Work closely with front and back-end engineers for support and code review

  • Work with front-end and back-end engineers to insert certain automation at appropriate times during coding, code review and deployments; specifically ensure a defined set of tests are run before code deployment

  • Work with QA and Engineering leadership to ensure that coded scripts align with business goals/objectives for Sprout

  • Gather and present metrics related to test automation, ensuring deviations from standards and procedures are made visible in a timely manner

  • Maintain our automated test library and perform routine checks to ensure that scripts are current

item.title: Server Side Engineer at Spanning by EMC (Austin, TX)
item.description: We believe strongly that a well-designed application makes customers happy, reduces support costs, and removes the need for static documentation. We ensure that every feature is customer driven, and simple enough to explain on a single page wiki.  Rather than hire into well defined categories, we are looking for engineers that want to take ownership, deliver results, and make a difference in many different parts of our product and process evolution.

item.title: Principal Engineer (Matching Engineering) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
eHarmony is looking for a highly talented individual to join our Matching Engineering team! Every day, eHarmony matches millions of people based on deep compatibility, built on decades of psychological research and Machine Learning. Matching is the core of eHarmony, and you have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be right in the middle of it. 

Your challenge as a Principal Engineer on our team will be to implement and scale these matching systems, to support ever more complex modeling processes, across a rapidly growing community of users. 


In this position, you will be responsible for:



  • Getting to work with innovative new technologies (e.g. Hadoop/Map-Reduce, NoSQL stores like MongoDB and Voldemort, AWS based cloud computing, SOA via REST services)

  • Working on a matching system that creates trillions of potential pairings in our candidate pool (over 51 million registered users)

  • Designing core back-end Matching components

  • Coding day-to-day in Java, and other languages such as Scala, Ruby, Groovy, C++.

  • Analyzing and improve the efficiency, reliability and scalability of components across the Matching infrastructure

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala(Automotive) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE Berlin is searching for a Senior Software Engineer with strong Java skills and interest in Scala to join our Automotive Cloud Team


About the Team


The team develops backend services, most of which are exposed using REST based interfaces. As our new team member, you will be participating in all stages of the software development lifecycle in an Agile/Lean environment and be responsible for designing, implementing and testing key components for Automotive Cloud Services products. As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will have a breadth of knowledge and success in developing highly-scalable web services as well as the ability to comprehend requirements, complete work in a timely manner and communicate information effectively. We are currently mainly developing our Software in Java, but will use Scala more frequently going forward.


 As a Software Engineer in our team, a variety of tasks is waiting for you:



  • Development of applications or system components

  • Software design and review

  • Requirements definition and analysis

  • Unit testing

  • Investigation and root cause analysis of software and system defects

  • Maintain and run tools and processes that support and automate software product release

item.title: Database Engineer at News Distribution Network (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Overview:


NDN attracts entrepreneurial-minded individuals, who are looking to boldly disrupt and relentlessly innovate in  a fast-paced and rewarding digital media environment. We seek passionate and dynamic talent looking to join a collaborative team that provides a wealth of opportunities for career development and growth.


The Database Engineer will be based in Atlanta, GA at NDN’s headquarters, and will report to the Senior Manager  of Engineering Operations. S/he will primarily be responsible for developing and maintaining SQL/RDBMS along with all functions related to data.


About You:



  • You are a detail oriented database engineer

  • you take pride in writing clean and clear SQL

  • You take pride in writing clean DRY code.

  • You don’t need micro managing. You can be given a task and ensure it gets completed properly on time.

  • You are a team player, who enjoys collaboration and working in an agile environment.

  • You are confident enough in the work you do to give an Operations Engineer your cell phone number.


The Perks: 



  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision benefits for employees and dependents

  • Competitive salaries

  • Apple products for all employees

  • Complimentary on-site gym & discounted local gym membership

  • Free on-site parking in Buckhead office

  • A stocked kitchen full of free food and drinks!

  • Social events and celebrations

  • Relaxation areas, golf putting greens, ping pong, pool and play station

  • Inspirational, colorful and collaborative work environment

  • Business casual work attire (jeans!)

  • Free NDN swag

item.title: Senior Front-End Software Engineer at Teikametrics (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Join a team of passionate software engineers in a small, rapidly growing online retail SaaS company, and help us make elegant, usable software that delights customers. 


At Teikametrics, you’ll use the latest web technologies and play an active role in designing and developing both new and existing products. You’ll be expected to learn new technologies quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment, working both in a team as well as individually.


As a Senior Front-End Software Engineer, you will lead all aspects of user-facing features and functionality for several B2B SaaS applications and work with our product manager and existing team of full stack developers to deliver an outstanding experience to our customers.


You will be expected to contribute immediately to both mature and new products and will have a significant impact on our future road map in a short amount of time.


Who are you?



You are a software engineer:




  • with at least 5-7 years professional coding experience




  • who creates elegant, testable solutions to complex problems




  • who has experience designing, coding, building and testing software




  • who has experience debugging and optimizing code




  • who has experience with functional programming




  • who is an expert at merging branches & doing code reviews for others




  • who understands how to make and communicate design tradeoffs




  • who ideally understands data structures, design patterns and algorithm design




  • who ideally has used agile development practices like Scrum




You are a web developer:




  • who builds single page web applications




  • who is an advanced JavaScript developer




  • who ideally has worked with one of React, Backbone, Angular or Ember




  • who ideally has experience developing reusable UI components




  • who ideally has experience with jQuery




  • who ideally has started learning ES6 / ES2015




  • who ideally has some experience with Node.js, Meteor or Ruby on Rails




You are a UX designer:




  • who has experience in web usability




  • who is an expert in HTML and CSS




  • who ideally has good intuition on what makes a delightful user experience




  • who ideally has experience converting mockups from designers into HTML




You are a team member:




  • who wants to work with smart, motivated people




  • who is self-motivated, introspective and driven




  • who plays nicely with others




  • who has excellent analytical and problem solving skills




  • who has excellent written and verbal communication skills

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.



We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.



As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:




  • Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers

  • Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.

  • Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’

  • Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications

  • Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production

  • Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs

  • Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: Front End Software Engineer at Amino, Inc (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Amino is looking for a front-end engineer with top-notch modern web development skills. 


You’ll be jumping into a small team tackling big challenges through technology and design. You’ll work with our CTO, Head of Design, software engineers, and other members of our team to create new ways to help people make confident decisions about their health.


Your primary responsibility will be building highly usable, fast and responsive user interfaces to delight our users on desktop, tablet and mobile platforms.


You should be comfortable working with members of various Amino teams and switching back and forth between thinking about the big picture and fine implementation details.


You’ll also need to be a great listener, love and welcome ongoing feedback from the team and our users, and iterate quickly and continuously.

item.title: Cloud Engineer MIH at Rijksoverheid (Apeldoorn, Nederland)
item.description:
Cloud Engineer MIH


Functieomschrijving

Wil jij een leertraject in de Master Information Hub?


De Cloud Engineers in het Centrum voor Infrastructuur en Exploitatie (B/CIE) hebben de opdracht gekregen om de gegevens van belastingplichtigen op ieder gewenst moment beschikbaar te maken. Daarvoor was niet alleen een nieuw team nodig, met een nieuwe infrastructuur, maar ook een nieuwe werkwijze. Er wordt gewerkt in een DevOps setting waarin van alle leden van het team verwacht wordt dat ze met enige regelmaat van rol wisselen. Lijkt het jou leuk om deel uit te maken van deze interessante nieuwe ontwikkelingen? Dan ben jij misschien een ideale nieuwe Cloud Engineer.

Het team Master Information Hub werkt aan de change, release & deployment management processen van de Cloud Service Provider organisatie. We automatiseren processen en procedures zo veel als mogelijk en leggen ons werk zo goed mogelijk vast in documentatie. Ontwerp, bouw, test, planning en beheer zijn op een agile manier allemaal binnen het team belegd. Daarnaast helpen we de Cloud Service Consumer organisatie gestalte te geven. Van alle mensen in het team wordt verwacht dat zij in staat zijn om een inhoudelijke bijdrage te leveren op meerdere kennisgebieden. We zoeken mensen die uitstekend functioneren in een werkomgeving die gekenmerkt wordt door dynamiek, klantgerichtheid, zelfstandigheid en het nemen van eigen verantwoordelijkheid. De opdracht aan het MIH-team en dus aan de nieuwe Engineer is om de ontwikkeling en het beheer van het platform in goede banen te leiden en verder uit te bouwen.


Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu.

item.title: Senior Cloud Engineer MIH at Rijksoverheid (Apeldoorn, Nederland)
item.description:
Senior Cloud Engineer MIH

Functieomschrijving
Wil jij werken in de Master Information Hub?

De Cloud Engineers in het Centrum voor Infrastructuur en Exploitatie (B/CIE) hebben de opdracht gekregen om de gegevens van belastingplichtigen op ieder gewenst moment beschikbaar te maken.
