item.title: Application Support Engineer - Tier 2 at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Remedy Production Support team seeks a Tier 2 Application Support Engineer. In this role, you will help support Remedy System’s growing user base for our enterprise technology platform and Episode Connect: an innovative care coordination platform used by Remedy Partners and hospitals across the country to manage patients in bundled payment episodes.



Key Responsibilities:


•Use available tools, resources to resolve user tickets – ranging from account requests to database inquiries


•Help build tools to assist team in day-to-day support operations


•Work on group and firm-wide projects collaborating with various teams


•Mentor junior team members in best practice support methods

item.title: Jr. Network Engineer at Augmedix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: A successful Network Engineer will have a proven record of engineering and implementation of network infrastructure, a strong sense of commitment, is highly business-oriented and skilled at delivering robust system solutions. You will collaborate with peers to deliver consistent world class network services for Augmedix and our customers. You will contribute to the global system architecture by ensuring a consistent standardization of the systems. This is a cross functional opportunity and will involve both networking and systems engineering. You will report to the Head of Network Engineering and act in the capacity of technical lead to other technical support staff.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At Amazon Web Services, we run one of the largest networks in the world. We are taking all the industry trends and blending them into the critical foundation of utility computing: the network. Our goal is to become the infrastructure platform for the world and our team will make the bones of the platform “the network”, work flawlessly. Not only supporting Amazon.com at the global level, but amazing global companies. (http://aws.amazon.com/solutions/case-studies/all/).



Amazon Networking is looking for senior software engineers to build a platform to manage thousands of network devices; providing significantly improved control, visibility and predictability for Amazon’s global network. Our goal is to eliminate human intervention and errors from network engineering, network build and device management by building tools and systems to successfully manage thousands of heterogeneous devices in dozens of data centers across the world.



ROLE

You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for network automation software used across all of Amazon’s businesses. You are interested in solving difficult software problems at massive scale. You want to talk to customers directly and design solutions that solve their problems through innovation and automation. You understand how to build software in a continuous integration and continuous deployment environment. You are interested in working autonomously and owning your own code from requirements to launch and for supporting it in the field. You enjoy solving challenging problems and working in a fast-paced, flexible, collaborative team environment.

· Strong customer orientation with ability to work directly with customer/product owner to define requirements and the associated acceptance criteria for user stories.

· Excellent software development skills, preferably in Python or Perl with Java, C/C++, Ruby acceptable as a substitute.

· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development team with solid understand of the principles of continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment and test driven development (TDD).

· Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to apply design patterns to common software problems and define dimensions of a solution including robustness, scale and maintainability.

· Strong communications skills both written and verbal are required for this role. The ability to present complex ideas in a convincing and understandable manner are a key requirement.

· Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and as part of a cross-functional team with the ability to influence others as a senior technical contributor.

· Ability to mentor more junior software developers in best practice with demonstrated capability to maintain architectural vision and software quality during the implementation cycle.

· Knowledge of and previous development experience in a Linux or UNIX environment with a good understanding of networking concepts.

· 5+ years of industry experience in core product development, building production quality software.

· A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms and deftness at object-oriented design and systems architecture: a bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent) is required.



· Certified Scrum Master Certification is a plus.

· Familiarity with networking protocols (OSPF, BGP, HSRP/GLBP, IPSEC/VPNs, DNS, HTTP).

· Familiarity with SOA design principles include orchestration and RESTful Interface definition.

item.title: Software Engineer - Java Back End Development at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Software Engineer - Java Backend Development (Mid to Senior level) 



RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE


RIGHT TO WORK IN US REQUIRED.  WILL TRANSFER EXISTING H1-B



We are a successful and well-funded growth company in beautiful, sunny, San Diego, CA with sub-offices in Los Angeles and Alpharetta, GA. Due to continued company growth we are looking to hire some key Java Developers to join our growing team. You will have 5+ years or more of overall Java Engineering experience to join our Enterprise Ordering Systems group. You’ll be engaged in hands-on coding, managing process, procedure and projects.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Flite (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Flite is looking for a Front-End Software Engineer with great well-rounded technical skills and a talent for building awesome web applications. As a part of Flite's exceptional engineering team, you will build out the next generation of Flite's world class ad platform. Flite is a powerful, dynamic creative platform for scaling mobile, native, and rich media ad campaigns. Flite’s self-service platform is used by the world’s biggest brands and publishers to create better ads optimized in real time. Better ads. Better internet.


You will be responsible for participating in technical design discussions, implementing new features and products, working with UX designers, researching and evaluating new technology, and maintaining a well-tested and high quality software codebase. We're looking for someone with a deep knowledge in Javascript and knowledge using various frameworks and packages such as Backbone, Mustache, Underscore, jQuery, React, etc. Knowledge of Java, Java APIs, and JSP is also important, but you should be able to understand how web application development works no matter the kind of stack or technology is employed. Experience with web advertising platforms or building systems around ad servers/tech, reporting/charting packages, and SQL/NoSQL databases is a huge plus. You should have great communication skills and be able to work closely with User Experience and Product Management to build beautifully designed UIs that are rich and user-friendly.


This role is for you if:



  • You love to use and learn about the latest Javascript frameworks and technology

  • You want to make software that makes a difference for our customers

  • You thrive in a "roll up your sleeves and get it done" work culture

  • You appreciate simple, reusable, fast, and elegant software

  • You embrace change and like working in a fast-paced, agile environment

  • You are eager to share your expertise and experience with others

  • You want to be part of a small, close-knit team

  • You enjoy working in an agile development environment with an aggressive release schedule

  • You want to work in a startup environment and enjoy actively participating in groups


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary

  • Attractive stock option plan

  • Medical/Dental/Vision insurance

  • Use as much as you need vacation/PTO

  • 401K, commuter, FSA

  • Casual and fun work environment

item.title: Principal Front End Engineer at Gap Inc./GapTech (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
GapTech, we are passionate about delivering great customer experiences utilizing cutting edge technologies through sound agile development practices.  As we continue evolve our platform capabilities, the ideal engineer would have a passion for delivering value to our customers and a strong emphasis on quality.  The ideal candidate is experienced in using tests to drive the design of their code; using mocks and stubs as design tools for interface discovery in a way that maintains agility in the codebase while verifying functional behavior. We’re looking for someone who has experience & passion for front-end technologies & strategies (e.g. Javascript, CSS, Jquery, AngularJS, Knockout, Responsive Web), delivering solutions within enterprise scale systems, & producing something spectacular.  GapTech is a place where you can flex your imagination in designing and developing industry leading features that are reliable and scalable while providing an excellent customer experience.



  • Works collaboratively with the stakeholders, architects, & project team members to implement & deliver front-end focused features to customers with quality.

  • Is influential and engages actively in continuously improving practices and methodology.

  • Displays strategic thinking and can implement and deliver sustainable solutions - keeping an eye towards simplicity, reliability, manageability, scalability, extensibility, performance and re-use.

  • Can provide technical expertise in the areas of architecture, design, testing, and implementation.

  • Is actively involved with and may influence direction of industry groups and open-source communities.

  • Identifies standards based solutions that are appropriate to our environment and drives adoption via mentoring and guiding others who are still developing their skills.

  • Initiates and leads effort towards organizational goals and objectives.

  • May contribute to front-end architecture roadmap & technology standards for front end development

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Engine at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Core Developer, you will be involved in the development of these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until the 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Integration Engineer at NSONE (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Integration Engineer
Come help us lead the infrastructure-as-code revolution

NSONE is based in New York City with offices in San Francisco and Singapore. Were a world class team of internet infrastructure experts, working on deep solutions to real world traffic management problems, and operating a large global delivery infrastructure powered by bleeding edge technology.

Tight-knit, customer focused, driven by innovation

NSONE is not a sprawling, hierarchy addled behemoth. We are lean and fast, and theres a tight loop among our entire team. Were all about automation, intelligent distributed systems, and quick iteration.

The role

Were looking to add a new member to our small but fast growing engineering team: an Integration Engineer who can draw on their passion for infrastructure-as-code along with their broad community knowledge and connections to craft all manner of integrations for our cutting edge DNS platform. This dynamic position will involve writing and maintaining code in various languages - much of it open source - centered around getting data into and out of our platform. Youll work on in-house repos as well as contribute to various well known community infrastructure projects. Youll also work in our REST API and other internal systems to create and maintain integrations with other SaaS platforms.

No matter which language, you will be expected to write clean, maintainable, and fully tested code along with top notch documentation. You should have experience working on open source projects in a distributed environment (typically GitHub), including handling tasks like Pull Requests and Issues. Knowledge of various Continuous Integration systems such as Buildbot and TravisCI will be helpful. You should be familiar with the package distribution systems of various programming languages such as pip, gem, npm, etc and ideally have some experience contributing to them.  

You should have good general knowledge of the modern internet infrastructure landscape, especially well known and up-and-coming infrastructure-as-code projects and various IaaS and SaaS providers in the space.

Youll need to be able to quickly digest and understand diverse technical documentation and APIs of varying quality. Communication skills are equally important as youll be expected to maintain relationships with the project leaders, providers and services that youll be integrating with. Youll take ownership of all the integrations and work autonomously towards aggressive development goals.

Some stuff youll work on:

  • REST API clients (to our service), in various languages (open source)
  • Integrations with other SaaS platforms related to both ingesting data into our platform as well as pushing notifications externally. Examples include Pingdom, New Relic, Datadog, Catchpoint, Pagerduty
  • Create and maintain NSONE DNS modules for various configuration management systems such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet
  • Create and maintain NSONE DNS modules in infrastructure projects such as Terraform, libcloud, fog.io, Netflix denominator
  • Maintain developer relationships with all of these providers and projects

Working @ NSONE

Were a small, well funded startup with a casual work environment and strong work ethic. Theres a lot to do so we keep meetings and process to a minimum. Were headquartered in NYCs Financial District. We like to have fun, but skip most of the fancy startup gimmicks (fresh beer yes, gourmet chef and afternoon yoga no). We prefer candidates local to NYC or SFO, but will happily consider well qualified remote employees.

We offer:

  • competitive compensation (salary and stock options)
  • medical, dental, and vision
  • commuter benefits
  • 401k
  • flexible hours and time off

NSONE is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at MediaMath (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Platform Integrations team at MediaMath solves unique client challenges via the development of custom software solutions and bespoke integrations that leverage TerminalOne APIs, MediaMath technology platform services, and 3rd party technologies.


We are currently seeking a highly qualified DevOps Engineer to work in our New York office.


In this role, you will



  • Work in a fast-paced environment overseeing a combination of self-managed Debian boxes and Amazon Web Services

  • Troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve production issues

  • Develop automation and monitoring solutions and tools, creating efficiencies in daily operational activities



Responsibilities:



  • Manage the scalability, performance, and availability of the Platform Integrations infrastructure and applications by solving for reliability against existing systems and services spanning the entire stack

  • Independently identify opportunities to improve system scalability and stability, and implement enhancements and best practices for modern development principles and methodologies

  • Develop tools and automation to minimize delivery time and increase developer productivity

  • Participate in the design and development of new and evolving services, architecture, and performance standards

  • Communicate and coordinate with internal teams and third party services to effectively resolve day-to-day issues and relay updates to the rest of the team

  • Develop strong relationships and collaborate with key internal engineering and product stakeholders; understanding the product and engineering roadmap, and acting as subject matter expert on advanced infrastructure and platform capabilities, features, and offerings

item.title: Sr. Front-end Software Engineer on the EO Ground Segment Engineering team at UrtheCast (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
UrtheCast is growing at hyper speed and we're looking for a Sr. Front-End Software Engineer who will be responsible for designing, developing and testing user interfaces and front-end functionality to be used within the UrtheCast Ground Systems, as well as to support the Lead Architect in devising upgrades, refactoring strategies, common utilities and implementing UI/UX design procedures and testing processes, and produce or update the corresponding documentation.


What can we offer you?



  • Competitive compensation, full benefits and flexible time off

  • Great work environment, team and office location right over the water in the new Vancouver Convention Centre

  • Great lunch programs will provide you with an opportunity to learn and socialize, and our Friday afternoons will set the right mood for the weekend

  • Gym membership

  • Sports teams (soccer, dodgeball, etc) and lots of events

What you'll be doing, the gist:

  • Code review and merge new features and test bug fixes to integration and production environments and monitor and execute server deployments

  • Support the discovery of requirements for the Ground Segment

  • Support the management of the sprint work across all systems

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at HBC Digital (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior QA Engineer, your day to day activities include: developing test scripts, executing tests and analyzing results, solving complex problems, providing/evaluating solution options, collaborating with IT teams, researching new products and/or working on internal projects. Your job requires ability to: manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, adapt to changes in scope or schedule, work under tight timelines, be creative in working through obstacles, effectively communicate, collaborate with business and technical teams, and deliver on time. You are expected to know how to effectively manage a project from planning to delivery. You can be assigned individual project or participate in group project, in a lead or contributor capacity. Additionally, you are responsible for administrating of QA systems and tools. Last but not least, you will be conducting performance/load testing, and/or assigned functional projects.

Requirement:


  • Proficient with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

  • Fluent in Object Oriented Design and Object Oriented Programming.

  • Proficient in a high level programming language (Java/C# - prefer Java).

  • Ability to maintain/enhance existing (complex) Java code.

  • Familiar with Windows Server and Linux Operating System.

  • Proficient with SQL and able to create DB table schema, stored procedure, and trigger.

  • Good knowledge of system networking (understand switch, router, load balancer, network monitoring, etc.

  • Background in performance/load testing ecommerce architecture.

  • Knowledgeable of the various data exchange formats like XML, JSON, etc.

  • Ability to analyze complex data sets (log analysis, network package analysis, etc.

  • Familiarity with Continuous Deployment and Continuous Integration.

  • Ability to lead a technical team.

  • Ability to solve complex problems and recommend solution options.

  • Project management and time management skills.

  • Ability to effectively communicate with business and technical audiences.

  • Capable of multi-tasking and working through multiple priorities.

  • Self-starter, go-getter, and team player.

  • Flexible to work extended hours or off-hours when needed.

item.title: Software Development Engineer Ref: IRC202655 at The Science and Technology Facilities Council (Didcot, UK)
item.description:
STFC Rutherford Appleton Laboratory, Harwell, Oxfordshire


Salary £37,213 - £43,426 (dependent upon qualifications and experience and inclusive of annual allowance)


About The Role


We now have an opportunity for an experienced Software Development Engineer to join STFC’s Central Laser Facility (CLF), which provides scientists with an unparalleled range of state-of-the-art laser technology to carry out a broad range of experiments in physics, chemistry and biology.



This role will develop and support software systems which are used throughout CLF, and implement and maintain professional software development tools and techniques.



Further duties include:



  • Manage software development projects for large scale laser systems.

  • Develop laser and target area control systems using professional development tools and techniques, producing all relevant documentation.

  • Develop software for laser diagnostic equipment.

  • Automate target area systems and improve data collection and processing.

  • Maintain and develop Subversion and Trac configuration management system.

  • Develop software development policy.

  • Provide rapid response support consistent with the operation of a scheduled facility including out of hours work as appropriate.

item.title: Application Security Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Are you ready for your next security challenge? New Relic is growing our world-class security team, and you have the opportunity to be part of it!


If you want to work in a dynamic environment with fast paced adoption of innovative technologies that creates a constant flow of new security challenges - then we have the job for you!


We are looking for passionate security professionals that want to be part of an exciting company that values employee empowerment, experimentation, and work-life balance. The right person will be driven to solve complex security challenges, push their skills, and learn new ones.


In this role, you will be responsible for promoting, designing, and evaluating application security in all phases of the development life cycle. You will work with groups and individuals from across the company, including development, support, and QA. More importantly, you will be on the leading edge of defining how to do security right in a continuous-deployment, cloud-based environment.


In this role, your responsibilities will include:



  • Identifying security issues and risks across New Relic's products and services via threat modeling, design and code reviews, and security testing

  • Working with engineers to build secure software, addressing and mitigating security issues and risks

  • Evaluating designing, and implementing security tools and automation, including monitoring

  • Participating in security incident handling

  • Evangelizing and building awareness of security throughout the development organization, including providing training

item.title: Affect Social Change as a Senior DevOps Engineer with Blackbaud at Blackbaud (Charleston, SC)
item.description:
As our Software Engineer in DevOps you will work as a member of the technology team to create, manage, and monitor our application infrastructure, release pipeline, and continuous deployments that enable nonprofits world-wide to execute on their mission. You will work with other engineering and operations team members to develop, maintain, and optimize multiple levels of infrastructure, lead conversations around application implementation, and help make engineering pipedreams possible. In this role you will help build an agile operations model to support Blackbaud’s entire product line while maintaining the high level of reliable services our clients need. This is a highly visible and challenging opportunity that will bring you to the next step in your career.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, build and maintain as release pipeline and pipeline process to help engineering teams guarantee successful production deployments

  • Ensure application performance in production to scale, provide infrastructure and architecture guidance to engineering teams, and trending monitoring to find and address issues before clients even know they exist.

  • Update the data center infrastructure through automation for scaling the services and reducing costs in both private and public cloud environments.

  • Ensure the SLA for Blackbaud services with a high-availability system design and production-monitoring plan.

  • Ensure the security and integrity of Blackbaud’s cloud services

  • Plan, implement, and test disaster recovery plans for all SaaS products

item.title: DevOps engineer with Python experience at Chirp (London, UK)
item.description:
Job Description


We are building the Internet of Sound - many devices small and large communicating via the Chirp platform. Your work will be used in production by large-scale clients including banks and telcos.


We’re now looking for a talented DevOps engineer with a passion for creating robust and streamlined backend architectures to drive our cloud infrastructure, develop new features for the API that powers thousands of Chirp transactions each day (Python, MongoDB) and automate our AWS deployment with deployment and configuration tools.


This job is your opportunity to own and lead the backend development of the Chirp platform.



Our focus is on delivering a first-class developer experience for third-parties wanting to create software and hardware that can share data over sound.


What we need you to do



  • Extend and streamline our existing cloud infrastructure, introducing automation tools for deployment and management of systems (Ansible, Puppet or Chef), introducing a caching front-end to improve system performance

  • Introduce and oversee realtime monitoring systems to give Chirp and third-party developers insight into their data.

  • Develop our REST API backend (Pyramids, Mongo) with new endpoints and features, and take ownership of further Python backend services including our developer resources controls

  • Design and build new backend services as part of our Chirp Labs web-based micro-product range

  • Lead proactively on developing our back-end strategies, introducing best-practice approaches.


Experience



  • Significant knowledge and experience in DevOps, including experience with automation tools such as Ansible and monitoring services

  • Solid understanding of REST API architecture

  • Several years' Python development in a professional environment

  • Experience of working across diverse platforms, either professionally or recreationally (e.g. Arduino, Raspberry Pi) preferred

  • Written a RESTful web services API and maintained a deployed system through different versions


About You


Python development (3 years)


Significant experience of DevOps and management of cloud infrastructures, including experience with AWS


Solid understanding of REST APIs and best practices


Knowledge of MongoDB, Pyramids and related platforms


Proactive approach, desire to own and lead backend development


Boundless curiosity and desire to learn more!

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test - Senior Staff at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Software Development Engineer in Test -  Senior Staff


Location: Seattle, WA


We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. This position is in the Core applications development group based in Seattle, responsible for creating the WAVE platform used for critical communications around the globe.



Our office has a great downtown location looking directly out onto Puget Sound, Olympic Sculpture Park and Elliott Bay Trail. We provide secure, covered, paid parking, dog Fridays and summer BBQs on the deck!



Responsibilities:


-Designing and building automated software testing frameworks in C# that verify the integrity of a critical voice communications platform


-Plan, create and run manual functional, integration, performance and security tests in a Windows environment


- Be a sysadmin for your test network, including configuring Windows servers, hypervisors, switches and troubleshooting data and audio routing using Wireshark


- Work as part of an Agile development/test team


- Influence and guide the team’s automated testing approach

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Ruby, Rails, Clojure) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) is seeking a passionate Software Engineer to join one of our cloud based web application development teams. Our mission is to work with the absolute best engineers to provide clinical research organizations with the most advanced tools for planning and managing their clinical trials.


Have you ever wondered how the drug that you pick up in a drug store goes from an idea in a researcher's mind to being approved for use around the world?  We make the software that medical researchers use to manage clinical trials -- enabling researchers to verify the efficacy and safety of new drugs -- which allows the industry to bring new drugs to market quickly and efficiently.  This position will allow you to work with a team that helps connect clinical trial subjects with new and innovative medicines following all regulatory requirements to optimize the clinical study process. 


We are continually building and improving our cloud-based clinical trial solution to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. 


If you are interested in applying your passion and skills to truly impact society in a positive way and not just work for a company that creates yet another social media network app please read on.  


What we are looking for:
Software Applications Engineers with 2+ years experience building cloud based web applications. You’ll demonstrate a passion for your craft, be self motivated and eager to engage in high impact, challenging, engineering problems while continuously raising the standard of quality in our products and services in a full solutions-oriented SaaS environment.  Your responsibilities will include hands-on implementation and development with Ruby on Rails and MySQL amongst other tools 


What’s in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA, commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We send engineers to conferences and seminars to learn and get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.


We provide top of the line computers (PCs or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at The College Board (Reston, VA)
item.description:
Senior Systems Engineer




Job ID: AD20150406-55610

Description:


Introduction


The College Board, a national educational organization, is conducting a search for Senior Systems Engineer in our Shared Services organization, who will be resident in our Reston, VA office.


Summary


The Sr. Systems Engineer will support system management, software deployments, system monitoring and reporting, performance/stress testing, and other operational activities.  This individual will provide engineering support to IG staff in the form of process automation, tools development, and systems integration, leveraging a combination of existing tools as well as selecting, implementing and developing additional ones.  The Sr. Systems Engineer will address trouble shooting and problem resolution with a focus on the development of tools to create repeatable processes for deployment, maintenance, and operation of software and systems.  This position collaborates with IG engineering and operations staff, developers, and business unit personnel to identify opportunities for improvement and then insures that these plans are properly implemented and operated.


The Sr. Systems Engineer will support day to day operations of the SOA platform at the College Board. This includes, but is not limited to, deploying business services, implementing end to end transactional monitoring, creating and applying run-time governance policies, ensuring QoS and SLAs are met through the use of monitoring, run time quotas, and throttling, participating in troubleshooting of complex multi-team, multi-component SOA based systems, detecting and helping mitigate security risks, proactively identifying performance bottlenecks or system performance degradation. This position works closely with the NOC, operations, networking, development, QA, release management, and enterprise architecture groups.


Responsibilities



  • Troubleshoot issues related to production and non-production servers and applications to ensure a consistent and positive experience for our customers.

  • Execution of daily operations activities in support of Data Center Operations, which includes validating the health of the production and non-production servers by reviewing the daily event log, monitoring performance and operation of applications, servers, and networks.

  • Work closely with peer Infrastructure teams to ensure seamless operation of the production and non-production environments.  Ensure application patches and virus prevention signatures are current. Perform regularly scheduled maintenance, routine tasks, or emergency system maintenance to minimize system downtime.

  • Detect, troubleshoot, and resolve any hardware, software, or operating system problems.

  • Develop, maintain, communicate, and implement written processes and procedures related to all aspects of Data Center Operations.

  • Deliver well-provided customer support and communicate and implement defined change management procedures.

  • Candidate will support implementation efforts of infrastructure upgrades/enhancements as required.

  • Develop increasing expertise in key technologies including security and disaster recovery/business continuance planning.


Qualifications


Education/Experience:



  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with 5+ Years experience in IT with a broad range of exposure to all aspects of operational, stress and performance evaluations, systems analysis, and system engineering.

  • Experience with Linux system administration

  • 3+ years experience with support of Oracle, Linux and AIX systems are required. 

  • Demonstrated understanding of database concepts in the Oracle relational database platforms

  • Possess a working knowledge of architectural frameworks and methodologies

  • Demonstrate a broad knowledge of operating systems and software development tools


This position will be subject to a background check.


Apply


If you are interested in joining the College Board and you meet our qualifications, we encourage you to APPLY by following the link below to send us your resume and a brief introductory cover letter that includes salary expectations. 


Benefits


We offer our employees an outstanding benefits package which includes 4 weeks of paid time off, a generous retirement plan, tuition reimbursement and ongoing professional development and training.


Mission


The College Board’s mission is to connect students to college success and opportunity. We are a not-for-profit membership organization committed to excellence and equity in education. Among our best-known products are the SAT®, PSAT/NMSQT®, and Advanced Placement Program®. 


The College Board is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The College Board participates in E-Verify, a service of DHS and SSA, where required. Please understand that only qualified applicants will be contacted.




Requirements:
Desired Travel Less than 25%
Areas of Expertise IT Infrastructure
Highest Level of Education Bachelor's Degree
Job Type Full Time
Location Reston, VA
Years of Relevant Experience 4-5



Apply Here


PI91780763

item.title: Cloud/DevOps Engineer for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:

We are seeking a cloud engineer to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and scalability of our cloud services. The ideal candidate will be comfortable choosing the appropriate technology underpinnings, defining the end-to-end architecture, configuring the full stack through DevOps techniques, managing the data, and working with Application and Algorithm specialists to ensure the system’s scalability and performance. The ideal candidate is a cloud native, deeply familiar with handling computationally heavy workloads using Infrastructure-as-a-Service solutions.

Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:

• What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

• What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

• Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help with the building and operation of our Real Time Analytics Platform. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex environment.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build tools to ease provisioning and scaling of TubeMogul Analytics infrastructure

  • Monitor and improve service performance and stability

  • Continuously extend and improve infrastructure components to handle growth

  • Investigate failures and offer suggestions for future improvement

  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that platforms are designed with "operability" in mind

  • Assist our software engineering team to ensure proper monitoring and metrics are being built into the applications before going to production

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Spanning by EMC (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Our collaborative and iterative development approach has us testing all the time to avoid the last minute crunch. In order to do this we use lots of tools and test data to ensure that we can efficiently do functional, regression, and integration testing as part of the daily development process. The full team is involved in testing, but we need a mastermind to coordinate this effort for each engineering project that is running, playing a material development role on each project.  


This is a core engineering position where you will write production code. You are also responsible for ensuring that each feature can be built, tested, and deployed (along with our DevOps team) in a reliable and repeatable manner.  


Automation is a key part of this effort, but we also know that we need to be smart about what we test, when we test, and how we test. Very often the best results come from a well-informed user doing something "clever" with our app. We are looking for engineers that share these ideals and can help us take our test and development technology to the next level.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Java at Chewy.com (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
The Overview:


As an engineer on our Ecommerce Systems team, you will deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the United States. You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core Ecommerce Platform which consists of customer management, order and shipment management, returns management, catalog management, competitive pricing tools, search and personalization services, and operational analytics.  You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform. Working with other technology teams, you and your team will design and build interfaces that integrate with vendor & supply chain systems, fulfillment systems, and financial systems. This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

item.title: Be a hero in helping us solve complex Big Data problems! at kCura (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The Sr. Software Engineer (Portland) is responsible for delivering results for the Product Development department by:


• Contributing to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software


• Rapidly producing high quality code • Being a dependable and highly skilled development resource for peers


The Sr. Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:


• Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.


• Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.


• Improves operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes in policies and procedures.


• Encourages pair programming and collaborative design


• Thinks out loud- Consistently communicates ideas to others


• Provides development expertise to team members  through education and review


• Always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers


• Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection


• May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved.


In addition to the above responsibilities, the Senior Software Engineer is expected to display professionalism in the following ways:


• Maintain an attitude of commitment through outward display of willingness


• Practice positive interactions - lean on encouragement in place of judgment


• Impress responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks


• Act in the best interest of the overall team

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) at Jet Propulsion Laboratory (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Jet Propulsion Laboratory


Requisition ID 2015-5361
Posted Date 8/19/2015
Discipline Description Engineering Applications Software Engineering
Scheduled Hours 40
Hiring Organization 397G - DATA SERVICES
Education Bachelor's
Travel No
Clearance Options None
Job Locations US-CA-Pasadena
Category Software and Computing Systems
Career Level Level 3
Relocation Eligibility Yes
Minimum Years of Experience 6
Work Authorization U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Clearance Status None

Overview:


Do you excel in an environment that values exploration and discovery? We have a universe of opportunities waiting for you!




The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is NASA’s lead center for robotic exploration of the solar system. Our core competency is the end-to-end implementation of unprecedented robotic space missions to study Earth, the Solar System, and the Universe.




JPL, located in Pasadena, California, has a casual, campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.





We are proud to be part of NASA and Caltech, as we explore the universe and make history through new discoveries.




We aim to do things never done before and to go places few can go. We dare mighty things…do you?




Responsibilities:


You will be a Software Engineer and member of the Data Services Group (397G) reporting to the Group Supervisor and will contribute to the software planning systems of the Mars Science Laboratory (MSL).  

You will utilize domain-specific engineering expertise to understand the needs of the customer, translate needs into requirements, develop prototype applications, iterate with customers and then deliver quality applications. Involved in entire life-cycle of system, including planning, development, deployment and maintenance. Responsible for understanding and meeting software operational and engineering requirements.

item.title: Senior software engineer - equity + market salary at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Retail Growth Fund acquired the Ice.com domain in 2014 to launch the best place for women to discover and purchase jewelry. We don't take any inventory because we're a marketplace - which means our capital goes towards building IP and acquiring/retaining users. 

A few things that make us interesting:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including equity in a high growth VC backed start-up (Crosslink, Maveron, Quest, Polaris). Salary/equity is determined based on a sliding scale: if you would like a higher salary, we can issue you less equity, and vice versa. 
  • Small (12 person), growing, and agile team. 
  • $1k gift card to dog food our own marketplace sellers! 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with extensive experience in Python/Django or Java. (Django is a key part of our stack but we use some Java). 
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform (Django, Java, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • MS or PhD
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Front End at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer - Front End

We are looking for Front End Developers WITH A MINIMUM 5+ years experience to drive our new product initiatives in web-based ordering and payments. You will get to be part of a technology playground offering a fun, collaborative, and fast paced environment where ownership, problem solving, and teamwork are rewarded. Everyone on the team (from the greenest developer to the CTO) writes robust, maintainable, and scalable code every day.

item.title: Tech Lead & Rails Software Engineer (relocation assistance available) at Ikayzo (Honolulu, HI)
item.description:
Looking for a career with a world class dev team solving problems in big data, renewable energy and fintech?


Relocation Assistance Available - see details below


Ikayzo, a Honolulu and Tokyo-based boutique software development and interactive design agency, is looking for an experienced Rails engineer and tech lead. In this role he/she will be responsible for designing and implementing applications for customers ranging from web startups to energy companies and global banks.


Successful applicants will have a history of being major contributors and leads for successful software projects.


Job Description
This position entails hands on work and leadership roles in software architecture, implementation, deployment management, development of best operational practices, testing and documentation of non-trivial systems with massive scalability requirements. We are looking for motivated individuals who do not require step-by-step directions and can work cohesively with our team.


Successful applicants will have a proven track record with non-trivial Ruby on Rails projects, be comfortable with agile development methodologies, have a solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns and be comfortable with the Rails technology stack from front to back. Most importantly, we are looking for developers who are passionate about their craft. Our interviews are rigorous, so only serious developers with the requisite skills need apply.


Notes
We will pay relocation expenses of up to $2,000 as well as provide general assistance settling in (locating a place to live, etc.) for the right out-of-state candidate. Unfortunately we currently cannot sponsor visas. We aren't accepting resumes from recruiters for this position. We are looking for core team members in Honolulu. We aren't looking for remote developers at this time.

item.title: Software Engineer - NLP Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As an NLP Developer, you will be involved in the development of our Natural Language Processing system component. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Senior Java Engineer for Disruptive Insurance Startup at Goji (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Insurance is a complex product that everyone needs but few understand. At Goji, our mission is to deliver something that consumers aren’t getting anywhere else – clarity and peace of mind. In a market that bombards consumers with gimmicky ways to save, we provide consumers an easy way to comparison shop top brands and purchase insurance that best fits their needs. By combining human expertise with smart technology, Goji has helped over 700,000 people make better, more informed decisions. As a result, we have grown quickly to become one of the largest independent, online insurance agencies in the country.


Job Summary:


Our vision is to integrate the fractured value chain from consumers to insurance carriers by building cutting-edge applications (e.g. Expedia or Charles Schwab for insurance). Thus, technology and data are at the core of what differentiates us in a large industry that is ripe for disruption. Here are a few of the ambitious projects we are working on:



  • A responsive SaaS application for our sales process that integrates a robust predictive dialer, a dynamic customer relationship management system, and an end-to-end insurance buying platform

  • Real-time lead buying platform based on rigorous data analytics

  • Integrating with carrier partners to transact policies completely on our platform

  • Customer facing portal to purchase, view and manage policies


The Goji development team is led by folks who have leveraged their backgrounds in computer science, math and engineering to build and scale multiple technology companies. We strongly believe that empowered people are the key to building a great company, and our development process focuses on iteratively improving our product as well as ourselves as individuals and as a team. We are looking to add a Senior Engineer who can be a core member of our team and work on every part of the stack to accelerate product development. So if you share our ambition and want to help shape the technology that will make it happen, then join our team!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET) - IoT/Cleantech Company at Syncromatics (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Tagline: Make Transit Work


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers.  Did we mention that a Whole Foods is going in a few blocks away where you'll be able to overspend on lunch every day? The Kogi taco truck also sets up shop nearby every Friday!


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong .NET generalist eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building a highly-available, distributed system using messaging systems and the actor model

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption

  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Kanban process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

item.title: We Geeks // Fullstack Engineer at Xola (Bengaluru, India)
item.description:
At Xola, you'll be part of a small, but elite team of amazing engineers. This is a great opportunity to build an incredibly disruptive technology platform from the ground up.


Our products are completely API driven which allows for an incredible amount of flexibility and creativity around the ecosystem we build. We love experimenting with new technologies and doing mash-ups with our APIs and would expect you to be imaginative with them also.


We consider design and usability to be paramount for the success of our product -- both, for our front-end app and our APIs. We have a brilliant French designer whose designs make it to the top 5 of Dribbble every time -- you'll love his work! You're expected to be creative and throw in you're own "special sauce" into our products -- whether it's beautiful animations or fun easter eggs, you'll have the freedom to make the product "yours".

item.title: Android Engineer (Washington, DC) at LivingSocial (Washington, DC)
item.description:
You know LivingSocial as the marketplace to buy and share the best things to do in your city and beyond. And while we're bringing excitement and value to our merchants and consumers, we're also committed to creating a world-class environment for our employees. Our talented LivingSocialites bring an all-hands-on-deck approach to our work, taking pride in being collaborative, creative, and flexible. If you’re passionate about working as part of a team to drive value to businesses of all sizes, you may have just found your new home.


LivingSocial is revolutionizing local eCommerce. With millions of consumers and tens of thousands of merchants using our web and mobile tools, we're constantly improving our suite of products. Using data to drive decisions, our engineers are solving hard problems at the heart of our business. We’re looking for hungry, creative, and pragmatic engineers to help us continue innovating - you can learn more about our team on our tech blog and our public github repository.


We are looking for an experienced Android Engineer to join our talented team that wants the opportunity to make a difference and deliver value on a regular basis.


Your responsibilities:



  • Working across the software stack (UI, back-end, datastores, services)

  • Shipping new releases often

  • Collaborating daily with your team and other groups

  • Working on a distributed team

  • Iterative and incremental development

  • Fixing existing production issues as much as building new solutions

  • Taking smart risks and championing new ideas


Desired skills, experience & qualifications:



  • 3+ years of mobile development experience; preference given to candidates who have experience with large applications of some scale

  • Passion for creating an immersive user experience on a mobile platform

  • Background in developing and working with RESTful APIs

  • Dedicated, pragmatic approach to problem-solving

  • A preoccupation with staying on top of industry trends and technologies


 Compensation:



  • Competitive base salary and bonus plan

  • We’ve got you covered with health, dental, and vision offerings and a fantastic 401(k) matching contribution that vests immediately

  • Generous paid time off program

  • Some of our offices offer commuter benefits, all of our offices offer snacks...lots of snacks

  • Opportunity to work with committed, talented people with a great sense of humor


LivingSocial appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. It is the policy of LivingSocial to provide equal opportunity for employment to all qualified employees and applicants, regardless of race, religion, religious affiliation, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, or veteran status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, placement, training, transfer, promotion, termination, pay, and other forms of compensation and benefits. The company will comply with its legal obligation to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at Greenhouse Software, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Most companies do a poor job of interviewing and hiring top talent: interviews are disorganized or repetitive, hiring decisions are made based entirely on "gut feel," and spammy messages fill the inboxes of hot prospects. Greenhouse helps companies get organized, make data-backed hiring decisions, and find top talent without the spam. 


We have an enterprise product that works, big-name paying customers (Airbnb, Pinterest, Uber and Buzzfeed are just a few) and a huge potential market.  We’re VC-backed and growing like wildfire.


Greenhouse is looking to hire a Senior Full-Stack Engineer. Every engineer at Greenhouse is truly full-stack and owns individual features end-to-end, and there’s a lot to own: Greenhouse is a complex platform with a tremendous amount of functionality. 


During your first year at Greenhouse you will: 



  • Apply functional & OO programming techniques to build high-quality and reusable services in Ruby

  • Write reusable Javascript libraries, responsive SASS, and semantic HTML

  • Architect complex relational models & optimize PostgreSQL

  • Define RESTful web services

  • Help us figure out our distributed micro-services strategy based on SOA/EDA principles

  • Deploy to prod at least once a week

  • Mentor junior/mid-level engineers


 You should have:



  • Degree in CS or related field

  • Solid Javascript fundamentals

  • Experience with Ruby or experience with another dynamically typed programming language

  • Experience with Rails or another web based MVC framework

  • Interest in solving real-world business problems

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Wiland, Inc. (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work.  Currently, we have an opening for a Quality Assurance Engineer.  The Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for performing the integration/system testing phases of product development. These activities include writing system test plans, executing test cases, verifying test results, and communicating results to the development team.


The primary responsibilities of the Quality Assurance Engineer position include:



  • Leverage project requirements and design documents to create a comprehensive system test plan

  • Write specific test cases to adequately test new/modified functions and to regression test unmodified system components

  • Enter/manage the system test plan in JIRA

  • Execute test cases and verify results, including scripts to query the affected database tables to verify database inserts/updates are performing correctly

  • Report failed test cases to the appropriate Software Development Team Lead

  • Build a library of test cases for each software component that can be used for regression testing

item.title: iOS engineer at Fleksy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Fleksy, is the next generation smart keyboard that lets you type on a touch-screen, without even looking at the screen. Fat fingers everywhere rejoice - we've solved this problem!


Holders of the Guinness World Record title for the fastest keyboard in the world (officially!), Fleksy is also the first company to ship a keyboard on a smartwatch, to enable typing in 3-D (with Leap Motion), and to enable truly blind typing on a smartphone. We are venture-backed by leading VC funds including Kleiner Perkins and Highland Capital Partners.


Since launching in December 2013, Fleksy has already become the fastest growing keyboard company with millions of downloads. Since the launch of iOS 8, Fleksy has been featured by Apple in the Best New Apps category, and has been consistently appeared in the top 50 paid utilities apps on iOS.


We are now preparing to take our technology to the next level, and are looking for motivated, entry-level engineers to join our iOS team.


You will be working as part of the team that develops our iOS keyboard app. This is a mission critical project for our company to bring our app to millions of iPhone users.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Developing new features for our iOS app and extension

  • Collaborating with our partner companies to offer innovative new communication methods from the user’s keyboard

  • Writing efficient, maintainable, and reliable code in Objective-C using appropriate data structures, algorithms, and features of the iOS SDK


WE DO NOT ACCEPT RECRUITER APPLICATIONS FOR THIS POSITION



Benefits



We are the most innovative keyboard company in the world, and are currently experiencing explosive growth. Put simply, you will be joining a very hot startup at a very exciting stage.


Up for the challenge? Here's what we offer:



  • A dynamic work environment alongside talented people.

  • Competitive salary

  • Employee equity incentives

  • 15 days paid vacation

  • Free lunch

  • Gold Health, dental and vision insurance

  • Career development and the opportunity to grow with a fast-growing company

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Team at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native Android team. In this role, you'll be a driving force in the Android team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and iOS teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our Android app and give it a spin!


The Facts


* Our apps are used around the world and have been download over 100 million times


* TripAdvisor has well over 100 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year


* We have over 3 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry


* As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential


You Will


* Design complex systems and lead the technical solution of projects


* Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications


* Be responsible for the code quality on your team


* Mentor more junior developers


* Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the TripAdvisor native Android App


* Be responsible for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA and maintenance.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, iOS Team at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native iOS team.


In this role, you'll be a driving force in the iOS team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and Android teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our iOS app and give it a spin!


The Facts:



  • Our apps are used worldwide and have been download over 110 million times

  • TripAdvisor has over 108 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year

  • We have over 5 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry

  • As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential

item.title: Software Engineer (Scala) at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Software Engineer II (Scala).  We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt throughout the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.  We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.


YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Write design specifications, programming specifications, and documentation

  • Develop and maintain applications written in a Scala platform environment, operating on a Linux platform or appropriate technologies

  • Create logic to interface with RDBMS and NoSQL systems (Postgres, HBase, Hadoop)

  • Develop systems and APIs for interfacing with open and proprietary network services and complex business logic/algorithms

  • Design, deliver, develop and implement features and functionalities for large-scale, multi-tiered, distributed software applications, tools, systems and services

  • Assist in the writing of unit and functional tests and documentation for the projects/tools

  • Assist in gathering and analyzing of business and functional requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications for robust, scalable, supportable solutions that work well within the overall system architecture

  • Working with members of the Engineering team, participate in the completion of aggressive goals and meet strict deadlines

  • Try to resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur and escalate as necessary

  • Interact with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities

  • Be an active participant in an Agile/SCRUM environment

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (Coventry, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.


We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.


As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:


• Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers
• Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.
• Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’
• Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications
• Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production
• Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs
• Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: Head of Content at Cloud Academy Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We educate the world on cloud technologies and believe that cloud is a major revolution for all the industries worldwide. We help people and companies in 140+ countries understanding cloud technologies, build software and infrastructures in a better way and make it a concrete part of their career. Our training approach is practical, vendor-independent and globally accessible. In a multi-platform cloud world we discovered how difficult and confusing is understanding and following cloud technologies for companies and professionals to make them part of their teams and strategies. 


Head of Content at Cloud Academy


We are looking for a real leader, passionate about technology, training and skills development. You find yourself very comfortable working with engineers, editors, content managers and technical leaders. You will mainly lead our content operations but you will need to apply your technical knowledge and experience to help our product team and to help scaling our operations.


As Head of Content you are the leader of our content organization: your biggest goal is building a strong team of passionate engineers and subject experts and lead them to create state-of-the-art educational training for people and companies in 200+ countries worldwide. In this role you build our content strategy including defining the right processes and define learning paths within a broad set of products like Courses, Labs and Quizzes. 


What you will do at Cloud Academy as Head of Content



  • Content strategy. Create, organize and manage our content strategy for our training. Today we work with a product composed of video courses, laboratories (proprietary technology) and quizzes (proprietary technology). 

  • Content team. Hire and manage a team of engineers and content professionals that will create and manage our content and work with you to define our roadmap

  • Content process. Create and optimize the best content creation process for our business to allow Cloud Academy to scale with the number of courses, labs and quizzes produced. You will work with our tech team on our technology, Content Engine, to optimize its efficiency. 

  • Define learning paths and curriculum. Work with subject experts in your team to define learning paths and curriculum for our training, both for individuals and enterprise

  • Work with Sales, Marketing and Tech. Work with tech, sales and marketing to align the company on our content strategy, study the best technical solutions to improve our processes and measure results and retention of our customers within our content. 

  • Data-driven approach: you will work with our engineers to study our metrics, understand what are the most important KPIs for our customers' success and iterate on your strategy. 


Cloud technologies and DevOps focus for our training strategy
