Are you an AWS, Azure or Google Cloud expert, excited about DevOps and the revolution in the IT industry? Did you spend the last 5 years working in the infrastructure/ cloud industry or building technology? 


Great! We are looking for you! You will build your team looking at people that can help you executing the content strategy, improving our content creation process and scale our content to satisfy our increasing number of customers in the enterprise and consumer world. As a vendor-independent provider our vision bring us to deal with different cloud technologies from the most known vendors and in the ecosystem. Our customers look at us to understand and implement that technologies in their business. 


You are excited by e-learning and career development and love to empower people with new skills, experimenting with engineers and experts the best way to deliver and acquire them. 


Scale and manage our training content at a global level


You are passionate about data-driven strategies. You will regularly work with our tech team to analyze results and numbers related to our training product, both for B2C and B2B and you will make decisions based on data, trends and customers' feedback. You will create the right team of e-learning experts and subject experts to assist you in the process. 


You will report to the CEO with an assigned budget to manage all the content operations company-wide. Cloud Academy offers a very competitive salary, bonuses and stocks. 


This position is full-time and it is based in San Francisco/Bay Area

item.title: Ground-breaking Social Enterprise Seeks - Full Stack Engineer at Social Finance Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Social Finance is now hiring a Full Stack Engineer to work alongside our growing team, including founder Toby Eccles, director Stephen Brien and product manager Daniel Miodovnik.


As a full stack engineer, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the technology on which our apps, analytics and insights are built. In addition, you will architect, develop and launch our suite of new products and services. As an engineer within Social Finance Digital Labs, you will be at the forefront of the technology revolution we are bringing to the public and social sector.


This will be a challenging role. To deliver on this vision will require all of your energy, abilities and ambition. You will be a polyglot, already adept across the full-stack and keen to get up to speed with new technologies. You will be an engineer at heart: hands-on, unafraid of getting stuck in and focused on great results.


Your day to day activities will encompass anything and everything that’s required to build great tech: architecture, engineering, story planning, and of course, heads-down coding. You know what a high performance team looks like and will insist that the team is well organised so as to achieve brilliant results.


You probably bring several years of applied experience, perhaps in a start-up, tech firm or consultancy. And you will definitely bring a thirst for learning, a love for technology and a deep desire to solve real world problems.

item.title: SR. QA Engineer at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo, Singapore and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!

About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow us @TripwireInc on Twitter.


Job Summary

The Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for a leadership role in an agile 
research and development organization, working closely with scrum teams to execute on product backlogs, champion customer focused solutions, drive successful defect resolutions, and communicate product readiness to key product stakeholders. 


Key Responsibilities & Duties



  • Take a lead role and mentor junior staff members, both on and near-shore 

  • Facilitate initiative level planning across multiple scrum teams

  • Evangelize and implement best QA and Development practices 

  • Apply independence and creativity to problem solving across project assignments 

  • Establish and drive short-term and long-term goals for a small team of test engineers 

  • Design, author and execute automated and manual test procedures to ensure timely defect discovery 

  • Document clear, concise and detailed product defect reports and work with developers to ensure successful defect reproduction and resolution 

  • Engage and participate on an Agile team of a world class software engineers 

  • Provide ongoing project status to direct management and stakeholders 

  • Maintain strong customer focus when producing results 

  • All other duties as assigned. 




Scope

Working independently and with the Scrum teams, the Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer resolves a wide range of diverse problems utilizing personal judgment and experience to develop solutions in a creative manner. Interacts with employees at all levels of the organization and takes personal responsibility for meeting the needs of the customer while demonstrating an understanding of business objectives. Authority to act within defined policies within the area of expertise/knowledge as directed. Effectively communicates research findings to the organization and develops plans for implementation. Determines necessary resources required and develops goals and metrics for function.

item.title: Software Engineer II at Lumeris Austin Texas (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Responsible for designing and developing the rich presentation layer based on technologies such as HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, MVC, and ASP.NET

  • Responsible for designing, developing, and consuming Open API’s using REST and OAUTH 2

  • Responsible for designing and developing the middleware tier using C# and Microsoft .NET Framework

  • Responsible for designing and developing the data access layer that interfaces with RDBMS such as Microsoft SQL Server and no-SQL databases like MongoDB and Hadoop

  • The candidate will participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle from requirements gathering and design to coding and testing

  • Work with cross functional team members - such as Development Leads, Architects, Quality Engineers and DBAs - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Work directly with partners on the integration of outside solutions into Lumeris’ application frameworks

  • Identify and implement industry best practices for software development; be able to introduce and train peer groups on these practices

  • Lead the way by developing company standards for software development

  • Work with and lead, at a project level, the local and offshore staff responsible for the research and development efforts

  • Continually build the skills of colleagues through mentoring and training

item.title: Polyglot / Artisan Engineer at LShift Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Fantastic opportunities available for skilled Software Engineers to join LShift in our London Office. Be a part of the most interesting technical team around!


Our outlook is moulded around the principle of recruiting only candidates who combine breadth and depth of outlook and experience. We do not recruit people to slot into a particular technical role, but all-rounders familiar with a broad range of operating environments, programming languages, etc., combined with a high level of software engineering expertise.

item.title: Security Engineer at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?


 * You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business


 * We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career


 * We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company


 * We love open source and actively participate in the open source community


 * We win prizes (Netflix Cloud Prize for one)


 * We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative


 * We host and speak at meet ups


 * We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career


 * We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


What we're looking for in you


 * We want you to come with passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.


 * We want you to be focused on moving the business forward. We don't just talk about security for the fun of it. We focus on how it matters to our customers and our business.


 * We want you to have a keen interest in the business, not just a given security topic. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.


 * We want you to be excited the field of internet security like we are.


 * We want you to participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider security community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.


* Establish, maintain, and communicate Hotels.com security strategy.


* Establish and promote security best practices for developers, testers, and system administrators.


* Analyse security threats and propose strategic and tactical mitigation.


* Work with teams across Expedia, Inc. technology organisations on security related topics.


* Serve as primary owner for ongoing security audits.


* Manage vulnerability testing done on behalf of Hotels.com.


* Perform vulnerability testing when required.


* Manage and drive work related to obtaining and maintaining various security related certifications (i.e. PCI).


* Participate in architecture reviews to represent security concerns.



Your background


 * University degree or equivalent in computer science


 * Proven experience in security-related roles


 * Demonstrable knowledge of web technology


 * Prefer knowledge of Java development


 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills


 * Proven influencing and partnering skills


 * Proven organisational skills to manage security related remediation across functional teams


 * Excellent familiarity with common web security exploits and defences


 * Good system and network level knowledge


 * Knowledge of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS), TÜV SÜD s@fer-shopping, and SOX


 * Experience with enterprise level Security strategies


 * Experience with industry standard security tools from vendors like Fortify and Acunetix


 * Awareness of current and emerging industry best practices related to security


 * Familiarity with native mobile application security concerns

item.title: Java Software Engineer at BlackRock (Wilmington, DE)
item.description:
The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breadth of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise. 



APG Core Client Processing group (APG-CCP) aims to develop a centralized, controlled platform to support the complete money/flow lifecycle on the systems of Clients, Agents, and BlackRock.The APG-CCP-Global Cash Dev team provides software development and technical services to Fund Investors in BLK-managed Cash Funds and to internal BlackRock staff - mainly the T&LS Global Cash teams located in Philadelphia, New York and London, plus regional offices. The Global Cash business is approximately $500 billion in AUM. The team provides technical sevices to Fund Investors -- (current figures) 24 Order Placement interfaces, 35 Fund information data exchanges, 90 Transfer Agent data exchanges in the US-domiciled and Dublin-domiciled Fund ranges.


This position is for a java software engineer to Build Out Operational, Collateral management Capabilities on Aladdin.


Responsibilities include:




  • 80% development of strategic systems around the reconciliation, accounting  and reporting areas and 20% providing 2nd line of support for technical and/or operational issues encountered

  • Understand and refine business and functional requirements

  • Provide ongoing development maintenance of existing application functionality, working closely with the client support teams to address issues that are escalated for resolution

  • Work with team members in multi-office, multi-country environment

  • Continuous communication of technology decisions, issues and plans to senior team members

  • Deliver high level of client service through responsiveness and accuracy



Specific activities:


 80% Development



  • Developing and maintaining existing reconciliation, Accounting and Reporting systems, tools and processes, including participation in tactical and strategic development projects

  • Working alongside project managers, technical leads and business analysts throughout the SDLC cycle

  • Code new business functionality in the system, specifically in the Reconciliation and Reporting tools, to meet business and customer requirements, working closely with end-users, client operations staff, and other Aladdin development teams


20% Production support



  • Providing 2nd line of support for technical and/or operational issues encountered

  • Help the team conduct end-to-end UAT tests to ensure production operations run successfully during monthly cycles

  • Provide ideas for process enhancements that will result in development projects

item.title: Network Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Be more than an IT wizard! Be someone who saves the lives of animals. Best Friends Animal Society is looking for a Network Engineer.  We are working to end the killing of more than 9,000 dogs and cats who lose their lives in animal shelters daily, just for not having safe places to call home. It’s an enormous endeavor, and we need the support of a strong IT department. Come be a part of it, and never see a cubicle again. Here, IT works among the gorgeous red rock canyons of southern Utah in a warm and relaxed environment. And when you take a break, you can come pet some of the 1,700 animals who call Best Friends Animal Sanctuary their “home-between-home” on any given day.  You can spend your weekends hiking at Zion’s National Park! It’s a location you have to see to believe. And a career that will really make a difference in the lives of animals.  


Position Summary: Responsible for engineering, architecture and the daily management of Network Infrastructure, including Branch office, VPN and Data Center connectivity. Responsible for all upgrades and design engineering of complex network infrastructure, including LAN/WAN, Fiber Optic, Ethernet and Wireless infrastructures and network security. Network engineer works on projects as assigned, to integrate new systems into, as well as update, design and enhance, the existing network infrastructure.


Your main responsibilities will be working on Network Engineering, Voice Engineering/Architecture,  Fiber Optic/Data Infrastructure Engineering, System Engineering and Project Management.  


For a full description of responsiblities, please check out the posting on our Careers site.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Atlassian (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Love staying ahead of the growth curve and experimenting with new software and environments? Get on board as an Atlassian Site Reliability Engineer.


 As part of the Service Ops team, you’ll build solutions to problems that interrupt availability, performance and stability of how our systems, services and products scale. You'll also respond to alerts, pings, pages, queries and problems that you can investigate and really sink your teeth into.


You'll be working on hardware or virtualized delivery systems, automation (like provisioning systems), monitoring and data collection and configuration management (we use fab, puppet, FAI).


One thing we promise: you’ll never be bored.


More about you


We’d love if you have experience working with Apache, Nginx, Bash, Linux, AWS, virtualization technologies, Nagios, Python, Java, Puppet and yes, Atlassian products too if possible.


 The best person for this role is someone that has a collaborative spirit - in our world, it’s not about being a hero and having all the answers, it’s about sometimes saying "I don't know" and working on finding solutions rather than starting with an assumption. The team needs someone who can ask questions, learn from others and turn chaos into order.


This role would be a great fit for someone that likes to see concrete results from their work as you will be developing and delivering solutions that operate at scale - seeing your own technology efforts grow and evolve, from a proof of concept to hosting 180,000 JVMs on 50,000+ VMs running in production.


Site Reliability Engineers often wear many different hats, and are called to step up in times of crisis, so the right candidate will possess:


A clear head in the presence of alerts / Nerf darts


Solid communication skills with team members near and far


Strong knowledge of emoticons and memes


Awareness and insight into industry trends (technology, methods and tooling)


Strong scripting experience - we don't want you doing repetitive work!


Serious troubleshooting skills across different levels of the stack


Participation in an on-call rotation and occasional shift work


Understanding ITIL terminology like incident and problem would be a plus

item.title: QA Engineer at SemanticBits (Herndon, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
SemanticBits is looking to hire a talented QA engineer who can help us test the next generation clinical applications.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, a fast learner and passionate about testing software. He or she has a strong grasp of computer science fundamentals, experience working across different technologies, and the ability to think critically about problems and choose the right course of action.


You will...



  • Develop, manage and execute test plans and test cases.

  • Generate test reports and traceability matrix.

  • Decompose high-level business requirements into test scenarios.

  • Setup and maintain test environments.

  • Deploy software in Linux environment from .jar and .war files.

  • Build automated data-driven test harnesses.

  • Use several open source testing tools/frameworks such as SOAPUI, Selenium

  • Investigate and conduct root cause analysis of software and system defects.

  • Work as part of a team and interact effectively with others.

  • Mentor and supervise junior members of the team.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (PaaS) at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft is looking for Node.js full stack developers to join our award winning API Platform team in San Francisco.

You will get to pioneer a greenfield JavaScript/Node.js project with a growing team creating brand new services and features for our award winning AnyPoint API Platform. You will work on a team that developed RAML - a new language to design REST based APIs, and started large open source projects such as RAML Designer, Console, RAML parser, and many others.

You will have the opportunity to apply Node.js to develop high-performance and highly-scalable event-driven components which  provide the backbone for the API platform, and a set of shared services across the Anypoint Cloud platform. This is a greenfield project so there is tons of room for you to be creative, solve impossible problems, try new technologies and make your personal mark on things. In addition you have the opportunity, client-side, to use JavaScript and React.js for developing Single Page Applications.

You’ll get to work with a great team of smart and talented engineers in San Francisco, as well as plenty of opportunity to travel to our engineering team in Buenos Aires, Argentina. We have a really nice office space with lots of company perks, and we run regular meetups and hackathons. Most importantly you’ll have a lot of fun doing this.

item.title: Software Developer in Test - Drivers at DataStax (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
DataStax delivers Apache Cassandra™ in a database platform purpose built for the performance and availability demands of IOT, web, and mobile applications, giving enterprises a secure always on database that remains operationally simple when scaled in a single datacenter or across multiple data centers and clouds. We are looking for a Software Engineer in Test, focusing on the drivers and tools used to develop applications against Apache Cassandra. Can be located anywhere in the United States. 



Essential Job Functions:



  • Conceptualize, develop, and execute driver and tool code tests (coverage, duration, and stress) against local and distributed Cassandra/DataStax Enterprise (DSE) clusters running on a variety of platforms.

  • Dive deep into the code base to analyze features and bug-fixes while using debugging and profiling tools. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams to define functionality and resolve issues.

  • Have the opportunity to learn new languages, tools, and processes in a dynamic, fast-paced, small team environment.

  • Set up automated build and testing tasks across varied platforms and create analysis/tracking reports.

  • Write user-facing blog posts, driver software demos, how-to tutorials, as well as debug customer issues.



Job Requirements:



  • 2+ years in a production software development role.

  • Motivated self-starter who has experience working in a distributed team that exchanges ideas via IRC and HipChat. Must possess the discipline and focus to work independently at a remote location.

  • Understand the complexities of testing in a distributed, big data environment, and place a strong emphasis on performance tuning.

  • Strong development background using C#.

  • Comfortable with code development and scripting in a Linux environment.

  • Comfortable interfacing with the open source community and having your code reviewed via github pull requests.

  • Passion for making great software in a small company setting.

  • History of learning new technologies on the fly.

  • Possess an assertive communication style.

item.title: UX Designer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.


Stability meets Agility. CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we're hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career.


CDK Global is transforming the car buying process for both automotive dealers and car buyers. To achieve this lofty goal, we are deeply engaging with the our users to ensure that our products ignite efficiency and productivity while being delightfully easy to use. The User Experience engineering group at CDK is focused on the quality of the interactions people have with our technology and is looking for professionals that employ the principles and techniques of User Centered Design to join us. UX @ CDK follows a multi-disciplinary approach that focuses on all the users' emotions, beliefs, preferences, perceptions, and behaviors through an iterative research and design process. As a UX designer you will...



  • Transform the end user experience for CDK's automotive dealership solutions

  • Work closely with product development teams to follow user-centered design principles

  • Provide interaction and visual design

  • Drive the design vision, processes, and execution

  • Collaborate closely with UX researchers to ensure designs meets the needs of the user

  • Present and evangelize your work and the concept of usability across the organization

  • Operate with lean, agile frameworks and methodologies to improve the ability to respond to change

item.title: Research Scientist - Text-to-Speech at Amazon (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
Amazon TTS team researches, develops and delivers cutting edge multi-language Text to Speech technology, leading in voice quality, accuracy and ease of use.

As part of our development team you will work within the Amazon Digital Products department. This department has developed significant digital businesses including Amazon MP3, Amazon Video on Demand, IMDB, Amazon Fire TV, the Kindle Fire and our recently released Amazon Echo.



We are a team of creative people who successfully combine passion and ambition in creating one of the best speech synthesizers in the world, and now are one of the most visible teams within Amazon where you will get the chance to have a huge influence on making a positive impact on customers all over the globe.

At Amazon, we take pride in building complete end-to-end solutions, staring from researching a problem, implementing the solution, building a scalable and reliable service and ensuring the service is there when you need it.

Our goal is to build a next generation Text-to-Speech (TTS) system that takes the user experience to the next level and speaks a large variety of voices in the world’s most spoken languages. The challenges we face is handling whole variety of data which need to be pronounced correctly (such as names, surnames, proper names, foreign words), as well as finding correlation of end-user ratings and internal TTS quality metrics. This requires an engineer approach to improve the basis of huge amount of synthesized texts and semantic knowledge of the text to improve pronunciation of context specific words.



This position is based in Amazon Development Center in Gdansk, Poland.



As part of our development team you will be responsible for research in speech synthesis, providing analysis using mathematical modeling tools to answer important questions, designing system architectures, utilizing code (C/C++, Perl or Java) and existing tools for modeling or prototyping, effective communication with management as well as with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds. You will be involved in projects from concept to deployment, working closely with our core technology team, taking part in the complete project lifecycle.


  • MSc. or PhD degree in Computer Sciences, Machine Learning, or related technical field.

  • Proven track record of achievements in language research and development for Text-To-Speech, Automatic Speech Recognition or Natural Language processing

  • Professional experience in software development.

  • Knowledge of C/C++

  • Proficiency in at least one scripting languages (Perl, Python, Hadoop, Hive, etc)

  • Strong fundamentals in problem solving, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

  • Fundamentals in object-oriented design and data structures.

  • Strong personal interest in learning, researching, and creating new technologies with high commercial impact.




  • Knowledge of parametric and/or unit selection TTS technology.

  • Knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

  • Clear, professional communication skills able to contribute to team discussions.


When applying, please enclose the following statement:

„I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my offer to be processed for the purposes of recruitment, in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act dated 29.08.1997 (uniform text: Journal of Laws of the Republic of Poland 2002 No 101, item 926 with further amendments.

item.title: Software Engineer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
About the Position:


EFL is seeking a technology guru to work directly on the intersection of software engineering and data science. As the primary lead on critical system operations and quality, you’ll have the opportunity to interact directly with clients all around the world and play a critical role in the smooth functioning of our critical modelling, data science, and software engineering processes.



You will work closely with EFL developers, statisticians, Account Managers, and customers. With responsibility for the end-to-end dataflow, you’ll ensure that our mobile platforms are working well in the field, our systems are running, and our data is being scored correctly. With responsibility for monitoring and client escalation issues, as well as critical roles during the new client launch phase, you’ll see an incredibly detailed view of how EFL works in 20 different countries around the world.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Successfully manage and execute customer-facing Level 2 escalation issues

  • Develop hotfixes and upgrades to support a highly available cloud based platform

  • Participate in release deployment validation and processes

  • Develop automated testing frameworks and regression processes for a highly efficient quality system

  • Contribute and drive major development initiatives with codebases in Python/Django, R, MySQL, JQuery and React


Location: This position will be based either in our Boston office (in Cambridge) or Lima, Peru. At a minimum, this position will require an initial period of 2-3 months of up-front time spent in Lima followed by periodic trips back to Lima.

item.title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:

• Work in SDDC [Software-Defined Data Center] Solution Quality Engineering team to Design and qualify SDDC Solutions for various customers including the non-functional attributes like performance, security, interoperability, etc., in Cloud environment
• Support in design and validation of Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud and VVRD [VMware Validated Reference Design] document, as part of Agile groups
• Identify the potential integration/interOp challenges from reading PRD and functional spec. of involved products, talking with customers, field engineers and internal customer to understand the interoperability requirement for products in suite, towards SDDC Deployments. Write SDDC level integration/interOp test plans, test specifications, and certify integration/interOp requirements
• Ensure test environment reflects the operating environment of our customers Design and implement the customer test beds and End to End applications/various workloads simulated from a customer environment, documented in Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design and execution of automation scripts to support Automation of E2E workflows/use cases derived out of Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design Interoperability/compatibility Test Matrix and Requirements-based use cases, Test execution, reporting and tracking the overall progress, analyze risks and come up with the mitigation proposals
• Work with the required stake holders to escalate/resolve open issues
• Have an excellent Customer Focus related testing and develop Customer use cases in order to have our products work in customer like environments
• Deep understanding of customers through use cases, Alpha, Beta, IT use and the validation of those use cases
• Need to build very tight relationships with the field in collecting feedback and by sharing engineering expertise
• Co-ordinate with development and test teams for SDDC Solution testing across various VMware products and 3rd party products
• Support the BU vision of multiple SDDC Deployments
• Drive implementation of End to End Automation of customer workflows/use cases
• Act as a customer advocate, looking for innovative ways to improve current quality processes and procedures
• Mentor junior engineers

Requirements:

• BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Master is preferred
• Experience in testing in an enterprise or system level environment
• Positive mindset, excellent attitude, energetic, motivated, sharp learner, dedicated and hard working
• Experience and knowledge in automation frameworks is a must
• Strong experience in gathering test/use case requirement from customers, PMs and reading spec., familiar with risk based test design, test cases (automation/manual) implementation and execution, test resource/planning knowledge and experienced in Solution level, Integration and InterOp testing
• Passionate about quality
• Good understanding about the best practices, SDLC/SQLC processes, methodologies of QE, detail oriented and good follow through skill
• Manage activities to meet their delivery dates and publish the testing status report to different functional teams, management, project, engineering etc. clearly on regular basis
• Experience in testing Cloud solutions
• Possess the in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows/Linux/Unix) and one or more of the following areas: System administration, Networking and transport protocols, Storage (SAN) and file systems technology
• Strong analytical skill, critical thinking and debugging/trouble shooting skills with initial triaging of software/hardware failures
• Strong collaboration skills, good leadership and initiative to work with teams which might cross different business units, departments and partners to finish the end to end product integration/interOp testing independently
• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
• VMware product experience is a plus

VMware offers:

• Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
• Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
• Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
• Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and celebrations

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Software Engineer II-Salesforce.com at Windstream Communications (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
Software Engineer II– Salesforce.Com


This is a key position in the IT Applications organization, and is responsible for meeting customer needs through application development, deployment and life-cycle management, specializing in Windstream’s Salesfore.Com application.


This position will be a strong software engineer for IT development initiatives, geared towards a combination of building custom applications, configuring, implementing and integrating Salesforce.Com, and/or designing and maintaining integration interfaces. This position will interact with other organizations in the IT group e.g., IT Operations and other IT Application teams in order to provide proactive solutions to the business and drive business value.


Responsibilities include:



  • Development and implementation of Salesforce.Com initiatives in the context of Windstream’s systems roadmap.

  • Development and production support of Salesforce.Com

  • Full working knowledge of the Systems Life Cycle development methodologies, from analysis through implementation.

  • Understanding and working knowledge of databases and associated development

  • Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.

  • Thorough knowledge of software development methodologies

  • Good judgment in identifying issues and recommending solutions to others

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills.

  • Ability to think out of the box to solve complex business issues using technology creatively.

  • Application Support – Provide 24x7 production support on a rotating schedule communicating problem status and resolution time frames.

  • Commitment to an open, high integrity, hard working culture with a real sense of urgency

  • Extreme sense of urgency and high work ethic to get the job done regardless of the complexity or obstacles encountered

  • Proven ability to 'flex' processes when needed to ensure delivery 

  • Self-motivated individual

  • Customer focus and sense of advocacy

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer / Software Engineer at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid growth our site traffic is now reaching around 3 billion requests per month. For this reason we are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our dynamic Software Engineering department and ensure a reliable, fault-tolerant production environment. We want all our users to experience trivago at its best, and you are the person who will make this happen. If you are a master of PHP, eager for a new challenge and looking for the freedom to experiment with new technologies then we look forward to hearing from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Monitor applications in production (Price Search, Community, Hotel Manager etc.) and solve any issues or complications that arise, especially during peak traffic hours.

  • Build a fault-tolerant and scalable environment to support our rapidly growing business.

  • Research solutions for new projects, pitch pioneering concepts and build prototypes to drive trivago's technological infrastructure forward.

  • Design and build customized cutting edge tools by experimenting with new technologies.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and ensure maximum productivity by guaranteeing a reliable production environment.

  • Share your technical know-how with the team and document your tests, solutions, concepts and approaches for future reference.

item.title: Full-stack JavaScript hacker @ fast growing VC backed start-up at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with 2+ years of production experience in Python/Django or Node.js strongly preferred.
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform in Django, Angular.js, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Java Scala Developer (M/F) at Transpaygo GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
Fonmoney is a young and dynamic Start-Up based in Vienna, Austria. Created in late 2011 we are providing a service for our clients to send money around the world as a top-up or a bank-transfer. Our goal is to change “The act of sending money home”.


Fonmoney is developing a cutting edge Anti-Fraud and Anti Money Laundering Engine. We are working on the distributed machine-learning platform based on Apache Spark. In order to achieve this, we are currently looking for a passionate a Java engineer (M/F) for our office in Vienna. If you have a good knowledge and experience with Unix/Linux and you are also a little bit familiar with Windows environment, then feel free and apply for this position.

item.title: Product Manager at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


We’re looking for a detail-oriented Product Manager to work closely with our software engineers and product teams to build new and exciting projects. These projects will help revolutionize how companies work with their data and files through utilizing Vena’s software. At Vena, we believe that product releases should be fast and they should be often. To make this happen, our belief is that teams should be split by function and have end-to-end responsibility for what they build all the way into production.



As a Product Manager, your goal is to help us build an experiment-friendly culture that encourages failure and empowers teams to build great products and own their code all the way into production. Your role will be imperative in building autonomous team through alignment, transparency, and collaboration. You will be on the ground floor as we scale our teams and push ourselves to become the next great Canadian software company.



Responsibilities:



  • Drive Vena’s transition to Agile/Scrum software development in the role of Product Owner

  • Assist in establishing new and workable processes to make the development cycles increasingly effective each sprint.

  • Serve as the conduit between the user community (internal consultants and external customers) and the software engineering team through which requirements flow

  • Establish a shared vision across stakeholders by building consensus on priorities

item.title: Angular Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (McLean, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring Angular developers to create state of the art interfaces for large-scale and highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Are you an amazing Software Engineer who can provide expertise, leadership and mentorship to our IT team so that homeless pets will have technology on their side?  Our IT is growing so come work among the beautiful red rocks of Southern Utah!


Position Summary:  Responsible for providing technical expertise, leadership and mentorship to the software engineering team.  Ability to help define and set coding and architecture standards and practices and give similar input on other technical items.  Will work closely with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to determine priorities, technical approach and future direction.  Will actively generate code, participate in code reviews and be involved in deployments and operational support.


Responsibilities:



  • Providing software engineering team with leadership, technical expertise and mentorship.  Working closely with the team on ensuring that the project goals are being met with the solution being coded, that standards are being followed and efficient practices are being employed.  Will help to define a standard methodology for development and ensure that all solutions are compliant. (40 percent)

  • Actively generate code, do code reviews and similar operation support/project related activities.  Will take an active hand in projects and difficult operational issues. (40 percent)

  • Work with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to understand and plan future work, discuss technical approach and other similar items. (10 percent)

  • Participate in required administrative tasks.  Will actively participate in operational support meetings, CRM support meetings and other key business support items. (10 percent)

item.title: DevOps Engineer at RootMetrics (Bellevue, WA)
item.description: RootMetrics is seeking a bright, self-motivated DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering team. The DevOps Engineer will be a jack of all trades with experience in system administration, network operations, software development, build and release engineering, performance engineering an site operations. A small organization mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at RootMetrics. Sound good? Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.

item.title: iOS Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (McLean, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring iOS developers to create state of the art interfaces for large-scale and highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: Software Engineer, Devops at HookLogic, Inc. (Ann Arbor, MI)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a member of the Devops team, you’ll build tools to facilitate the deployment and management of our applications and deploy scalable cloud infrastructure to support them. You’ll work to migrate our standard cloud fleets to CloudFormation-driven fleets. You’ll help improve our processes and security using the newest and best available techniques and cloud services. You’ll help us plan for and monitor our applications during peak traffic periods, and give our other engineers the tools they need to properly monitor and take ownership for the performance of their own applications.

item.title: Software Engineer at SaleCycle (Houghton le Spring, UK)
item.description:
The web-based SaleCycle platform forms the core of our business and handles an incredible amount of data from our 500+ international clients. As a Software Engineer, you would ensure the continuous delivery of current features and services whilst delivering new and exciting products that keep SaleCycle at the forefront of the remarketing industry; you’re a pivotal part of this organisation!



As a Software Engineer, you will...


• Write high-quality code for SaleCycle’s portfolio of products, within an Agile team environment; code that forms the backbone of the business
• Conduct reviews of existing systems and processes to ensure we’re always performing to our best capacity
• Share your knowledge and experience with your team, mentoring newbies and helping everyone excel at what they do
• Collaborate with the wider business, in particular the Product & Business Managers, in order to accurately deliver what they need whilst also providing ad-hoc tech advice & support to all

item.title: Senior 3D Software Engineer at E4D Technologies (Richardson, TX)
item.description:
Are you resourceful, innovative, forward thinking, committed and have a passion for software development? If you are, please read on!


We have an excellent opportunity for a 3D Graphics Software Engineer to join our R&D team and contribute to developing our next generation 3D design software using innovative UI and intelligent algorithms to make the CAD/CAM process more intuitive.


E4D Technologies is a high-tech medical device company focused on 3D imaging, successful entrepreneurship, and commercialization of new technologies. The company has taken the dental profession to a higher level of productivity, patient comfort and convenience with its E4D CAD/CAM restorative systems and software solutions for dental offices, laboratories and teaching institutions.


We use the latest tools and standards to develop high-performance, cross-platform 3D design applications that keep us extremely competitive in our market. Our team is lean and mean, using scrum to develop high-quality code quickly and efficiently. E4D is an R&D-driven company, with an executive leadership team led by 3D coders.  Like technology itself, E4D Technologies is moving the future of digital dentistry forward with ongoing investment in imaging and CAD/CAM technology. With research and development led by the top electrical, mechanical, optical, firmware, and software engineers in the industry, E4D Technologies is committed to staying on the leading edge of precision, quality and digital applications


You will participate as high-level technical expert in design, coding, testing, and debugging.  Please visit our website at e4d.com.

item.title: Senior QA Engineer at HyTrust (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
HyTrust is seeking a Senior QA Engineer to help improve the quality and performance of its award-winning flagship product, HyTrust CloudControl. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on experience on one or more virtualization platforms, an understanding of the ecosystem in large customer environments, and an instinct for uncovering quality, usability and performance issues. 


The HyTrust product suite provides control and visibility for virtualized infrastructures as well as encryption and key management capabilities for cloud-hosted virtual machines and data.

item.title: Build Engineer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Build Engineer


Location: Seattle, WA


Motorola Solutions is seeking a ninja-class Build Engineer to join our team in Seattle. We make apps used for critical communications around the globe. Our customers love our products. We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile.


What you’ll be doing:


The primary role of a Build Master is to manage and maintain versioning, branching and the creating installation packages for our CORE product. The Build Master works with the VP of Software Development, Program Manager and other developers to produce quality software installation packages and strict version control policies.


Responsibilities:



  • Experience and passion for build and deployment automation, ideally around .NET-based infrastructure. Experience with setting up continuous build and test environments a plus.

  • Create and maintain installation packages for our software products

  • Take ownership of build issues


Create and maintain software configuration management documentation



  • Create unit tests for nightly runs

  • Branching and versioning process

  • Providing accurate estimates and meeting your scheduled commitments

  • Collaborate with developers, testers and support personnel

item.title: IOT Software Engineer Embedded Linux Development at Intel (Leixlip, Ireland)
item.description:
Creating and extending computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth--that's our vision, is it yours? We are changing the world at Intel. 


Step inside our world and you'll find one brilliant mind after another working together in a spirit of collaboration that is simply contagious. And through this shared dedication-this culture of innovation and exploration-we do more than deliver the latest technologies. We deliver the future. See for yourself. Look Inside. 


That's where you come in. We need innovators and proven communicators like you to push our thinking. We need your strong collaboration and organizational skills, as well as your ability to effectively work with and manage teams. You will help push us to the next level. Joining us means joining a dynamic team at a company that has established a reputation for innovation. 


As an IoT Software Engineer – Embedded Linux Development in Quark Design team you will play an integral role in designing and developing software for new Quark silicon devices, ensuring that we develop outstanding products. Your responsibilities will include but are not be limited to: 


- Conducting or participating in multidisciplinary research and collaborating with design, layout and/or hardware engineers in the design, development, and utilizing of productivity enhancement layout tools and design rule checkers, electronic data processing systems software.


- Determining computer user needs, advising hardware designers on machine characteristics that affect software systems such as storage capacity, processing speed, and input/output requirements, designing and developing compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. 


- Responding to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education, judgment and formal software process.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Whistle (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Join our pack! The role:


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to build out new applications and features for our web apps, mobile apps and our device. You’ll play an important role in building out applications that support our mobile apps, partner integrations, customer- and internal-facing web experiences, and scaling our platform as our number of customers grows.


As our team grows there’s lots of opportunity to grow into team or technical leadership, so consider growing with us!


You will:



  • Architect, plan and develop beautiful, functional web experiences for customers, partners and internal users using React and Ruby on Rails

  • Scale our platform to accommodate the growing number of Whistle customers

  • Collaborate with our mobile engineers to develop back end features and work with APIs for our mobile applications.

  • Perform estimates and work breakdowns from design specifications

  • Work with a TDD process across engineering and QA to ensure high product quality

item.title: FIRMWARE ENGINEER at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
The Cloud Platform Group (CPG) is seeking for a Firmware Engineer. In this position you will work on low-level programming, system architecture, operating systems, device architecture and hardware design, as well as source code development, review and maintenance (C/C++), unit and system level test and verification.
You will be working on next generations products and will have an opportunity to gain experience on best in the world server technologies that will be released to the market in few years. You will be a member of a cross-functional, cross-geo team that is very process-oriented and that delivers a world class server platforms based on Intel silicon.

Your responsibilities may include but not be limited to:
- Understand feature requirements, architecture and design.
- Firmware development (mainly in C language)
- Unit Tests development
- Firmware debugging
- Firmware integration with other server HW and SW platform components, like CPU, PCH, BIOS, OS etc.

item.title: Devs sought for Health Information Exchange (HIE) platform vendor at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We're designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

item.title: Qt SDK Product Engineer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
If you have a passion for building native apps and working with the latest developer APIs, Esri may be the place for you! We’re on a mission to find talented software engineers who can help us discover innovative ways to make Esri software reach new audiences. As an engineer on the team, your responsibilities will range from designing and testing new features to building cool sample apps and improving usability.



Responsibilities: 



  • Build example Qt and QML apps and samples using the latest technologies and features

  • Work closely with product and development teams to comprehend and influence upcoming features and tools for the ArcGIS Runtime SDK for Qt

  • Design APIs for new features

  • Define and complete robust test workflows to validate product capabilities and ensure acceptable performance and reliability

  • Assess product quality and release readiness and deliver feedback to team members

  • Create user documentation and tutorials for developers


More experienced individuals will:



  • Ensure that the Qt/QML SDK keeps up to date with current trends in Qt developer patterns

  • Examine complex user workflows and define solutions

  • Work within and help further define our SDK product roadmap

  • Assist with implementation designs and product architecture

  • Analyze our current delivery process and suggest new techniques that will help us deliver high-quality features to our customers faster

item.title: Windows Systems Engineer at WSM International (Saint Clair Shores, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
WSM is an established industry-leading technical services and solutions integrator undergoing a rapid growth phase due to demand for our cloud adoption, migration, transformation, security and DevOps services.


We offer virtually unlimited career growth potential for talented and motivated developers, systems engineers and server administrators.


We thrive in a casual, open, friendly and collaborative environment. Our work is rewarded with very good pay and an awesome benefits plan including health, term life, short and long term disability, 401k with company match (yeah!), dental, vision and flexible PTO. This is a full-time, 40 hour/week position.


We're looking for a sharp, self-motivated and self-managed Windows Systems Engineer to meet a growing demand for Windows environment cloud and server migration projects. 


You'll help plan, architect, consult and execute on a wide range of workload, application and data migrations working both independently and as part of our Windows systems engineering team. 



  • Evaluate, estimate and perform proof-of-concept for server and cloud migration projects (all Windows-based)

  • Collaborate with team members as well as operate individually to execute all phases of complex migration projects

  • Maintain existing Windows-based environments

  • Gain an in-depth understanding of our customer's objectives and related system interactions through direct customer, partner and/or WSM business staff communications, meetings and project discovery sessions

  • Work closely with partners, customers and colleagues to define and clarify project plans, deliverables, expectations, and scheduling

  • May contribute to DevOps tool chain implementation, DR and/or security initiatives as a part of the overall server or cloud transformation & migration engagement for WSM customers and partners

item.title: Software QA Automation Engineer at CYREN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The Software Quality Assurance Automation Engineer will join our Anti-Spam R&D team to oversee the entire development process, from start to finish and monitors every phase of the software development process to ensure design implementation quality.  The incumbent ensures that our software adheres to set standards by using state of the art automation tools and techniques.



  • Map the QA aspects of development process into goals such as verifications, activities, measurements, abilities, and commitments

  • Set up and maintain test environments

  • Test new features and verify bug fixes (whitebox & blackbox testing)

  • Understand overall security implications of new bugs and features

  • Ensure interoperability and standard conformance of new features

  • Track security issues in 3rd party components

  • Maintain and improve the (automatic) build environment (includes writing own scripts etc.)

  • Analyze issues brought up by operations and support

  • Write extensive documentation

item.title: Systems Engineer, AWS Network Monitoring at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Systems and Software Engineers to build and scale the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring Scaling team.



- You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

- Solving problems at scale excites you.

- You do not implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

- You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

- You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they are a core part of writing great software.

- You do not throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

- You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

- Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

- Bash experience plus knowledge of at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, Ruby)

- Strong track record of working in areas of significant complexity and 'getting things done'

- Record of mentoring other engineers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

- Proficient at designing software systems - from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to bespoke scripted solutions.

- Advanced UNIX (preferably Linux) systems engineering skills.

- A strong understanding of core internet technologies (e.g. TCP/IP).

- Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.



- Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

- The desire to work in a fast paced and constantly evolving agile environment

item.title: Software Engineer C#/.Net at WheelRight Ltd (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Developer – C# / .Net required to join a ground breaking technology company to develop innovative new products for the global marketplace. The business is expanding rapidly and requires dynamic developers to join the development team. As part of the team they would be responsible for a wide range of tasks from researching and recommending new methods of implementation through to coding and testing new software.


The WheelRight systems are designed using a combination of software, hardware and mechanical designs working together. This is an opportunity to be involved in the capture and processing of real-time data along with back end database design and customer interface development.


Work is in progress on the development of new products involving the use of image processing techniques. Opportunities exist for new engineers to be involved with the development of algorithms in this field. With a growing customer base there is also an increasing demand for software developers within the team to support differing user interface requirements.


This role is based in Oxfordshire.  Applicants must have existing permission to work in the UK.

item.title: Back-End Web Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (McLean, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring Back-End Web Application Developers to create state of the art, highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Portfolio.me (New York, NY)
item.description:
Portfolio.me has a small, fully dedicated team committed to building a dynamic, results-oriented work environment.  Using an investment strategy build upon an institutional investment strategy with exemplary out-performance, and our quantitative finance experience, we are working hard to launch a premium investment product.  We believe in educating and informing investors to bridge the gap between their social principles and their investments.


We are looking for an intellectually curious, and accomplished software engineer to help lead our development team, and add to our company culture.  We are socially conscious, and excited to positively impact both investing and corporate transparency.  Hopefully, working for a hedge fund or investment bank sounds or feels stale to you.


Being an Engineer at Portfolio.me is more than just an engineering role.  It is entrepreneurial, inquisitive, and technical leadership responsibility. You should be a technologist who is adept at solving problems, Developing a product that does not exist means creating the roadmap.   Working with a relatively complex data model, financial markets, as well as crafting a great UI experience present interesting day to day challenges.


You should love the idea of building a product versus maintaining a codebase, and taking on a leadership role.  Portfolio.me believes in interating and making things better over time as new technologies emerge.  Lean principles, test-driven development and continuous delivery matter to you.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java) at Linkable Networks (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Linkable Networks was founded on the premise that the disconnect between digital media and physical retail was a major gap in delivering a great experience to consumers. Since 2011, we’ve been nose-down building a scalable platform that provides brands and retailers the ability to engage, reward and incent their consumers directly and across any channel – online, mobile and in-store.


To do this we've built a sophisticated platform that spans the three major credit card networks and integrates into merchant POS data feeds.  We've built our cloud based platform to deal with scale from a number of directions- from high volume real-time user interaction to batch processing of huge data feeds.  As we continue to roll this platform out to customers we're recognizing the the application of our solution is broader than we ever realized and we're working hard to meet the demands of our customers to extend the range of our capabilities.


In order to keep growing we’re seeking well rounded Senior Java Engineers who have demonstrated success at building large scale distributed systems in creative ways. We want engineers who are excited about the challenge of delivering software on horizontally scaled architectures to processes huge numbers of transactions and user requests a day.


We have a great team of smart, committed and hard working engineers.  Everyone on our team has a stake in our process, our design, our delivery and our customers' satisfaction.  We're committed to building the best product possible and leading our space. 


Collaboration and communication are central to our process.  Successful candidates will possess a combination of strong technical expertise and communication ability.  You'll need to be able to clearly express (verbally and in writing) complex technical ideas to your engineering teammates and be able to translate those ideas so that colleagues in business operations can understand.


If this sounds good to you we'd like to hear from you.  We offer competitive salary, benefits, stock options and weekly team lunches.  Please see our Stack Overflow Careers company page for more details.

item.title: DevOps Automation Engineer at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Summary


We are expanding our operations and looking for talent to join our organization.  This is an exciting opportunity to join a first class technology team who is developing accountable delivery solutions for the healthcare industry.  The role of the DevOps Automation Engineer is to analyze, design, implement and validate strategies for continuous deployment to both host- and cloud-based infrastructure while ensuring high availability on both production and pre-production systems. Also, the ability of this role to design and implement automated dynamic environments to support the needs of delivery teams, plus collaborate with functional and technical team members to develop deployment strategies for existing and new types of services.   


The successful candidate will partner with Development, QA and IT Operations teams to successfully deliver Lumeris solutions to our customers.  The DevOps Automation Engineer is development-oriented and will become familiar with our critical operations – including event management – and to develop tools and automation that will make our operations more efficient and provide more time to advance best-in-class operations and development practices. Our operational responsibilities are constantly evolving and require engineers to remain flexible and reactive to new priorities while maintaining a consistent record of delivering results employing the latest tools for continuous delivery and continuous integration


Primary duties will center on automating the management of software configuration, build operations, and deployment systems.  Expected to create, maintain, and manage the infrastructure used to build software applications, as well as basic systems testing and troubleshooting of code after deployment.



  • Design and develop complex high performing scripts and applications that support automation and innovation

  • Create and implement best practices and standards with regards to the automation of tools and services
