  • Administer users of our software development life cycle tools which include source code management, build operations, work tracking, and project reporting.

  • Experience with cloud and virtualization technologies: AWS, VirtualBox, VMWare, KVM, zones/containers, Vagrant, Docker

  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, or Ansible

  • Experience building services in one or more languages (Python/Perl/Ruby/Java)

  • Data management skills



  • Dedication to providing a great customer experience

  • Excellent troubleshooting skills and ability to correlate system behaviors based on known interdependencies between those systems

  • Comfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Bomgar Corporation (Ridgeland, MS)
item.description:
Our Quality Assurance team is currently looking for software testers with strong Linux experience. So what flavors are you familiar with?


As a QA Engineer, you will be responsible for planning and implementing the QA procedures for daily, milestone and release candidate testing of the Bomgar product line of screen-sharing and remote control technologies.


For this position, we need someone who displays individual motivation and the keen ability to respond with innovation to new tech problems and new possibilities. In other words, we need you to think outside of our Bomgar Box!


As a member of the QA team, you will be responsible for the quality of software released to the company’s sales and marketing departments.  Our QA Engineers work closely with our development team creating new products while enhancing existing products.


 Our QA Team:



  • Determines test objectives and standards by studying software requirements, writing test cycle plans, test cases, and test scripts.

  • Meets test objectives by determining testing methods, cycles, phases, and conditions; set up testing environment and equipment.

  • Identifies software capability and reliability by conducting functional, system, and performance tests.

  • Resolves testing problems by modifying testing methods during tests; conferring with management to revise test objectives and standards.

  • Maintains testing database by developing defect tracking and regression testing information requirements; designing information system; enter test outcomes; secure data.

  • Reports test outcomes by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and displaying data; recommend software changes.

item.title: Senior QA Performance Engineer at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Investment's Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) division is seeking a Senior Software Quality Assurance Performance Test Engineer for our Durham, NC site. The individual will be responsible for managing the projects as well as testing of  multi-tiered distributed applications. A strong background in performance testing and/or in web development is well suited for this position.  Knowledge of multiple application infrastructures and strong communication skills are required. The Performance Testing & Engineering team is a group of highly skilled engineers who help design, test, and monitor high performing financial service products. In addition to a diverse and deep technical understanding the team members are experts in performance testing and financial services.


Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) enables business partners to win in their respective marketplaces by designing, building and maintaining the technology platforms and products of Fidelity Institutional and parts of the Retail and Workplace Investing divisions.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop test strategies using project artifacts as well as in depth interviews of architects and development leads

  • Create or modify performance scripts for Web based applications using HP LoadRunner with the Web and Web Services protocols

  • Execute performance tests on applications to assure capacity and stability of the applications meets requirements for production deployment.

  • Monitor all impacted systems for network connection disruptions as well as any obscure application behavior resulting from a network anomaly.

  • Measure resource consumption of components and processes and latency at measurable points in the systems under test

  • Identify application bottlenecks and assist engineers with improving application performance and reducing latency

  • Communicate performance testing results and identify areas for improvement with stakeholders at all levels

  • Manage project deliverables and drive delivery of performance output with project managers, developers, and peers.

  • Provide interim reports as well as a final report that summarize results to senior management.


Why Fidelity?



  • Three consecutive years on CareerBliss’ Top 50 Happiest Companies Employees Survey

  • A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology

  • More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, OS, and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture


At Fidelity, you can find it all here.  We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Full Stack UI Engineer at FinTech startup at FundApps (London, UK)
item.description:
FundApps is a growing fintech startup that helps investment managers comply with worldwide regulation.


We're looking for someone to take our industry leading user experience to the next level, working closely with our UX and Visual designer. While we're leagues ahead of our desktop, grey-screen based competitors, there's so much more we can do. You'll be shaping the evolution of our product - from tackling those small tweaks that can have an immediate impact for customers through to the broader user experience and the technical approach we want to take.


This isn't some “shiny-but-vacant” consumer app. There's real complexity both in terms of volumes of data that we deal with, and how we visualise the results of hundreds of rules running across thousands of portfolios - in a way that's simple, understandable and easy to manage.


If you love front-end development and achieving simplicity in both code and user interfaces then we'd love to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer for Onefootball at Onefootball GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
While being the latest platform launched by Onefootball, our web app (https://app.onefootball.com) is at the centre of our sharing infrastructure and an important source of information for football fans on both mobile and desktop. 

Your Role


You’ll join our web team and work directly on the existing code base of the web application and the related administration tools. The product is fresh enough so that we don’t have a lot of cumbersome legacy code and we follow the industry’s best practices to keep the job pleasant. We're always open to suggestions and expect you to use your experience to constantly improve our product. You should be fun to work with and like to learn and teach everyday. Also we value pragmatism and intellectual curiosity. Since you'd be working closely with other teams from different departments, your job is to make sure your voice is heard both inside and outside your field of expertise.

The position is located in our awesome football office in Berlin. We offer free drinks and food and great team events such as tech talks, football public viewings, sport events, lunch roulette and of course support with relocation and Visa application processes.

Who we’re looking for


You are passionate about programming and have already successfully developed products for a large and diversified user base. You ideally have more than 4 years of experience in coding for the web, a solid background in computer science concepts and a good understanding of the entire lifecycle from design, engineering to release and maintenance.

You master unit testing and respective frontend developer tools (we use bower + grunt + less but any similar variation is fine). You have a good comprehension of browser performances, UX across multiple screen sizes and you are attentive to details. Ideally, you have gained a significant experience with AngularJS.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. And if you’re a football fan, all the better.

item.title: Customer Integration Engineer at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
NuData Security is looking for developers who have a flare for coding and way with words to join our Customer Success Team.   


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. We are headquartered in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia, and our client base includes Fortune 50 companies, giving us a global footprint.


This customer-facing role integrates the NuData SaaS solution into client interfaces, the trusted guide before, during and after onboarding. Provide one-on-one assistance for customer calls, participate and lead project meetings, even travel on site for customer integrations. You’ll sharpen your coding skills writing code samples for customers, tweaking systems during implementation, following up with solid QA verification, and build product plugins for third-party web application frameworks. It’s beyond customer support – it’s customized customer integrations, an integral part of our product.


This is a permanent, full-time, in-office position.  


Qualification and Experience 



  • Minimum 4 years software development experience in a professional development setting;

  • Expert level knowledge and experience with at least one of the following programming languages with emphasis on object-oriented development: PHP, Java, C#, C++, Python; the primary development will be in PHP so at least some prior experience with PHP is required;

  • Strong knowledge of HTTP, RESTful services, Javascript, JSON, HTML/CSS, Web Application Development;

  • Experience designing and developing high availability, scalable web services with both SQL and NoSQL databases;

  • Experience with scalable/cloud-based software platforms, Amazon Web Services experience would be an asset;

  • Background in use of logging and monitoring support for server-based software components;

  • Basic understanding of Internet Security, Online Behavioral Analysis, and Machine Learning;

  • Exceptional understanding of data structures;

  • Strong software design, written and verbal communication skills;

  • Ability to lead customer engagements without supervision;

  • Bachelors of Computer Science or equivalent degree.


What we offer in return includes a beautiful view of the North Shore mountains, coffee that doesn’t suck, and colleagues that are as brilliant as they are likeable. We do cool things as a company. You know, like sword fighting, pinball playing, craft beer tastings. Plus all that normal stuff like a competitive salary, extended health benefits, flex-time schedules, and a work environment that encourages and supports professional development.  


If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job.  


(Our focus currently on candidates that are either already in or willing to relocate to the Vancouver area, and who are already eligible to work in Canada.)

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at EcoSys (New York, NY)
item.description:
Be heard, have influence and do work that is constantly challenging. Being a developer at EcoSys means that you’re part of a collaborative team focused on a product that is actively changing, not just supporting and maintaining an existing product. You’ll work alongside of our owners and newbies alike on cutting edge enterprise software that’s pushing the envelope in the areas of enterprise-level data volumes, user configurability, and flexibility.


We’re looking for a seasoned Java server-side developer with a wealth of experience designing, developing and perfecting server-side systems that are able to process complex business rules, multi-layered transactions and scale to thousands of users. As a Java expert you will be designing and building complex object-oriented systems.  You must have a firm handle on how to solve real-world business needs with elegant, reusable and efficient Java code/architecture. Only veteran software developers with demonstrated full-lifecycle delivery experience will be considered, meaning you need to possess a strong foundation in the science and discipline of structured programming.

item.title: Mobile Application Developer Android/iOS at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a Mobile Engineer at Rocket Internet you help launching and supporting successful startup companies all over the world.


If global scale and speed of execution is exciting to you, if you are passionate about your craft and if you are striving to build apps that matter to millions of people around the world, Rocket Internet is the right place for you!


Growing at an incredible pace we’re looking for sharp and passionate mobile engineers that help us make our mobile applications the best in the world.


What we offer:




  • Agile, cross-functional team with lots of responsibility on the team level




  • Build 200+ mobile applications for our startup companies that reach millions of users in 100+ countries every day




  • Many opportunities to grow on a personal and professional level




  • Work with great people from many countries




  • Challenging projects




  • Competitive salary




  • Relocation package ensuring a smooth transition to work and live in Berlin

item.title: Android Developer at Appthority (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As an Appthority Android developer you will be the lead engineer responsible for the design and implementation of an Android app that complements the industry’s leading system for automated, scalable Mobile App Risk Management. In this role, you will be responsible for design and implementation of an app that performs on-device malware detection, and synchronizes to the Appthority cloud solution via REST API. Your design scope will also include enterprise deployment strategies in light of privacy and security concerns.


Working at Appthority as an engineer is intellectually challenging, professionally stimulating, and potentially world-changing. This is not a lifestyle web site or a niche application. Rather, Appthority is a leader in the rapidly expanding world of mobile computing and mobile app security. We feel good about what we’re doing, and we have fun doing it!

item.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer - iOS at OfferUp (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
You have a solid career in software development and fell in love with iOS. You have a portfolio of successful apps you’d love to show us. You have a strong understanding of Objective-C, a deep knowledge of Cocoa and Cocoa Touch framework classes, and a hearty appreciation for Agile and iterative development practices. On previous projects you’ve worked with map integration, push notifications, social SDKs, and JSON responses from web APIs. You share our passion for good UX/UI design and have strong experience building compelling touch & gesture interfaces. 


You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of significant portions of the OfferUp iOS app. You will craft clean and well-documented code, hit deadlines, exercise professionalism and maintain an active interest in the overall success of what we're building as a company, beyond just the scope of your projects.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - C#/JavaScript at GoFormz (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
GoFormz is a San Diego startup looking for great developers to add to a rapidly-growing engineering team.  Our goal is to help individuals and businesses replace paper forms with web and mobile-based digital forms, and then to provide ubiquitous access to the collected data.


What will I be working on?

We work on a wide variety of projects and technologies, and you will have a lot of freedom to choose what you will work on.  We do everything from JavaScript/HTML5 web apps to mobile app development to solving complex database/platform architecture problems.  One thing is certain; you will be a core contributor working on production code.  The work you do will become part of the day-to-day life of thousands of our customers. 


What is it like to work at GoFormz?



  • We have a fantastic team that gets stuff done and is fun to work with!

  • Our office is in San Diego, CA right next to the bay. 

  • Everyone has the best hardware for doing their particular job. You tell us what that is.  We have some pretty sweet monitor setups.

  • The environment is fast-paced, so you will see the results of your work immediately

  • We actually care about your physical health.  Everyone in the office has automatic sit/stand desks, and we provide membership to an executive health club/gym as well as providing healthy food snacks.

  • You will receive equity.  We also pay well - at or above market.

  • Full gold-level health and dental insurance is provided

  •  You will have plenty of opportunities to use and learn cutting-edge technologies with which you are currently unfamiliar.

item.title: Ruby Engineer at Oversee.net (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Job Responsibilities:



  • Design & implement new features throughout the whole stack in Ruby on Rails applications

  • Modernize old code by cleaning up bugs, implementing best practices, and in some cases rearchitecting features so that they work better and are more maintainable

  • Actively participate in our team through participation in scrum and code reviews, and participation in the design and execution of new features

  • Develop algorithms critical to informing data driven decisions within our services and products.

  • Internal API development and integrating 3rd party APIs across multiple systems.

  • Design & implement Ruby on Rails systems using scalable methodologies and best practices.

  • Modernize legacy products and services to support product growth and scope, including migration to the cloud and exposing services.

  • Lead through example. Perform code reviews, write effective test, lead discussions on critical technologies, mentor fellow developers, pair program, etc.

item.title: DevOps Engineer for VC backed fast growning Start-up at Ice.com (Menlo Park, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • Experience running a large-scale mobile and web operation
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible or Fabric
  • Strong Linux skills (Ubuntu preferred)
  • Strong Python development experience
  • Hands-on knowledge of high-availability approaches such as load balancing, failover, clustering and disaster recovery
  • Familiarity with performance and security best practices
  • Passion, drive, energy, a sense of humor and a great attitude!

Initial Responsibilities Include:

  • Build and improve platform services including web application hosting, databases, and networking
  • Automate the provisioning, configuration, scaling, and monitoring of our platform
  • Manage vendors and integrations used to deliver Ice.com services
  • 24/7 on-call rotation
  • Promote knowledge sharing and DevOps culture across our entire engineering department

Some of our Perks:

  • Entrepreneurial culture
  • Great Health care, Vision, and Dental plans
  • Build a team and product from the ground up
  • Have a suggestion? ...We would love to hear it. :)
  • Jewelry discounts for yourself, wife, or kids ;)

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Staff Software Engineer - Web Development, ACOS at A10 Networks (San Jose, CA)
item.description: You will be responsible for developing high performance, responsive user interfaces for A10 network management GUI. The clean, intuitive, and beautiful user interface you will build plays a critical role in the A10 user experience -- allowing users to navigate through page flow and visually manipulate network management components. You will develop core frontend components of a fast, scalable, complex web application (Angular JS, Django, HTML5, Sass, CSS, JavaScript) using libraries and frameworks (e.g. Knockout JS, Angular JS, Ember JS, Batman JS, Closure).  The sleek, beautiful results of your work make you an integral part of our product/engineering group as you define, design, and develop new features with a top-caliber team.

item.title: Embedded Linux Engineer at Renesas Electronics Europe Ltd (Wooburn Green, UK)
item.description:
Renesas is the world's leading microcontroller vendor. We are looking for an Embedded Linux Developer to join our design group in Bourne End near Maidenhead where we developing a variety of advanced embedded solutions for our newest range of quad-core devices based around the ARM Cortex A15 and A7 processors. You will work on the development of core solutions such as drivers for SDIO, PCI Express, USB, Ethernet, NAND Flash, Quad SPI display, audio, DMA, MMC, SATA and Video capture as well as Linux Kernel porting (3.x.x). Other interesting areas include Wayland graphics, Virtualization, Heterogeneous Multi Processing (HMP) on A15/A7 (big.LITTLE processing) and Multimedia.



This is initially a 6 month contract with similar length extensions the norm. Daily rate £300 to £360 based on experience.

item.title: Software Engineer - Air Traffic Control Simulation at UFA, Inc. (Burlington, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for motivated, creative C and Java professionals to join our team developing simulation software for the air traffic control industry.


What You’ll Do:


• Specify, design, develop, and support our ATC simulation products ranging from application development, algorithm development, image generation, voice communications, and voice recognition products.


• Utilize modern software engineering methods, software tools and support processes on a product development team for one of our many in-house product and customer programs.

item.title: iOS Engineer at Vokal (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Vokal, the expert in all things mobile, is looking for passionate iOS developers of all skill levels for our growing team. Come take part in a supportive community where designers and developers across iOS, Android, and web collaborate to face exciting new challenges and redefine the way mobile impacts people’s lives. We’re prepared to give you the tools you need to be great at what you do, including six ways (and counting) to brew your coffee—or plenty of tea if you prefer. Your experience as a member of our team matters just as much as the experiences we create for our clients and the users of our products.


If you are an iOS application developer who loves to solve problems and gets excited about agile process for iPhone and iPad application development, we can’t wait to have you on board.


This position is based in our home office in Chicago’s River North neighborhood.


Vokal offers a competitive compensation package.


Position Responsibilities



  • Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop highly innovative, consumer-facing, and enterprise mobile solutions

  • Support and collaborate with clients, other developers, and designers to determine business and technical solutions

  • Continually deliver creative solutions with excellent execution

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Windcrest, TX)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Does contributing to the Open Source community WHILE working making you happier than an engineer who just found the ultimate gif? Is collaboration a key component to what makes you tick? If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Developer at Rackspace.


With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to build the best private cloud offering in the industry, the life of a dev at the Rack can be different but don’t worry we will help match your skills, passions and birthday wishes with the right opportunity. Here’s a preview to get you started:


Private Cloud:
Rackspace has some of the most notable upstream OpenStack contributors on the planet. Duh…we co-founded the thing so of course we do and you will have the opportunity to do the same. Private cloud devs literally pound out Python code from all over the globe in one of our offices or from the comfort of their own home if they have shown superior abilities, yet don’t worry we have the tools to keep you connected when you need to be. These teams manage, scale and optimize every aspect of the customer’s environment including a little Ops work so be ready to own it like it’s your own little baby.


Public Cloud:
The largest OpenStack public cloud in the world just obviously means huge, large-scale, highly distributed customer environments that extend to many of our 10+ global data centers. Python, Ruby, PHP you name it. Teams are made up of specialists for each but they dabble in everything. Swiss Army code knives are just how we roll. This squad pulls in other devs from other business units, infrastructure engineers and quality engineering all to get the job done. No one fails alone because they are never left alone. Even as they push the bounds of big data or whatever comes out next they learn together and win together.


What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, get a chance to talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


Still not convinced? See what the Rackspace teams are doing for our customers. Rokkan Story

item.title: Watson Machine Learning Engineer - AlchemyAPI at AlchemyAPI, an IBM company (Denver, CO)
item.description: Here at AlchemyAPI, we are crafting solutions to some of the most interesting problems in AI today. Are you interested in poring over literature relevant to computer vision and channeling interesting ideas to drive development of impactful products? Have you seen examples of mind-blowing NLP results and wondered how you could replicate them, or to make them better? If the thought of developing, prototyping, and industrializing real applications of AI with deep learning is exciting to you, then we should talk. From the data curation and training of machine learning systems to the preparation of robust and battle-tested object oriented code, the work of a machine learning R&D role at AlchemyAPI is always exciting.

item.title: Pre Sales Technical Evangelist at Openmind Networks Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Are you a smart, creative, people-oriented engineer? Are you passionate about the software developer community? If so, we’d love to meet you!


Golgi is a cloud service for connectivity and data transport that decreases time to market in delivering IoT Solutions. Developers define their service using Thrift and use Golgi to generate type-safe APIs specific to their needs. Golgi significantly cuts development time and allows the developer to concentrate on adding value to their app or device.



You will be a passionate evangelist for Golgi (http://golgi.io) as well as a champion for developer interests within Openmind Networks. This is a position for engineers who love being out in the wild working with developers around innovative technology.
You will help build and foster the community and help extend the technical direction around the product by being the lead Developer Advocate for Golgi.


Your responsibilities will include the following:


- Educate prospective clients by assessing customers’ needs and recommending solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Golgi - Create momentum and drive the success of Golgi through your interactions with third party developers


- Hands-on coding with developers on-site; 1st line technical support for developers


- Evangelize Golgi by participating in technical presentations on conference panels, at user groups, on social media/blogs/forums, at meetups, through technical articles, etc.


- Generate sample content (demo applications/snippets), tutorials and technical documentation using a variety of development languages and platforms; Publish open-source projects that allow developers, partners and customers to quickly understand and utilize our SDK


- Advocate for developers internally and influence the technical direction and roadmap for Golgi. Work cross-functionally with Engineering, Business Development, and Marketing

item.title: Principal Software Engineer (Service Owner - myBBC ID) at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


Service owners play a key role in our engineering function providing whole life technical ownership of our development. Working closely with Product Leads the Service Owners you’ll ensure that development is consistent with our world class quality values and total cost of ownership concerns.


You will initially work with our 3rd party supplier to establish this new service, whilst concurrently recruiting and forming the longer term team that will further develop and support the IDL.


You’ll also:



  • Support product management with stakeholder engagement, evangelizing the benefits of the service

  • Own and drive technical service innovation, while delivering end to end engineering excellence

  • Ensure the compliance of delivered product with functional and non-functional requirements

  • Manage/oversee a mutli-disciplinary scrum team(s)

  • Manage releases and the service transition to live

  • Oversee the full operational lifecycle, including sunset as applicable


You’ll also keep up to date with developments in the field that may be advantageous to your own delivery. As well as help and coach other team members as you see fit.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Test Automation Engineer - Atlanta / Alpharetta at Intelligrated Software (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
This position will be responsible for the development and support of automation applications. Responsible for applying expertise in tools and methodologies to develop the requirements, procedures and guidelines for the automation testing efforts of all Intelligrated software applications prior to deployment to ensure they are performing according to specifications and are free of errors. This includes defining the automation test plan and strategy, testing environment, scenarios, creating/modifying scripts and data required, executing tests, and reporting on findings. Also responsible for organizing the resources necessary to prepare and execute tests and reporting back to the development team on issues to be addressed as required. This may include automation of testing processes, and the identification and management of testing tools and standards.  In addition this person will:



  • Work with development to ensure their code and the test automation code will interact efficiently together

  • Be responsible and accountable for one or more of the major components of the test automation framework; this will include the design, development, delivery, maintenance and evolution of these components

  • Develop and maintain test script requirements

  • Review broken scripts for suites and resolves/fixes them

  • Identifies vulnerabilities in automated testing and defines and manages plans to mitigate risk

  • Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality

  • Participate in the automation feasibility analysis for new systems/applications

  • Propose the acquisition of new testing tools to management

  • Participate in the Agile software development cycle, including meetings, iterative development, estimations and design sessions

  • Create the automation test plan for a project, conceiving of the testing strategy and approach

  • Be responsible for the creation of all project level automation test plans, detailed test plan, or phase level plans such as component, system, integration or user acceptance test plan

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

item.title: Quality Engineer- TDD Environment at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar is the world’s largest ‘car-sharing’ company and is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.


As we continue to grow our operations, we are looking for talented, passionate people with great ideas to join the Zipcar family. We aim to create an environment that is supportive, diverse, and as fun as our brand. If you’re results-oriented, dedicated, and ready to contribute to an unparalleled member experience for our community of Zipsters, we encourage you to apply.


To learn more about Zipcar, what we do, and how we do it, visit zipcar.com. For further employment opportunities, visit http://www.zipcar.com/about/jobs


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with development and product owners to drive continuous improvement of the Zipcar member experience

  • Continually add Business Value to Agile Teams through Proactive Participation

  • Design and execute automated functional tests within the test automation framework

  • Develop and Maintain functional Regression tests

  • Pair with team members to identify and mitigate software risk through exploratory testing and other techniques

  • Lead improvement initiatives to process, testing, and tools. Own improvement initiatives identified in team retrospectives.

  • Analyze production defects, and drive effective corrective actions


Requirements:



  • 3 or more years of experience testing Web Applications in a hosted environment

  • Hands on Experience developing automated functional tests using Selenium or similar tools

  • Experience with an Object Oriented programming language (Java, Python, Ruby, etc.)

  • Prior experience working in an Agile software development environment, collaborating with developers and product owners

  • Experience with creating SQL queries and using relational database technologies or experience with non-relational data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra and MongoDB.

  • Strong command of Linux operating systems

  • Experience testing front end web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Adaptable and willing to work in a dynamic, fast paced environment


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • Prior experience with Ruby on Rails, Scala/Playframework or Enterprise Java

  • Experience with Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB

  • Experience with software version control using GIT

  • Prior experience with testing using Rspec

  • Self-motivated, with a passion for learning

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • An obsession with delivering outstanding customer experience

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Senior PHP Software Engineer at The Idea People (Charlotte, NC)
item.description: The Idea People are looking for an experienced web developer. You will be responsible for delivering applications that drive cutting-edge technology development. You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of a wide variety of web-based products using PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, and MySQL/NoSQL. Our team enjoys challenges and thrives on cool design delivery.

item.title: IT Architect at Itility (Eindhoven, Nederland)
item.description:
Natuurlijk ben je een specialist. Maar wel een met grensoverschrijdend inzicht en het vermogen om in alle fases van een project je expertise in te brengen. In de rol van IT Infra Architect bij Itility ben je zowel strateeg als diplomaat, visionair én pragmatisch. Nu Senior Engineer of op zoek naar een bredere rol als IT Infra Architect? Dit is je volgende stap.


IT Architect


Wat ga je doen? 
Bij Itility krijg je de kans om ervaring op doen in de volle IT-breedte. Je doet ervaring op in complexe (internationale) IT projecten. Je gaat onder andere:



  • middels assessments en technische deep-dives, IT applicatie platformen analyseren;

  • complexe IT systemen op basis van bouwblokken re-designen;

  • feasibilities, architecturen en implementatie plannen opstellen;

  • implementaties, migraties, installaties en systeemtesten begeleiden.


Als onderdeel van een winning team werk je bij klanten als Telco’s, ISP’s of bedrijven in de hightech, semiconductor industry, finance of energy in de Randstad of in de regio Eindhoven. Het voortdurend delen van kennis en ervaring met engineers en andere architecten is part of the job.


We denken in resultaten, net als jij.


Dit is ons aanbod
Je krijgt de kans om je in een inspirerende omgeving optimaal te ontwikkelen, onder de persoonlijke begeleiding van een Senior Architect of Programmamanager. In complexe internationale IT projecten pas je de nieuwste technieken toe, in de volle breedte van het vak.


Bij Itility investeren we in elkaar. Behalve een prima salaris krijg je bij Itility veel extra's, zoals:



  • opleiding aan de 2-jarige Itility Academy en externe trainingen op maat;

  • deelname aan conferenties;

  • aanvullende variabele beloning op basis van geleverde prestaties;

  • 26 verlofdagen;

  • onkostenvergoeding;

  • auto, laptop en smartphone.


Locatie
Eindhoven tot Randstad

item.title: Systems Engineer - Site Reliability at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Systems Engineer - Site Reliability



Relocation assistance is available


Must be legally available to work in the US.  Transfer of existing H1-B visa or Green Card OK


 Due to continued growth an opportunity exists with Tillster as Systems Engineer - Site Reliability.  In this position you will help build, monitor and scale the infrastructure that powers online ordering & loyalty programs for many of the largest brands in the quick service and casual dining industry.


 Your creativity and skills will directly support a platform that processes millions of transactions for Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, Burger King, KFC, Dominos, and others as we scale globally.


 You’ll be depended upon to provide innovative approaches to configuration management, continuous deployment, monitoring and provisioning new environments.


 It’s a role that demands a motivated & self-directed engineer who solves problems large or small with the big picture in mind, communicates well and pushes their team to think about problems in new ways.


What you’ll do



  • Build, monitor and scale our infrastructure during a period of rapid growth

  • Tackle complex infrastructure challenges with creative automation and configuration management solutions

  • Build and support application environments that are deeply integrated with AWS

  • Build custom tools and instrumentation to ensure service availability

  • Help improve and expand the coverage of deployment automation

  • Implement custom monitoring across the entire application stack, including 3rd party APIs and Point of Sale systems

  • Work with partners and vendors on technical improvements and fixes

  • Constantly research new technology and techniques that will benefit the team, the company, and its clients

item.title: Associate Implementation Engineer at Q2ebanking (Austin, TX)
item.description:
This position is a technical implementation role that requires mid-sized application troubleshooting and support experience.  Work as part of the Platform Advancement team and focus on optimizing our clients’ environments by implementing updated adapters, participating in configurations for platform upgrades and other as needed components into the production environment. 


Essential Job Functions:



  • Modify software as necessary including, but not limited to, changing scripts, reviewing application logs and making necessary modifications in database tables to optimize the client’s production environment

  • Construct and schedule automated processes and create custom processing scripts

  • Implement updated adapters, components and bug fixes into production environments

  • Regularly troubleshoot complex client application, integration and environment issues

  • Troubleshoot and resolve customer problems of a complex nature such as code defects, product configurations (files or data), networking, platform, third party communications, hardware configuration or other issues commonly encountered in systems operation in a networked environment

  • Thoroughly document and track production environment modifications

  • Manage multiple projects while regularly receiving escalated cases from management and prioritize accordingly

  • Regularly document and report product/application defects to Development team, and escalate unresolved problems to the appropriate resources

  • Establish relationships with other partner teams that impact technical support. (e.g. tool teams, third level team, QA, Development)

  • Follow internal change control process to implement any required product modifications

  • Contribute to a knowledge/FAQ database for supported software

  • Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned

item.title: Designer, Web and Mobile at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (Arlington, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring a Web Front-End and mobile app designer to create state of the art interfaces for large-scale and highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: Software Engineer at MetaBank (Sioux Falls, SD)
item.description:
Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative software development environment? Would you like a new challenge? Are you looking for a stable, growing company that provides work/life balance and cutting edge technology?


Due to company growth, we are expanding our software development team. We are committed to skills development, enhanced training, and career progression for qualified candidates. Does this sound like something you’d like to be a part of? Come join us! Together, we can change the way people use money.


Job Summary:


Coordinate activities surrounding all software development. Specifically, participates in the architecture and design, oversees development and maintenance efforts for enterprise applications.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Review, analyze, and modify existing systems including coding, testing, debugging, and deployment efforts in support of enterprise needs.


Participate in requirements process providing feedback and engagement to ensure sounds processes are developed.


Provide support for complex issues within existing systems and applications, including resolution of user issues, errors in system data, and general maintenance items.


Create solutions based on experience, sound judgment, and creative problem solving.


Assist in solving complex development problems through the use of good design and practical experience.


Ensure business remains current and competitive in find emerging technologies to improve business processes.


May be asked to mentor, lead or direct the work of others.


Ensure high availability and reliability of business applications.


Demonstrate personal commitment to excellence in service to customers and other employees.


Conduct business with strict adherence to bank policies and procedures. Participate in the bank's Performance Management System.


Other duties may be assigned.

item.title: Python Web Developer for Trading Firm in Chicago's River North area at Old Mission Capital, LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We are currently seeking a dedicated software engineer to join our technology team in Chicago.  You will be taking over primary responsibility for a key internal system used to track and analyze trading activity.  Responsibilities include:



  • Build new features and fix bugs in Python, Django, SQL and some C++

  • Create web applications for traders and middle office

  • Develop server-side programs for real-time trade processing

  • Develop server-side scripts and programs for post-trade analysis

  • Work closely with traders, operations personnel and developers to manage and improve systems

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer at EduMetrics (Boston, MA)
item.description: We are in need of a Senior Ruby on Rails developer to join our growing team.  Our company is currently in a startup phase and focuses on building Web and Mobile apps for K-12 schools.  The team this developer will be joining is located in Boston and different parts of the country.  The ideal candidate would be able to manage the product backlog, be a primary contributor, and a mentor to junior developers.  The role requires someone who is comfortable meeting with non-technical people to gather and create requirements for the product backlog.  This individual must also be comfortable dealing with last minute problems that arise from having an active user base.

item.title: DevOps / Configuration Management Engineer at ABB (Kraków, Polska)
item.description:
Build the software product (compile and link).
• Lead the integration of source code between branches in the CM system.
• Perform entry-level debugging of source code to facilitate resolution of integration problems.
• Release the software product for customer use at the end of a development project.
• Automate repetitive tasks by scripting and development of software tools.
• Deploy the software product on internal test systems, some of which are virtual and some physical.
• Set up test systems from scratch, i.e. install OS, configure networking, install software, configure security.
• Create customized OS installation images of Windows and Linux to be used on both internal and customer systems.
• Provide performance data within the CM area, such as build times, lines of code, compiler warnings, etc, and make this visible to the rest of the team.
• Participate or lead improvement projects within the CM area, e.g. automating builds, creating interfaces between different tools.
• Be prepared to work odd hours at times – usually planned well in advance.

item.title: System Engineer/IT Manager at Visible Equity LLC. (Salt Lake City, UT)
item.description:
Visible Equity LLC. is looking for a highly motivated individual to serve as a system administrator/IT Manager for desktop, server, and network infrastructures.  The candidate will also be part of the release management process for code releases and have responsibilities in leading the company efforts around data security and protection.


Role/Responsibilities:  System Administrator


The SysAdmin role at Visible Equity will encompass many areas of system administration; all system infrastructures, network administration, security administration, web server administration, desktop/laptop/device administration, and storage administration.  This role will also be a critical component to overall systems and infrastructure strategy and the audit readiness of Visible Equity.


Key duties to include, but not limited to:


Infrastructure support/strategy/design/management/performance—servers for production applications/business


Office Technology support/strategy/management—development environment, laptop support/standards, Anti-Virus, backups, policies, office network infrastructure/performance including voip systems, web-conferencing needs and back-office support applications/tools.


Audit Readiness:  development and adherence to user policies, security management, virus/intrusion management and documentation of policies/processes as they relate to system administration areas of Visible Equity capitalizing on knowledge share and process tracking in company WIKI.

item.title: (SENIOR) SOFTWARE DEVELOPER CoC Navigation (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Garching, Deutschland)
item.description:
Tasks / Responsibilities:



  • Define use cases, negotiate interfaces and implement prototypes and solutions in the emerging field of navigation related online services to supply solutions at and beyond market expectations

  • As part of a matrix organization work with engineers, designers, testers and managers as needed to help integrate and productize your solution.

  • Integrate of new functionality into an existing solutions

  • Propose new ideas, approaches and implement them Elaboration and implementation of component design, concepts, algorithms for new features in area connected services/location based services

  • Performance Analysis / Profiling of implementation

  • Technical coordination with developers of navigation controllers, navigation engine and online services

  • Analysis, improvement, and optimization of complex, distributed algorithms for geo-data processing

  • Elaboration and implementation of component design, concepts, algorithms, and architecture for new navigation features


Our Offer:


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer / Architect (Python) at Vision Fleet (Marina del Rey, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a dynamic full stack software engineer to lead the development of our technology and analytics platform, iQ.


What You’ll Do
Located in LA or SF, you will work closely with our product, analytics, and ops teams, external consultants and vendors. Specifically, we’re looking for you to do the following:



  • Deliver complete, high performance web applications for desktop and mobile devices

  • Automate and support the data value chain (vehicle to backend, to front-end), including migration of prototype algorithms into production intent server-based scripts

  • Integrate and develop REST APIs

  • Build client-side user authentication and authorization between multiple applications

  • Implement user security and data protection

  • Write end-to-end (unit/integration) automated test suites for all components

  • Create configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments


Personality Types We Like



  • You are high energy (this is a startup, with an all-hands-on-deck approach).

  • You are responsible, responsive, and good at managing expectations

  • You appreciate the value of feedback: you’ll be collecting extensive customer feedback and helping us learn

  • You are a big-picture thinker: We are aiming to accomplish something big

  • You love backend development, new technology, and operations


Perks



  • You get in on the ground floor with a company that has initial validation and lots of growth opportunities

  • You’ll also work closely with high-level contacts in key energy, automotive, and government sectors

  • You get to work with cool technology in a collaborative culture, making a difference in the world


Compensation



  • Competitive salary

  • Equity

  • Health, dental, vision

  • 401k

  • Unlimited vacation policy

item.title: Front-End Developer at Fidelity Investments (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced front-end developer to join our UXD team in Jersey City. You'll be working with an amazing team of engineers and designers to help write the robust, reusable, client-side code that drives Fidelity.com applications.


We have an amazing new space with an in-house usability lab and some of the best design and research talent in the world. Our office is directly across the Hudson River with a beautiful view of downtown Manhattan.

item.title: C# .NET Developer at YieldPlanet (Warszawa, Poland)
item.description:
You will be working with a team of dedicated engineers and data scientists on developing and maintaining the next generation of hospitality tech products. YieldPlanet development work is done in collaboration with Princeton University and polish Universities for our Business Intelligence applications. 
Our team is working in an agile environment and you will have direct impact on code and the final product.


In detail, you will be doing the following:
- Developing applications using .NET technology
- Customer requirements analysis
- Creating technical documentation
- Developing good quality Code
- Research new technologies and share discoveries with other team members

item.title: Senior C++ Developer; architect ultra low latency trading strategies at Tower Research Capital (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are a tight-knit, 3-person trading team at Tower Research Capital. We're looking for a C++ ninja to be our lead engineer and help take our low latency trading strategies to the next level. You will be a key revenue generator, and your compensation will reflect that. You will be asked to:



  • Design, implement, test, and deploy real-time trading systems

  • Develop tools to monitor, analyze, and further automate existing trading processes

  • Measure and optimize software, hardware, and network performance

item.title: Application Engineer at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 


We are looking for a talented individual to be a key technical evangelist about Exaptive, educating the user community and customers in writing, presentations, and short videos.  He or she will support the sales process through demos, technical training sessions, proposals, and proofs of concept to identify customer needs, design solutions, and communicate Exaptive’s unique value.  This role is the bridge between us and our community, communicating our story to our community and representing that community in shaping our company’s direction.


We will provide intensive training during which you will create top notch documentation and video tutorials for our users – written and video.  The role will evolve according to the dynamic needs of a startup and to your talents and professional desires.           


This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to other Exaptive and customer locations. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as an opportunity to excel. The startup environment is not for everyone, but offers the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 



Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/).  Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Intermediate - Senior Software Engineer at Shift Health (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Located in downtown Toronto, our developers enjoy a flexible work environment (wear what you want, dog friendly, work from home days, free Friday beers), alongside an empathetic, intelligent team that holds themselves up to high standards. We offer healthcare benefits, bottomless coffee, an all-expenses-paid development conference, and additional ongoing support for professional development. You’ll work in a financially stable but young company where your efforts will have great social, business, and technological impact.


-----------------------------------------


General Skills:



  • work directly with Development Manager to establish transparency in day to day workflow

  • take responsibility for the implementation of product plans from initial stages to launch

  • actively participate in all parts of scrum (daily standup, sprint planning, retrospective, backlog refinement, scoping, point estimates)

  • mentor junior developers, any previous instruction experience a plus

  • strong communication skills both oral and written, team player, sense of humor


Technical skills:



  • a conscientious developer, both in personality and work

  • very familiar with all parts of the Rails ecosystem (rvm, bundler, rspec, capybara, etc.)

  • be able to debug issues both in the application and in external dependencies

  • enough familiarity with CompSci concepts to participate in architecting new parts of the system, both in Rails backend and in Angular front end

  • very familiar with command line tools as well as sysadmin automation tools (capistrano, pallet, or ansible)

  • experience with systems and data security

  • desire and ability to scale a product from ideation to enterprise-scale


-----------------------------------------


Part of the selection process will be collaborative problem solving (involving one or more of coding, devops, or overall design of a feature). Shift Health is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage qualified individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Salary is commensurate with experience.

item.title: Full Stack Development Engineer at Groupon International (, )
item.description:
Groupon are seeking experienced full stack developers to work in our Dublin office to design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe. We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!


Awesome things you will be doing!


You will work on our Ruby on Rail and Node.js e-commerce platform (similar architecture to Groupon I-tier) while delivering superior mobile and desktop user experiences.


We are producing high quality cross-browser and cross-platform code as we maintain high quality and test coverage while adding new functionality. 


We certainly work in an agile environment so we would like you to research and champion new innovative open-source technologies and frameworks and because you will be an awesome candidate we know you will embrace mentoring junior developers on technical issues and modern web development best practices.


No country is the same and we, the local extensions team, know this better than most.  Most of our time we spend touching multiple code bases to provide that one feature a country can't live without.  If you're interested in touching many code bases or get bored from spending forever on the same project, this position is made for you.

We traverse the links from frontend to backend, sometimes multiple backends.  We're exposed to lots of different code bases, encountering most languages under the sun, usually in code, but sometimes in speech too.  Would you like to be a part of us?

item.title: Web Developer at Garena Online Private Limited (Singapore)
item.description:
Description:


The web developer would be someone with strong experience in web and server side technologies. This is a fast-paced position that requires a high degree of energy and focus without compromising quality.


Responsibilities:



  • Write server-side Python code as well as client-side Javascript/HTML/CSS code that powers the whole web user workflow

  • Build new features and fix bugs

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Implementation of security and data protection

  • Write high-quality, clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, source control, continuous integration, automation, design patterns, etc.)

  • Collaborate with other software engineers, product managers, user experience designer, and operations engineers to build new products with web technologies

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Technical Product Manager at Author it (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Author-it has been an industry-leading provider of content authoring tools for more than 16 years. With our focus on SaaS solutions for the Life Sciences content lifecycle, we’re growing by leaps and bounds. But we also know we can do more, better. This is where you come in.



We’re looking for a smart, detail-oriented, and technical Product or Program Manager who will contribute to the next stage of evolving Author-it products and services. You’ll work on projects that span the Product Management and Engineering organizations, including front-end development, platform/API development, and QA, with vendor management opportunities for outsource projects.



As a Technical Product manager, you’ll work closely with functional leads to dive deep and solve both customer pain points and complex SaaS challenges (performance, scale, extensibility, security, and more). Our customer-centric philosophy extends across everything we do, whether you’re defining new UI with the UX Designer or optimizing our web services API with the Software Architect.



There’s interesting and exciting work ahead, and you can be a part of it.



Key responsibilities



  • Collect, assess, and prioritize customer requirements for future versions of Author-it products and services.

  • Collaborate with platform/API developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of the Author-it Cloud service.

  • Collaborate with other PM team members to define the user experience for Author-it products and services.

  • Define the business and functional requirements for enhancements to Author-it products and services (Alternatively, write the user stories or scenarios.)

  • Create specifications and other planning artifacts for product enhancements and new features.

  • Work with developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of all solutions proposed in specifications you create.

  • Collaborate with Scrum Masters and Technical Project Managers on project management tasks related to Engineering efforts, including both in-house development and outsourced (vendor) projects.

  • Work with the Interaction Designer to validate user experience designs through both ad hoc and formal usability testing, such as “card sort” affinity exercises and A/B testing.

  • Identify sources of user/customer data, such as usage metrics and community feedback, and then analyze the data with team members to provide recommendations for improvement to new or existing product behaviors.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Austin, TX)
item.description:

item.title: Senior Full Stack Web Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Help us build the world’s best user generated gaming platform, supporting integrated desktop and mobile gameplay. We have a viral gaming directory, a massive virtual goods catalog, and an engaged social network. We also have a broad technology stack, including best-of-breed open-source components, a high-speed C# back-end, SQL and NoSQL data stores, and cloud services (both Amazon and our own proprietary cloud).


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Software Developer for dynamic startup, latest web technologies at MindLink Software (London, UK)
item.description:
You will work with our kick-ass core development team to design, develop and deliver our high-quality full-stack solutions in JavaScript and C#.


Want to build high-quality mobile applications? You will, with MindLink targeting all major mobile operating systems (iOS, Android, BlackBerry 10) we use hybrid technology (cordova) to deliver a native experience with a highly shared code base.


Excited by developing and using your own APIs? MindLink has a core RESTful API that can be used to develop integrating components - you will help shape that API and use it for fun and useful side projects. Think hooking into GitHub, JIRA or the London Underground.


Love the latest technologies? We are passionate about using the latest technologies to deliver even better applications. The latest advancements in ECMAScript and .Net are readily brought in to make code more readable, more efficient and more modern.


Want to improve your JavaScript or .Net knowledge? You can, MindLink is full of bright engineers who you will work with closely developing across the full MindLink stack.


Care deeply about performance? We do too! Whether it's improving the user experience or optimising protocols to minimise data transfer there is always a way to get a little more performance.


Want to take on the next big challenge? MindLink is making professional chat easy, elegant and powerful. Innovating what once was stale and integrating into the lives of millions of professionals in companies around the globe.


Think you have the skill, ideas and playful determination to join our team? You could be part of research and development or the fast-paced agile product release team.

item.title: Automation Test Engineer - Telecom at Gogo Business Aviation (Broomfield, CO)
item.description:
Gogo Business Aviation is the world's leading provider of airborne communications. Until recently, time spent in the cabin of a business jet meant that you were disconnected from the world circling below. That’s all changed. Airborne technology has finally caught up with the rest of the world. Simply put, voice, data and even the entire Internet can be at your disposal during flight–in the cockpit and in the cabin. Now you can use that time to return calls, answer email, download files or simply conduct a little firsthand Internet research. Using Wi-Fi or wired connections, in the U.S. or around the world.

As a key member of the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team, the Automation Test Engineer - Telecom will be responsible for quality assurance and testing of software associated with embedded Linux based data and telecommunications system products. The overall system involves proprietary software/hardware communicating via a wireless link through a satellite network to ground stations. You will be responsible for test case creation, test execution, and test automation development to verify the overall system including the application and embedded software.   

Gogo Business Aviation is committed to the development of full automation test tools and complete automated test environments as a necessity to our success. We understand that to truly scale software development in an Agile world it requires financial and resource commitment to automate regression test capability. We are creating world class automated test environments and we are looking for people that share our vision!      

Do you want to work on the latest technology with people who are experts in their field and have fun working together? 
Come on board the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team!  

How will you make a difference?



  • Verify, validate, and regression test software for features including: PBX switching systems, VoIP/SIP, wireless telecommunications protocols including data communications, and device’s graphical user interface;

  • Create test plans, test scripts and test cases for product validation and bug fixes based on system requirements;

  • Identify opportunities to introduce and implement test automation;

  • Identify and effectively troubleshoot software/network problems and implement appropriate corrections;

  • Lead test effort from early development to release of product. 

  • Occasional travel to work with contract developers will be involved. 


Gogo Business Aviation LLC is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.

item.title: Full Stack LAMP Developer at Vital Storm (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Software Engineer - PHP Developer


The person that accepts this position will be responsible for developing the internet marketing platform that drives VitalStorm forward. This technology is the centerpiece of what we provide our clients.
