The person will not only be responsible for the development of the platform but also have input on the direction we move our technology and company in the future.


About VitalStorm


VitalStorm is a growing team of creative thinkers who are passionate about driving leads through local search. Whether it is through PPC, SEO, Social Media, or Web Design, we convert Internet traffic into qualified leads via a unique process of creative design and campaign management that is tailored toward and perfectly suited for the Home Services Industry. 


Vital Storm provides a fun, high-energy, cutting-edge environment. Work environment and company culture are very important. We work hard but also want to make sure everyone enjoys their time at work as much as possible and feels like they are part of a close and engaging team.


Job Summary


The VitalStorm Metrics (Metrics) platform is a state-of-the-art marketing management and reporting system. Metrics has multiple audiences and is used by both Clients and internal Account Managers. Our clients use Metrics on a daily basis to track and manage their internet marketing campaigns.


Clients can log in to the Metrics platform and review information and reports associated with their account. The analytics reports include a merger of data from Google AdWords, Microsoft AdCenter, Marchex Call Analytics, plus additional client data.


Clients have multiple types of users that have access to different levels of information.  For example, VitalStorm Feedback is a training platform that is supported by Metrics. Client Users who are part of the training program do not necessarily have access to additional information available via Metrics.


They can only access the information that is relevant to them. In addition, Metrics is used internally by VitalStorm Account Managers to gather and merge data to aid in the account management process. In summary, VitalStorm Metrics is the focal point for our company going forward and a competitive advantage in the world of digital marketing. 


The developer that fills this position would be required to maintain the existing platform and also complete additions in the functionality of the overall system. The programming task associated with Metrics will be approximately 30% maintenance and 70% new development.


Other tasks could include:



  • Monitor changing API specifications

  • Maintain a complex application hosting environment

  • Work with and manage third party companies and may augment development

  • System testing, fault finding, and bug fixes

  • System documentation and reporting

  • Research new information and technology


This position includes competitive pay, paid time off, standard holidays, and medical benefits.  Additional perks will include new work station with multiple monitors, updated development environment, and the opportunity for continuing education.


Growth Potential


Initially this position is focused on the development of the Metric platform as described above.  However, the person that accepts this position will have the opportunity to work on and manage additional high profile client projects.  This responsibility could include leading a development/technical team.  More information concerning future growth and additional projects can be discussed during the interview process.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Systems Administrator is responsible for helping to manage an office IT infrastructure including network switches, firewalls, wireless access points, telephone systems and end user workstations. Working as part of a team with infrastructure and dev-ops engineers, the Systems Administrator will help with monitoring, troubleshooting and issue response.  Ideally, the Systems Administrator is interested in working towards a Systems Engineering or dev-ops role.



Essential Duties



  • Management of Office IT infrastructure and workstation environment

  • Oversee provisioning and configuration of new user systems and account creation

  • Work with Infrastructure and dev-ops teams on issue resolution and systems management

  • First-line responsibility for new system, end user and application issues

  • Management of local IT systems including directory services, NFS, NAS and XenServers

  • Provide desktop support and end user system and application management 

  • Participate in on-call rotation and 24x7x365 NOC

item.title: Software Testers - Manual and Automated - Central Edinburgh at Axios Systems (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
To be considered you must have the right to live and work in the UK. We cannot offer sponsorship.


Ideal Candidate


The ideal candidate for this role will have worked in an agile environment within an enterprise software organisation. They will have been responsible for all aspects of the testing discipline for agile projects e.g. elaboration of requirements, testing of stories, maintenance of regression test suites, defect tracking & progression, automated testing discipline for a large and complex system etc.


Job Description


Test Engineers are responsible for the quality of released software and documentation. The specific responsibilities include:



  • Elaborate software requirements, in conjunction with the team, to produce detailed Acceptance Criteria.

  • Provide technical expertise to influence the direction of test automation

  • Execution of both manual & automated tests to verify the quality of the software.

  • Maintenance of complex test data

  • Maintenance & execution of regression test suites.

  • Select and develop appropriate test automation tools, applying the latest techniques in test automation e.g. Behaviour Driven Development, Continuous integration

  • Analyse, plan and write generic reusable test scripts that verify the evolving business logic and user interface software continues to satisfy requirements

  • Reporting effectively on all test activities; test results, defects, test progress.

  • Tracking and managing the status of defects through to successful closure.

  • Review customer facing documentation to ensure that it correctly & concisely describes the released software.

item.title: System Administrator at Old Mission Capital, LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Old Mission Capital is seeking a well-rounded technologist with core strengths in Linux and network administration.   This System Administrator will be responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems that host proprietary trading, third-party, and open source applications.    Daily responsibilities involve effectively collaborating with our traders, developers, and other teams to meet the Firm's technology needs.

item.title: .NET freelance developer at Razorfish (Seattle, WA)
item.description: A Freelance Senior Software Engineer (.NET) is involved in the design and implementation of next generation websites. Applicants must demonstrate success and experience in each of the phases of software development; including requirements, design, coding and implementation, test and maintenance.

item.title: Chief Engineer ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Connected Safety (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:



We are developing several industry-first ADAS products. Our ADAS products combine powerful in-vehicle processing, V2X connectivity, and cloud analytics, taking advantage of Harman's strength in highly complex systems. Now we need an experienced chief engineer who can help us design our next generation products and deliver those that we have already been awarded. As the ADAS chief engineer you will directly supervise a team of systems / software engineers, and provide technical guidance to a larger cross-functional team. Your tasks at Harman will include:




  • Work with systems and software engineers to develop and document connected safety implementation requirements, from the physical to the application layer, including key vehicle interfaces.

  • Lead the technical architecture development for Connected Safety, defining the interaction between external environmental sensing, map data, V2X communications, and cloud connectivity.

  • Define / invent features that support our Connected Safety roadmap: What will it take to make cars drive themselves? We are looking for your creativity to refine our plans.

  • Lead the activity to develop a demonstrator for Connected Safety features: Proof that your ideas will work.

  • Participate in industry forums and stay current on state of the art to ensure a competitive position for Harman. We want you to be a thought leader in the industry.



Our Offer


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Software Engineer Web Developer at CommissionsInc.com (Marietta, GA)
item.description:
This is a full-time salaried position from $100k - $130k DOE.


Join the fastest Growing SaaS Real Estate Company in the US.


Ranked the #4 fastest growing company in Atlanta by the Atlanta Business Chronicle!


We've seen explosive growth in just over 3 years of operations... and we need your amazing skill set to continue to grow.


We are seeking a motivated Software Engineer to work on Back Office web applications with emphasis on .NET, AJAX and jQuery to join the Software Development team. Any accounting background is a plus!  As a Back Office Web Engineer, you will oversee the software processes that invoices millions of dollars of revenues, integrate with Google, Facebook, Bing, Yahoo APIs to help manage pay per click, and build data mining tools for sales as well as many other processes.  As head of back office you will have the opportunity to manage 1 junior engineer and build out your own team as the company grows. If you are motivated, dependable and want a position that gives you full project responsibility from start to finish, then Commissions Inc may be the right place for you to launch a successful and rewarding career!


Furthermore, you will strive to improve the infrastructure of our platform so that it yields better performance and stability for our customers.


Apply Online: http://www.commissionsinc.com/careers/applyonline.php?id=294565&extsourceid=SOBackOffice


As a Back Office Web Engineer, you will regularly be involved in full life cycle development from start to finish. You will ensure that your software meets the demands from the business in a lean, agile software development environment.


Additional responsibilities for the Back Office Web Engineer include:



  • Developing features for the software platform based on business requirements

  • Interfacing with other technology teams to resolve issues, gather requirements and support platform systems

  • Experimenting with new technologies to improve website performance and scalability

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer at New Visions for Public Schools (New York, NY)
item.description:
New Visions for Public Schools is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our CloudLab Team, whose role will be to provide technical leadership around the analysis, design,development, testing, implementation and  integration of secure REST APIs and service-oriented web applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres.  The New Visions CloudLab Team designs, builds and maintains web applications that respond to educator needs and supports school leaders in effectively integrating data and technology. This team’s work is integral to New Visions’ direct support to nearly 200 public NYC high  schools in modernizing their tech  infrastructure to improve the responsiveness and quality of operations, instruction and student support. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and affect urban schools everywhere.  We are looking for an engineer excited about public service and the prospect of joining a fun and growing team in an open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse environment. 


Essential Job Functions



  • Leadership, Vision, and Communication

  • Help lead the New Visions CloudLab in its evolution from a leading non-profit edtech laboratory to a software development operation that employs smart practices and technologies to create scalable solutions for schools around the world.

  • Play a visionary role in the design and communication of a software architecture that will leverage modern Javascript frameworks to allow the optimum blend of flexibility, security, and scale.

  • Play a leadership role on a team of four engineers in adopting continuous integration and test driven development techniques and best practices to improve the stability of both our existing and future tools.

  • Provide ongoing guidance as we explore and wrestle with the inevitable trade-offs between  scalability vs. flexibility, complexity vs. user capacity, utilities vs. out of the box solutions, etc.

  • Play, teach, and learn with us in search of the most agile and sustainable ways to organize the fun that is our work.


Software Design and Development



  • Work directly with the School Tools and Systems Development team on discovery, specification, implementation, user-feedback, and iteration of applications that gain adoption and improve schools by winning hearts and minds.

  • Collaborate with relevant New Visions staff within iterative design cycles that are coupled to data coaching and school-facing relationships that ground product development in the careful qualitative appraisal and optimization of user-experience, as well as rigorous analysis of resultant usage analytics and student performance data.

  • Develop secure REST APIs and service-oriented applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres

item.title: wanted: Senior Front End Engineer / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a boutique tech consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to a diverse client base, from Fortune 250s to startups. We focus on providing product delivery services in the areas of agile, big data, cloud, mobile / multi-screen, and web applications. We are a team of unconventional thinkers, visionaries, scientists, and entrepreneurial engineers.


Work We've Done


In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native mobile (iOS/Android with millions of downloads), mobile web, machine learning, natural language processing, Big Data (330+ TB/mo), real time bidding, real time event processing (10k events/second), wearable devices, facial recognition, augmented reality, programmatic advertising, wrangling browsers and geospatial applications.


We are technology and process agnostic, so as a team member you’ll be exposed to many different technologies. We use proven technologies, following basic architectural principles and design patterns and practice Agile Engineering in a collaborative shared repo team development setting.


Our stacks consist of Objective C, Swift, Java/Android, Java/Hadoop, PHP, Python, Scala, Groovy/Grails, Ruby/Rails, Angular, React and Erlang.  


A great plus of being a Hackeratus is that you can draw upon a broad and deep collection of best practices from our respective Practice leaders to help you grow professionally.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


As Hackerati consultants we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. Engagement teams vary in size and a typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is on-going diversity of cool new things to build.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Senior Software Development Engineer


Location: Seattle, WA



We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. We are seeking a senior software developer to join our team in Seattle to work with our core WAVE product and IP telephony code. Our ideal candidate will have protocol-level IP network development experience and a desire to work on challenging problems in a multithreaded distributed system.



You will work on the WAVE audio processing Engine, the WAVE SDKs, network modules, IP telephony, Supernode peer routing, and other sophisticated real-time two-way communications components. Our software is used by demanding organizations worldwide and we have very high quality and craftsmanship standards.



You will be responsible for creating and maintaining sophisticated low-level code and the frameworks required to test, build, and certify it. Your optimization and debugging skills will be called into play daily. Understanding of H.323, SIP, and audio CODECs will be of great value to our team. Your professionalism lets you learn quickly, adapt to changing situations, help others, and take care of the details. You communicate well and get along with other people. And your sample code is a joy to read.



Key Responsibilities:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of core WAVE components

  • Specifications, architecture, wiki pages, and other design documents

  • Creation of unit tests and test scaffolding

  • Cross-training and mentoring

  • Providing accurate estimates and meeting your scheduled commitments

  • Primarily acts as a multiplier by building systems, authoring tools, or introducing policies or patterns that raise the level of productivity of the entire organization

item.title: Senior Operations Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description: SugarCRM Operations has an immediate opening for a customer-focused information technology professional in the role of Site Reliability Engineer. Leveraging Open Source technology to deliver highly available services, our operations group provides 24/7 support in an energetic, fast paced work environment. The successful candidate will possess the focus to work through challenges to ensure customer success and the drive and autonomy to work independently.  You possess excellent written and oral communication skills, deep technical knowledge and experience in a startup environment. We're looking for someone who will be a mentor and can help define the infrastructure that powers all of our online services. You are self-motivated and have a strong commitment to quality.

item.title: QA Engineer at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The QA Engineer should be well-versed with automated PHP, Java and Javascript testing.  As a QA Engineer, you'll be responsible for coding and creating automated test frameworks for the various languages in use, as well as participating in the design and development of Automation test strategies, using GUI verification, User defined functions, Database verification, API testing, Smoke test sets and Functional test scripts.  Qualified candidates will have extensive experience with performance testing and providing reports on test results.



Key Responsibilities:




  • Learn from mentors and code review feedback



  • Focus of quality and repeatability



  • Consult with functional groups to understand and design requirements



  • Identify, escalate and tackle problems head on    



  • Strong analytical skills



  • Highly pragmatic with a focus on delivering business value



  • Willingness to openly debate the pros and cons of a technology or solution



  • Ability to context switch when required

item.title: Senior Data/Database Software Engineer at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
The “TripAdvisor for Business” (T4B) team is responsible for areas of the business where we allow travel-related business like: hotels, resorts, travel agencies, vacation rentals, and restaurants to connect with their customers and travelers around the world. We help these businesses promote themselves by generating unique and new opportunities to build their brand and grow their businesses.


T4B’s Partnerships team is responsible for projects supporting display and integration of TripAdvisor content on third party websites around the world as well as integrating third party presence on TripAdvisor. This team designs and maintains the major portals into the TripAdvisor ecosystem for our business customers.


Now that you’ve got an idea about what the T4B team does, here’s some detail about the role!


This is a fast-moving and growing team and looking for someone who is just as comfortable whipping up a web page as developing the platform that will deliver that dynamic page to millions of visitors per hour (yes, millions per hour!).


So, until Chuck Norris applies for this job…


We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer with in-depth and hands-on knowledge of PostgreSQL, Hive/Hadoop and Microsoft SQL Server which is used to deliver our content. In this role you will design API’s, build global e-commerce systems, and create analytic platforms for customers and everything else facing our business clients.

item.title: Data & Reporting Analyst for Non-Profit - Raise the bar of Afterschool Programs at Boys & Girls Harbor (New York, NY)
item.description:
Interested in making a measurable difference in the lives of children?  Join the Boys & Girls Harbor team on its mission to empower children and their families to become full, productive participants in society through education, cultural enrichment, and social services.  Boys and Girls Harbor is a leader in arts-infused education offering programming in early education, afterschool programming and performing arts.


We are seeking a dynamic Data & Reporting Analyst to deliver data driven insights to enhance the quality of our programs and services.  In this role you will serve as a data analytics and business intelligence expert by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around educational program recommendations and reporting. 


What You Will Do



  • Define and implement a new data strategy, data store, and tools to collect data for ongoing analysis

  • Interface with business users and technical teams to bridge the gap in terms of data needs and business logic understanding 

  • Develop internal and external business metrics and reports

  • Develop dashboards, visualizations and manage data requests related to key performance goals

  • Explore data and provide insights, working closely with program teams to identify opportunities to optimize revenue and growth potential

  • Be the champion for sharing data across the organization and actively present findings

item.title: Early Stage Career - Java Software Engineer at Kobalt Music Group (London, UK)
item.description:
As a graduate software engineer at Kobalt you’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle: requirement gathering, specification, development, building, testing and deployment of our in-house system and writing fast, reliable and clean code on a daily basis. Our new developers are always mentored by an existing and more experienced member of the team.


This is no small task: our system is currently responsible for sending worldwide notifications of all of our clients’ songs; and it delivers albums, singles and videos to a whole host of digital services, including iTunes, Spotify, YouTube and many others. It also licenses use of our clients work in TV, Film, Games, and Adverts. Once all of that has been done, it then has the not-so-small job of processing the millions of resulting payments through to our clients. All of this is just the tip of the iceberg, and everything that happens in our system is reflected in our industry-leading client Portal so that our clients know what’s happening.


This means that you’ll be working with core Java libraries, Swing UI, J2EE technologies and Apache/Tomcat, and testing with JUnit. You could be modifying or creating new third party integrations with AWS, PayPal, Docusign or others. Perhaps you’ll be adapting our processes for encoding, transcoding, and delivering master audio and video files. No one week will be like another as we strive to improve and innovate.


At all times you’ll be responsible for ensuring your changes move swiftly through our continuous integration processes, and liaising with other departments to improve their overall experience of our systems.

item.title: Software Engineer(s), C/C++ and Java at Rockwell Collins IMS (formerly ARINC) (Annapolis, MD)
item.description:
At Rockwell Collins, it’s our people who make the difference and are the backbone of our technologies. Employing some of the most talented, dedicated people on the planet is not by chance. People from all over the globe choose Rockwell Collins as the cornerstone of their careers, helping create and deliver communications, integration, and engineering solutions that our global customers demand so that our world keeps moving and stays connected. Join Rockwell Collins and help shape our future while creating yours.

Rockwell Collins Surface Transportation Systems in Annapolis, MD is currently seeking a motivated Software Engineer(s) with programming experience in C and Java to join our development team. The ideal candidate(s) will perform all phases of software engineering in a SCADA and train control environment. It includes requirement analysis, design, development, code / unit test and system integration, test and field installation.

Other duties will include, but are not limited to:

- Perform software development.
- Work with and extend existing components to implement client requirements.
- Participate in Requirement analysis and Design / Code reviews.
- Assist with software testing and documentation.
- Handle documentation for procedures, training and enhancements.
- Participate on project teams to adapt ARINC's AIM rail control system for new customers.

The ongoing goals for this position are as follows:

- Design new elements or changes in scope of project software.
- Maintain and enhance existing software baseline.
- Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer.
- Interact with end customer on technical issues.
- Meet schedule deadlines and remain within budget.
- Follow and enforce engineering guidelines set in software development methodology.
- Contribute to team coding standards and monitor the code base for compliance.
- Ability to interact with customers and correctly interpret their needs and requirements.
- Establishes and maintains effective professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
- Diligent Work ethic.

WE HAVE MULTIPLE OPENINGS FOR THIS POSITION.

item.title: Front End Engineer (Must live in San Francisco/Bay Area) at Collective Digital Studio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
CDS is seeking a self-motivated front end application developer who has a minimum of 3-5 years working experience as a software engineer.


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with the back end API team and Design team to implement a responsive, data-driven web front end for various applications.

  • Implementing site concepts and designs, layout, user interface, usability and overall user experience of website(s) and web enabled applications.

  • Follow-up on feedback that addresses website functionality, usability and content.

  • Design, develop, test new features, enhancements and content to website(s) and applications.

item.title: HBO Senior Software Engineer at HBO (New York, NY)
item.description:
OVERALL SUMMARY:


The Business Systems Software Engineering team at HBO enables the business workflows using creative and pragmatic technology solutions. We are a software engineering group that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Seattle.

Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as integrate third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning.

item.title: JavaScript Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer  to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


JavaScript and HTML 5 engineer to support Xbox and HTML5 clients.  This is AP work and backend analytics.This is a unique opportunity to develop video ecosystem software in JavaScript around the built-in video support in HTML5. We have influence in the web standards and are heavily involved in emerging video delivery systems. The position involves developing web-based client-side software to interface with our high-scale video back-end systems. This position is focused on creating JavaScript libraries to support a web UI built on our video ecosystem framework.


Responsibilities:



  • Follows coding standards, unit tests and integration tests

  • Communicates constantly with other server and operations teams

  • Takes ownership of the project and innovates on library API design and standards

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Web at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build out TubeMogul's next generation of elegant and responsive web interfaces. The role will require hands-on experience across the stack- from MySQL query optimization to cross-browser responsive HTML/CSS.

Candidates will be familiar with the technologies we are using but may have not necessarily had the ability to work on them in their current job setting.  That's generally OK.  However, you should have true passion for technology that is apparent through your previous work experience.  Further, the best candidates are excellent team players, as one of the benefits of working at TubeMogul is coming to work with people you can rely on. 


Responsibilities: 



  • Collaborate closely with product managers and designers to produce extraordinary user experiences

  • Design and code in PHP, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS

  • Ship new features and bug fixes every week

  • Optimize UI performance and responsiveness

  • Pro-actively look to retain TubeMogul’s edge as a world-class product

item.title: Software Engineer- iOS at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary: Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Responsibilities:


You will be responsible for the software design, implementation, and maintenance of one or more of our client platforms that include smart televisions, set top boxes, mobile phones and tablets, desktop and laptop computers, and other consumer devices.


You will have a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and know what separates mediocre user experience from great ones. Collaborating with the team, UX designers, and product management, you will create an innovative UI experience optimized for your platforms.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mission: Dramatically improve human health and quality of life by developing and applying advanced computational methods that transform the way compounds and materials are designed.


What we do:We develop a software platform for drug researchers, replacing labor-intensive procedures in favor of automation. Our platform gives access to an unparalleled combination of collaboration, data access, and computational modeling tools that speed up the drug discovery process. This technology allows scientists to run virtual experiments on massive compute grids and to analyze the resulting large dataset efficiently as a team.


Who we are: We are a community of passionate, friendly, and skilled team players. We are a diverse set of developers, entrepreneurs, and scientists who have made the decision to collaborate together on something with significant human impact. We take pride in our relationships with many satisfied clients, including numerous large pharmaceutical companies. Our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


The position: As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger, you will design and develop scalable methods of building, deploying, and supporting our enterprise application services and systems across various machine infrastructures (primarily Amazon AWS). These are industry-transforming systems that our users (drug researchers) depend on daily to move their projects forward.


The position is one that draws on technical skills stemming from development operations, systems engineering, as well as systems administration. You will leverage these existing technical strengths to understand our existing infrastructure while being given the freedom to innovate major improvements to meet changing needs. This role is primarily an engineering one that does not require experience in the physical sciences (chemistry, biology, or physics).


Responsibilities:


Architect and implement the infrastructure for building, testing, deploying, tuning, and troubleshooting our engineering team’s production and development systems


Advise the development team on best practices throughout the design process of their applications, to ensure that they can be delivered to manageable and highly available production environments


Communicate frequently with stakeholders to prioritize infrastructure enhancements by DevOps team


Design and manage our monitoring/alerting systems


Organize and participate in the on-call schedule process for our operations team


Requirements3+ years of relevant work experience: DevOps/Infrastructure, Test Automation, Systems Administration, and/or Development


Experience working with modern infrastructure operations and automation tools:


server virtualization (e.g. Amazon AWS, Xen, Rackspace, VMWare)


cluster configuration (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt)


continuous integration and testing (e.g. Jenkins, Hudson, BuildBot)


Proficient knowledge of and passion for the UNIX operating system:process limits, devices


networking / http


system administration and bash


we primarily use Ubuntu/Debian, Centos/Red Hat


Experience solving security problems:


certificate management, network/firewall configuration, encryption


Experience working with Monitoring and Alerting Tools:e.g. Datadog, Nagios, Zenoss


Experience with a modern scripting language:


e.g. Python, Ruby


Experience with the deployment and maintenance of databases:e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB


Experience with source control


e.g. GIT, SVN


Proficient interpersonal skills (oral/verbal communication), complemented by an ability to collaborate in a team environment


Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems and a willingness to learn


Ability to ask smart questions, think outside the box, and be creative


Pluses:


Bachelors in CS/Engineering/related field


Experience deploying distributed web applications:


e.g. Apache, Nginx, NFS, LDAP


Experience working with containerization (e.g. Docker, Vagrant, LXC)


Advanced DBA skills


Experience with maintaining databases and database replicationScience minor or independent interest (chemistry, physics, biology, or related)


Check out the website for our platform here: https://www.schrodinger.com/livedesign/



We are prepared to offer a highly competitive compensation package for an exceptionally well-qualified candidate. Benefits include medical, dental, 401(k), flexible spending account, 3+ weeks vacation, and tuition reimbursement.

item.title: Software Engineer -Voice Guidance,Text-to-Speech(TTS) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities create Location Based Services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Navigation team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in voice package development. The Navigation team offers a unique chance of developing voice guidance features for cutting edge turn-by-turn navigation products used on automotive, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


You will be responsible for creating high quality voice directions for navigation systems used in over 40 different countries/languages.


 The responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
 


  • Design, development and maintenance of voice directions software for turn-by-turn navigation products

  • Development of tests and test automation tools for the voice directions software and related content.

  • Being accountable for the quality assessment of the software both functionally and non-functionally.

  • Ensure proper deployment of the software to test and public servers

  • Integration of delivered technologies in the voice software

  • Coordination of  activities with project and product management

  • Documentation of developed code, tools and test environments

  • Coordination of new feature implementation with other teams

item.title: DevOps Engineer - AWS, Cloudera, Hadoop... at Chartboost (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We deal with an extraordinary amount of traffic, our platform encompasses everything from API calls to servicing a real-time dashboard to delivering ads to mobile games. 


We are looking for someone with energy to take our mission-critical infrastructure to the next level. This includes provisioning, load balancing, service hosting and uptime, monitoring, alerting and everything else. 


You are looking for the opportunity to work in a complex, high traffic system and be given the freedom to create this system the “right way”.  We really want this role to “own” this side of our platform and build and be responsible for making our platform awesome and reliable.

item.title: Software Engineer Python Specialist Job Ref 19 at First Light Fusion Ltd (Begbroke, UK)
item.description:
Vacancy Specification


First Light Fusion is seeking a Python engineer to join our cutting-edge numerical team that is developing a set of tools for the prediction and analysis of inertial confinement fusion. We have built a multiple-fluid compressible flow solver from the ground-up that brings together heavily templated C++ for performance and Python for user interaction.


Our toolset makes extensive use of third party libraries such as CGAL (www.cgal.org), OpenVDB (www.openvdb.org), VTK (www.vtk.org), and boost::python for wrapping. Work is coordinated through github and organised through agile best practices, including test driven development where appropriate. The successful candidate will engage with the existing technical program, while also providing leadership for the Python components of development, including architectural decisions.


Additionally, we continue to develop a library of Python code to process in-house experimental data. The successful candidate will contribute to the architecture and quality-control of the diagnostic tools in this ever expanding code base. It is anticipated that this stream of work will involve significant time in close collaboration with the experimental team, for example engaging in pair programming.


Benefits


A competitive package, opportunity to participate in the company’s share option scheme, and relocation expenses.


How to apply


Please upload a covering letter / supporting statement and CV to www.firstlightfusion.com/careers quoting the job reference. We will commence interviewing candidates on 30th September 2015 and the post will remain open until filled. Two referees should be available on request.


Informal enquiries may also be addressed to careers@firstlightfusion.com. 


CVs sent by recruitment agencies will not be read, and in the event that the company receives a CV from both the direct applicant and a recruitment agency the CV will be treated as a direct application by the individual only. Unsolicited contact from Recruitment agencies will be disregarded. 


We are an equal opportunities employer. This role will be subject to background checks.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Software touches every corner of our company, enabling us to continually improve every process by controlling the tools that run them. In addition to our internal tools that control the manufacturing, testing, operating and optimizing the satellites we also run a massive data processing pipeline that crunches terabytes of imagery (and will soon do that every single day). We run a cloud-first, API-driven architecture. Our goal is to enable everyone in the world to access our imagery, so huge web-scalability is a requirement. Our ‘full stack’ runs from the spacecraft to our web tools, and there are enough hard and interesting problems to keep many teams busy for a long time to come.


Our Backend Software engineers currently code primarily in C and Python. We run tens of thousands of jobs per day on an AWS infrastructure with PostgreSQL, Flask and ElasticSearch.  Our applications are built on a foundation of open source projects. We work to be active contributors of those projects and dedicated stewards of new open source image processing and infrastructure projects.

item.title: RHEL Engineer- Platform Services- $216K at Crossover (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
As the Engineer for Platform Services you will provide technical engineering and implementation services for the planning, design, integration, and testing of Enterprise Cross-Domain Services (ECDS) on RHEL platform. You will interface with the client in the design process to translate security and business requirements into technical designs. You will also Coordinate designs with enterprise architects, service consumers, and certification and accreditation authorities.


Key Responsibilities


· Install, configure, and maintain RHEL systems to support business processing requirements.


· Provide top level technical support, assist in the evaluation of new products and services, and may manage vendor SLA.


· Networking and storage-related switching, routing. Configuring static routes, packet filtering, and network address translation.


· Implement, design, and manage complex Virtual and physical RHEL server infrastructures. SME in provisioning Servers, Various hypervisors and management platforms (vSphere/vCenter, VCAC).


· Implement and maintain system management software, as well as research, analyze, and implement software patches and Hardware modifications to resolve deficiencies. Setting kernel runtime parameters & Shell scripting for automation.


· Perform capacity and resource planning by assessing risks and developing contingency plans.


· Maintain production change control schedule and, when needed, assist in the change control.


· Support and schedule operating systems installations and upgrades, as well as layered software packages, in accordance with established IT policies and procedures. Software automation, Puppet preferred.


· Assist with the configuration and maintenance of physical and logical components.


· Monitor, analyze, and tune the technical system to achieve optimal performance levels.


· Ensure compliance with established standards, policies, and configuration guidelines.


· Develop and maintain a comprehensive technical system configuration and database library of all supporting documentation.


· Develops business cases and gains basic understanding of project and operational budgeting.


· Assists development team with modeling, physical design and application tuning.


· Assists in the recommendation of strategies for data center and infrastructure management from business continuity, DRP, monitoring, storage, security.


· Routinely audits hardware and software to ensure compliance with established standards, policies, procedures, and configuration guidelines.


· Implements and use backup and restore techniques.


· Mentors less experienced administrators on an ongoing and often formal basis.


· Solid knowledge and experience with Red Hat (RHEL) OS (4x, 5x, 6x) and application delivery/packaging solutions, including


· RPM consolidation, critical patch management using Satellite, Kernel tuning and Shell scripting (bash, perl).


· Experience with VMware, SRM, console management, and virtualization system backup capabilities.

item.title: Enterprise Support Engineer at Unity Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Unity’s Technical Support team is at the front line of the company; we solve the problems that other people can’t solve, and we look good while doing it. Our customers have crazy tight schedules and high expectations, and our developer relations engineers are up to the challenge in providing rapid, accurate, and personable assistance. As a member of the specialized Enterprise Support team, you will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our very-highest-profile customer productions.


Travel is a must, and it certainly won’t hurt to have a passion for solving intractable, never-before-seen problems on a daily basis.

item.title: Senior Windows Engineer at SANS Institute (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description: Senior Windows Engineer responsibilities will be focused on the installation, maintenance and monitoring of SANS critical computing infrastructure, including our Learning Management System, Active Directory/IDP, and other Windows OS and Linux-based OS-based server systems. In addition, the position will be responsible for continually monitoring and adjusting the performance of our learning management systems and other business critical systems, identifying system performance issues, and making recommendations on hardware or software modifications to optimize system performance.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of RESTful web services, written in Java and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as Spring, Camel, JUnit, Mockito. In addition, experience of Swagger, Apigee-127 and Node.js will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including SQS, DynamoDB and Lambda will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA and our colleagues in User Experience & Design.


As we receive high levels of traffic, you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and scalability of Notifications services meets the demands of our audience.

item.title: Lead Engineer Mobile (iOS) at INRIX (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
ParkMe, recently acquired by INRIX, is a global automotive SaaS and DaaS company that helps drivers find, compare, and pay for parking. INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics, serving more than 400 blue-chip customers in more than 42 countries around the world. Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.


Not only are we working on a relevant problem which helps real people save money and reduce stress every day, ParkMe is also an awesome place to work. We're located in the heart of Santa Monica, and follow the work-hard play-hard ethos: flexible work hours, dog-friendly office, monthly outings, Friday lunches, etc.


Description:


We're looking for a developer who can take our already successful IOS and Android apps to the next level. You'll be leading a team of two offshore engineers. The job is a mixture of development, architecture, design, test writing, code review, and defining best practices. 


Our space is a challenging one: parking. We deal with massive data-sets and mapping algorithms that need to have both pinpoint accuracy and aesthetic appeal, while still being easy, simple, and intuitive to use.


UI is important, Performance is important, Reliability is important. If these are things you have the skills and experience to provide, then we can make sure you are important. Compensation, Location, Benefits, etc. and a chance to work on something that makes people's lives easier every day. ParkMe is a company like no other, and we need a unique, talented individual to fill this spot.


Requirements:



  • 3+ Years of industry experience

  • 2+ Years experience with Objective-C and the IOS SDK

  • Non-trivial background developing in 1 or more *other* programming languages


Ideal Candidate should also look forward to:



  • Experience with both iOS (SWIFT and Objective C) and Android

  • Managing and caching large datasets on a mobile device

  • Experience with Maps/Navigation or Commerce

  • Distributing a mobile codebase in SDK form

  • Unit-, Automated UI-, and Integration-Testing

  • Significant git experience

  • Presence in the local tech community (going to Meetups, conferences, etc.)

  • We offer competitive benefits, unlimited PTO and vacation days, and did we mention we are building an awesome product with millions of users? We are solving a serious problem that could help the lives of people all over the world!  Come join us.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at Minted (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About Minted:


Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. 


About the Role:


Minted is seeking a talented principal software developer with a strong vision who is looking for the opportunity to express that vision across Minted.  You’ll help design and implement a top tier 1 ecommerce platform, helping it scale 100x beyond its current load. You will develop your vision and teach our talented engineering team how to build it while enabling independent artist all over the world to bring their talent to consumers.


Specific Responsibilities:




  • Create strong object oriented designs, both for module and service level interactions




  • Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, cross-functional projects.




  • Consistently create clean code and teach best practices to junior engineers




  • Dive deep understanding our complex eCommerce systems to derive root causes and propose fundamental changes




  • Design both large and small changes to existing software, and decide which is needed




  • This is a startup!  You will get lots of opportunity to show off your design skills in a large and complex environment with great growth potential




  • Find operational problems through dashboards and alarming.




  • Prove success of projects with metrics and reporting




  • Work with a minimum of technical supervision and supplemental engineering support, while responding efficiently to multiple program priorities




  • Effectively research and benchmark Minted’s technology against other competing systems in the industry




  • Contribute intellectual property through patents.

item.title: Software Engineer at Silicis Technologies Inc (Westfield, IN)
item.description:
As a key member of the Silicis team, you will be responsible for development, execution and measurement of Silicis’ software. You will also be responsible for the continued integration and modification of existing software to improve performance and meet new platform requirements. The ideal candidate is a versatile developer who can translate design solutions to the highest quality standard C#, WPF, and C embedded software, and has an eye for detail that allows them to own the final quality assurance of their solutions. The applicant must demonstrate a strong interest in application development, the development process, and a curiosity and excitement for new software technologies and techniques. This position will also work closely with other disciplines as needed in a team environment that includes other electrical, software, mechanical, and aeronautical experts all working toward the success of Silicis’ platform.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in C# for robotic platform and ground control applications

  • Work closely with Electrical Engineers on electronics & low level system interaction

  • Participate in software, electronics and systems design requirements/reviews for identification of metrics, system risk and reliability analysis

  • Coordinate software system installation during final assembly and verify system functionality to ensure specifications are met

  • Maintain standards compliance

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality for internal use and field training manuals

  • Perform multidisciplinary tasks in order to meet design/delivery requirements & timelines

  • Full lifecycle application development

item.title: Developer Relations Engineer at Unity Technologies (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Unity’s Technical Support team is at the front line of the company; we solve the problems that other people can’t solve, and we look good while doing it. Our customers have crazy tight schedules and high expectations, and our developer relations engineers are up to the challenge in providing rapid, accurate, and personable assistance. As a member of the specialized Enterprise Support team, you will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our very-highest-profile customer productions.


Travel is a must, and it certainly won’t hurt to have a passion for solving intractable, never-before-seen problems on a daily basis. 


**Also hiring in San Francisco, Austin and Montreal

item.title: DevOps Engineer / Sys Admin at Growing Mobile App Company at Eventbase Technology Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Eventbase Technology and our sister company, Intergalactic Agency, are looking for a DevOps Engineer / Sys Admin to facilitate the development, deployment and support of our fantastic products and services.


Eventbase is a rapidly growing mobile technology company with a global client base. We power official apps for high profile brands, including three Olympic Games, SXSW, Disney, Sundance Film Festival and Comic-Con. Intergalactic is a digital agency specializing in mobile, web, interactive installations, UX and visualization with clients including BC Liquor Stores, Oracle, BMW, Trump and other global brands.


You, as an expert in your field, live and breath the tri-factor of system administration, development and  deployment. Maintaining enterprise level uptime is your bread and butter. Bringing a wealth of history and experience, you know how to develop and maintain fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable and portable systems.


As someone who is always on top of new developments in your field, you bring the perfect mix of tried-and-testing and cutting-edge tools and procedures.


Primary activities:      



  • Oversee and maintain Eventbase and Intergalactic’s server architecture

  • Full-life-cycle (design/implementation/support) of solutions for web stacks

  • Plan for scalability, redundancy, monitoring, and graceful failover

  • Assist in troubleshooting of web application performance issues

  • Assist and triage issues with the web development team

  • Mentor other team members to cross-train and share knowledge; deploy tools and workflows to permit the wider team to support operations

  • Lead DevOps efforts, including automating deployment & maintenance tasks

  • Perform installations/patching of operating system, software installation, and system backups / data recovery


Technologies:


Stack: Unix / Linux in its various forms, MySQL, LAMP, HAProxy, Apache, Varnish, Redis


Cloud PASS Providers: Rackspace, AWS, Azure


Scripting & languages: Any combination of Bash, Perl, Ruby, Python, PHP


ToolChain:  Ansible, Vagrant, ELK etc


Containerization: Docker, Rkt, CoreOS, Consul (all nice to have)

item.title: Senior Software Development Manager at SonoSim, Inc (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Job Description – Senior Software Development Manager


SonoSim, Inc., a start-up company, is seeking a Senior Software Development Manager to lead the technical team in scaling our product suite, company, and team. This candidate should be a self-motivated individual with strong leadership skills seeking to work in a high energy, team-oriented and friendly environment. This position reports directly to the CEO.


Job Description



  • Provide technical project management and leadership in the overall production of a high-quality ultrasound training client-server application using Agile/Scrum methodologies. This software-based product incorporates some hardware elements.

  • Manage a collaborative team of software engineers, QA analysts, and system administrators to deliver a high-quality ultrasound training simulation product.

  • Responsible for the technical production schedule and the implementation of evolving business requirements and feature sets into working product.

  • Produce iterative releases every 2 weeks as part of our Scrum methodology.

  • Liaison between Executive Management and Development Team.

  • Grow and scale technical team as company expands.

  • Collaborate with Director of Operations on Product Fulfillment, including management of Release Versioning Software, Activation Files, Software Updates and Upgrades, Server Management and Data Transfer.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

  • Oversee continual improvement of the code base through targeted refactoring, working unit tests, and any necessary design documentation.

  • Employ Quality Assurance best practices and standards defining, collecting, and interpreting metrics and diagrams.

  • Participate in regular status reviews with all stakeholders

item.title: Database Specialist Programmer at 21st Century Oncology (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
21st Century Oncology is a leading developer and operator of radiation therapy centers, medical oncology, and multi-specialty practices throughout the US.  Our centers, which are freestanding and hospital based, provide a full spectrum of radiation therapy services and medical oncology treatment to cancer patients, and multi specialty care to patients in the areas of Urology, Gynecology and medical specialties.  We are growing and need highly qualified candidates to join our team.



We are seeking a Database Specialist Programmer to support our growing Clinical IT Team in Fort Myers, FL.  He/she will perform a variety of programming assignments requiring knowledge of established programming procedures and data processing requirements.


Responsibilities will include developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using .Net Windows C#, .Net Web C# application, Java and Javascript; also backend tier developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using MS PL/SQL and Stored Procedures.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  1. Code, test and troubleshoot programs utilizing the appropriate hardware, database, and programming technology.

  2. Learn all databases running in the company environment and develop queries to retrieve data and to store data to produce custom reports with valuable medical and business information.

  3. Maintain and modify programs new and existing applications; make approved changes by amending flow charts and documentation, develop detailed programming logic, and coding changes.

  4. Evaluate interrelationships between programs such as whether a contemplated change in one part of a program would cause unwanted results in a related part.

  5. Analyze performance of programs and take action to correct deficiencies based on consultation with users and approval of supervisor.

  6. Confer with users to gain understanding of needed changes or modifications of existing programs. Resolve questions of program intent, data input, output requirements, and inclusion of internal checks and controls.

  7. Write and maintain programming documentation.

  8. Analyze client/server and micro-computer based software solutions compatibility with company requirements.

  9. Maintain confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored or accessed.

  10. Document programming problems and resolutions for future support reference.

  11. Design, develop and maintain database applications.

  12. Write SQL statements and stored procedures

  13. Learn and maintain interfaces with vendor  representatives to resolve problems.

  14. Design, develop and maintain interfaces using HL7 protocol (Mirth Corp appliance)

  15. Assist other team members doing support work to new/existing application.

  16. Other duties as assigned.

item.title: Principal Architect - Java at Automatic Data Processing (Roseland, NJ)
item.description:
The Principal Application Architect is responsible for the software architecture, design, development, and maintenance of software services and web based application software products, mobile, internal and 3rd party integrations for our ADP Reporting product. The ADP Reporting team is focused on building a cutting edge reporting product with a simple mission -- make it beautiful, performant, simple and useful. The product will include a simple drag and drop interface, report preview, a library of categorized fields/reports and will extend to the manager persona. The reporting solution will be tightly integrated with the Analytics solution to enhance the user reporting experience while also providing insightful information combining transactions data with predictive analytics, benchmarks and mash-up data so users can make intelligent business decisions.



We are seeking candidates with a desire to get involved with a product through its infancy and help contribute to its success. The right candidate will not only have strong technical skills but also possess the leadership skills needed to mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) while meeting their own deliverables. We seek someone who is continually looking to grow, technically, as our architecture stack continues to evolve to meet the changing demands of our clients and growing user base.


The successful candidate must have at least 10+ years of hands-on experience in distributed Object Oriented programming skills. The ability to take charge of defining and implementing practical software solutions that can adjust to rapid changing business needs is a must. Strong written and oral communication skills coupled with the ability to work with all levels of IT management are required. You will also be called upon frequently to be a contributing member of an agile development team or to lead a specific project. The candidate must have a natural bias toward test-driven software development in a rapid software release cycle.


The ability to provide technical strategic thinking along with day-to-day hands-on software implementation in project work represents the challenges of this position.


Main Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Deliver quality software releases on schedule in an Agile environment

  • Develop new customizations and enhancements

  • Support and maintain existing functionality

  • Be the escalation point for production software issues for technical guidance

  • Develop Technical Designs

  • Oversee Unit Testing, test automation, and Source Control

  • Self --Starter, able to work independently or within a multi-faceted team

  • Participate in Requirements definition

  • May lead other developers

  • Demonstrate prototypes and/or released application software to an audience

  • Successfully navigate both the business and developer audience in solution development

  • Highly skilled communicator across multiple disciplines and with Internal and External customers.

  • A natural bias for action.

  • Team player and influencing skills

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at HealthCare.com (New York, NY)
item.description:
HealthCare.com (corporate name is Healthcare, Inc.) is comprised of an experienced team of entrepreneurs, engineers, online marketers, product developers, data scientists and healthcare experts. We were founded in 2014, and formed with the mission of building a world-class web application (and eventually mobile) to help our users to become better healthcare consumers.  As the Senior Front-End Developer, you will: 



  1. Be involved in the strategic parts of the UX process


  2. Work closely with UX and UI designers, project managers and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to web development problems


  3. Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do


  4. Implement responsive, adaptive and mobile websites that are flexible to the many different devices and browsers


  5. Manage his/her own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team


  6. Launch, iterate and make a difference. Provide front-end coding expertise, and be ready to make our products better for our users

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Rhapsody International/Napster (Seattle, WA.) (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Rhapsody is experiencing significant growth in subscribers, expanding internationally, and is always looking to bring in top talent. We have start-up feel with the security of a strong revenue stream. With more than 3 million paying subscribers and over 32 million songs, Rhapsody is leading the digital music service revolution in the US (and soon globally).  We make it possible for fans to listen to any song, anytime and anywhere.


About The Role:  
In this role you will focus on development of Java-based middle tier and back-end services. The Platform Services team within Rhapsody International is responsible for the creation, delivery and support of back-end systems such as user profile services, ecommerce services and music data services. The team consists of technical architects, developers, test engineers, business & technical analysts, program/project managers, headquartered in Seattle, Washington.


As our new Senior Software Development Engineer you'll be responsible for development of major areas of functionality. You hold yourself to high standards and strive to bring out the best in others .


Perks:


We are very proud of the culture that we have built at Rhapsody.  Below is a snapshot of some of our benefits and perks, but what you will be most blown away by is the amazing talent you will get to work with here.



  • Benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance

  • Free Rhapsody Premium Account (with great music discovery advice from your peers)

  • Brand new state of the art office in downtown Seattle’s Columbia Tower

  • Centrally located near public transportation,  ferries, bike parking, as well as subsidized commuting options.

  • Highly collaborative, hardworking, open environment where you’ll work alongside extremely creative and dedicated people.

  • One of the most generous paid time-off packages in the industry and you are encouraged to use it

  • In-house private music concerts on the incredible Rhapsody Stage

  • Brown bag Lunch & Learn sessions

  • Sponsored off-site company events.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification.  They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.  All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.  Rhapsody International Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Amazon Echo - Software Development Manager at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Interested in Machine Learning? How about Amazon Echo? We’re building the machine learning platform behind Amazon Echo and other Amazon products and services. We’re working hard, having fun, making history; come join us!



As the Manager of Software Development, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of distributed workflow systems and machine learning infrastructure systems. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing distributed systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. You will be helping to hire and build your team and systems, and will own defining the road map for your group.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the over-all systems development life cycle

  • Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments; Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment

  • Management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring, and enhancing and maintaining a best-of-class engineering team

  • Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management

  • Customer engagement and product road map definition.




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.)

  • The key requirement for this position is established skill designing and developing solutions to complex problems in a distributed systems environment.

  • Strong technical credentials, with at least 8 years experience managing software development teams, ideally with some hands-on architectural or distributed systems experience

  • Mastery of the tools of the trade, including familiarity with modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Objective C) and open-source technologies (Apache, Hadoop)

  • A strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional, projects

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences

  • A track record of communicating well with executives and non-technical leaders




  • MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.

  • Experience with big data solutions

  • Knowledge of ML fundamentals


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile iOS Android at MAG Technologies (Dallas, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
MAG Technologies is a well funded startup, and the developer of a secure chat mobile app. Our app has a strong focus on privacy, user choice, and beautiful, usable interfaces. The positions are for self-starting senior developers who can take ownership of project components and deliver long-lasting, maintainable, extensible, and optimized code. Given the app is a messaging app, there is a server tech component as well. We are thus looking for great computer scientists with a broad expertise in object oriented software development, service oriented architecture and APIs, and an advanced expertise in Android and/or iOS. This is a unique opportunity to lead the technical evolution of an app in the prestigious mobile chat and messaging space. 


Responsibilities will include:



  • Design, Development, and Testing of newer features in the Android or the iOS version of the app

  • Fixing bugs and maintaining code - all the while ensuring we follow industry best-practices and design patterns, and ensure the most efficient use of computing and storage resources

  • Collaborating with other engineers on the project

  • Researching, exploring, and executing newer, better approaches to solving our software development and maintenance challenges

  • Participating in some user testing, as well as receiving feedback on app usability, and improving the app based on such feedback

  • Interfacing with XMPP server, and possibly coding a bit on the server side as well

  • Using many modern APIs, SDKs, and tools, and learning new tools as needed


Remote applicants: Only those within a 3 hour drive from downtown Dallas, TX, please.


What else to expect?



  • Walking meetings

  • Top notch equipment

  • Being surrounded by startup enthusiasts, and highly qualified software engineers both within and outside the company

  • Awesome Dallas high-rise views

  • Flexible work schedules, as long as goals met

item.title: Senior IT Ops Engineer - Python - Tomcat - TCP/IP - Linux at ING (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Nederland)
item.description:
Senior IT Ops engineer Global Commercial Banking Portal


ING is looking for a (mid-senior level) IT Ops/System Engineer within Global Digital Channels domain of Commercial Banking.


If you want to work at a place where you are in charge of the correct operation of systems impacting tens of thousands of our commercial banking customers, where investing in the automation of provisioning and monitoring never stops, and where we are building a team of top-notch Ops engineers that can take on the challenges of running one of the most important internet-facing applications of one of the largest European Banks, please read on.


Work description


As a Mid-Senior Ops Engineer you look after the availability, reliability of our main Internet-facing commercial banking system—Global Commercial Banking (CB) Portal. The Global CB Portal covers the whole range of ING’s Commercial Banking products and offers the whole spectrum of Commercial Banking products: payments & cash management, FM, Lending, etc. The portal is accessible via web as well as mobile and tablet devices (with native apps for iOS and Android). The impact of what you are responsible for is huge. The field evolves fast and staying up-to-date and exercising technical leadership to help the organization stay at the forefront is of paramount importance. You will focus on strengthening the monitoring and automated delivery of our software to meet the challenges posed by the growth in the number of users of CB Portal. Some of the main responsibilities are listed below, we expect you to be able to cover more than half of them.



  • Monitoring and supporting the production environment and several other environments of CB Portal

  • Automating the installation and integration of different components making up CB Portal

  • Capacity management of file systems and databases used

  • Owning backup/restore and disaster recovery processes

  • Ability to analyze DB performance and make necessary performance tuning suggestions
