Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet.


We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary. We only hire super stars and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:



  • An intimate understanding of Object Oriented design principles and patterns.

  • An intuitive understanding of software design/architecture and the ability to discuss and make design considerations and trade-offs.

  • A strong understanding of computer architecture concepts such as operating systems, processes, threading, memory, libraries, cloud computing, multi-core processors, etc.

  • Strong development experience with Linux server software

  • A working understanding of computer networking such as Ethernet, IP, TCP, UDP, network routing and switching, etc.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer- Bucharest or Prague at Anritsu (Praha, eská republika)
item.description:
Anritsu has been a major player in the information and communication field for 120 years. Anritsu’s Multi-Dimensional Assurance Solution provides Communications Service Providers with unrivalled visibility of network and service performance that enables optimization of the customer experience, understanding of how customers use data services and understanding the impact problems have on customers.


This is an exciting opportunity for you to join the international development team in Romania or the Czech Republic.


As a Software Engineer you will be responsible for the design, implementation, testing, maintenance, and support of software components for the Anritsu product range. You will be developing software implementations to the specified Anritsu standards and conventions.                                        


As a key member you will undertake the delivery of software design, development, maintenance and technical documentation in accordance to the management requirements, development practices and industry best practices. You will also be developing and maintaining specifications and user documentation in accordance with the relevant Anritsu methodologies. Your role will involve problem analysis, resolution, performance of quality control/Verification and Validation (V&V) activities in accordance with the relevant Anritsu methodologies.


Your input will be highly valuable to identifying continuous improvement to the relevant Anritsu methodologies. You will also be involved in software support activities which include global customer visits.

item.title: Engineering Manager at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
About Tripwire


Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!


About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow @TripwireInc on Twitter.




Job Summary


As a member of the Engineering Management team, this position will oversee a team of cross-functional engineers designing, developing and testing Tripwire’s flagship product, Tripwire Enterprise.  The value that the team delivers will sustain the product, support its large customer base and enhance the offering to meet the emerging needs of the information security market.


This position is responsible for supporting the engineering team through coaching, mentoring and adoption of strong working agreements and agile principles.  Successful candidates will have a leadership approach that empowers decision-making at all levels of the organization, focuses on removing impediments to team success, and holds individuals to high standards of craftsmanship, professionalism and execution.


This position will also provide value to the development of the organization, working to enhance engineering practices and drive continuous improvement toward efficient, innovative delivery.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at GrubHub, Inc (Chicago, IL)
item.description:

  • Ansible for task orchestration

  • Linux (CentOS, Ubuntu), Apache HTTPD, Tomcat, Flask

  • Mac, Linux or Windows. (We won’t judge you if you run Windows….much)


HOW WE THINK ABOUT WORK


We have a few favorite sayings or slogans that help us guide the way we work not just for new projects, but also as we begin to retrofit some legacy applications. Here are some sayings you’ll hear around the team. (None of these were invented at Grubhub)



  • YAGNI (You Ain’t Gonna Need It)

  • DRY (Don’t Repeat Yourself)

  • “If it moves, we track it. Sometimes we’ll draw a graph of something that isn’t moving yet, just in case it decides to make a run for it.”

  • Make it work, make it right, make it fast, make it small. In that order. An imperfect tool in production is more useful than a perfect tool still in development.

  • Try something different. If it sucks, throw it out and try again.


WHAT WE THINK ABOUT EACH OTHER


Even though the SEs are embedded in their own teams, we still work together quite a bit and have a lot of fun doing it. We have a standing happy hour meeting every week just to catch up, decompress and hang out. We share book, movie, anime and beer recommendations all the time. It really is a good group to work with.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Soft Skills



  • Someone with a passion for learning

  • Someone gutsy who isn’t afraid to try new things

  • Someone who is comfortable failing, learning and trying again

  • Someone who is data obsessed.

  • Someone with an automation mindset.

  • Someone who hates black boxes


Hard Skills



  • Linux experience

  • Proficient in a high level scripting language

  • Continuous Integration Knowledge

  • Experience with RDBMs and NoSQL implementations

  • Knowledge of distributed systems design and constraints


We’ve got a lot of challenges ahead of us and a lot of really awesome things we intend to get done. If you’re looking for a new challenge and want to join an awesome team, we’d love to hear from you. Thanks!


GrubHub Holdings Inc. is an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION employer.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Angular, Node.JS, Microservices) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA)
item.description:
Full Stack Software Engineer (Angular, Node.JS, Microservices)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives

Who We Are:


This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:


Are you a Full-Stack Software Engineer with a passion for making experiences that delight your users? Are you an expert in JavaScript, Cloud Computing, Web Services, and full-stack development with a strong desire to continually learn new technologies including Node.JS, Angular, and the like? Can you code effectively despite the threat of flying Nerf darts whizzing past your head and frequent beer runs?


As a member of the Apply Experience Team, you will have the opportunity to work on Careerbuilder’s core technology, the application path. The team has been tasked with building Careerbuilder’s next generation apply experience.


To achieve this experience we’re leveraging cutting-edge technologies, platforms, and concepts like Node.JS, Angular, Javascript, SQL/NoSQL, CSS 3, HTML 5, Microservices, and .NET.


If you’re looking for experience in a multi-language shop, working with teams across the globe, working on a mission critical product then look no further!

A Day in the Life...


* We follow Scrum and adhere to truly Lean/Agile Software development principles
* Bring your code to life using your choice of a MacBook Pro, Air, or a Windows laptop if you prefer
* Our coding philosophies align with SOLID principles and Clean Code embodies our culture
* We work in a highly collaborative merit-based environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas

item.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer at Mendix (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At this moment we are looking for very smart and fun new Cloud Infrastructure Engineers. Our Cloud team develops, deploys and maintains the global Mendix Cloud. With state-of-the art technologies and tools we build reliable and scalable systems so our customers can get their applications in production faster than ever before. 


You will work on:



  • Our world-wide Mendix Cloud that enables our customers to deploy and run their applications with one click

  • Cloud Foundry and our +open sourced+ Cloud Foundry service brokers that integrate with various AWS products (EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, Route53, ElastiCache, etc.)

  • Designing, building, shipping and maintaining Distributed Systems and Micro Services

  • Building a scalable, reliable and highly available platform on top of unreliable infrastructure

  • Our diverse software stack, containing code in Java (Spring Boot, ), Python, Go, Lua, Swagger and if you have good arguments to use it, your favorite language

  • A (clicky) keyboard of your choice

  • Everything from the front-end (a Mendix app) to low-level systems

  • Advanced configuration of NGINX, PostgreSQL and the JVM

  • Assuring all systems are always available by also being responsible for running them in production, we are a DevOps team with 3rd line on-call support duty


We should have a chat if you:



  • Have a BSc./MSc./PhD in Computer Science or related technical field

  • Have strong skills in software development and scripting paired with strong knowledge in systems and networking

  • Run *nix on your workstation

  • Are fluent in English

  • Are passionate about technology. Show us your hobby projects!

  • Have a positive, result driven, entrepreneurial spirit

  • Are proficient with Java, Python, C-sharp or other relevant modern languages. We're shifting more towards statically typed languages

  • Have experience with cloud development and technologies, especially AWS and Cloud Foundry

  • Have a deep understanding of distributed systems and their specific failure scenarios

item.title: Senior Java Software Developer with NOSQL & Cassandra Experience at BlackRock (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breadth of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise.


The Aladdin Product Group, Business Operation Systems team provides technology solutions to support investment accounting, performance measurement, cash, asset reconciliation, Derivatives & Client Reporting. The team is responsible for a suite of applications including performance calculation, client and adhoc reporting systems, reconciliation and report publication tools. We innovate incrementally and focus on high level of client service through responsiveness and accuracy.


In this role you will be designing, implementing and supporting highly available, real-time, event driven solutions across the systems infrastructure of Business Operations functions in Aladdin.



  • Involvement in full SDLC in accounting, performance measurement, reconciliation and client reporting areas

  • Engineer and implement highly available storage and distribution systems using NoSQL technologies.

  • Implement new business logic into existing financial systems and services , specifically in the client reporting and accounting infrastructure applications and databases, to meet business and customer requirements, working closely with end-users, client operations staff, and other Aladdin development teams

  • Work on service-oriented architecture projects in JavaContribute to core Aladdin® library code used by hundreds of developers across the globe

  • Provide ideas for process enhancements that will result in development projects

  • Research and analyze the suitability of relational DB, NoSQL databases, and Big Data clusters, into various projects

  • Understand and refine business and functional requirements

  • Establish relationships with operations teams and streamline existing workflows to be more efficient and operationally independent.

  • Implement enhancements and perform maintenance in existing business operations applications, working closely with the client support teams to address issues that are escalated for resolution

  • Providing support for technical and/or operational issues encountered by our partners in business operations

item.title: Engineering Manager, .NET at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Our .NET Agent team is looking for someone with a passion for building amazing software that makes developers’ lives easier. Our team needs a caring creator to help grow and support our whip-smart agent engineers. Our agent powers New Relic’s software analytics products used to monitor thousands of applications. Programming agents is fun, challenging, rewarding, and kinda crazy.  We're passionate about wowing our users with visibility they never thought possible. 


As the manager of the team you'd be focused on creating the collaborative, creative, and purpose-filled environment, which makes these innovations possible. You will provide the technical leadership to help define and deliver New Relic’s products for Microsoft .NET users around the world. For us, technical leadership includes talking directly with customers and building connections with developer communities that our customers rely on to build their web apps, as well as managing the design, scope, direction, features, and quality within our .NET Agent.


To fast track your cover letter please tell us about a time you introduced positive change to your team, and why you want to join our fun dynamic company.

item.title: Lead/Senior .NET Developer (Full Stack) at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a Lead/Senior .NET web developer to join our rapidly growing development team. This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of JavaScript and other front-end frameworks. If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint!


Responsibilities



  • Perform & lead development of complex software applications

  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Engineering Manager - Technical leader for a Music Software Company at BMAT Music Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
BMAT is an innovative and fast growing software company with a team of young and international tech/music lovers located in the sunny Barcelona.


We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has the mission of leading outstanding technical teams like R&D, IT, Software Development, among others, to guarantee the quality in our product development and services for the music industry. You will report to the Board and works closely with other functional leaders in the company, being responsible for the translation of the company strategy to the technical team, managing them with a hands-on behavior to achieve the objectives in the expected timing and quality. You will be the responsible for all of the company’s product development activities and the satisfaction of the team members.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities



  • Develop strategic planning, direction and control of product development activities.

  • Provide technical direction and guidance, as well as hands-on project management, for all product development.

  • Ensure the optimal application of technology and engineering resources to meet product development and/or customer requirements

  • Detects conflicts and risks, find solutions and report them.

  • Ensure that the product is fully and correctly defined and documented.

  • Hire, coach and direct team members to acquire necessary resources to meet scheduled commitments.

  • Represent the company managing the customers during the process of product development and maintenance.

item.title: Software Developer at U.S. News & World Report (Washington, DC)
item.description:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a full stack Software Developer with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead.  You'll get to experiment with interesting technology and see your work enter production regularly.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python or Java, and strong oral and written communication skills.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Pyramid, although we also maintain some applications in Java.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, iPad/tablet apps, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals, and other business applications.  Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Great chance to be part of a Healthcare project! at Telefonica Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We are searching for a keen problem solver, that likes to find new, better and faster ways to create and test concepts and products. He/she will be a keen learner and be up to date on most tools and programming languages in order to advise us on the best ways to prototype now and develop tomorrow.

If you have a passion for technology and a vision for driving disruptive change on a global level impacting millions of people in the world, this is your opportunity: you’ll have the chance to build up something big from the ground up with full CEO backing and the freedom to completely re-think how to tackle big problems

 You’ll have the reach and impact of a globally operating Fortune 100 company while working in small, focused teams and high-energy environments to be truly disruptive.


This position would be based in Barcelona, Spain. We are willing to support you with relocation and work permit if necessary.

You must be able to:



  • Write code that is both robust and efficient.

  • Become the point of contact, first line of support and owner of the prototypes, modules and applications you work on. This includes designing, implementing, testing and maintaining code written by you or other team members.

  • Focus on the details and the things that really matter. Writing perfect code is a must, but also it is to deliver it in time.

  • You must be able to learn new frameworks, APIs and determine the best toolkit for each requirement.

  • Share knowledge and document it with the rest of the team and our customers.

  • Work with customers and understand their needs, propose solutions according to it and quickly iterate to a solution.

  • Excel as a team worker, as you will become a key factor of the success of a multicultural team.

item.title: Quality Data Analyst at Wisconsin Hospital Association (Fitchburg, WI)
item.description: This position performs analysis of clinical, quality process and outcome measures associated with healthcare improvement projects.  Works with project staff to design and execute databases to maximize functionality and access to data and reports.  Work with Chief Quality Officer and Quality staff to develop various ad hoc reports.  Assist WHA members with understanding their data.  Develop processes to ensure the integrity of data and accuracy of reports.

item.title: Senior Program Manager - Mobile at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is seeking a talented, passionate Senior Program Manager on our Mobile team.  This is a leadership position for a results-oriented person with the ability to communicate effectively, encourage sound decision-making, and guide your team to successfully deliver on commitments. The applications and services built by the team are highly visibility within the company. 


This role is a unique opportunity to join a successful company and help grow it to the next level.  If you want to lead the delivery of a wave of inspiring new consumer applications and services that will bring millions of people greater sanity, improved communication and better productivity then this is the role for you.


Who we’re looking for:

The ideal candidate is results-oriented, collaborative, assertive, organized and is committed to delivering amazing work in a team environment. You will be responsible for delivering mobile products and services as a Product Owner of the Android mobile team.  As a Product Owner, you will work with UX, services groups and other POs to deliver on key scenarios for the next INRIX Traffic application. As a Product Owner, you will work with customers to determine needs and/or deliver custom solutions.  You will review internal processes, make continual recommendations for improvements and sets vision, values, methods, and metrics for the team.



  • You’re experienced in Android mobile app and cloud services development, and can ramp up on complex engineering challenges with ease.

  • You’re a master communicator – it is a key strength of yours and you can communicate complex problems in simple, easy-to-understand language to a variety of audiences – engineers, partners, customers, designers, salespeople and executives.

  • You’ve worked with a number of external clients before, and understand their expectations for understandable costs, regular updates on projects, etc.

  • You have deep engineering experience, and can guide the team to create the right layers between reusable app platform components and core product experience.

  • You’ve seen products get into trouble in every way imaginable, and know how to avoid these pitfalls on your future projects.

  • You’re an expert in Agile engineering process and can prepare and communicate product roadmaps that are based on weekly agile sprint delivery cycles.

  • Proven results as a Product Owner in short sprint cycles.

  • You have a history of working through ambiguity to create great products.

  • You constantly push our product forward and our team to achieve more than they thought they could.

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science (or a great reason for not having one).

  • You have managed a UX process to deliver great experiences in your projects.

  • 6+ years of relevant professional experience.

  • Prior experience as a developer is a plus.


What you’re looking for:



  • A fast paced “start-up like” environment with an Agile workflow and small, high performing teams.

  • Being part of a team where smart, passionate, and ambitious engineers, testers, and PMs both support and challenge one another.

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one else in the company has thought of yet.

  • A position where you have the chance to influence major industries that most people interact with regularly and help define the future state of the art experiences for those industries.


We also have some great perks:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast! 

  • Free car – Well not really free... but we have a couple new test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home. We pay for the gas. 

  • Free Parking & Electric Vehicle Charger onsite - We have a covered garage with enough spots to go around.

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good, or better than most companies our size.  We even pay 100% of our employees’ medical, dental, vision, and disability premiums. 

  • Lots of free food – We have free onsite snacks and drinks; Friday family style lunches, and stocked fridges with lunch items for everyday!  The food comes to you so that you write lots of good code (at least we’re honest). 

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work. 

  • Open Ended Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard, and don’t bother counting the days. 

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting.  The CEO even sends a handwritten card and gift to your child on their special day.  How many CEO’s do that?


INRIX is making a positive impact in the world:


INRIX, Inc. is the fastest growing traffic intelligence platform in the world delivering smart data and analytics to solve transportation issues worldwide. INRIX is leading efforts to leverage Big Data to reduce the economic, environmental and individual toll of gridlock. 

Today, commuting by car or public transportation can be slow, aggravating, and well… painful.  In this position you’ll have the power to keep millions up-to-date and in control of their daily schedules and commutes, just for starters.  You’ll also have the freedom to propose brand new consumer products and user scenarios in which INRIX provides value to millions of consumers multiple times a day.  This is bigger than navigation – there are whole new product categories to invent.


Are you ready to join a different kind of company?  Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Senior Software Developer .NET at AutoAlert (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Listed as one of the Fastest Growing Private Companies by the Orange County Business Journal and Winner of the Best Places to Work two years in a row, AutoAlert is the automotive industry's leading data-mining and lead generation platform providing innovative software, direct marketing and training solutions that have been implemented in over 2,300 dealerships in the United States and Canada.

What we offer:

  • Actually seeing the results of your work and not getting lost in a big company’s sea of developers!

item.title: Lead PHP Developer/Architect at Guidepoint (New York, NY)

item.title: Jobba med världsunik teknologi inom 3D kartor at Vricon Systems AB (Linköping, Sweden)
item.description:
Vricon is in an expansive phase and now we are looking for 3D developers to Vricons visual production tools for 3D maps and the team working on application development and product customization.


As a developer you will work with everything from 3D visualization, algorithms for 3D meshes for data management in GIS databases. In the team, you are jointly responsible for the final product. On Vricon development cycles are short, and you are working with large part of the code. This means you get a varied and eventful work. 


You can also get to work with application development and product adaptation to Vricons customers. A large part of this service means working with the GUI and feature development. In some cases, you can also act as technical sales support where you will be the expert on what is possible to do. Therefore it is important that you understand what the customer wants and be able to develop features along it.


Then Vricon has a number of vacancies at the moment, there are great opportunities to adapt the work to suit your experience and interests.

item.title: Principal Web Services Developer - Spring and REST at Fidelity (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
The Strategic Investments Product and Data (SIPD) Team is seeking a skilled Principal Software Engineer / Developer to play a key role designing, developing and maintaining JEE-based web applications. 
SIPD is a shared services provider of technology platforms and product solutions designed to drive successful business outcomes across many of the firm’s most critical areas of growth.  A fast-growing team of more than 900 associates located throughout the United States, China, India and Ireland, ours is a culture that is committed to innovation, supportive of continuous learning, focused on building teams and relationships and one that places a high value on maintaining an environment of trust and transparency.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Focus strong technical leadership experience to ensure software product development is delivered on time and of the highest quality.

  • Foster teamwork and a spirit of collaboration among team members and business partners while conveying a sense of urgency and responsiveness to meet business needs.

  • Contribute to or write concise and clear technical specifications based on analysis of complex business requirements

  • Drive product delivery through building innovative web services utilizing Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD), supporting your solution from Development through to Production.

  • Analyze, describe and model new and existing business and technology processes with a primary focus on how these processes manipulate and use the data

  • Coordinate multiple development work streams through integration and ensures architecture is scalable and extensible

  • Own technical delivery for OOD and development of the most complex components of the application

  • Define, maintain and support Java development environment and best practices using tool such as Stash, Maven, Jenkins,Sonar, uDeploy and other Open Source tools

  • Play a key role in resolving technical roadblocks involving multiple technologies

  • Continually improve quality of development team deliverables

  • Ensure code reviews, unit testing and integration testing is completed efficiently and effectively

  • Help coordinate the delivery of technical components across internal/external technical teams.

  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to more junior team members of the team

  • Contribute to process-improvement initiatives in an effort to maximize velocity for the product team

item.title: Sr. Java Developer at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
POSITION SUMMARY


At ADP, innovation is a core value that is now foundational to all parts of the business. Our collaborative environment is designed for collocated teams to work, live and play together focused on delivering products that solve BIG customer problems.


With ADP building a startup culture in Pasadena, we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Center is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Participate in planning, development and testing of key features

  • Perform design, code, and unit test software on a predefined schedule using technologies, techniques, and tools to ensure high quality, performance, and reliability, at varying levels of complexity.

  • Following department coding standards, write well documented programs that perform effectively and efficiently.

  • Performs system analysis and design in accordance with established procedures and policies. Provides accurate estimate of time needed to complete work.

  • Will develop test automation scripts with Selenium, Java, CA LISA, SOAPUI and other tools

  • Provides support for specification, design, testing, deployment, documentation and production.

item.title: Software Developer at U.S. News & World Report (Washington, DC)
item.description:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for an experienced Software Developer with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead.  You'll get to experiment with interesting technology and see your work enter production regularly.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as MySQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python, and strong oral and written communication skills. We are seeking someone with excellent project management skills and an interest in taking the lead on projects.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Django, although we also maintain some applications in .NET.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, data ranking products such as Best Cars and Trucks and Best Vacations, and other applications.  Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

item.title: Technical Support Lead at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


Lead the support team and build a strong feedback loop between the product development and customer support teams to ensure that customer success. Use customer feedback to improve the product, and technical feedback to improve our customer service. You will be the voice of our customers internally, bringing product feedback and technical issues to the engineering team, and using your deep understanding of our customers to influence the prioritization of product improvements.


You will also communicate product and technical updates to the customer success team, so that they can expertly resolve any issues.


The Technical Support Lead will work with internal teams including Professional Services, Quality Assurance, and Product Development as required in order to completely resolve customer issues.



Responsibilities



  • Prioritize and escalate highly impacting issues

  • Manage / coordinate critical communications

  • Ability to manage and resolve customer issues

  • Manage customers’ expectations and experience in a way that results in high customer satisfaction

  • Develop and maintain technical expertise in assigned areas of product functionality and utilize that expertise effectively to help customers / partners

  • Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency while also empowering and enabling the Customer / Partner Community

  • Research, document, and escalate cases according to procedure

  • Review support cases for technical and troubleshooting accuracy

  • Ensure client requests are acknowledged and resolved within service level agreement times

  • Provide a superior client experience by providing timely updates and problem resolution

  • Identify and document opportunities for improvement based on client suggestions

  • Work closely with Product Development and the Quality Assurance teams to move issues through the software release process

item.title: Software Engineer - Java, Scala at HBC Digital, Saks Fifth Avenue (New York, NY)
item.description:
You will work on a fairly small, cross-functional team. A typical team will consist of about four developers, a dev manager, a project manager, a product manager, one or two QA engineers, one or two front-end engineers, a business analyst, an infrastructure engineer, a data engineer, and a creative — although things can vary depending on the nature of the work at hand. The team sits together, works as a fairly autonomous unit, and owns the accountability for delivering value. Teams don’t operate in a top-down fashion; if you’re on the team, then you’re on the team, and you’re expected to be freely interacting with everyone else on the team.


Projects are run in an Agile fashion, although we do not strictly follow any one flavor. Suffice it to say that you will never have a pile of requirements flung over the wall at you, nor will you in turn fling your work over the wall to another team.  


While we do practice pairing, it’s not dogmatic. What you’ll often see is someone working through a problem for an hour or so, and then turning to the person next to them and walking them through what they’ve just done. There are times when full-on pairing makes sense, and times when it doesn’t make sense at all, but we leave that up to the developers to decide. 


We have a strong belief in the value of automated testing, so writing tests, designing for testability, and selecting good testing tools will be something that you’ll spend a significant amount of time thinking about. 


Most of the work that you’ll do will involve either adding features to one of our commerce sites, or helping to build out the platform on which they’re running. You can expect to be working with a mix of Java and Scala. If you have never worked with Scala, don’t worry, we’re perfectly happy to help you get up to speed. It’s a great language, and we’ve found that people really enjoy working with it. There is also some Clojure in our ecosystem, so you may get the chance to work with that as well. On the Scala side of things, we are heavily leveraging Akka and Play, as well.

item.title: Senior Product Development Manager at 2U, Inc. (New York, NY)

2U is a leading provider of software-based education, enabling premier universities to take their Master’s degree programs to the online space. We separate ourselves by offering well-designed and intuitive learning products that deliver the best education possible. If you decide to join us, you will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic group of Engineers, QA Analysts, and other Product Managers building and maintaining these learning products that will be used by faculty and graduate students from some of the top universities in the world.

item.title: Web App Developer: Ruby on Rails at MojoTech (Boulder, CO)

We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team in Boulder.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE.

BONUS QUALIFICATIONS.

DESIRED SKILLS & CHARACTER.

  • Up on recent movements in software development.

  • Curiosity to learn about new technologies and approaches.

  • Resourceful and self-initiating.

item.title: Media codec developer - Nizhny Novgorod/Moscow at Intel Corporation (Nizhniy Novgorod, Russia)

The position is based in one of Intel offices in Russia - either Nizhny Novgorod or Moscow.

item.title: Data Associate Refining and Chemicals at Wood Mackenzie (London, UK)
item.description:
Our expertise in the refining and chemicals sectors is driven from our unique databases, economic models and forecasts. We provide comprehensive asset and company valuations, in-depth market analysis and insight into key issues. This objective research helps companies around the world to identify, evaluate and rank growth opportunities.


Role Purpose


This role is in the EMEARC Refining and Chemicals team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the team's data from end to end; assisting Research Analysts with tasks ranging from data sourcing to building VBA/SQL solutions and the population and production of the team's research products, ensuring data integrity at all times and with a view to delivering workflow process efficiencies wherever possible.


Main Responsibilities


• Primary ownership of the team's data
• Collect and compile industry data from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources into team spreadsheets and then into the Wood Mackenzie database
• Create and maintain automated processes involving databases, spreadsheets and web sites
• Create and prepare datasets for data visualisation solutions such as Spotfire.
• Maintain data quality and integrity, revising as necessary, and maintaining audit records of base data and subsequent revision for all Refining and Chemicals teams
• Produce reports and data queries as required by the team
• Collect and compile data using feeds from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources using Kapow Software
• Contribute to the effort of synchronising all web scraping, forecasting and reporting platforms across Markets teams
• Create and maintain data links to mapping interfaces and implement edits to and maintain the currency of the regional maps where relevant
• Prepare charts and tables for publication/presentation and assist with publishing research to the Wood Mackenzie client website
• Devise and implement data gathering and storage protocols to minimise business risk and maximise operational efficiency
• Support data gathering and processing activities to support consulting engagements as appropriate
• Understand and interact with other Wood Mackenzie teams by developing relationships with wider Data and Operations Analyst community

item.title: Data Analyst / Report Developer at stratton (Port Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe data, and are you excited about the possibility of using your skills to become a key member of a fast growing Australian company? If this sounds like you, then you want to work for us.


We need a senior data analyst who can help drive the next phase of growth for our business. In this role you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing all aspects of our data-driven strategy. We have a suite of in-house developed software and access to large volumes of website data collected since the company's inception. You will closely work with all of our departments including software, marketing and sales with the view of upgrading our data reporting and analytic capabilities and advising on strategies for optimising growth within the organisation.


We are a business that defines itself through the smart and efficient use of technology. We may be a finance company, but we’re nothing like other finance companies; no stuffy old bankers, no bean-counters, and no corporate bureaucracy – just a dynamic, fast-growing business with a passion for the cutting edge. We’re successful because we disrupted our industry 12 years ago and continue to do so today - we do things differently, and our information technology team plays a critical role in our success.


Whether you have many years experience and are now looking for a new challenge or an intermediate data analyst ready to take the next step in your career, if you’re smart, driven, enjoy a challenge – and most importantly, love data – then we want to hear from you.

item.title: C# Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)

Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. #TakeBackTV

item.title: Software Engineer - Automated Trading at Optiver US LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Optiver’s Automated Trading Systems teams strive to develop the world’s best trading software. These systems must also be simple, flexible, and well-architected so they can quickly be changed to meet the dynamic needs of our traders. item.title: Java Software Engineer at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


You’ll:



  • Build, design and deliver high quality, high volume, high availability and high performance solutions in line with guidance and best practices of the department

  • Have daily liaison with the product owner, technical lead and design teams to ensure the definition, design and development of new features run smoothly.

item.title: Front End Developer at Spin Systems, Inc. (Fairfax, VA) (allows remote)

 EOE/M/F/D/V.  We participate in E-Verify

item.title: Executive Technical Director at AKQA (Shanghai, China)
item.description:
Responsible for the inspiration, innovation and continuous delivery in every idea, product and service that AKQA crafts, the Executive Technical Director is the driving force behind technical strategy. They recruit, build and coach an excellent team that is able to provide a robust framework for build, test and deployment, surpassing client expectations.


Inspired by best practice, state-of-the-art techniques and technological innovation across enterprise, consumer applications and experiences, the Executive Technical Director provides unique outlooks and solutions for our clients.


Located in Shanghai, China, as part of AKQA you will have access to world-renowned thought leadership from influential authors, athletes, artists and entrepreneurs. You will work in an environment that fosters a meritocratic culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields.

item.title: Lead Backend Engineer - Financial Process Management at Oxford Valuation Partners (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Oxford Valuation Partners is a leading financial advisory firm, specializing in Private Company Valuation, Mergers & Acquisitions, and 409a Reports. OVP works with startups and venture capital firms to provide critical business services to emerging firms raising capital, allocating options, and heading towards IPO or sale.


OVP already provides its clients with top-notch professional services. Now, we're bringing those services into the online arena, so our clients can collaborate better with our expert staff to manage and control key financial aspects of their corporations.


The world of funding, financing, and compliance is complex and challenging, and underpins much of the vibrancy in the tech sector today. This position is a good opportunity to gain exposure to this space, learn how it all works, and advance the state of the art in financial applications. 


Our application is being developed as an RoR app using Postgres. 


As a developer, you should be a strong problem solver with a focus on simplicity, performance, and security. It is your job, literally, to make sure that our clients' finances are calculated correctly and that their information is held securely. At the same time, we expect our tools to be on par with the best consumer-oriented websites in terms of utility, interface, and performance. A solid core will enable us to do that well.


This role initially entails implementing features related to equity modeling and management and user messaging. Over time, we expect you to architecting and implement components all across the application.


Our application is Ruby on Rails using PostgresQL as the data store. In keeping with modern programming standards, we're working towards an API-first, continuously integrated system.  As the lead backend developer for the project, you have a key role in making the application shine, and we expect you to be fluent with modern patterns and expectations.


You'll also be responsible for leading API integrations with complementary tools and for designing and implementing our own APIs.


The team is distributed so strong communication skills and openness to collaboration are important as well. We use Git and Slack as our primary collaboration tools.


This role is a full-time contract role. It may evolve into a staff position based on personal performance and the success of the application.

item.title: Manager, Software Development at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Amazon strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can research and purchase anything they might want online. We set big goals and are looking for people who can help us reach and exceed them. Kindle is the best-selling product in the history of Amazon.com and our team is responsible for providing the best shopping experience for all the Amazon.com devices and accessories including Kindles, Tablets, Echo, Fire T.V. and much more. We are the most innovative and fastest growing businesses at Amazon. You should be passionate about customer experience and think it’s fun to utilize, extend, and invent Amazon’s AWS technology. This critical role will continue to build on the current success by leading a software development team responsible for multiple aspects of the Devices and Accessories store. We are looking for a proven, hands on, results-oriented Software Development Manager to lead a team that will build the future experience for our customers, who are looking for the best product and accessories to meet their needs.



In this role you will be responsible for:

  • Hiring, leading, mentoring a world-class engineering team

  • Working effectively with product managers, designers, and business teams to deliver the best overall experience factoring in financial goals and usability goals

  • Working closely with engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Establishing a consistent, scalable engineering framework and excellent development processes

  • Owning and report on status of development, quality, technical operations, and system performance




  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is required.

  • Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms and programming languages, messaging and asynchronous architectures)

  • A track record of great hiring of technical team members and leaders

  • Minimum 6 years of software development experience

  • Minimum 3 years of people management experience

  • Track record of building quality software and operating services delivering high quality, performance and availability.

  • Experience working effectively across functional teams

  • Ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment

  • Ability to communicate and discuss software components in simple, general terms with business partners and in great detail with software development engineers

  • Strong sense of ownership, urgency, drive, independence, and flexibility

  • Analytical approach to problem solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement

  • Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously and proficiency at leveraging precious resources

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor




  • High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor

  • Willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done

  • Well-timed tenacity and conviction

  • Vocally self-critical

item.title: Android Developers at Babajob Services Pvt Ltd (Bengaluru, India)
item.description:
Babajob started as an experiment to help everyone – regardless of their literacy, income and computer skills – elevate their class level by finding a better job. We help households and companies like OLA, Puma and SnapDeal hire drivers, rural delivery workers, office helpers, housekeeping staff, cashiers, cooks and countless other roles in the modernizing economy of India.



Our interfaces span voice-only automated and call center systems to mobile apps and SMS/WhatsApp interactions to multilingual,  responsive sites for employers and job seekers, all with the goal of facilitating the right job seeker and employer connecting, calling each other, actually showing up for interviews and ultimately getting hired.



The last year has been awesome for us. We just crossed 3.5m users, have 100,000s of active users each month, receive 20,000 calls a day, 7x'd our revenue in the last 6 months and raised $10m from SEEK, the biggest job marketplace in the world, with the top job sites in Australia, China, Brazil, Mexico and many African countries.



In order to achieve our vision of helping 100s of millions get reliably hired, we are building iOS & Android apps for the largest aspiring job sector marketplace in India. In order to execute this with technical precision and scale, Babajob is building a team of highly talented engineers to deliver best in class mobile experiences.



What you will do



  • Take complete ownership of the mobile products you work on including but not limited to design, development, testing and delivery

  • Build a polished, well-performing application around a server API.

  • Work debugging a live app from crash logs and if needed track issues back from the client into the server code

  • Unit test for reliability and robustness.

  • Collaborate with cross functional teams in defining and delivering the roadmap for products on mobile and tablet devices

  • Conforming to industry standards for mobile application development, create internal technical documents and mentoring junior engineers


 What you should have



  • 3 Years of Native application development experience on Smartphones with expertise in Android

  • Experience using mobile platforms programming environments such as Eclipse and Android SDK

  • Experience in using testing and conformance frameworks for Android.

  • Experience using Web Services and Data parsing using XML, JSON.

  • Experience developing applications using multi-client development platforms such as PhoneGap, Titanium or similar platform is a strong plus

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent

item.title: Junior Software Engineer - Full Time - Telecommute at ClickTripz (Manhattan Beach, CA) (allows remote)

ClickTripz is a growing company serving many big-name advertisers including Expedia, Priceline, Travelocity, and Hilton, to name a few. The technological backend serves millions of advertisements per day, yielding many technical challenges. Business is growing and so is the workload. ClickTripz needs your help.


At ClickTripz, your primary responsibilities will be to



  • Integrate advertisers into the ClickTripz code-base

Secondary tasks will vary depending on your skill level, interests, and company needs. Potential projects include

  • Developing new features
