item.title: QA Engineers, Mid-Sr. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise. Most of our work is server-side. We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: Software Engineer at Maritima Dominicana (Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic)
item.description:
Maritima Dominicana is expanding quickly. We aim to provide a seamless experience for our clients and hope to serve as a bridge between the Dominican Republic and the world. We are looking for people who can work the full stack, though they prefer to focus on the user interface and experience of the app. You want people to sit in front of the app you build and understand what it is meant to do. 


All levels of experience are welcome. The degree to which you might do more or less of something would depend on this.


With that said, this is what your job will most likely look like.


Immediate needs:



  • Refactor and repackage our systems that are currently using Non-SQL databases that are inaccessible with C# and .NET.

  • At our current pace we will be done Q1 2016. We are looking to finish sooner.


What you will be assigned at first:



  • Fix something from our list of faulty UIs. Good JS chops are prized.

  • Jump onto one of our 24 applications and implement pending changes.


On-going responsibilities and longer-term projects:



  • Prepare for our 8:30 stand-ups. We do Scrumban.

  • Maintain a personal Kanban board for work assigned.

  • Ensure that the project Kanban board stays updated.

  • Packaging of our internal libraries into reusable components.

  • Lead Friday learning sessions. We know you will be learning on the job. Are you ready to teach?

  • Accommodate ongoing client-requests for integrations. We try to make the experience as seamless for our clients.

  • Forming part of our Support Center rotation. Everyone who can program helps out at the support desk. This is our way of keeping our department in sync with our business.

  • Suggest ideas and improve our systems as you see fit. If an idea is easy to build, please improve the system as soon as possible. We have a lot of warts!


You can reply to the ad or email gtk@mardom.com.

item.title: Senior Protocol Firmware Engineer at SunCulture Solar (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop products from concept, through design, manufacturing and support to end of life

  • Work with hardware teams on board bring-up

  • Interface with contract manufacturing to support diagnostics and operations

  • Interface with various hardware and software vendors on complex system integration tasks to achieve efficient, cost-effective and delightful product solutions

  • Effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams

item.title: Sr. JavaScript Developer at Move, Inc (New York, NY)
item.description:
Here at Doorsteps, we’re a small team focused on helping renters across the US find their next best place to live, building a new experience from the ground up. We also act as a think-tank within our organization, experimenting with new ideas and processes to bring to our larger group.


Our parent company Move, Inc. (Realtor.com), based in Silicon Valley, operates realtor.com and is an industry leader in the homes-for-sale space. This has given us strategic advantages in terms of listing content which we are using to build a brand new rentals experience (Rent.Doorsteps.com).


We’re looking for highly motivated engineers to join us. You’ll be exploring prototypes with our design team, designing and building new features in code, creating and consuming APIs, working with geospatial data, and pushing our rentals experience forward.


Responsibilities



  • Architect, build, and deliver production quality and scalable JavaScript.

  • Participating in a collaborative team (with product, design and other developers) including some pairing, lightning talks, mentoring, and generally helping move everyone and the product forward.

  • Comfortable taking on back end infrastructure and front end features.

  • Stay up to date on new technologies and trends to contribute to the evolution of our technology stack

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Indiegogo (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role: 
At Indiegogo, you will have the opportunity to literally change the world and people’s lives by developing new features for our consumer platform to make it even more robust. You’ll work with exceptional developers and there are lots of interesting technical challenges to tackle,including projects dealing with heavy transaction volume, scalability and data. 

You will: 
* Build a marketplace that empowers people to follow their dreams 
* Architect, design and implement beautiful, performant & scalable Ruby code 
* Create features for the international payment system which sees millions of transactions per day 
* Extend the reach of our platform APIs 
* Always staying innovative (we use Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and more) 
* Work with the latest and greatest JavaScript & front­end tools: We use Angular, Gulp, Mocha, Chai, Jasmine, Karma and more 
* Work collaboratively in a fast paced XP environment ­­ pair programming, TDD, BDD, and continuous integration

item.title: C++ Software Engineer, Mid and SR. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise.
This position is a leadership role requiring hands-on ability, deep technical expertise and the ability to influence across teams.
We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: Security Engineer at Braintree (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


At Braintree, we’re building products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. Our full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We have developer friendly APIs built to integrate with various platforms - Ruby, Python, Java, PHP, Node.js and .NET - and we also have SDKs for iOS, Android, and Windows.


Our technology fuels companies like Github, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable. Heroku and more.


We're also in a unique position to greatly impact how merchants and customers interact. The product teams at Braintree work together with Venmo, the mobile payments company we acquired in 2012. Our joint offering, Venmo Touch, gives our users one touch purchasing within apps, eliminating the need to retype your credit card number inside each app you download. Recently acquired by PayPal, we're now in an even greater position to change the way people pay.

item.title: E-commerce Software Engineer at Canada's Largest Retailer! at Loblaw Digital (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. We create leading mobile-responsive e-commerce experiences including Loblaws Click & Collect, an innovative online grocery shopping experience. We also built and now operate the award-winning site JoeFresh.com in Canada and the US, as well as the Joe Fresh iPad and iPhone apps, and we are proud to announce the launch of beautyBOUTIQUE.ca, our newest site that allows all Canadians to #bringBEAUTYhome with the click of a button.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.


We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.


Responsibilities:



  • Java Development on the hybris eCommerce platform

  • Responsive front-end development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework

  • Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript

  • Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks

  • Conduct and participate in design sessions and review design documents

  • Conduct code and architecture reviews

  • Lead and participate in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Profile eCommerce application to identify performance bottlenecks.

  • Debug and refactor code as needed to improve those performance bottlenecks.

  • Some system administration of Linux, Apache, Tomcat and Oracle environments.

  • Work with various Loblaw IT teams to design and architect integration into Loblaw IT systems.

  • Work together with external design and development agencies.


Skills & Requirements



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar

  • 3+ years of experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years experience in object oriented design and development in Java

  • 1+ years experience developing with the Spring Framework

  • Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO

  • Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling, preferably on an Oracle database

  • Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS

  • Experience with web app servers, such as JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic

  • Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git

  • Experience developing SOAP and/or REST based web services

  • Strong understanding of XML and JSON and how to manipulate using document based and stream based API’s

  • Experience working with an Agile methodology, frequent releases, automated testing, builds, deployment

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Senior Software Developer


CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its headquarters in Paris, France.


Your mission:


Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Backend Engineer - Microservices at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.

Description:


We are looking for a self-motivated, senior-level back-end web developer to assist in the design and implementation of a next-generation enterprise web application.


Responsibilities:


As a key member of a small and versatile team, you will:



  • Work in a dynamic team to develop awesome new features

  • Work with other developers, front-end designers and various Tenable teams

  • Promote great software design and quality

  • Drive innovation by coming up with new ideas for our products and processes

  • Point out issues with the existing architecture and code, and fix it up

item.title: Backend developer - Medior/Senior C# .NET at Amsterdam based startup at Neocles (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you ready to change an industry and work on software serving global players? Then join our team!


You will write server-side code (.NET C#) for web-based applications and create robust high-volume production applications. You're able to develop prototypes quickly and will work with a team of developers and product managers to ensure that engineering know-how and excellence is shared and nurtured. You have to be able to communicate your ideas clearly and concisely and work in a team well. And last but not least you "Think API".

item.title: Web App Developer: Ruby on Rails at MojoTech (Providence, RI)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team in Providence, RI.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE.



  • Professional programming experience in multiple languages, preferably developing web applications.

  • Some experience with Ruby on Rails and at least one JavaScript framework.

  • Practical knowledge of RDBMS principles.

  • You must be able to show us some code (either your own, or as part of a team), ideally with Rails.


BONUS QUALIFICATIONS.



  • Strong grasp of data-structures, algorithms, and design patterns.

  • Git gurudom.

  • Some experience with Node.js.

  • Ability to evaluate cutting-edge technologies for use in production environments.

  • Having fun with clouds (e.g. AWS).

  • Some experience with native mobile development.

  • Deep familiarity with the web’s many 4-lettered acronyms (e.g. HTTP, JSON, REST, AJAX, CORS).


DESIRED SKILLS & CHARACTER.



  • A passion for programming.

  • Up on recent movements in software development.

  • Curiosity to learn about new technologies and approaches.

  • Resourceful and self-initiating.

  • You can work independently, but you know that great software takes teamwork.

  • Detailed and organized. Ability to meet deadlines and work efficiently.

  • Big ideas over big egos. Show-offs welcome, but no “I” before “team”.

  • You write code for humans first and computers second.

  • You know the difference between software engineering and hacking, and you can do both.

  • You are passionate about code quality.

item.title: Full Stack Python Developer at Tixie (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Position:


Development Engineer; Tixie Consumer Engagement Platform 


What we are looking for:


We are seeking an experienced mid-level developer to develop the full-stack (front-end + middleware including API integration + data layer) of our new products and product iterations. You will work closely with members of our small team to develop and flesh out features and integrations. Proficiency with taking non-technical feature requirements and translating them is essential.


To be considered for this role you must have experience with Python, Django, and developing an API. For this level role it is expected that you have prior experience developing functional web apps from the ground up, applying Bootstrap or other UI frameworks, and using appropriate versioning, testing, and security practices. Some nice to haves are experience with deployments, server maintenance, and iOS development.


 This is a challenging job but also a rewarding one. Come be a part of the action!


Working Conditions



  • Ability to work out of our NW Portland office in a startup environment preferred.

  • Remote location in the US will be considered.

  • Flexible work schedule.

  • Tixie is an equal opportunity employer.


This is a full-time employee position, with competitive salary and benefits. Evening and occasional weekend hours are not a regular component of the weekly schedule, but aren’t entirely unheard of.  Interested applicants should electronically submit resume, portfolio, web links, and cover letter to jobs@tixie.com:


Compensation
Based on experience

item.title: Ruby Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Ruby developer motivated about building a variety of Ruby applications, including projects ranging from web development with Ruby on Rails, to complex groups of back-end microservices, to command line utilities and data processing scripts. Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop applications and to coordinate with the teams working on different layers of the infrastructure. Thus, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and building quality products is essential.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

  • Apply scalable application fundamental design principles as needed.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Mobile Game Developer at DoubleDown Interactive (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced mobile games developer to join our rapidly expanding games studio and lead our mobile initiative across multiple platforms. We are looking for a passionate game developer that leverages new technologies focused on creating compelling mobile games. As our lead mobile developer you will:



  • Play a lead role in the design and development of mobile games leveraging HTML5 and other mobile languages

  • Work closely with game designers, producers, artists and developers to expand our product offering into the mobile arena

  • Act as the primary interface with internal/external mobile development teams from a technical, design and production perspective driving the delivery of leading mobile game experiences

  • Maintain code quality across multiple mobile game development environments



First Year Goals:



  • Develop engaging content in JavaScript and the latest web technologies.

  • Evolve our custom cross platform game engine. 

  • Work towards optimization and best practices, increase performance of our application.

  • Make the team better – Bring your skills and experience to our team and help us take our game to the next level!

item.title: Java/Ruby Developers at Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) (Fairfax, VA)
item.description:
Java and Ruby Software Developers


Northern Virginia


Relocation assistance will be available to qualified candidates.


Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) was founded in 1993 when Betsie Miklos chose to build a better kind of software development company. Over the years, people who have come to MSI have found approachable management, a culture of integrity, and an environment of technical excellence. Together, we have become a small company with a large impact on our people and our customers and we are pleased to announce that we have just become 100% employee-owned.


MSI employees work with customers across the Federal Government to build tools vital to our nation’s security. Our engineers, developers, and testers solve problems ranging from big data analysis to automated testing, from cloud engineering to website design and development.


Our Positions



  • Most require a TS/SCI clearance with polygraph or ability to obtain a clearance.



  • Are located in Northern Virginia, at customer locations.



  • Offer access to many contract positions via multiple contract vehicles.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Enterprise Payroll at NetSuite (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled and energetic software developer who loves the challenge of working on a fast-paced team where he or she will build systems they can be proud of. The selected candidate will become a critical member of our growing software development team responsible for creating and supporting new features for NetSuite’s Enterprise Payroll solution.


More specifically, the person in this role will be expected to:



  • Attain a full understanding of the NetSuite Enterprise Payroll solution.

  • Develop high quality new features and enhancements that delight customers.

  • Fix product defects.

  • Follow established software development processes.

item.title: Director of Engineering, Programmatic TV at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead a team to build the strategic programmatic TV products for TubeMogul.  Responsibilities include leading the team to make the right design decisions for front-end user interface, microservices, real-time bidding and partner integrations. 

The ideal candidate is highly organized, action-oriented, and accomplished in the development and deployment of "Web scale" systems.  You have a pragmatic, results-oriented approach to application architecture and are excited to work on a Javascript and Java application stack.

In this role, you will be expected to acquire a deep technical understanding of the product; plan, manage, and execute a development roadmap; as well as provide mentorship to the engineers on the team.  Ideally, you are familiar with the technologies we are using but you must possess a true passion for technology that is readily apparent in your past experience and/or personal projects. This position will report to the VP of Engineering.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate closely with product management, operations, business and the executive teams to drive the execution of the product roadmap

  • Lead a team of talented engineers to build out products on the Programmatic TV roadmap

  • Drive architectural & design decisions for the full-stack product 

  • Track and manage key engineering metrics such as team velocity, quality and team morale 

  • Mentor & develop future technical and management leaders on the team

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Software Engineer - Web and Mobile Technologies at Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (Morristown, NJ)
item.description:
Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (ASCI) is a Systems Software engineering company located in Morristown, NJ. We create software products of our own design and have done so for more than 30 years!  As we continue to grow, ASCI is looking for individuals who also enjoy the Software Engineering process using Agile/SCRUM methodologies, and who are looking to use the latest software technologies and tools to advance our company goals as well as their own understanding of software systems. A passion for Software Engineering along with the ability and desire to learn are key.


Responsibilities:



  • You will be part of a Scrum Development team working on Web and Mobile products.

  • As part of that team, you will be working on both Server and Client side aspects of the product.

  • You will be working on the latest software technologies that are used to build leading edge software products.

  • Candidates must be able to work independently as well as within a group. Attention to detail, positive attitude, the ability to learn and be challenged and pride in quality and timeliness are all attributes the successful candidate will have.

item.title: Java Technical Lead / Hybris e-com project at Host Europe Group (HEG) (London, UK)
item.description:
We need talented people to own key parts of our Hybris eCommerce architecture in the digital commerce space. HEG is replacing its core ecommerce platform, moving legacy systems onto to Hybris. The first project will be working with a talented Systems Integrator and a brand new offshore team and focusing on one of our core UK brands. Other brands will then follow until we have completed 6-7 system migrations across our European business. 


We have the opportunity for a talented Technical Lead/Senior Java Software engineer with a background in web application development alongside good knowledge of the Spring Framework (MVC/IoC) to join our team in a location of your choice (Birmingham, Leeds, London, Romania, Munich or Cologne). 


You’ll be leading small teams of talented Software engineers, taking ownership for the quality of your teams coding output, managing work load vs. resource, planning sprints and managing in a manner that maintains HEG's company strategy. As a company we pride ourselves on being market leaders with a visionary approach to our products and services. As such we look to our technical teams to provide the direction, structure and support needed to achieve these goals. You will be involved in projects and products that will go on to define the direction of the web, producing robust, scalable and commercial tools, living and breathing your role and delivering above expectations.


Key Duties of the Technical Lead: 



  • You will need a genuine enthusiasm for the Hybris eCommerce platform taking a proactive interest in its features and functionality, to maximise your technical understanding. Therefore becoming the champion in your area with the ability to influence its future development within the Hybris team you’re working with

  • You will work in an Agile (scrum) and fast paced environment where you need to work closely with the business and respond to changing priorities

  • Providing technical leadership and be seen as the go-to person and the technical guru of the development team

  • You will need to direct a technical development team and think creatively to deliver technical designs for any enhancements or changes required or recommended

  • Responsible for code review

  • You will deliver code enhancements and manage the development process

  • Heavy customisation of the Hybris framework that suite the business’ needs

item.title: CTO at Freedom at Freedom (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Would you like to improve lives of millions of people with your work?
Are you interested in building software that people will truly value - and pay for?
How about working to solve one of the biggest challenges of our era: digital distraction?


If you're a highly qualified engineer who finds that these questions resonate, Freedom is hiring a CTO to help scale our 6-person, venture funded, revenue-positive company. As CTO, you will manage and accelerate development of our platform, ensure product and engineering standards across our software, and build a world-class cross-platform engineering team.


The ideal candidate for this role will have demonstrated experience managing and scaling engineering teams, including the management of remote teams. We are a consumer software company, so the candidate should be comfortable with high scalability systems, consumer quality UX, and user-centric development. Prior startup experience, and experience with technical aspects venture fundraising or M&A (software due diligence, data rooms) a plus.


We expect compensation for this position to be a mixture of cash and equity, negotiated on an individual basis. We are open to a remote arrangement, but we'll expect a remote candidate to be in our Durham offices 25% for the first year. We're open to starting the relationship on a fractional basis. Please feel free to reach out directly via LinkedIn or email to Fred Stutzman, our CEO, with questions.

item.title: PHP Developer at WSM International (Saint Clair Shores, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
WSM is an established and rapidly growing technical services and solutions company, offering unlimited career potential for talented and motivated developers. We thrive in a casual, open, friendly and collaborative environment. Our work is rewarded with very good pay and an awesome benefits plan including health, term life, short and long term disability, 401k with company match (yeah!), dental, vision and flexible PTO. This is a full-time, 40 hour/week position.


We're looking for a sharp, motivated PHP Developer. You'll create and implement a dynamic range of new web applications, and also maintain and develop a variety of existing applications. 



  • Develop in PHP, JavaScript, MySQL and HTML

  • Collaborate with team members as well as operate individually to develop complex web-based applications

  • Maintain existing codebases, to include troubleshooting bugs and adding new features

  • Gain an in-depth understanding of our customer's business goals and related system interactions

  • Work closely with others to define and clarify project plans, deliverables, expectations, scheduling and of course, functionality of applications

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Ping Identity (Denver, CO)
item.description:
As a Ping Identity SRE, you will be involved in every facet of our On-Demand SaaS services. From conceptual design of interconnected sub-systems to network design, platform testing and analysis, security policy, service troubleshooting, and application performance. Ping SREs own responsibility for application performance, monitoring, and adherence to SLAs. Everything needs to just work, all the time... and you’re the one who’s responsible. If things need to get fixed in the middle of the night, you’re the one to get it done.


Working within the DevOps Team, you’ll be expected wear many hats. From first responder to performance analysis, system architect, capacity planning and monitoring support. Our DevOps team is fully integrated and running continuous deployments daily. SREs are expected to provide input wherever possible in the product’s development, deployment and design.

Responsibilities:



  • Linux systems administration, configuration, troubleshooting and automation.

  • Experience with virtualization platforms such as VMware, Xen, KVM and public cloud resources such as AWS or Rackspace Cloud.

  • Analysis of complex system behavior, performance and application issues.

  • Development of monitoring solutions and analysis across multiple data centers.

  • Capacity analysis and planning, traffic routing, and security policies for Ping’s market leading Single Sign-On SaaS applications.

  • Develop, maintain and administration of cutting-edge infrastructure deployment tools.

  • This is a 24/7 on-call position with a rotation schedule. You’re expected to jump out of bed to fix stuff when it’s down.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer at Wunder (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
We don’t like job descriptions at Wunder. Truth be told, we don’t even like calling them jobs. That said, we need someone to join the team and help us save the world, so call this what you will...


Wunder was founded with one simple vision: to address the greatest crisis of our generation by accelerating the proliferation of renewable energy. Members of our team have raised hundreds of millions of dollars in private equity, developed energy infrastructure solutions for the Department of Energy, and built digital products used and loved by millions of people. Now, we’re saving the world.


We have an amazing opportunity for an experienced, dependable, intellectually curious, and creative Full-Stack Developer to join our fast-growing startup. Like the rest of us, this person will wear many hats; you will work closely with our partners, customers, and investors. Specifically, you will be overseeing the development of our customer-facing investment portal that will help us build a strong investor base to finance the renewable energy infrastructure of the future.


You’ll be working side-by-side with the founders, collaborating and executing to make Wunder’s vision a reality. Additionally you’ll be helping to build a top notch engineering team, chock full of talented, curious, and ambitious engineers.


If you get excited about bringing an entirely new asset class to market, building an organization aimed at saving the world, and ensuring that all of the details needed to make all of that happen are covered, then this is the role for you.

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer ( Manual Tester ) at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Summary


Software Quality Assurance manual testing professional


Professional SQA knowledge and skills with expertise across the entire software development life cycle in an Agile Scrum environment supporting all testing activities.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Time - Telecommute at ClickTripz (Manhattan Beach, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
ClickTripz is a growing company serving many big-name advertisers including Expedia, Priceline, Travelocity, and Hilton, to name a few. The technological backend serves millions of advertisements per day, yielding many technical challenges. Business is growing and so is the workload. ClickTripz needs your help.


At ClickTripz, your primary responsibilities will be to



  • Maintain our existing features


    • Bug fixes, refactoring, etc


  • Develop new features


    • Some of our on-going projects include analytics tracking, updates to our database data quality, traffic targeting, automation of tasks currently done manually, tools to further test our systems, the application of machine learning to our campaign bidding system, and new types of advertisements.


  • Update server infrastructure


    • Ensuring server deployment and maintenance runs smoothly is a moving target that we always pursue.

item.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer (Founding Team) at Avanoo (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
A bit about us


Have you ever wondered what the most successful people in the world have, that the rest of us don’t? No, it’s not a high IQ. And no, it’s not that they studied more than the rest of us at school. There are a whole host of attributes that these people embody, which are never taught in school. Things like perseverance, passion, laser-like focus, a positive mindset, and the list goes on and on.


Avanoo exists to help employees at Fortune 2000 companies embody these attributes, through 3-minute-a-day, 30-day programs designed to help change their behaviors, thereby helping them perform better at work, and at life in general.


If the skills we learn in school are the applications we use to get through life, the attributes we help people embody at Avanoo are like the operating system.


We're doing quite well


Just fresh out of 500 Startups, we’re very well funded. In addition, we already have meaningful revenue, unlike
most startups at our stage. Our client roster already boasts Kaiser, Liberty Mutual, The Vanguard Group, The City of El Paso, TX, Toyota, White Castle, etc etc.... Our revenue has grown an astounding 5x in the last 7-8 months alone.


What you'll be working on


That’s where YOU come in: Helping us sustain this incredible growth, by building out the platform. You’ll be helping us build out an enterprise-class analytics platform, which will pull data from a variety of sources, to help us track and show growth in human potential.


If being part of a team that is helping to track and improve human potential for the first time ever, then read on!

item.title: Team Leader: Software Engineering at SaleCycle (Houghton le Spring, UK)
item.description:
The web-based SaleCycle platform forms the core of our business and handles an incredible amount of data from our 500+ international clients. Leading a team of Engineers to continuously achieve business needs is a vital role; it’s not just about man-management but motivation, empowerment and inspiration – all of which you’ll provide to your team.



As a Team Leader, you will...


• Provide an environment where your team can succeed; motivating & inspiring them as a great leader
• Take up the role of Scrum Master ensuring there is mutual satisfaction for both your team and Product / Business Managers to allow delivery of high-quality products
• Continually grow your own knowledge – being the best you can be – sharing this knowledge with the wider team; mentoring and supporting them in a style they respond to best
• Conduct analysis of existing business practices, making relevant improvements where needed and supporting in estimating the size of tasks to ensure effective planning
• Adopt a collaborative approach with the whole business by acting as an expert technical liaison and providing ad-hoc support as needed

item.title: Market Data C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Market Data department develops high quality software that handles inbound and outbound data for various Bloomberg products. We manage massive volumes of data from major exchanges and contributors around the globe including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSX). We deliver billions of data points a day to customers through our market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our data enables global market makers to make financial decisions and is held to the highest standards. Our developers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, project management, design, development, testing and release.

There are two main groups in Market Data (Feeds and Data License). More information on individual teams within these groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred team.

>> Feeds

The Feeds group builds low latency systems in a Linux environment. We gather data from financial sources across the globe to deliver quality market data sets. We strive to provide the highest quality of data while maintaining minimal latencies on high throughput real-time market data.

Exchanges

The Feeds Exchanges team develops feed handlers from North and South American exchanges. We provide critical data to our clients for high profile exchanges such as NYSE, NASDAQ, CME, BM&F/Bovespa and TSX. Our initiatives include improving the resiliency of our feed handlers through enhanced data recovery mechanisms while upgrading to our latest infrastructure to improve upon our data model.

Contributions

The Contributions team processes data from central banks, global banks and inter-dealer brokers for non-exchange traded OTC markets using industry standard protocols. We strive to make our system simple, efficient and fault resilient. We build scalable and massive infrastructure used by our business and operations teams to increase data accuracy, deployment and troubleshooting of real-time feeds, reducing time-to-market for our clients. Ongoing projects include the next generation of cloud infrastructure to increase fault tolerance, load distribution and on-demand resource management.

News

The News team provides reports on earnings, interest rates and major economic indicators like unemployment numbers, housing reports and consumer indices. Our systems connect the Bloomberg terminal with information from social media such as Twitter and Weibo. Our automated systems also cater to algorithmic trading.

Tactical

The Tactical team excels at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. Our main goal is to provide a timely response to all client-facing issues. We build tools to better debug and enhance the development experience. Tactical developers work closely with feed handler developers to identify gaps in the product and enforce operational and functional standards, upholding quality in the market data product.

>> Data License

Data License is Bloomberg's market leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, which requires our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options. We work closely with our business and sales teams to develop solutions to satisfy customer demands.

Core

The Financial Data Delivery Core team builds and maintains high performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to Bloomberg's customers through its market leading enterprise reference data product. Our system delivers information on nearly all types of financial instruments to key players in the industry who rely on its accuracy.

Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL)

The BVAL team builds a product that calculates pricing for over two million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. This evaluated pricing data is delivered with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as net asset valuation calculations. Our product calculates, validates and delivers millions of data points. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable and fault-tolerant architecture. We are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop to address scalability needs and new offerings that will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements.

Content

The Content Generation and Distribution team builds systems that deliver a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, options, derivatives, indices, bonds, commodities and currencies. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. Our data is delivered to clients via various mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP.

Workflows/Analytics

The Workflows and Analytics team designs and implements flexible, usable, and performant systems for ensuring data quality and consistency across our feeds and workflows. Developers in our team use a variety of technologies, including C++, Python, Perl, Java, JavaScript, Comdb2 and Hadoop.

Metering

The Metering team is responsible for building high performance distributed systems for managing large volumes of client data. We work with multiple groups within Bloomberg and develop tools to transform and efficiently store the data for trend analysis, billing and business intelligence. We are leveraging Hadoop to meet the demands of the massive amount of data we collect and analyze, and the complexity of algorithms that operate on the data. Our technology stack for the next generation system will include Webservices, Apache Kafka and Hortonworks Hadoop distribution.

item.title: Data Platform Architect (Java) at OnePlus (Shenzhen Shi, China)
item.description:
• Design and develop data platform infrastructure

  • Design and develop systems for big data collection and analytics

  • Implement both online and offline solutions and multidimensional query support

  • Design and develop real-time data analytics and streaming cloud services

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java Web Apps) at Sony Network Entertainment International (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The primary role for this position will be to work on the development of back-end applications and components and the integration with third party systems. The ideal candidate must be a skilled Java developer with experience in web application development, full life-cycle application development and systems integration. He/She will work with peers on the development of large scale systems that support other Sony's businesses in the digital content area. The role will primarily be focused on development and delivery of projects. This entails architecture, coding, unit testing, bug fixing and assistance in the deployment to production as well as maintenance knowledge transfers. The Sr. Java Software Engineer is expected to communicate with senior members of the Technology group by providing status, identifying and raising issues and participating in planning activities.


Our group develops software for the PlayStation Network and Sony Entertainment Network. These networks provide online services for the PS4, PS3, PSP, Vita, Tablets, mobile phones, PC, Bravia TVs and more. We build large internal enterprise applications which integrate and support such services as Movie/TV Show streaming, PSN gaming commerce and much more. Our environment is fast, agile and we use some of the latest tools out there.



  • Write Java code for internal application development

  • Write and execute unit tests using the JUnit framework

  • Apply and help refine coding standards

  • Gather requirements from business users for application development projects

  • Create required documentation including low-level design documents, User Interface wireframes and simple UML diagrams

  • Ownership of the implementation and delivery of small or mid-size features

  • Design small features or implement more complex features as designed by technical lead

  • Communicate estimates, schedules, issues and dependencies to technical or project lead

  • Increase expertise in the areas of development related to the assigned projects

  • Identify and address issues independently

  • Fix bugs and provide support for business and maintenance teams

  • Refactor existing code base and improve overall quality of code

  • Perform knowledge shares

  • Proactively improve development processes

  • Participate in the establishment of best practices

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at NewsCred (New York, NY)
item.description:
NewsCred has always had a clear social mission – to help the journalism industry survive by building the world’s first content ecosystem and disrupting the status quo.


How are we doing that? By building a revolutionary technology platform for all of the world’s content. Filtering, streaming and organizing millions of articles a day, in real-time. That’s a lot of data, a lot of content and a lot of opportunity to build something amazing. Join a brilliant, fun team of engineers that are solving big problems every day.


NewsCred is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer with the technical skills and talent to navigate our entire stack, solving interesting and challenging problems along the way. Whether you’re:



  • improving our search infrastructure using the latest techniques in information retrieval and natural language processing, or

  • analyzing terabytes of usage logs to discover what content performs best for our customers, or

  • building a revolutionary content consumption UX,


you will play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, and launch.


Individuals that succeed at NewsCred are intelligent, highly motivated, fearless team players with great senses of humor.  They proven self-starters and quick learners. You will write lots of code that solves both visual and technical challenges, delivering high impact solutions to our customers around the world.


The Stack
We’re not dogmatic about specific technologies but here’s a list of some of the stuff we’re using:



  • Python

  • Solr

  • Django

  • AngularJS

  • MySQL

  • MongoDB

  • Ansible


The Team
The engineering team at NewsCred consists of some of the most brilliant, considerate, and fun-loving people you’ll ever meet. We're highly selective; we seek people who can contribute and share in the success and happiness of our team. We organize ourselves into small, autonomous teams that are as self-sufficient and independent as possible. This allows us to maintain our scrappy, entrepreneurial culture as we grow


About You
You love creating software so much that it’s disconcerting to your family and friends. The idea of game night and free lunch sound fun. You find few things as satisfying as reading and writing beautiful code and you plan on pushing some code on your first day. You’re irresistibly curious about the latest emerging technologies. You may or may not have a computer science degree.

item.title: Sr. Development Engineer & Architect at Stage 3 Systems Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a very talented programmer who has experience leading teams and is interested in a software opportunity that is not the run of the mill consumer web site development. We're solving big industrial problems using the very latest methods and technologies. We are taking the most modern web technologies into one of the largest industries in the world. You will make a difference in how people do their jobs globally.


We rely on your ability as a self-starter to tackle issues of immense complexity, bringing your experience to bear on solving problems, driving technical direction, while working with, leading and learning from teams of equally talented and experienced colleagues. We believe in small, empowered, focused teams who thrive in an environment that gets out of their way and allows them to do excellent work. We want you to continue to experiment with the latest technologies, development  and operations methods and to help us to constantly raise the bar of our offering.


We expect you to be extremely qualified in one or more of the technologies listed and we would especially like to see someone with DevOps experience, having deployed to scale to Amazon or one of the other large public clouds. We know that deployment and operations are as big a part of the solution as the applications themselves and expect you to embrace the challenge that comes with taking responsibility for that part of the job as well.


After we've had a chat with you from seeing your Resume/CV we would want to see code examples, working systems and other things you've built. We will want to learn what you liked about those efforts and  what you'd do differently and why.


This is a full time position which allows us to offer you benefits and stability but we are open to trying things out on contract at first if you wish.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Conversions Manager at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
The Workplace Investing Data conversion and Implementation team is looking for a Data Conversion Analyst in our Stock Plan Services (SPS) organization. SPS provides public companies with the expertise and convenience of a single provider to administer their equity compensation programs across a range of vehicles, including: Employee Stock Purchase Plans, Restricted Stock Awards/Units, Stock Option Plans, and Stock Appreciation Rights.


This position is a data-centric role that is looking for a detail-oriented Analyst to help manage multiple projects within our Data Conversions team. This role will be a client-facing position that interacts with multiple clients outside of the Fidelity organization, so a service-minded individual is a must! if you enjoy working with people and problem-solving this role could be a great fit. The candidate must be highly organized and should be able to move seamlessly between multiple implementations and ever-changing client requirements.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Organize and conduct data conversion project status meetings, including communicating status to internal project management, Fidelity business partners, outside vendors and clients

  • Maintain detailed project plan, issues and action items list throughout the implementation, while documenting requirements and addressing operation process issues to accomplish business objectives; and determining required changes and their impact

  • Provide input and suggestions into process improvements and discretionary projects

  • Build strong partnerships with client and third party vendors

  • Communicate project status and technology issues to sponsors stakeholders and senior management

  • Collaborate with each other WI management teams and business partners to share approaches, develop solutions, and improve capabilities to successfully deliver projects

item.title: Algo Engineer at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
item.description:
At HRT, we program computers to intelligently trade on the stock market. Because we don’t have any customers, the only problem we have to worry about is how to make the world’s markets more financially efficient using smart algorithms - which is as difficult as it sounds. Because this a non-trivial problem, we hire some of the smartest mathematicians and computer scientists in the world to develop new machine learning, statistical models, and, most importantly, very clever code. This last bit is where you come in.


We need more software engineers that specifically enjoy making other people more productive. Sure, we understand that you can spout off the complexity of any classical data structure operation in your sleep. We know you are going to regale us with a war story about the last terrible bug caused by an unexpected out of order execution in a multithreaded program (we are not a big fan of threads, either) or how the Python GIL killed your scalability. But in addition to those technical skills we need engineers that live to hear the word “thanks”. As in “thanks, your script saved me 50-60 hours of work this month." Or “thanks, that new system you put in place lets us easily try different mathematical models which we thought were too difficult to experiment with.”


Obviously finding this blend of serious technical skills and personality is not easy, but we are willing to work to find you, the perfect candidate.


We also added some perks to sweeten the deal:




  • Breakfast and lunch cooked in house every day by a team of chefs




  • Wear whatever you want to work (there are no customers, remember?)




  • Regular team events that are actually fun (for example: beer brewing, wine tasting lessons, ping pong tournaments, soccer teams, fancy dinners)




  • One of the best health insurance plans you can get in NYC




  • Very small company with a flat organizational structure




  • Tech-oriented leadership - all of our Partners are programmers




  • Almost no multithreaded programming




  • All of the biggest monitors

item.title: Software Engineer, JavaScript at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is committed to bringing cleaner, more affordable energy to more people. In order to make that happen, we have a dedicated group of software engineers working on the most interesting projects in the industry. We are looking for bright, talented, and versatile software engineers to join our team and help us build tools and products that will accelerate the adoption of clean energy, and improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of users. You will get to work with a tight-knit, fast-paced, and dedicated software team on cutting edge products.

The ideal candidate is smart, driven, loves learning, solving challenging problems and getting things done.

You’ll be responsible for designing and developing cutting edge web applications that sustain our continued growth. These projects will be challenging, but will play a key role in empowering our workforce and informing our customers and advocates.



Some of the software projects we’re working on include:


• Real time energy production and consumption monitoring
• Distributed energy management using battery storage
• Microgrid monitoring and administration
• Internal tools to mobilize our workforce
• External apps to facilitate solar adoption
• Graphical CAD systems for auditing and design
• 3D whole house energy simulation models
• Pricing and proposal tools
• Project management, scheduling, and resource allocation
• Complex financial fund modeling
• Quadcopters used in site inspection and modeling
• Gamification

a10:author.a10:name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc.

item.title: Data Warehouse Developer/Architect (210122) at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
The Henry M. Jackson Foundation, for the Advancement of Military Medicine (HJF) is seeking a Data Warehouse Developer/Architect to support the Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) located at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center (WRNMMC) in Bethesda, MD. HJF provides administrative and management support to SC2I.    


The Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) capitalizes on unprecedented advances in casualty research and clinical care by partnering Department of Defense efforts with civilian academic leaders to introduce paradigm-shifting approaches in care based on biomarker assessment into routine practice.


Responsibilities:



  1. Design/develop data warehouse applications and systems to support SC2i operations by incorporating data from Program data sources including laboratory and clinical applications and legacy data stores.

  2. Design/develop data integration strategies and methods to allow SC2i data warehouse applications and systems to interact (consume and feed as necessary) with external collaborator’s systems.

  3. Provide technical support to scrub, curate, and migrate legacy study data into Program data warehouse applications and systems.

  4. Participate in required program meetings at USUHS, WRNMMC, Naval Medical Research Center, and offsite collaborator locations.

  5. Performs other duties as needed.

item.title: Software Engineer at Daugherty Business Solutions (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Do you want to solve business problems using the latest technologies, frameworks, and methodologies?   Do you have the insight, creativity, and perspective to drive business success for our client’s at levels never before seen?  Do you want a company where employee training is at the forefront of its strategy and career planning and advancement is part of every conversation?  Then Daugherty Business solutions may be the place for you.  Daugherty is currently looking for software developers focused on designing state-of-the-art solutions and constructing reusable services that provide true business capabilities to our clients via Web, Mobile, and exposed APIs


We develop software better and faster through robust, team- oriented, solution crafting using modern development languages and frameworks.  We innovate by tightly aligning to the business and receiving the rapid feedback and story prioritization that makes Agile our preferred method.


What You Could Be Working On:



  • Full product life-cycle development, performing a technical uplift across 30+ applications into .NET, Service Oriented functional components.  Work is being performed by a full Daugherty project team in an agile method and will run through 2015, setting the stage for additional phases in 2016.  Current opening is for Technical Leadership across a team of 3.

  • New software development using Spring Boot to provide a new suite service capabilities via composable MicroServices.  This end-to-end assignment will be 18 months of full product development in Spring, Hibernate, and Core Java.  All work will be performed by a full Daugherty team in a collaborative, agile method.   

  • New software development projects moving the client to the latest technologies and methods.  Cloud based development using AWS and Docker, providing fine grained composable MicroServices via Scala.  This end-to-end assignment will be 12 months of full product development needing strong understanding of WebAPI and WebServices with a strong pedigree in Core Java.  AWS and Scala is a plus.  All work will be performed by a full Daugherty team in an agile method, collaborating with the client.

item.title: Software Engineer at Daugherty Business Solutions (Bloomington, MN)
item.description:
Do you want to solve business problems using the latest technologies, frameworks, and methodologies?   Do you have the insight, creativity, and perspective to drive business success for our client’s at levels never before seen?  Do you want a company where employee training is at the forefront of its strategy and career planning and advancement is part of every conversation?  Then Daugherty Business solutions may be the place for you.  Daugherty is currently looking for software developers focused on designing state-of-the-art solutions and constructing reusable services that provide true business capabilities to our clients via Web, Mobile, and exposed APIs

  • New software development using Spring Boot to provide a new suite service capabilities via composable MicroServices.  This end-to-end assignment will be 18 months of full product development in Spring, Hibernate, and Core Java.  All work will be performed by a full Daugherty team in a collaborative, agile method.

item.title: QA Lead / Software Engineer in Test at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
Simply Business – We are looking for a QA Lead (this could be a ‘step up’ role for you, or you could already be coming with this experience)


Based onsite in Moorgate, London


The exciting part = It’s totally a blank canvas for someone to come in and set the direction and strategy of our QA and drive that change across the company.


We’re the UK’s leading price comparison site for small businesses and startups looking for insurance. We’ve completed disrupted an ‘old school’ and traditional industry and revolutionized it with our state of the art technology and now we’re looking to grow!


The role



  • You will be our most senior QA person and responsible for taking an excellent Agile QA team to a
    new level

  • Hands-­on whilst leading a team of 6 QA Analysts and setting the direction and strategy for the team
    and the QA function as a whole

  • You will liaise with our Tech Leadership team to continue the strong integration of our QA function in
    the development process

  • As we do Continuous Delivery, your testing focus will be geared heavily to the automation side of
    things, but we do what makes most sense for each situation

  • Work with product owners and track leads to review and set story and feature acceptance criteria

  • Implement business functionality in a testable form

  • Develop appropriate and maintainable test automation functionality at unit, integration and system
    tiers

  • Act as a customer champion within the team, representing risks and needs when implementing
    solutions


Some things we believe in


*Creating an best-in-class technology culture – Agile / Lean / TDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / pair programming / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source


*Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’


*Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community


*Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, finish early on fridays, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)


*Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our team out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).


Our tech stack


Cucumber / RSpec / Turnip / Jasmine
Ruby on Rails
MongoDB
RabbitMQ
Puppet/Boxen
AWS
SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery


This list is always changing as we do not believe in limiting ourselves with technology, we are always experimenting and using the right tool for the job

item.title: Web Developer at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility sites for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).
• Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing applications that present dynamic information from a variety of sources.
• Use proprietary technologies and industry standard best practices to build and deliver high performance web applications for users across the globe.
• Compliment enterprise application sites with both existing and custom jQuery plugins.
• Utilize progressive enhancement techniques to support older browsers, while simultaneously delivering cutting-edge user experience in modern browsers.

Requirements
• Solid understanding of client-side development with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
• Experience utilizing client-side frameworks like jQuery, jQuery Mobile, and Modernizr
• Ability to develop full-scale applications with C# .NET, or comparable platforms
• Experience with object-oriented principles and development patterns like MVC
• Excellent technical, analytical, and communication skills
• Experience or interest in learning mobile web development a plus
• SVN and/or GIT knowledge preferred
• Demonstrated ability to work and learn independently or as part of a team
• Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis

Compensation
• Salary – Commensurate with experience
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance
• Company paid life insurance
• Matching 401(k)
• Gym reimbursement
• Three weeks paid vacation plus holidays, personal time, sick time and paid volunteer days
• Commuting benefits including paid public transportation (Eco Pass), bike-to-work incentives, in-door bike parking and discounted bike safety gear


Markit On Demand is a design driven technology company based in Boulder, Colorado. We’re part of Markit, a global financial information company that’s headquartered in London. Here in Boulder, where the sun shines 300 days a year, we have a team of 400+ professionals dedicated to the presentation of financial content and data for our clients in the Financial Services, Media and Healthcare industries. On any given day, you might work with a colleague in New York, a retail brokerage in the US, a newspaper in Germany, a bank in Africa, or throw ideas around with an economist in our London office. (And that’s before you meet up with co-workers for a foothills hike or brewery happy hour).

Notes
Please include a link to code samples and/or your GitHub repository in the cover letter section. You may instead include code samples as an attachment when submitting your resume.

item.title: Software Engineer - Team Leader at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Development Team Leader to lead the programming team responsible for developing all code underlying the Ontoit search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Team Leader you will oversee the development from start to finish within all these fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will develop all technical specifications and be responsible for the delegation for tasks to team members. You will compile all technical documentation developed by the team and manage the overall code development process ensuring high quality, effectiveness and appropriateness of all code.


The role is expected to break down as approximately 20% Project/Team Management, 30% Quality Assurance, 50% Development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £40-55,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th September, 2015.


Job responsibilities:



  • To develop high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development

  • To help CEO plan and execute the process and delivery of development tasks in a custom Agile framework.

  • To help CEO review completed tasks from the development team and hold to a high standard of quality.

  • To help CEO manage task delivery timeline and expectations.

  • To help CEO maintain and apply policies and guidance of development workflow and processes.

  • To help CEO allocate work to individuals of the team based on assessment of each strengths and weaknesses.

  • To help CEO be a point of escalation for development issues within the team, making sure you are open and available to team members and take ownership of issues raised to you.

  • To help CEO carry out a mentoring and coaching role to team members in order to assist in their development.

  • To help CEO drive the development and direction of our scientific work in computer science related fields.

item.title: Software Engineer at Daugherty Business Solutions (Saint Louis, MO)
item.description:
We develop software better and faster through robust, team- oriented, solution crafting using modern development languages and frameworks.  We innovate by tightly aligning to the business and receiving the rapid feedback and story prioritization that makes Agile our preferred method.


What You Could Be Working On:



  • Full product life-cycle development, performing a technical uplift across 30+ applications into .NET, Service Oriented functional components.  Work is being performed by a full Daugherty project team in an agile method and will run through 2015, setting the stage for additional phases in 2016.  Current opening is for Technical Leadership across a team of 3.

  • New software development using Spring Boot to provide a new suite service capabilities via composable MicroServices.  This end-to-end assignment will be 18 months of full product development in Spring, Hibernate, and Core Java.  All work will be performed by a full Daugherty team in a collaborative, agile method.   

  • New software development projects moving the client to the latest technologies and methods.  Cloud based development using AWS and Docker, providing fine grained composable MicroServices via Scala.  This end-to-end assignment will be 12 months of full product development needing strong understanding of WebAPI and WebServices with a strong pedigree in Core Java.  AWS and Scala is a plus.  All work will be performed by a full Daugherty team in an agile method, collaborating with the client.

item.title: Platform Mobile Engineer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Mobile is a key channel for SHOP.CA and we want to provide our customers with the best mobile (App and HTML) shopping experience.  As Head of Mobile Engineering, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining and executing SHOP.CA’s mobile strategy for phone, tablet across HTML and app solutions.  You are passionate about mobile and user experiences and will create mobile solutions that our customers love to use.  You will create daily KPIs and measure and report on the success of our mobile channels focusing on results first.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the latest mobile capabilities in localization, notification, bar-code scanning, voice, etc to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA a world-class mobile destination with a terrific consumer experience

  • Develop daily KPIs on mobile site and app utilization, conversion rates, etc

  • Make proactive recommendations to improve customer experience based on analytics

  • Lead the strategy and recommend solutions to meet SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies including

  • support for mobile HTML on phone and tablet devices as well as apps.

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new

  • features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Define, and implement front-end standards for performance, analysis and personalization

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Use all available and emerging creative development tools in your work

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • Wireframe development (PhotoShop or other similar programs), site (XHTML, DHTML, HTML,

    • CSS, AJAX, JSP, PHP, Flash and JavaScript files) and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of SHOP.CA mobile solutions (iOS, Blackberry & Android)

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java/JSP to support the mobile eCommerce platforms.


  • Creating documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally.

  • Build out QA test ‘lab’ for devices and handsets necessary for the QA team to adequately test SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies

  • Working with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production.

  • Innovating new solutions and researching new technologies that may complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s mobile commerce experience world class
