We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Booz Allen Hamilton (Springfield, VA)
item.description:
Key Role:
Conduct statistical analysis, modeling, and simulation for various federal clients that lead to actionable decisions affecting government operations. Use statistical methods on large data sets to characterize uncertainty through statistical methods. Leverage knowledge of large data analysis and perform research at graduate-level mathematics to ensure study results are properly interpreted and documented. Implement analytical approaches that will require knowledge of statistical programming languages, including SAS and R and traditional programming languages, including Java, C++, and others. Work closely with stakeholders and teammates from non-mathematical disciplines to ensure that operational strategies are considered in the context of applying statistical theory. Use statistical theory through modeling, simulation, and large data analysis to deliver lasting measurable improvements to organizations.

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Front/Full-Stack Developer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a Front-End/Full-Stack Developer to join our team in Madrid! As Front-End Developer your main responsibilities would include:



  • Improve the UX of our frontend and develop various frontend features using Django / Python, Javascript, AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS.

  • Develop charts that visualize data from our database using d3.js and other frameworks.

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well



We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Machine Learning at Hivemapper (Burlingame, CA)
item.description:
Hivemapper maps the Earth for drone fliers. That's a lot of data!  How do we teach our data collection engine to systematically crawl and extract the billions of pieces of data we need to map the earth for drone fliers.  Our earth crawler and extractor has acquired hundreds of millions of interesting objects on the planet, from 'hidden'  to 'hidden' . We have 'hidden' spanning the entire earth. 



At Hivemapper you'll help design and build the machine learning systems to collect the earth's data and instantly deliver the most relevant results to drone pilots. One day you might be figuring out how to process these terabytes of data and those billions of database rows. Another day you might be designing how to send five square miles of detailed 3-D map data to our drone fliers in under 100 milliseconds. And another day you might be out flying a drone with the man who took Hivemapper to Nepal.


We are backed by Spark Capital (Oculus Rift and Twitter), Google Ventures, Homebrew, and Harrison Metal.


[Hivemapper is currently building in stealth mode]

item.title: Data Scientist at Evidence for Policy Design (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Evidence for Policy Design at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government (EPoD) seeks a qualified data scientist to provide support on data analytics initiatives. The candidate will work with our Data Analytics Lead to perform data cleaning and analysis, manage databases, and produce graphics and basic software applications. In addition, the candidate will be involved with the production of policy-related op-eds and data journalism-style pieces.



The position is part-time with an initial duration of 6 months and may be open to extension based on performance and subsequent demand. The position may involve travel to India.



To apply, please send a CV, cover letter, and link to your GitHub account to Eric Dodge (epod@hks.harvard.edu) with “Data Scientist Application” in the subject line. Applications will be accepted through September 30, 2015.

item.title: Ruby Architect at Razer Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer with extensive experience in architecting, implementing, scaling, and supporting high-traffic / high-availability commercial web services and applications in a distributed cloud-based environment. This particular role requires significant experience in full stack web application development utilizing Ruby on Rails under Heroku and Amazon Web Services.


This is a very hands-on role, and you would be joining a small team of engineers to develop cutting edge services, applications, and API’s that will be utilized by both our internal and external customers around the world. As a senior engineer on this team you will have significant impact on future direction and development of these services.


Responsibilities:



  • Help design, develop, and support high-traffic, high-availability web services and applications

  • Insure successful delivery and 24/7 operation of all developed services and applications

  • Design and implement well-structured, easily maintainable, well-documented code, APIs, and test scripts

  • Optimize and/or debug code as needed to maximize performance, scaling, usability, and quality

  • Assimilate new technologies and solve complex problems, formulating and evaluating technical alternatives based on experience and data-driven decision making skills

  • Generate and update documentation and technical/functional specifications as needed

  • Provide development support and troubleshooting assistance to clients and/or other teams

  • Participate in agile planning, scope estimation, and updates for team projects

item.title: Principal Engineer at Getty Images (New York, NY)
item.description:
Getty Images is looking for a Principal Engineer who wants to lead one of the best engineering teams in the business as part of our Internal Platform team. We are a lean company, data-driven and committed to delivering real customer value. We are interested in finding someone who is smart, dedicated, a quick learner and raises the bar for our team. This role is focused on Scala, Akka, RabbitMq, ElasticSearch, AWS, CoreOS and various other technologies that we use. If you aren’t an expert in these technologies already we’ll help you get up to speed quickly. To learn more about our technology stack and our team’s work check out the following deck from a NYC tech talk:


https://speakerdeck.com/mhamrah/the-new-enterprise-rabbitmq-akka-and-aws-at-getty-images


Who You Are:


You love developing elegant solutions to complex problems. You follow the development community on twitter and are passionate about finding ways to improve quality, performance and delivery times. You have a great mix of technical and soft skills which allow you to excel in a highly collaborative, agile work environment. You are a passionate developer who has led in the design, quality, and testing of any development platforms built in Scala or Java. You make strides to learn new languages and tools and look for ways to incorporate them into the team. You are able to level up both senior and junior members of the team. You can partner with the PM organization helping build out visions for the software that you build.

item.title: Experienced QA Engineer to make our products rock at Yousician (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Yousician is the fastest growing music education company in the world with over 25 million users. Our mission is to make music education accessible for everyone by changing the way people learn to play musical instruments.


We are now looking for an experienced QA Engineer who will be responsible for our product’s overall quality and testing processes, making sure that our apps run as smoothly as possible for all users. You would take charge of our quality assurance in many different frontiers to make our products rock even harder than today! You would be working very closely with the development crew, product owners and our awesome music team in order to focus on the right things that make our products tick. Quality should never be underestimated and that is why we want to make sure that we have a cutting edge professional being responsible for that we do things right. Technically we are working in a challenging environment on many platforms, so a good understanding of multi-platform development and a passion to keep up with changes is needed.


Your responsibilities



  • Actively develop our testing and development processes to improve product quality

  • Work closely with customer support and product management to prioritize tasks relevant to product quality

  • Know the product inside out to understand how changes in it may affect quality

  • Create and execute test plans for the product

item.title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

item.title: Senior Software Development in Test at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Windcrest, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Were you the kid that took apart the family TV not just to see how it worked but because you thought you could make it better? Can you detect and prevent the invasion of bugs better than the Orkin man?  If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Development Engineer in Test at Rackspace.


With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to provide our customers the best platform to continue changing the world, the life of an SDET at the Rack can be quite unique and rewarding. How is this possible? Easy—we help match your passions, birthday wishes, and Sherlock skills with the right opportunity to be GREAT. Here’s a preview to get you started:


Pushing the Limits of the Cloud:
OpenStack…heard of it? Yep we worked with NASA as founders so of course we have some of the most notable upstream contributors on the planet. Whether for our public or private cloud offerings, our Devs are pounding out code in Python, Ruby, Java or whatever’s the next big thing at a break-neck pace. So when it comes to SDETs, we take pride in being true partners in excellence; not some robot or second-tier Dev whose only task is to cross off test cases from a checklist. Our SDETs have a tinker’s mind with a natural curiosity to know where we are going and to anticipate the unexpected. Diversity drives innovation so our teams are dispersed across the globe—even working from their favorite Cheetos-stained gaming chair at home.


Internal Innovation:
Ten data centers around the globe with several hundred thousand servers that all need to seamlessly interact like one of your LAN parties back in college. If you like HUGE environments then jump on into this playground. Our DevOps Engineers, Software Developers, and Infrastructure Engineers have to keep up with the demands of the industry that didn’t exist, oh maybe 5 minutes ago.  Our SDETs who partner with these teams are literally building their dreams to insure what’s new today is built to withstand the strains of tomorrow. Bulletproof code—that’s how we roll.


This is NOT your uncle’s Quality Engineering team where there was a lack of software development to accomplish testing and the job was just about manual button pushing. Are you ready to change the game doing what they said can’t be done? Are you ready to automate bigger things better and faster? What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


Still not convinced? Hear from the Rackers who do this day in and day out but still can’t believe this is their job. QE at the Rack

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Sophos (Burlington, MA)
item.description:
SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER



At Sophos, we operate at the cutting edge of technology, protecting businesses worldwide against complex threats, viruses and spam. We build high quality software security products in a fast-paced, nimble environment and we've been doing it for over 20 years.


Join us to help our customers protect their business and meet compliance needs.


Role


Senior Software Engineers possess the ability to function as a technical lead, providing technical direction to other developers. Frequently have direct responsibility for product features or key technology choices and implementation. Collaborates as part of a team for the development of complex systems; including requirements analysis, concept development and design, implementation and testing, demonstrating flexibility of role as required.



  • Candidates located in other areas of MA & NH are also welcome to apply


Main Duties



  • Drive design and implementation leveraging modern design patterns

  • Ability to partner effectively with UX, PM, DevOps, QE and other developers to design and implement meeting the spirit of requirements

  • Pride in authorship of code

  • Experience in modern front end frameworks

  • Technically curious to keep present on advances in technology

  • Experience with segregation of model, presentation, and business logic.

  • TDD experience and strong desire to build in test from the start.

  • Write code (Test or Product) to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements in various languages including Java or other selected languages for Sophos Cloud products.

  • Conduct Unit, System and Integration testing and fixing errors, with guidance if required.

  • Work with best of breed Cloud technologies (NoSQL, high throughput event processing, cloud-scale data analytics, etc)

  • Design small software components (Functionality, defect fixes or automation) that form part of a larger solution, in line with team objectives

  • Define Test scenarios and Test cases to ensure quality of the teams deliverables

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers in daily Scrum meetings.


Experience and Skills



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years of JAVA, API, JavaScript, Angular JS, Java Web Services, UI Skills, Json.

  • Experience using and creating RESTful APIs.

  • Experience with the following technologies (recommended);

    - MongoDB
    - Redis

  • Experience/knowledge with CI/CD

  • Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Essential



  • Design and write high quality code

  • Evaluation of code and design quality

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Evaluation of technical and functional specifications and their cohesion

  • Negotiation

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communication with different types of audience

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Coaching and training

  • Team Working


Benefits


In most cases, the compensation package includes:



  • Medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Long-term disability insurance

  • 401k plan

  • Vacation time

  • Gym membership compensation

item.title: SENIOR PRODUCTION SOFTWARE QA ENGINEER at Body Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


Body Labs makes the world's most sophisticated data-driven digital model of human shape and pose. We have extensive capabilities, tools, analytics and know-how in the areas of modeling specific individuals (such as fit models) or sub-populations (eg. targeted consumers, athletes, plus-sizes, etc.). We work closely with apparel and equipment companies to help them better understand and visualize their target consumers’ body shapes and motions, and improve their design-to-manufacturing workflow. Our current clients include large sports apparel manufacturers and the US Army.


Our forward product focus is on BodyKit, a set of APIs and embeddable components that can be used by any developer or company to easily build apps or tools that interact with the human body. With BodyKit we’ll power the next generation of custom clothing websites, fitness tracking apps, virtual reality experiences, and more.


Body Labs is looking for a highly-skilled and driven Production QA Engineer. We need someone who can design and implement testing, validate a large scale application deployment to production servers. You will be part of our internal product/engineering team, requiring teamwork, focus, and drive.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Design and implement testing infrastructures by writing code to validate a large scale application deployment, partner with software developers to create/code test tools and implement automation concurrent with product development. In this role, you will need to possess a broad view of the entire product deployment to ensure appropriate/efficient re-use of existing libraries, methods, classes, etc. in adequate automation tools and infrastructures. In addition, you will have following responsibilities:



  • Participate in software code/design/requirements review processes to assist with deciding what unit tests to write and ensure testability of new code.

  • Collaborate with Software Development team to maintain consistency and testability of our software.

  • Work with developers on all aspects of quality in software, database, migration and maintenance routines.

  • Collaborate with Software Development team in all aspects of the development lifecycle from early design feedback,

  • functional automation, reliability, stress, performance, integration testing, through to supporting production issues.

  • Create, maintain, and execute test plans and test cases. Analyze and report results, track defects, and participate in day-to-day QA support activities.

item.title: Lead Data Architect at Leap (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Architect, ideally with experience working on a SAAS or enterprise product.  You will work closely with the CTO and founders to discuss new schema design and future predictive capabilities for our real-time financial analytics products.  You should have experience with system design that follows best practices and leverage REST API's, as well as the ability to ensure that our entire stack is testable and scaleable. You like solving core problems around scalability and performance, thinking about how to leverage new tools, and optimize systems.


If you have management experience, or looking to grow in that area, this role will evolve into a technical leadership role as we grow.


Responsibilities include:


• Work closely with the CTO and Product team to define, design and prototype new features to our custom analytics and data visualization tools


• Develop highly scalable data ETL, data warehouse, and reporting solutions


• Help mentor the team on data architecture, new tools, and predictive functionality


• Investigate, propose, and/or prototype new tools for added security, storage and scalability

item.title: HPDC Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
A Developer at 1010data creates large-scale analytics solutions; this includes designing the associated high-performance database structure, data transformations, and workflow processes.


You will be developing adaptive distributed system software and high-speed communication system software to support high-performance distributed computing (HPDC) applications.


The successful candidate will have a passion for writing code and be instrumental in building a highly scalable, 24/7 availability platform for our in-house data center. 


Experience in specific programming languages isnot required; however the right candidate knows how to program and has the interest and ability to learn new languages quickly.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and is confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact and evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Senior BI Consultant at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
BI Senior Consultant


Role:


We are looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant to join our team in New York. Infusion’s Business Intelligence (BI) practice is a Microsoft Gold Certified BI Partner that was awarded Microsoft Impact Award for BI Partner of the Year. Our team consists of highly skilled individuals that are specialized in business process automation, data management, design, architecture, reporting and analytics. The BI Team takes a business first approach with our clients as we work closely them to understand and analyze their business and operational processes; their data collection mechanisms; their data reporting and decision making processes. This analysis allows us to formulate a vision and plan to work towards streamlining their enterprise wide processes to efficiently collect, manage, report on and analyze the data that is required by decisions makers.


We create a vision that looks beyond the traditional walls of departmental data silos and increases proactive lines of communication across an enterprise to ensure the right people are receiving the right data at the right time (when it is needed). Typically, we utilize the Microsoft Business Intelligence technology stack to build enterprise solutions that complement an organization's BI vision and goals. We provide our clients, across various different industries, with the tools and skills to organically grow and evolve Business Intelligence throughout the organization.


Job Duties:



  • Perform Enterprise wide business process analysis

  • Work closely with our clients to define system requirements

  • Design/implement Databases, Data warehouses and BI solutions around high volume enterprise applications

  • Develop business insight through reporting and dashboarding solutions

  • Provide training for our clients in the BI and data warehousing space

  • Execute rapid prototyping to support presales activities

  • Provide team leadership/co-ordination on projects

  • Provide expertise in cutting edge BI technology

  • Participate in Industry communities

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Priceline.com (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Are you a Software Engineer passionate about creating great software?  Is your mantra “Class, Responsibility, Collaboration?”  Do you want to develop products that are very important to the growth and success of the company?  Do you want to work very closely with the business folks?  Are you looking for a company that is not too big, not too small, and has a casual and agile work environment?  If so, then we just might have the perfect job for you!


The Rental Car group at priceline.com is looking for a talented engineer to join our services tier team.  In this software engineering role you will develop services software that supports the searching and booking of rental cars on priceline.com and other company-owned web sites, mobile platforms, as well as through our affiliate API.

We strongly believe that there is real value to the organization in crafting and engineering software beautifully so that it can be easily understood, maintained, and extended. We work directly with the business team and are involved in shaping our product and improving our business.  The Rental Car business is a major contributor to the company’s bottom line and still has significant opportunity for growth.  We work hard at creating software to improve the business and we do so in a casual, fun and flexible work environment.


You will have the opportunity to use your Java skills to craft internal and external Web services; connect to external suppliers via Global Distribution Systems (GDS) and Web services; work with high capacity, multi-threaded systems; create and use various kinds of caches; build interaction points between the Rental Car product and the other Priceline products (e.g. Hotels, Airline); build tools to help manage and control our systems, and much more!

item.title: Data Scientist for Global Health at Epidemico (Boston, MA)
item.description:
We seek a Data Scientist for our Boston-based public health informatics company. You would join a dynamic team of scientists, developers, and epidemiologists tackling global challenges across a wide range of population health topics, including infectious disease, disease ecology, healthcare, drug safety, and supply chain analysis. The Data Scientist will also contribute to products and research projects involving novel data sources for public health surveillance.


Applicants should have experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g. Apache Spark or MapReduce) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, R, Scala), as well as machine learning and natural language processing. An ideal candidate would also have knowledge of statistics and some domain experience from a related field such as epidemiology, geography, ecology, medicine, or digital humanities. We seek experience across the software stack including databases, software architecture, web development, and open source collaboration. This position will focus on data engineering for our data science team, developing our distributed data processing stack.


This may be a customer-facing position; ability to work with enterprise clients and strong written and verbal communication are important.


We are a diverse, multi-national, multi-ethnic, gender-balanced, and family-friendly organization. Candidates from historically underrepresented backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply. We will also consider junior candidates and recent graduates who don’t yet have all listed skills, but who are self-motivated with the ability to learn on the job.

item.title: Core Developer; large-scale analytics solutions at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a Core Developer to design and implement large-scale analytics solutions; including building tools and interfaces used both internally and by customers, high performance data manipulation algorithms, and innovative ways to visualize and deliver result sets to customers.


Our Core team builds portable code that enables our customers to use 1010data’s system in a more autonomous way while maintaining performance when dealing with massive amounts of data.  They work directly with our customers for tangible feedback on products/technology, enabling rapid release cycles.


If you appreciate the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and are confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact come evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Autodata Solutions (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Autodata Solutions is looking for multiple Senior Java Developers for their London, Ontario office.


Position Overview:


As the Senior Developer, your primary role is to design, code, test, debug and analyze software programs and applications. You will be expected to drive and contribute to researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production life cycle in areas with broad scope. This position contributes heavily to the guidance and mentoring of other developers.  This role is being offered as a permanent full-time opportunity without the option of working remotely. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Write software components and applications according to specifications and industry standards with thorough code reviews and mentor others in this effort

  • Occasionally acting as the project Technical Lead, you will work with Business Analysts, Architects & other Programmers in conceptualizing and developing new software programs & applications

  • Guide & assist in the preparation and documentation of program requirements 

  • Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement and general debugging

  • Generate statistics and prepare reports for management and/or team members on the status of the project

  • Liaise with Network Administrators, Systems Analysts, Database Administrators and Software Engineers to assist in resolving problems with client software products or software systems


Apply for this role directly using the following link: Click Here!.  We look forward to hearing from you!  For more information about Autodata Solutions, we invite you to check out our website at www.autodata.net.


We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified.  Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

item.title: Java Developer at EROAD (Auckland, New Zealand)
item.description:
Who is EROAD?


EROAD is an NZX listed technology company that provides road charging, tax, compliance and commercial services to the heavy and light commercial vehicle sectors.


EROAD has set the standard as the first GPS-based service provider to offer a government-approved electronic RUC and highway tax solution. A key to EROAD’s success is its core competency and ongoing investment in design, product development, manufacturing and operations to maintain its technical leadership and competitive advantage.


Why work at EROAD?


We have outstanding opportunities for experienced java developers who are interested in an exciting career in a fast-growing technology company.  We have a larger than average R&D division of high-performing engineers/developers working in an agile environment, across Java, web, mobile, firmware, analytics and testing. We employ only the best and we ensure our staff have the skills, training and technology to do their best work.

item.title: Android Developer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. This position is in the mobile applications development group based in Seattle, responsible for creating the WAVE Mobile Communicator used for critical communications around the globe. The enterprise mobility market is rapidly growing and we are looking for a strong strong Android developer to join us in delivering world-class solutions!


Responsibilities:


Work within an agile team to architect, design, build, test, and maintain our Android and iOS applications.


Collaborate with our cross-functional server and web client teams as well as other teams (some remote) who have a hand in creating the WAVE portfolio of products.


Work closely with other engineers, QA, project manager, and the product development team. Proactively "dogfood" the product to identify areas for improvement or enhancements.


Perks:



      Great downtown location looking directly out onto Puget Sound, Olympic Sculpture Park and Elliott Bay Trail


Secure, covered, paid parking



      Dog Fridays


Summer BBQs on the deck

item.title: Front-End Developer at Technology Will Save Us (London, UK)
item.description:
Technology Will Save Us is building (and rebuilding) a whole bunch of our software. We’re looking for a front-end web developer excited about the opportunity to build experiences that delight and amaze kids and parents.


Your Objectives


As the only front-end focused role in the team, we’re looking for a person interested in achieving the following goals:



  • Building easy-to-use interfaces that feel natural and empower users

  • Implementing a library of components that can be shared by the rest of the team

  • Making sure our user interfaces work correctly on all major desktop and mobile platforms

  • Supporting new developments (e.g. coding and making platforms and manuals) and our existing e-commerce platform

  • Defining the technology that will help us achieve all these goals


Our Culture


Finding the right cultural fit is very important to us. We’d like you to bring something new and complement the team.


We are a playful, focused and authentic team looking for someone who deeply cares about building great products and services and putting our users at the centre of their work.



  • We believe in simple, maintainable clean (and lean) code. We hold weekly code reviews to maintain quality and learn from each other

  • We work together to achieve goals. We’re open about feedback, we want you to be able to give and accept feedback

  • We use data to drive decisions and solve real problems. This includes analytics, A/B testing, research, customer interviews, usability tests…

  • We give people ownership and invest in their growth. Along with our UX expert, you will have the opportunity to be involved in user research and testing

item.title: Experienced software developer in the field of Sustainable Energy Solutions at The Sustainables (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Experienced software developer


We are looking for a smart and driven software developer to strengthen our team to build the best photo-measurement tools and platforms in the industry. The tools and platforms we develop are used for the remote analysis of houses in order to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy.  


A few examples of our systems currently in use are:



  • Solar Remote Quote: an application used by solar panel installers to measure tilted roofs, design a solar system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

  • Wall insulation Remote Quote: An application used to generate automated wall insulation quotes, by auto recognition of windows and remote surface measurement.

  • An application enabling home owners to create a detailed paintwork quote by taking smart-phone pictures only, supported by our database learning engine and photo auto recognition.


With the use of for example 3D laser scanning imagery (LIDAR) and advanced photo measurement techniques we are always looking at ways to enhance the accuracy and user friendliness of our tools and platforms.


We offer:



  • A lot of responsibility within the R&D team to make the difference by deploying your knowledge to make sustainable energy solutions available to the general public;

  • High pace, short cycle developments, directly result driven;

  • Interesting imaging and big data set challenges;

  • A lot of flexibility and freedom of choice in the use of tooling;

  • Flexible start and finish times, or partially working from home;

  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer at Smartsheet (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Are you the go-to person on your team? Do the hard problems always seem to land on your desk because you’re the only one who can solve them? Do you spend more of your time convincing people to let you build what needs to be built than actually building it? Have you spent more than 10 hours in meetings this week? Come work for us and unleash your true potential. Smartsheet is looking for our next Full Stack Software Engineer to join the development team. Our business is built on finding top grade talent and getting out of their way while they build and improve our award winning Software as a Service (SaaS) offering for collaborative work and project management. Our software team is small, highly efficient, and results oriented. We work in an agile apolitical environment that stays focused on building great software. Here you can use the latest web technologies to their fullest potential. We are looking for the most highly motivated and intelligent individuals. This position is based at our headquarters in Bellevue, WA. Job responsibilities include:



  • Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release

  • Implement new features and improve the ones we have already built

  • Develop and maintain server-side Java code

  • Build JavaScript client code, utilizing both proven and bleeding edge web technologies

  • Build and maintain integrations with the big boys: Amazon Web Services, Google, Salesforce.com, Box, Microsoft, PayPal and others

  • Participate in all phases of quality assurance and defect resolution

item.title: Junior to Mid Level Front End Developer - Java, Angular, JSON APIs, and Web Serv at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
The Fidelity Institutional Technology group at Fidelity Investments has an exceptional opportunity for a Software Developer / Engineer. This role will participate in the design, development, implementation and support of mission critical trading focused web applications and financial tools. Under moderate supervision, conduct the analysis, design and development of software to support a robust trading and supporting platform, contributing to the overall success of projects as they move through the different phases of the project life cycle. 


Your knowledge will be called upon to meet guidelines and standards that will allow our team to continue to deliver important and vital solutions for our customers.  Our projects involve developing functions and tools used by Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs) and Correspondents.  Our web applications use modular JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular, Backbone, etc.), JSON APIs, Java and Web Services.  You should be able to understand technical designs at the application level, define strategies and work closely with fellow developers.  You must be able to describe problems and recommend solutions to project leaders.  You must have great communication skills, be a team player, and have an aptitude for learning new technologies.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Designing, developing, and implementing web applications in a dynamic financial services environment

  • Contributing effectively at many different points in a project life cycle as an individual contributor

  • Adhering to project timelines, addressing and resolving technical issues

  • Coordinating functional/technical group discussions with analysts and developers under moderate supervision

  • Delivering on both projects and support tasks in a dynamic environment

  • Developing concise and clear technical design documents based on analysis of business requirements

item.title: UX Designer (m/f) - Rocket Internet at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: As a UX designer, you will tackle complex web and mobile ecosystems and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs across many ventures. As part of our agile team of designers you will work in close collaboration with Product Management, Engineering, Research and Marketing in a fast-paced, highly-dynamic environment to create the most beautiful, relevant, and user-friendly products in the world.

item.title: Back-End or Full-Stack Developer at Technology Will Save Us (London, UK)
item.description:
Technology Will Save Us is building (and rebuilding) a whole bunch of software. We're looking for a back-end (or full-stack) web developer excited about the opportunity to introduce and teach electronics and coding to a new generation.


Objectives


We're looking for someone focused primarily on back-end web development who is interested in achieving the following goals:



  • Help define the back-end technology we need to scale

  • Help us define and build a high-grade, stable and mature software development process

  • Contribute to all aspects of development (back-end and front-end development, design, planning, server administration, building and testing prototypes…)

  • Implement a continuous integration process

  • Support all our software (e.g., coding and making platforms and manuals, content and user management systems, our e-commerce platform, kit software…)


Our Culture


Finding the right cultural fit is very important to us. We’d like you to bring something new and complement the team.


We are a playful, focused and authentic team looking for someone who deeply cares about building great products and services and putting our users at the centre of their work.



  • We believe in simple, maintainable clean (and lean) code. We hold weekly code reviews to maintain quality and learn from each other

  • We work together to achieve goals. We’re open about feedback, we want you to be able to give and accept feedback

  • We use data to drive decisions and solve real problems. This includes analytics, A/B testing, research, customer interviews, usability tests…

  • We give people ownership and invest in their growth

item.title: Senior Security Researcher at Kaspersky Lab (Woburn, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
The senior security researcher reports to the head of the Global Research and Analysis Team (GReAT) in the United States. The position will encompass a wide range of activities, including technical anti-malware research, tracking APT campaigns, discovery of new threats, government relations and media activities.


Job Location could be considered. Working from home is an option.


Responsibilities



  • Active technical research on IT security issues and malware threats.

  • Participate in GReAT research activities by assisting with malware sample collection, collaboration with external entities and providing
    guidance and ideas on forensics.

  • Participate in the discovery and investigations into new and ongoing advanced threat actors (global APT research).

  • Create and deliver presentations at internal and external security events.

  • Actively participate in press tours and Security Analyst Summit
    planning.

  • Develop and maintain relationships with top journalists and actively
    participate in social media as part of the company’s expert positioning
    activities.

  • Serve as a company expert on security topics for media, as required by PR teams globally.

  • Participate in government relations activities.

  • Participate in meetings and presentations to government officials to disclose current research and emerging threats.

  • Help support and pre-sales teams with intelligence on malware threat landscape. Assist local sales/marketing/support teams with
    presentations at partner conferences and local events.

  • Engage in operations with respected national and international law enforcement to aggressive fight against cybercrime. Provide
    intelligence for expert positioning and to Anti Malware Research operations.

  • Assist with promotion and correlation of malware threat research with technologies. Assist with reviewing white-papers and videos to
    promote company technology.

  • Content creation; analyse and describe malicious threats and create blog posts for SecureList.com and Threatpost.com. Make short and
    long term predictions on the evolution of threats.

  • Proposes ideas aimed at improving performance of GReAT and assumes responsibility for achieving group goals.

  • Prototype development; imagine and develop prototypes or new technologies.

  • Assist with testing newly released products and technologies from Kaspersky and competitors.

  • Additional activities could be assigned.


The Team


Established in 2008, the Global Research & Analysis Team (GReAT) is an integral part of Kaspersky Lab’s R&D department, and leads the company’s anti-malware research and innovation. The team’s security analysts are based around the world, each contributing a unique set of skills and expertise to the research and design of solutions to combat increasingly complex malware code. Today, GReAT comprises 40 experts working in Europe, Russia, the Americas, Asia, and the Middle East. Costin G. Raiu has led the team since 2010.


GReAT undertakes incident response for the company’s customers during malware-related incidents. Other key departmental responsibilities include thought leadership in threat intelligence, driving and executing initiatives focused on improving malware detection accuracy rates and efficiency, and supporting key customer accounts with malware intelligence expertise.

item.title: Big Data Architect at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more



  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

a10:author.a10:name: New York University - Division of Libraries

item.title: Data Services Specialist at New York University - Division of Libraries (New York, NY)
item.description:
The QDA & Survey Research Specialist will be working in a vibrant and collaborative environment on a team that supports all phases of the data lifecycle for quantitative, qualitative, and geospatial research. Data Services offers access to specialty software packages, software training and support, and consulting expertise for many aspects of numeric, qualitative, and spatial data for research, including data access, analysis, collection, data management, and preservation. The successful candidate will work closely with Division of Libraries professionals and faculty as well as with colleagues in NYU Information Technology Services (ITS) with respect to referrals, service development, technology, standards, resources and projects.


*Please note that this is a two year fixed term position with potential to renew.

item.title: Quantitative Developer at AQR Capital Management (Greenwich, CT)
item.description:
AQR Research and Portfolio Management is seeking quantitative software developers. Our developers are responsible for building the core systems that drive the quantitative strategy research and portfolio implementation that powers AQR. Our development teams are small, motivated, and highly productive. Working side by side with the researchers and portfolio analysts, you will become intimately familiar with the investment philosophy which drives AQR.


We believe that the next innovation to transform our business could come from anyone at AQR. Expect to be recognized not only for your diligence and hard work today, but for your vision for tomorrow. We are mathematicians, computer scientists, and engineers passionate about advancing financial research and pushing the limits of today’s technology.


As a quantitative developer, you will build or extend our:



  • Proprietary portfolio construction and optimization techniques

  • Global asset risk estimation system incorporating millions of data points

  • Intuitive research APIs leveraging cloud computing and cutting-edge visualizations

  • High-performance historical simulation engine

  • Workflow platform using services, messaging, and graph-based dependency awareness

item.title: Lead UI Developer at RPX Corporation (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
RPX is seeking a dynamic individual to contribute to the success of the Data and Technology Solutions department. In this role, the Lead UI Developer will help design, deliver, and support technology infrastructure to meet the growth needs of RPX. In this role, this individual will be a trusted technology expert in the web applications team responsible for conceptualizing and designing technology solutions to meet business needs. The Lead UI Developer will provide technical thought-leadership in collaboration with the product management team, engineers, and their respective managers to deliver innovative and automated solutions in an agile, dynamic environment. This individual reports to the Director, Engineering & Enterprise Architecture.


Role



  • Influence web application architecture across development teams and establish standards and best practices

  • Interact closely with Product/Engineering management on the road map and technology concepts

  • Collaborate with global development teams in bringing the concepts to market rapidly

  • Build rapid prototypes and demo application features

  • Keep a pulse on the trends in the industry and identify technical innovations

  • Participate in cross company technical initiatives

item.title: Senior Linux System Administrator at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing hotel markets.


We are looking for a Senior Linux System Administrator to join our headquarters in Amsterdam, NL. As a member of our IT Production Team you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in different live operating data centers around the world. You will be part of one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world and work with some of our industry’s smartest people. You will work on a wide range of technologies which include UNIX, Linux, CentOS, puppet, chef, Perl, Python and more. By proactively thinking about scalability we can ensure the growth of Booking.com.


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As a Senior Linux System Administrator you will:



  • Combine your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to support and maintain a world-class infrastructure and to enable our continued growth

  • Analyze, monitor, configure, and maintain the existing system and identify possibilities for improvement;

  • Ensure the reliability and continuity of our global systems;

  • Cooperate with other System Administrators, Engineers, DBA’s, Developers and Product Owners during projects;

  • Research, deploy and implement new systems and solutions, for example on automation or scalability;

  • Advanced troubleshooting;

item.title: Android Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:


Working as part of a team to deliver a great television experience on a myriad of devices ranging from televisions and set top boxes to mobile devices. Primary responsibility is to improve our Android application, while also identifying techniques to simplify complexity and redundancy across the application. The ideal candidate has a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and knows what separates mediocre user experience from great ones.

item.title: Software Developer at Nanometrics (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a software developer to join our team of smart, creative engineers to help build our next generation of products.


How we work


We work in an informal, fun, fast-moving, collaborative environment with minimal hierarchy. While we have the freedom to set our own hours and the flexibility to maintain an excellent work/life balance, we work hard to ensure that our products are delivered on time.


We develop a full range of software -- from customized Linux kernels and advanced signal processing applications, to web services and APIs.  We believe in using the best development tools and practices, and use an Agile approach.


What we do


Nanometrics creates innovative software and systems for detecting and monitoring seismic activity. Our products make a difference in people’s lives by helping to understand the significant human impact earthquakes have around the world. Our customers are leading researchers and companies who use our products for earthquake scientific research as well as natural disaster warning systems, nuclear non-proliferation monitoring, and induced seismic activity detection. Our systems are deployed on every continent and in some of the most remote and harsh environments on Earth, from deserts and mountains, to the Arctic and the bottom of the ocean.


This position is available in our Ottawa office, located on the edge of the Greenbelt. Close to biking paths and bus routes, and a short commute to many nearby residential areas.

item.title: Java Developer - Publishing/Newsroom at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
Projects you might work on



  • A greenfield development role, working on a team building a new content platform using APIs for content delivery and harnessing triple store capabilities for semantic enrichment in order to offer more flexible ways to ingest FT content that will lay the foundation for building the next generation of FT.com. We actively use BDD, continuous delivery and DevOps within the team as a recipe for success and accelerated agile delivery.



  • A position within our Editorial Technology programme. This exciting new programme means working directly with our Editorial team to support the newsroom's continued digital evolution through the creation and adoption of new tools and improvements to existing tools.  Work will initially include exploring the world of data in the newsroom, and using our Content API to feed into our CMS.


Responsibilities


This role will work within the development team, developing and unit testing solutions to meet business requirements in a timely manner. Development at the FT is done within larger programmes of work using individual agile streams and within that framework this role will be required to implement fully robust software solutions, working closely with the QA team members to develop a repeatable, end-to-end testing process.

item.title: Web Developer/Senior Web Developer - myBBC Notifications at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of the Notifications front end platform, written in JavaScript and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSON, Ajax. In addition, experience of Node.js, PhantomJS and SASS will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including S3 will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA, our colleagues in User Experience & Design and DevOps.


Our audience uses a diverse range of devices and browsers to access BBC services; you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and reliability of the Notifications UI remains consistent.

item.title: Java Developer at ForeFlight at ForeFlight, LLC (Austin, TX)
item.description:
ForeFlight is looking for a Java Server Engineer to join our Austin team. This position is for a technically well-rounded individual with expertise in Java server-side web and enterprise app development that will have responsibilities for developing server-side features and APIs to support our mobile apps. Experience with weather products and APIs (aviation or otherwise), aggregation of data / mashups, and aviation in general are a big plus.


Technically, this person must have proven experience with server-side Java programming, including use and expertise of one or more frameworks, search, and web services (RESTful, binary, and/or XML based). This person believes building applications in the cloud is cake. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear.


This position is based in our Austin, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401K with matching, and flight training reimbursement. Relocation reimbursement will be provided if moving to Austin.

item.title: Software Development Manager at Communication Service for the Deaf (Austin, TX)
item.description:
CSD is now hiring a Software Development Manager to lead the development and implementation of next generation products and services for Deaf and Hard of Hearing communities. The Software Development Manager leads our team of designers, developers, programmers, and engineers charged with releasing innovative technologies benefiting the global marketplace.

You'll get to:


  • Lead CSDs multi-state Software Development team, ensuring optimal allocation of internal and contracted programming talent and resources to ensure timely delivery of deliverables and project milestones. Evangelizes and drives engineering best practices.

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders in evaluating strategic technology development, management of product priorities and projects, defining the goals and development plan for each software project, and establishing policies and procedures for software engineering and programming teams to meet product specifications

  • Provide technical insight and judgment of feature/schedule/cost tradeoffs. Ensure that product architecture and technology decisions support corporate strategies and future direction of the products

  • Manage the Design/Code Review, Unit Test, Component Test and such activities, and support the Quality Assurance team with ensuring quality products and deliverables

  • Establish platform scalability metrics, testing criteria, data samples, and system configuration and revises, as appropriate, to support long-term growth and sustainability of services

  • Define and publish coding best practices and standards, scalability goals, and provides continued mentorship of the development team to adopt and apply those standards

  • Ensure timely delivery of software products based on established specifications

  • Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire software development lifecycle

  • Tailor and implement software development methodologies, best practices, and standard work to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance, productivity and execution of the software organization

  • Motivate and mentor team members, developing a sense of empowerment and shared responsibility for CSD products and services

  • Define and champion leading software technologies to improve the efficiency, quality, and ease of use of our products and solutions

Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be an experienced professional who wants to change the world for the good. Lex Luthers need not apply.

Benefits


CSD offers a competitive benefits package for full-time employees. For a full list of benefits and perks, please visit the career page.

Communication Service for the Deaf, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer and drug free and tobacco free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Senior Manager AWS/Azure at Rackspace (Hayes, UK)
item.description:
Rackspace is seeking an experienced technical leader to join the incubations area within Operational Strategy. As a group we are responsible for designing and enabling new ways of delivering managed services to our customers. A petri-dish where disruptive items are cultivated, taking them from being embryonic to a state of maturity, minimising disruption to the mainstream support business. This is where DevOps, AWS and Azure services are currently being built and matured.



Your role is to lead the technical personnel hired to support the Fanatical Support for Azure and AWS services – namely Technical SDMs and Cloud Operations Engineers. The team is brand new and needs building from the bottom up. Finding talent, setting standards and building a delivery engine that supports Rackspace’s growth onto partner clouds.



You must possess a blend of commercial and operational acumen; balancing the needs of a support business in a way that does not impede growth. You will be required to successfully own and drive the operating model for support and service delivery within Azure and AWS. You will join a cross-functional leadership team and are expected to have the range in skillset to engage with the end-to-end customer journey – from pre-sale all the way through to BAU support. You will seed the founding members of new teams as well as create long term viable plans for integrating Fanatical Support for AWS and Azure with Rackspace’s mainstream support business. You must enjoy spending time with customers. You will communicate with all areas of the company.



This role is an opportunity to join a small and highly focused team that will lead the build out of something entirely new to Rackspace. The pace is fast with lots to go do. Leaders are expected to be versatile and to thrive in a hyper-growth environment.

item.title: Junior Front End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for a Junior Front End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. SharpSpring is the fastest growing company in the area and we need a Front End Developer that is passionate about user experience and is excited about creating a product that makes an impact on millions of users! If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

As a Front End Developer at SharpSpring, you have the unique and adventurous opportunity of working with our product and creative groups on challenging design and production problems across our platform. You will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. In this opportunity you will be developing a high-quality, fully functioning, large-scale produce that is used by thousands of our partners. If you have the experience we are looking for and are a well rounded developer, this is an opportunity to get in on the ground level and work on a platform that is changing the face of an industry.

Responsibilities

  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Writing code that is cross browser compatible
  • Work with a cross functional development team to engineer deliverables and quality software solutions for our Partners
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively
  • Comfortable working on the command line

The Person

  • Must possess 1-3 years experience in web development and user-interface code for large scale websites
  • Extensive expertise of front end technologies (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP)
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Strong design skills
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience with any of the following: Javascript modules, client-side unit testing, Chrome Developer Tools
  • Experience working with vector and raster graphics in applications such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember . js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

At SharpSpring, we strive to create an environment where you can flourish. As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our partners problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at: www.smtp.com

item.title: Big Data Applications Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our Retail Solutions team is seeking a creative, execution focused Developer to architect and build Big Data applications used by thousands of business users at Fortune 500 Retailers. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The 1010data Consumer Insights Platform (CIP) is 1010data’s premier retail data monetization portal which enables retailers to provide valuable and relevant store data to suppliers.


You will build applications that drive significant business value to retail customers by empowering merchants and suppliers to make better decisions through data-driven collaboration based on a single version of the truth. Example applications include analytically identifying the best promotions, forecasting sales, or creating analytic customer segments.  


Ideally you’re comfortable with SQL or a similar database query language, but experience with a specific programming language isnot required.  For us it’s more relevant that you are interested, willing and able to learn new languages quickly and possesses proven experience building (coding) software solutions. 


Using astoundingly powerful proprietary analytic database software, you will construct complex queries to produce actionable information to inform client business decisions.


Our culture of ownership ensure you will truly own the roadmap and architecture of applications you develop.


Big picture, fastidious developers that are able to operate with ambiguity yet always deliver will thrive in our flat organization that rewards results.


If you are passionate about using technology to solve real world business problems and add substantial value to the company—we would be excited to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and release production ready large-scale enterprise applications used by hundreds of customers and thousands of users

  • Build scalable code that can run analyses against billions of rows of transactions in seconds

  • Manage design of technical solutions to specs; Collaborate with key stakeholders (e.g users, analysts, sales) to understand requirements and build valuable applications
