item.description: Sports Analytics Big data developer - developing Big Data Analytics platforms for the Sports industry in London. With us, you will find an innovative, dynamic environment and a dedicated team of professionals who love what they do.

item.title: Senior SQL Server DBA at Origami Risk (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
This is a MS SQL Server DBA role in a fast growing cloud based environment. Upcoming efforts include upgrading to SQL Server 2014, Clustering and Data Warehousing for large data reporting capabilities. This role requires a self-directed individual who can run with projects based on feedback and direction from internal stakeholders and client needs. Performance tuning, optimizations and data redundancy are also important parts of this role.


This position is in our Chicago office with some work from home flexibility.

item.title: Sr. DBA at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Senior Data and Database Administrator is a mission critical and highly visible role responsible for the management and operations of all Database environments supporting Rewards Network’s technology platform. This role will partner with the Agile software delivery team, Data Warehouse team and the Business Intelligence team to implement SQL database requirements (e.g. efficient data structures, mission critical performance, high volume scalability and capacity, future flexibility, big data and intelligence) in support of product and business initiatives. This role is architectural and operational in nature and requires a balance of skill and experience in both of these general areas. This senior technology role will set the standard for the overall data management lifecycle for the SQL Database management environment.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Partner with technology teams to architect, implement and manage the data management lifecycle and database environment

  • Architect, design, implement, administer and operate all SQL databases for the enterprise

  • Identify and resolve technology and operational issues specific to the SQL databases to ensure that all databases are operating at full performance and adhering to internal SLAs

  • Manage the SQL server database specific disaster recovery, archiving, backups and recovery processes

  • Develop and maintain standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for managing the database environment using appropriate industry practices

  • Analyze and report the performance of database operations against the key database performance metrics established for the technology platform

  • Monitor and operate the database environment using standard monitoring tools/platforms and optimize the environment (e.g. IDERA Diagnostic Manager, IDERA SQL tools)

  • Design, develop and maintain applicable data integrations using the MS SQL integration toolset (SSIS) for exchange of data between databases and other operational/application systems

  • Support database requirements for technology teams comprised of Agile developers, application support staff, BI/ETL developers and AS/400 back-end system developers

  • Manage and operate the database environment for load, performance and capacity requirements

  • Support the Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence teams for their respective database requirements

item.title: Data Scientist Residency at IDEO (New York, NY)
item.description:
Data Scientist Residency (IDEO New York)
 


What’s a Data Scientist Residency?


We’re seeking a Data Scientist to join IDEO New York’s office for a 3 month, full immersion residency starting in October 2015. During your residency, you’ll work closely with both our design teams on client-facing projects and with our internal groups to understand IDEO better. You’ll be helping us push our edges on how we use and interpret data, how we make data visualization interesting and playful, and how we gather and bring data into our design and strategies.


 So who do we think this is? You’re a cross between John Nash and Jackson Pollock, bringing a unique blend of science and artistry to your work. You laugh in the face of messy data sets and can transform them into a usable format without breaking a sweat. You know how to ask the right questions to turn your data into meaning, insight and actions. You not only know how to draw conclusions from data, but can transform  quantitative findings into impactful stories and illustrate ah-ha moments to a variety of audiences.



Once you're here...


Within our client-facing project teams, you will:



  • Work across diverse industries with multidisciplinary teams, including many types of designers whose specialties range from Interaction to Design Research to Environments

  • Advise on structuring and conducting quantitative and qualitative user research and lead teams through analysis of data

  • Coach teams on methods, timing and resource requirements of quantitative studies

  • Translate data into a visual language to make them accessible to designers and our clients

  • Clearly communicate insights to clients using storytelling techniques to generate empathy and instill confidence


Within our internal teams like Global Talent, you will:



  • Help us select data that will have the most value for learning more about ourselves

  • Advise on ways to collect and report on internal data that fits wells within the context of our unique culture

  • Review and analyze our data from many angles and recommends ways to apply the data

  • Sift through our existing data, supporting the discovery of previously hidden insights

item.title: Python Software Developers at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Blacksburg, VA)
item.description:
Do you believe Open Source will always innovate faster? Are you most comfortable on the cutting edge of technology? If this describes you and you’re ready to attack some of the most complex problems in the industry, then it’s time for you to take on the challenge of being a large contributor to the Open Source world for Rackspace.


With over 300,000 customers hosting their environments from ten data centers across the globe, the opportunities to build, design, develop, and provide solutions in an in enterprise cloud computing environment is here.  Rackspace can help you carve out a new career path.  This isn’t a wish, it’s the real deal.


Would you like to be part of the next big product in the Rackspace cloud? As a cloud API developer on the Atlanta team you will design and develop a variety of products that connect the Rackspace managed cloud together with other innovative Cloud products.

The role you will play will help customers seamlessly integrate cutting edge tools into their system architectures, that will change the face of computing. As a result, you will have an opportunity to work on many high impact, high visibility products that will take fanatical support to new heights.


Do you want to be the next Fanatical Racker? Rackspace is looking for a software developer who will design and develop cutting-edge APIs for large-scale cloud based services. Join us and work with a team of energetic individuals who are passionate about Rackspace as the #1 Managed Cloud provider. You will work on a dynamic, Agile team to develop high-quality software in a fun, collaborative environment!


As a software developer at Rackspace, you will be working in a high-energy team, writing great software by using the best software development practices in the industry today. Passion for all aspects of software development is a must.


This position is located in Blacksburg, VA, a town in southwest Virginia.  Blacksburg, home of Virginia Tech, is nestled on a plateau between the Blue Ridge and Allegheny mountains. You’ll be doing world-class development for a cloud computing leader in a beautiful location with a temperate climate and very short commute time.


Responsibilities:



  • Write web application front-end code in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

  • Unify disparate product data models into a coherent user experience.

  • Diagnose and fix bugs

  • Write clean and maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, SOLID principles, Agile methods)

  • Work with other software developers, product managers, user experience designers, and operations engineers on a daily basis

  • Mentor and guide less experienced team members to provide technical direction

item.title: Front End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for an experienced and innovative Front End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. SharpSpring is the fastest growing company in the area and we need a Front End Developer that is passionate about user experience and is excited about creating a product that makes an impact on millions of users! If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

The Front End Developer will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. You will be developing a high-quality, fully functioning, large-scale produce that is used by thousands of our partners. You will work with our experienced Development, Design and QA teams to optimize navigation, architecture and improve the overall user experience.

  • Writing code that is cross browser compatible
  • Work with a cross functional development team to engineer deliverables and quality software solutions for our Partners
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues

  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Fluent writing semantic, cross-browser compatible HTML and modular CSS
  • Solid understanding of Javascript and experience with jQuery
  • Up-to-date on front-end web technologies.
  • Strong design skills
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience with any of the following: Javascript modules, client-side unit testing, Chrome Developer Tools
  • Experience working with vector and raster graphics in applications such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience building and or designing web applications

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

At SharpSpring, we strive to create an environment where you can flourish. As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our partners problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

  • We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!

About SMTP, Inc.

The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. item.title: Analytics, Trading, And Execution C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Analytics, Trading, and Execution is the largest and fastest growing department in R&D, and we are looking to add skilled software developers to our six core groups. The applications and infrastructure we build connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We are looking for bold, energetic, and independent developers to take ownership and responsibility in growing our industry leading applications. The ideal candidates should be able to lead projects, work with the business, meet clients, and understand their workflows to build high performance software. Our engineers are responsible for front-end UI/workflow applications, server-side/back-end development, system design, and high performance transactional database programming.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Trading Solutions

Trading Solutions is the largest group within Analytics, Trading, and Execution. The group designs and builds Bloomberg's three core order management systems, a fully developed connectivity and integration product and an order execution platform. These mission-critical trading applications are used by broker dealers and investment advisers throughout the world for managing orders, executions, quotes and positions. We are the global leader in building and delivering vital financial trading applications that allow banks and investment managers to manage their order flow, risk, P&L and the entire trade life cycle. Institutions rely on our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity and algorithmic strategy trading. Collectively, our teams provide a front to back environment to meet our clients' ever changing needs.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities

The Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) electronic trading group develops a global product that facilitates dealer to client trading, liquidity, and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. It is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, FICC has evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. Responsibilities include infrastructure design and implementation, database management and user interface development.

Equity Trader

The Equity Trader group provides highly resilient, efficient, configurable and distributed real-time trading platforms. We build the analytics used to make trading decisions, the UI used to interact with the market and other traders, tools to automate workflow, and advanced alerting to monitor ongoing activity. The system handles millions of transactions per day and enables traders to send orders to over 5,000 liquidity destinations globally. The transactions are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis, and are then fed back into the system to shape tomorrow's trading decisions.

Institutional Sales Applications

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for sales professionals that empower them to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. Our applications leverage sophisticated algorithms to present easy to understand answers to questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful developers are interested in finding solutions to manage and distill large volumes of disparate data.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics group develops applications that provide transparency to asset managers and analysts, to help them to make well-informed financial decisions. Our clients use our real-time system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. Portfolio and Risk Analytics also provides a suite of global, transparent and independent indices to serve the needs of the investment community. Our team applies broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop a constantly growing set of analytics. The scale of these calculations offers opportunities for optimizing the system using Hbase, Spark, Redis and Solr. The team is redesigning a large part of our architectural stack to keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product.

Tradebook

Tradebook is building the next generation low latency trading platform, which supports multi-asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets. Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting equities, futures, options and FX trading. We focus on developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to 120+ liquidity venues globally.

item.title: Music Information Retrieval/Machine Learning for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:

We are seeking a Music Information Retrieval Specialist to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the algorithms that underlie and enable the next generation of music experiences. You will apply your algorithmic expertise, your willingness to write code to explore problems, and your ability to implement solutions from scratch, all while solving challenging real-world problems. The ideal candidate will have experience with music service APIs, DSP, Machine Learning, and recommender systems (e.g., collaborative filtering and content-based solutions). Example problem spaces include contextual music recommendations, music similarity, playlist generation, and tempo/intensity estimation, but those are just to get you started.

Objectives:

• Within the first month, gain a broad understanding of the algorithms used in our existing products and prototypes. Gain familiarity with our existing data sets.

• Within the first three months, develop a fleshed out plan for implementing and testing the first versions of a handful of (already imagined) feature concepts. Demonstrate initial proof of concept of at least one new feature. In collaboration with other team members, outline a plan for building a scalable implementation.

• At the end of the first six months, demonstrate end-to-end proof of concept of at least one customer-facing feature. Be an active participant in the conception of new feature concepts.

Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:

• What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

• What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

• Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: Lead Systems Engineer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Job summary


Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our infrastructure and site operations. More than 330,000 teams and 2.5 million developers love Bitbucket and use it every day to manage their Git and Mercurial repositories. We're in the process of building our infrastructure and refining our operational processes for the next several years, to make our platform even more scalable, reliable and speedy to accommodate the next level of our explosive growth. This role will lead our systems engineering team to evolve our infrastructure and processes to help take the team to the next level. This is a rare opportunity to get in early and help drive our systems and operations strategy. You'll collaborate often with the development team and product managers and will assist with the design, build-out, monitoring, scaling, optimization and support of Bitbucket's customer-facing and mission critical infrastructure systems. We're serious about security, performance, reliability, observability and quality, so you'll be refining our operational processes to ensure our team is prepared for anything.


More about you


The Team Lead we’re seeking will have experience leading a team and be effective at mentoring and motivating people and leading projects. You should have past experience in leading a world-class systems engineering or operations team for a high traffic service. A good understanding of SaaS infrastructure and operational best practices is also key to this role. You should be one of those naturally curious types, always looking to improve things, love dabbling in your own side-projects and learning new skills that are not a necessarily part of your normal day job. You’re probably someone who enjoys sharing knowledge with your team, asking for help when you need it, and at the end of the day, thrive on leading people to help them grow.

item.title: Software Engineer - Web App Developer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Are you are an experienced senior developer with a broad skill set and a passion for tackling complex and challenging problems? Rally is growing rapidly, so the problems we solve are big and getting bigger. We think about quality, testing, and scaling all the time. We dedicate considerable developer time to making sure we’re doing the right things, the right way.

Rally Engineering is a team of polyglots, and if you explore our repos you will find a variety of languages including: Java, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Clojure, and Ruby. But we never exclude candidates because of their language of choice. Instead we focus on code quality and design, whether OO or functional. Our largest data store is a relational database however we’ve embraced NoSQL solutions like Cassandra, Datomic, and MongoDB.

Automated testing is a first-class citizen at Rally. We test at every level, from fast running unit tests to full-stack integration tests that drive dozens of concurrent browsers using Selenium. Our test suite is one of the largest and most comprehensive you might ever encounter. Yet our build pipeline from commit, through full test suite execution, and package for production deployment is exceedingly fast.

At Rally we seek people who are passionate about the software industry and want to work with the best and brightest. We value teamwork, the ability to make and meet commitments, dedication to continual improvement, and a proven track record in creating successful, highly usable software.

We strive for a healthy, productive work/life balance, while enjoying the opportunity to substantially contribute to the direction and success of a vibrant software business.

item.title: Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services at Puppet Labs (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Department: Customer Success
Reports to: SVP of Customer Success       
Location: Anywhere, East Coast   

Enjoy leading technical, customer-facing teams?  Do you love IT automation software?  Excited about what Puppet is doing and want to be a part of it?

Puppet Labs is hiring a Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services to help drive strategic direction for the department and set the daily operations for the Eastern Region, which is comprised of Solutions Engineers (pre-sales) and Professional Services Engineers (post-sales).  The Director will coach a growing team to ensure we are delivering outstanding services to Sales and our customers.  

In this role, you will both ensure we continue to support our Sales team and champion our customers needs and oversee PS engagements with customers as well as manage team members, milestones, and activities.  You will coordinate with peers and other departments, such as User Experience, Engineering, and Sales to collaborate on special initiatives and to formalize feedback and communication loops.  

You will work with the other Customer Success Directors to ensure best practices in pre and post-sales activities are implemented across the organization.  You will participate in the development of the services roadmap and represent the needs of customers.  Working with the Director of Partner Enablement you will ensure that the Eastern Region service and training partners are enabled to provide high-quality support through Puppet authorized partner programs.   

This position operates in a team-oriented environment.  As a result, you must build and maintain strong and effective working relationships internally with peers on the services management team, sales, marketing, business development and product marketing.  As a leader you must also ensure that your team creates and maintains effective working relationships with various internal and external teams.

Qualifications

  • A combination of  8 years management experience in building, leading and growing field-based pre-sales teams and professional services teams in an enterprise software or open source company.  Focus of experience should be on the pre-sales side.

  • Excellent leadership skills, with proven success in hiring, leading, engaging and motivating staff, as well as working effectively across departments.

  • Strong customer orientation with demonstrated experience in achieving a high level of customer satisfaction

  • Able to identify problems, resolve escalations (including collaborating with others when necessary), act decisively and show good judgment.  Able to gain sponsorship and consensus on key initiatives

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; highly refined interpersonal skills; and high caliber presentation skills.   The ability to successfully translate product information to both technical and non-technical professionals at all levels of an organization is required.

  • Empathy with our customers and their problems through experience in a Unix/Linux systems administration or development role.

  • Strong industry knowledge (configuration management, data center management, and systems management domains)

  • Excellent time and project management skills

  • Experience in developing and launching service offerings;  generating and interpreting business and service delivery key metrics; and managing multi-department budgets

  • Ability to travel up to 35-50% nationally and internationally

  • BA or BS degree in computer science or a related field

Application Instructions

Please include a cover letter with your application describing why you are interested in working for Puppet Labs, and how you feel your experience fits the listed qualifications of the position.

Working for Puppet Labs

Our mission at Puppet Labs is to drive the cost of technology change to zero.  We make IT automation software for systems administrators, freeing them from repetitive work and fire-fighting so they can do more interesting and higher-value work for their organizations.  Our most important measure of success is their love for our products.

We're growing fast, but we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day.  We're driven and restless.  We encourage creativity and collaboration.  By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement.  We hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

We offer excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career.  We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia.  Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park with views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

Puppet powers thousands of companies, including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal.  Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

Puppet Labs is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 877-575-9775 for assistance.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Growth Team at join.me) at join.me (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Our headquarters in the heart of Boston's Innovation District is 6 floors of sunlight, pinball, foosball, pool, and transparency. The 360-degree view from the roof-deck is one of the best you'll ever enjoy and considered to be Boston's finest. And our join.me product team is the group to be on!  Experiencing over 220% in the last two years, join.me is the tool dominating the headlines in ever-expanding collaboration market.  


 http://HTTP://GOO.GL/V94BR 


As a member of the Growth Team for join.me, you will help answer the question: how can we improve overall experience and conversion for join.me users? You will be a strong contributor in a solve/hack/code/test anything team. This is a unique position within the join.me team that requires a strong blend of programming chops and business acumen. We’re a code agnostic shop with iOS / Android apps, lots of new flavors of Javascript, and you'll work all over the stack.  Interested?  You bet you are.  We'll even get you a Batarang if you want.


Responsibilities and Essential Functions: 


•Work closely with the product, marketing, and business development teams to generate hypotheses for business growth opportunities. Deliver solutions to test those hypotheses.


•Extending the join.me experience by creating supplementary tools, widgets, and plugins that improve the join.me user experience and usage.


•Implement tools and tracking to improve the measurement of feature usage and user experience.


•Work with release management to drive efficiency in production release throughput.


•Server/Client-side web-based development for LogMeIn’s join.me product.


•Maintain, test, and modify programs, make approved changes.


•Participate in code reviews.


•Create and maintain internal technical documentation.


•Create and maintain unit / automation test cases.


 •Tackle and solve challenging problems at high success rate.


•Work proactively in an Agile environment.

item.title: Software Developer - Infrastructure, Data at Avvo, Inc. (Seattle, WA)
item.description: Avvo is looking for passionate developers to work on our Big Data pipeline. You will work with a smart, driven team to transform Big Data into applications and services that help delight, connect, and inspire users. In this role you have the opportunity to solve complex problems with the latest open source technologies.

item.title: Data Scientist at Swisscom AG (Liebefeld, Schweiz)
item.description:
Your job When it comes to solving complex problems and finding patterns, you're the one to ask, because abstract thinking, parsimonious models and neat implementations are part of your everyday thinking.


Workplace:



Bern-Liebefeld


Level of employment:



80-100%


OE:



INI-BIX-BDM

That's why we need you
You feel at home in the world of Big Data. This makes you ideal for supporting our BI and Big Data Competency Centre in designing, developing and deploying analytical systems. Come and work with us on the Switzerland of the future.

Your responsibility
You will apply your theoretical knowledge to solve real-life complex problems. In doing so, you will develop analytical systems and services, new theoretical models as well as technological solutions and present the results in front of various stakeholders. Technology scouting and consulting and supporting other teams with regard to the optimal and secure use of these models and solutions also belong to your responsibilities. Through all this, you define and drive the further development of the Big Data cluster and to continuously innovate and enhance the software we build.

item.title: MySQL/PHP Software Developer at DC Energy (Vienna, VA)
item.description: You will help acquire and optimize data storage from our many sources across the web. This involves designing and implementing solutions to challenging cURL, parsing, and data storage problems using our proprietary PHP-based applications, all the while ensuring data flows seamlessly into our MySQL and custom NoSQL databases. You may also be responsible for creating dashboards and displays we use to view this data. As your experience with tackling these data acquisition and storage problems grows, you may contribute to developing our in-house frameworks.

item.title: Data Analyst at BAE Systems (Portsmouth, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to be a part of the nation’s most complex and high profile marine projects? We currently have vacancies for Data Analysts to work across a number of Fleet Services projects, where you will be given unique exposure to programmes such as the Type 45 destroyers, the Type 26 frigates, and the Queen Elizabeth aircraft carriers.


As a Data Analyst, you will be analysing business data and investigating interesting insights and correlations. You will work to help us improve our diagnostic and prognostics capability for a range of equipment and services, through analysing this data.


This role will offer excellent opportunities to grow and develop a new team within the business, with the potential for excellent career progression. You will also have the chance to become one of the only defence industry experts, through developing specialist knowledge within a specific area of the business.


Your main responsibilities as a Data Analyst will involve: 


Analysing data from within the business, from vibration sensitivity on ships to HR and finance information


Using data to create predictions and turn this into business insight


Research and implement new tools and new data


Writing reports and presenting information


Creating insights, theoretical testing and metrics

item.title: Lead DevOps Engineer at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
• You will have the ability and willingness to drive us to the next level of DevOps rather than just doing DevOps. We’re looking for someone who has the ability to drive major cultural change (test driven infrastructure, automate everything) and the dedication to lead and portray the vision and direction to ensure things are done in a way that brings us closer to our DevOps nirvana




  • We subscribe to DevOps being the intersection of dev, operations and QA and this is the collaborative nature of the role we're looking to fill; the constant dialogue with various stakeholders not just within the operations team but across the entire tech team and even the entire company.




  • You will be hands on in creating tools to build and automate environments for production use. You understand the need to build scalable, reproducible and usable infrastructure. Along this journey you will be required to minimize scope for user error and provide clarity in de-risking security implications, through detection and sufficient layers of protection. 



Current projects



  • We are in the midst of migrating our applications to an infrastructure as code framework that is auditable, testable, peer reviewed and automated. In order to achieve a clear path for the provisioning and deployment of our development lifecycle environments we are making use of tools such as AWS Cloud Formation, Ruby, Capistrano, Github, Puppet Master, Hiera and Blackbox. The intention is to avoid previous disparate ways of working and get things to a consistent state in order to refactor more easily.




  • Writing a Ruby application to make provisioning to Vagrant and EC2 more straightforward; provide the right keys for deploying onto and have all the monitoring/backup packages pre-installed/configured and hooked into Puppet Master for security updates.




  • Implementing centralised logging using Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana.




  • Writing a Ruby application, to provide a library and CLI to manage Cloud Formation stacks, which accepts templates written as javascript objects.




  • Enhance Nagios and provision/deploy it using our infrastructure as code framework. Enhancements include more intuitive alerts, consistent checks, easier self-service for adding checks and integration to see the status of our security and traffic routing features.




  • Implementing an Intrusion Detection System



Future projects




  • Upgrading to Mongo version 3. Using the MongoDB Management Service to manage automated deploys and upgrades of Mongo. This will facilitate Mongo migrations more easily using the MongoDB Management Service.  




  • DSL-based approach for creating and managing our subdomains with regards to DNS, SSL certificates, traffic manager routing and monitoring.




  • Extending our current infrastructure as code framework e.g. areas where Cloud Formation is not yet supported, integration with other Amazon services outside of EC2.




  • Investigating Docker and other container technologies to see if we should add them to our tech stack.

item.title: Front End Developer at Findify (Stockholm, Sweden) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Front End Developer who is absolutely obsessed with pixel perfect implementations, has a keen eye for great UX, and really cares about performance. If you like building products that customers love, and want to build interfaces that make complex systems a joy to use, we really do want you!


Our tech stack:


We always strive to use the most suitable tool for the job, so our stack is constantly evolving. Currently, our frontend library is written in Javascript, split into small modules, uses jQuery and the Mustache templating engine. We have several applications that are yet to build so you'll have the opportunity to choose the technology that will best fit each project.


We’re not afraid to challenge our choices, we love open source and above all, we’re a product driven company so technology is at the core of everything we do. You can check out our full stack on StackShare.


Our development culture:


We are a small team that moves fast and iterates. We do weekly sprints, code reviews, testing, and once your code is submitted it gets pushed to production through our continuous deployment infrastructure (using Jenkins). We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness. You will get to work with a dedicated UX designer, and amazing engineers specializing in machine learning and distributed systems.


What you can expect from us:


As an early engineer in a small team, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on the product, company vision and culture. You will get to work with the latest technologies out there, without being bound to any legacy. Have the opportunity to solve real-life problems using machine learning. We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring! it's going to be an exciting ride!


If this sounds like a company you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch at: JoinUs+Frontend@findify.io


We’d love to hear from you!

item.title: DevOps/Ruby Engineer at Stitch Fix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About the Team


Stitch Fix has an extensive internal platform for managing our business, from inventory management to warehouse logistics to our own Personal Styling platform, each serving thousands of internal users who run the business every day.  Our public-facing infrastructure is growing as well, helping millions of our customers be their best selves.  It’s all tied together with an array of user-facing applications and back-end services.


We’re ops savvy, but not ops-focused. While we are currently hosting our Rails apps on Heroku and leveraging their add-on ecosystem, we are only married to what works, and are constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure.  We aren’t afraid of change if that helps us deliver faster, better, and more reliable solutions to our business partners and customers.


This is where you come in. Stitch Fix needs a Ruby and Rails developer with a keen interest in development tools, technical operations and “developer happiness”.  We have a lot of applications, services, and infrastructure, and we need someone who can be dedicated to make sure it’s meeting the needs of the development team.


About the Role


You’d be walking into a welcoming and diverse environment that is built around partnership, integrity, feedback, responsibility, and innovation. We have over 20 Rails apps and services, hosted on Heroku, and deployed with a high degree of consistency. Our mature engineering team is truly partners to those that run Stitch Fix by providing efficiency & effectiveness with the tools we develop.


You’re excited about this opportunity because you will...



  • Make application development and deployment easier for the engineering team

  • Help us solve thorny problems around performance and fault-tolerance

  • Build tools and systems to manage security

  • Make sure we’re up-to-date on the best practices of our service providers (Heroku, AWS, etc.)

  • Investigate new tools & technologies our team can use to solve problems for the business
